Company:

Bitu-mill specializes in road profiling, asphalt paving, road rehabilitation, and civil infrastructure works. We pride ourselves on our diverse range of services within the road construction sector. Drawing on over 30 years of industry experience we’ve built an exceptional team and have a reputation within the industry for delivering superior results that exceed expectations every time. Servicing a wide range of clients from VicRoads, local government and authorities to developers, builders, and other civil contractors, our team has the experience, knowledge, and capabilities to deliver all types of civil and infrastructure works including;

 

  • Road Construction & Reconstruction
  • Road Rehabilitation & Maintenance
  • Land Development
  • Water Infrastructure Works
  • Structures
  • Sewer Infrastructure
  • Electrical Infrastructure
  • Sporting Facilities

 

We are seeking applications from suitably experienced and high performing candidates for Skid Steer/ Truck Driver (HC).  This will be supporting our business in Echuca! 

 

 

Requirements:

  • Minimum 1-year work experience as Skid Steer operator/ Truck Driver (HC)
  • Willingness to regularly work away from home
  • Good verbal and written references to verify the above
  • Good attitude, willingness to be a leader in the field
  • Ability to think on your feet and make good decisions
  • Strong focus on safety
  • Construction Industry card and appropriate tickets

 

Benefits:

  • Access to an employee assistance program
  • Generous salary
  • Rewarding workplace culture
  • Work-life balance

 

Does all the above suit what you are looking for? Come join a team where our core values are people first. Simply click apply now! Alternatively, forward your resume to des.smith@bitu-mill.com.au or call on  0428 511 587.  

Bitu-mill is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity and inclusion. Applications are strongly encouraged from Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people; people with a disability; people who identify as LGBTIQ; and those from culturally and linguistically diverse backgrounds.

We’re the P&N Group, one of Australia’s largest customer-owned banking organisations.  Driven by a genuine belief in the value of mutuality, we strive to achieve success on behalf of our customers, our communities and each other with passion, energy and commitment.

With east and west coast presence, our Group operates under a unique multi-brand model.  The team comprises some 550 staff who work across one of our two retail banking brands (P&N Bank in WA, and bcu in NSW and Qld) or in Group Services that operates across the three states. We support our retail and business banking customers through a network of 36 branch locations, regional Contact Centres, mobile lending teams and online channels.  Group HQ is in the Perth CBD with regional offices in Coffs Harbour and Brisbane.

Our Group values innovation, agility and the ability to develop strong relationships. We work hard to create a contemporary banking experience for our customers while offering a collaborative, inclusive and engaging workplace where our people can learn, develop and thrive.
We’ve recently embarked on an exciting and significant strategic and digital transformation to build a bank of the future for our current and future customers. And, we’re on the lookout for more talented people to join our team.

P&N Group is seeking an experienced Business Development Manager to join our progressive team.

Reporting to the Head of Broker and Business Development and working closely with the wider P&N team, this key role will see you responsible for the overall sales, service and relationship management of allocated Aggregator Groups and individual Brokers. A key requirement is ensuring service delivery and expectations of both brokers and members are met.
  
As our ideal candidate you will have advanced credit assessment and end-to-end loan processing skills in the Home Lending field and can negotiate and workshop with internal and external stakeholders to ensure all viable options are explored to assist the Member.
  
Your demonstrated experience in building and maintaining relationships in the Broker Market is essential along with a proactive attitude and a focus on providing exceptional customer service to crucial business partners.

Responsibilites

  • This person will be working with individual Head Ops/FMs to formulate risk assessment/health and safety audit plans for new and existing sites as per our HSEQ requirements and WSHA
  • To carry out regular audit checks to ensure that all sites comply with our HSEQ requirements and WSHA.
  • Providing and maintaining a work environment that is safe, without risk to health and adequate as regards facilities and arrangements for the workpeople's welfare at work.
  • Developing and implementing procedures for dealing with emergencies that may arise while the workpeople at work.
  • Giving the workpeople all necessary information about the way the activities and operations on Sites are conducted as might affect their safety or health while they are on site.

Requirements

  • At least a Diploma in workplace safety with 6 years of relevant experience
  • WSHO certification must be certified and approved by MOM

*Only shortlisted candidates will be notified

At people2people and Frog Recruitment, everyone is welcome and as an inclusive workforce, we encourage our employees, clients, and candidates to showcase their authentic selves.

Job description:

Main Role:

  • Planning and conducting assessment to the client's management system against the defined audit criteria: preparing assessment report and other related documents. submitting the report and following up the certification decision recommendation according to the BSI policy and procedure as well as the respective accreditation and regulatory requirements within the specified timeframe.
  • Develop and maintaining the assessor/tutor qualification: Completing the planned resources development program. Actively pacificate the sector's calibration meeting.
  • Supporting the sales driving program and activities related to sector's marketing campaign as well as assisting the commercial team as needed in audit duration estimation and any other technical issues for sales proposal preparation and joining sales meeting for technical discussion with the client.
  • Supporting any other activities as assigned by the sector manager which relevant with sector team needs and BSI Group Indonesia management direction.
  • Safeguarding company's and client's confidential data/information.
  • Acting as a BSI Brand Ambassador for BSI.


What we offer:

Our Excellence Behaviours: Client-centric, Agile, Collaborative. These three behaviours represent how we do things at BSI. They help us ensure that BSI is a great place to work and a highly successful business.

BSI is conducting face-to-face interviews where appropriate and possible. If you are invited to a face-to-face interview but feel more comfortable with conducting the interview virtually, please speak to a member of our recruitment team.

 
 

Required profile:

Education:

  • Minimum bachelor's degree in engineering, natural science, social science or other relevant sectors.
Working experience :
  • Minimum 4 (four) years full time practical workplace experience in the relevant industries/services preferably in environmental services, manufacturing, mining, oil and gas, forestry, and engineering.
  • At least 2 (two) years in a role or function relating to implementation of the relevant management systems in the relevant industries/services such as ISO 9001/ISO 14001/ISO 45001, etc in environmental services, manufacturing, mining, oil and gas, forestry, and engineering.
  • Preferably having working experience relating to quality, health and safety, and environmental management system audits.
Technical qualification:
  • Preferably qualified lead auditor of ISO 9001/ISO 14001/ISO 45001.
  • Have a good knowledge in the relevant standards such as ISO 9001, ISO 14001, and ISO 45001.
  • Good understanding in legal, regulatory, and other requirements related to QHSE management system standards.
  • Familiar with Tools of analysis & Problem-Solving Technic.
  • Having relevant professional certification would be an advantage.
Other qualification:
  • Excellent communication, presentation and interpersonal skills with ability to deal with people at all professional level.
  • Strong logical thinking, analytical and problem-solving skills.
  • Ability to work effectively with minimum supervision and under pressure.
  • With a keen interest to learn and explore new knowledge and skills.
  • A good command of English both verbal and written including ability to write clear and concise reports in English.
  • Relevant computer skill.

An exciting Payroll Lead (x1 vacancy) has just become available at one of the international company based in Bangkok.

About the Payroll Lead Role:

In this business critical role you will be responsible for managing payroll and HRIS system to run accurately for both Thai and expat employees. This role offers a competitive base salary with attractive benefits.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Be the key person to ensure accuracy and timeliness of all businesses including plant and office sites
  • Act as the representative of the company to coordinate with external vendor for any mobility or tax issues of expat employees
  • Manage and organise data in HRIS system to be complete and up to date such as promotion, organisation change, termination or etc.
  • Work with related stakeholders to contact for any payroll, tax or data of HRIS issues
  • Monitor and suggest room for improvement for payroll or HRIS system to improve process or efficiency
  • Lead and train the team in terms of operation and also guide and provide solutions for any issues

To succeed in the Payroll Lead role, you will need to have good knowledge in payroll for both Thai and expat employees and good command of English.

Key Requirements:

  • Minimum of 10 years' direct experience in payroll area is required, preferably from international company
  • Detailed oriented, good communication skill and able to work under pressure
  • Can work in a dynamic environment under pressure
  • Have experience leading team or junior staff
  • Have experience using success factor
  • Must have good command of English
  • Thai Nationality

Activities Officer| Pinangba | Ny-Ku Byun Elders Village, Cherbourg

• Employment Term: Permanent Part Time
• Location: Ny-Ku Byun Elders Village, Cherbourg
• Remuneration: $32.42 p/hr + 11.5% Super + Not for Profit Salary Packaging +
Penalties & Allowances
.

Make a meaningful difference with BlueCare

We’re looking for someone who wants to make the world a little better through small moments that leave big impacts. To build meaningful relationships and make a difference in the lives of others.

An integral part of our big-hearted BlueCare team, as a Activities Officer you’ll be encouraged to grow, develop and feel empowered to make the everyday easier for the people we care so passionately about.

Let’s make a meaningful difference, together.

What makes a difference for you?

With a Blue Nurses legacy dating back to 1953, BlueCare is one of Queensland’s largest and most trusted not-for-profit providers of community and in-home care, residential aged care, disability services and retirement living.

  • Flexible work arrangements to support work-life balance
  • 12 weeks paid parental leave in addition to the government scheme
  • Access to salary packaging, meal and entertainment benefits - up to $15,900 per year tax free as well as up to $2,650 of your pre-tax income to pay for meal and entertainment benefits
  • A recognition and rewards platform, providing employee discounts at hundreds of retailers, including everyday expenses, holidays, health insurance, a wellbeing program and employee assistance program
  • A positive and inclusive team based on respect, shared standards, strong values and a commitment to serving others
  • Career development opportunities with one of the most trusted community and residential care providers in Australia to challenge yourself, grow and make a meaningful difference

Your part in our Blue Care team

Make a meaningful difference with Pinangba

We’re looking for someone who wants to make the world a little better through small moments that leave big impacts. To build meaningful relationships and make a difference in the lives of others.

An integral part of our big-hearted Pinangba team, as an Activities Officer you’ll be encouraged to grow, develop and feel empowered to make the everyday easier for the people we care so passionately about.

Let’s make a meaningful difference, together.

Your part in our Pinangba team

As an Activities Officer you’ll develop, coordinate and lead activities for our residents aimed at fulfilling their social and recreational needs, supporting their independence and improving their quality of life.

A key responsibility of this role will be to observe and record the effectiveness of the programs, by monitoring residents’ ongoing progress and adjusting the programs to any developing needs. You might also find yourself transporting residents (as requested and approved in Pinangba vehicles) on outings and attending to resident/client personal care needs as required.

What makes a difference for us?

  • Certificate III Aged Care, Home and Community Care, Disability Support or an equivalent qualification

  • NDIS Workers Screening Clearance or willingness to obtain

  • Basic experience with technology incl. smartphones, tablets, laptops etc

  • Confidence to satisfy the relevant probity checks required by legislation or policies

BlueCare is proudly part of the UnitingCare Family, we’d love you to be too

Joining the state’s largest network of aged care workers with its over 8,000 strong, bright team in blue, you’ll also be welcomed as part of the UnitingCare family. With more than 16,500 staff and 9,000 volunteers across our brands of BlueCare, Lifeline, ARRCS, The Wesley Hospital, Buderim Private Hospital, St Stephen’s Hospital, and St Andrew’s War Memorial Hospital, you are part of something bigger. Our team are compassionate, inclusive and committed to the work we do, helping people live life in all its fullness.

Start making a difference today

Our application process takes less than 15 minutes – Click the ‘APPLY’ button to be taken to our online application process and upload your resume and cover letter. Our team are available to answer any questions you may have.

Diversity & Inclusion

Our approach is simple –everybody is welcome here. At UnitingCare, diversity is at the core of our who we are, our mission and our values. We are committed to providing equal opportunities to all employees no matter their sex, race, culture, sexual orientation, disability or gender identity. Demonstrating our commitment to reconciliation and building long-term employment opportunities for First Nations peoples, UnitingCare strongly encourages Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander applicants for this position.

Safe workplace

We work hard to make our services welcoming and safe for every person. We are united in keeping children, young people and the elderly safe from harm, within our services, workplaces and the communities we support. We are committed to speaking up loudly for their safety.

As Structural Design Engineer, you will be responsible for designing and analyzing structural for formwork components and systems as well as providing technical support for other teams. This job will be based in Jakarta

Client Details

Our client is a multinational company who specializes in providing support to the construction industry. They are currently looking to expand their business in Indonesia.

Description

  • Prepare structural analysis, design calculations, and shop drawings according to local standard and code regulations
  • Coordinate with clients, consultants, and other related parties to ensure project specifications are met
  • Occasionally conduct job site visits or meeting to assess structural integrity and identify potential issues
  • Develop and implement innovative solutions and potential design improvements.
  • Evaluate the feasibility of proposed designs and make recommendations based on cost, performance, and safety considerations
  • Prepare reports and presentations to communicate design concepts, analyses, and recommendations to clients and stakeholders

Profile

  • Minimum Bachelor's degree in Civil / Structural Engineering or related field
  • Minimum of 3 years of experience as Structural Engineer in the Construction industry, preferably with experience in formwork industry
  • Familiar with construction software programs such as AutoCAD Software and 3D Modelling
  • Familiar with relevant construction codes, construction procedures, and health and safety standards
  • Good communication skills, growth minded, professional, and self-motivating
  • Fluent in English and able to work in a multicultural environment

Job Offer

  • Great career prospects as the growth opportunity in the company is tremendous
  • Opportunity to work on various projects across the country

To apply online please click the 'Apply' button below. For a confidential discussion about this role please contact Antonius Trianto on +62 21 2958 8899.

Responsibilities:

  • Trade mainly Flow/Exotic Products and some cash products for P&L generation, including cash equities, index and single stock options and delta-one products Work with Dealing, Sales and Structuring to provide solutions and pricing for block trades, option products, and execute these trades in an efficient manner
  • Manage day to day risk of transactions for the desk and implement various hedging methodologies to prevail cross cycles and events Work with Middle Office, Technology, Operations, and Risk Management team in relation to trade issues and development plans Develop and participate in trading strategies, positions, system optimization and risk monitoring tools

Requirements:

  • Degree holder in Finance, Mathematics, Sciences, Engineering or related discipline(s)
  • 3 to 5 years of experience in equity derivatives trading with cash equities trading experience
  • Good understandings of vanilla, and exotic/flow products and ability to further develop proactively
  • Prior experiences in flow/exotic trading, trading technology, quant strategist and structured products are highly desirable
  • Strong technical skills, since a lot of the work would be to continue the effort to build up their systems
  • Strong work ethic and desire to learn, ambitious is a must Ability to think fast and critically, solve various problems arising from trading, risk and operations
  • Excellent command of English and Chinese

Drive a department wide uplift in digital capabilities through a focus on:

  • experimentation,
  • learning and improvement,
  • putting the customer at the centre of everything we do,
  • championing digital capabilities both within the department and across the sector, and
  • leading a team of skilled and experienced professionals to deliver digital capabilities and outcomes.

In the role you will:
• Be responsible and accountable for leading development of the Department's digital strategy: (ensuring alignment with the Queensland Government's Digital strategy and whole-of-government direction) and working with TMR teams to deliver against agreed strategic objectives.
• Provide operational management and strategic leadership for a team of skilled and experienced professionals to achieve strategic goals and objectives, deliver digital capabilities and outcomes and maintain a highly skilled and motivated workforce.
• Promote methodologies and advocate for digital capabilities within the department and across the sector.
• Lead the successful delivery of digital POCs across the Department to support future capability direction and investment decisions.
• Facilitate awareness and lead adoption of contemporary digital delivery practices within the Department - taking into account existing governance, funding and procurement requirements and supporting any approved changes.
• Provide strategic advice and guidance to executive management on emerging digital capabilities and new ways of working to unleash the potential of emerging technologies and support innovative delivery approaches.
• Support the development of new digital capabilities.
• Develop and maintain positive relationships with key internal and external stakeholders.
• Contribute proactively as a member of the Leadership Team to develop a collaborative team culture across the branch, with a focus on achieving improved customer outcomes.

About you:
Demonstrated experience leading digital capability programs within large organisations
Demonstrated experience leading organisational change programs.
Leads development of culture that encourages innovation, risk-taking and collaboration.

Purses continuous growth - Broadens knowledge and perspective by seeking new collaborations and experiences and participating in development initiatives

Infineon designs, develops, manufactures, and markets a broad range of semiconductors and semiconductor-based solutions, focusing on key markets in the automotive, industrial, and consumer sectors. Its products range from standard components to special components for digital, analog, and mixed-signal applications to customer-specific solutions together with the appropriate software.

We are on a journey to create the best Infineon for everyone.
This means we embrace diversity and inclusion and welcome everyone for who they are. At Infineon, we offer a working environment characterized by trust, openness, respect and tolerance and are committed to give all applicants and employees equal opportunities. We base our recruiting decisions on the applicant´s experience and skills.
Please let your recruiter know if they need to pay special attention to something in order to enable your participation in the interview process.

In your new role you will:

  • Monitor PM activities, OEE & MTBA performance, quality and yield of assembly processes (mold, Xray, plasma and oven)
  • Trouble-shooting machine issues and drive for improvement activities in order to stabilize the machine performance
  • Spare parts management on usage, budget control. and provide proposal / improvement plan on maintenance cost reduction
  • Assist in monitoring, improving, analyzing and in control processes, materials, tooling and equipment & updating of relevant documents
  • Support to optimize machine performance and efficiency by using adequate problem solving tool available

You are best equipped for this task if you have:

  • Bachelor Degree in Engineering course
  • With 5 years working experience in semiconductor field
  • Possessed good analytical and problem solving skills
  • Basic problem solving skill
  • Good understanding of mold machine mechanism and capable to perform PM activities
  • Capable to trouble-shooting machine issues and drive for improvement activities.

job_title: Home Care Cleaning for the elderly
job_ad_details:
We are on the lookout for a caring and dependable individual to provide essential home cleaning services to our elderly clients. Make a difference in their lives by maintaining their homes.

Role Overview:
As a Home Care Cleaner, your role is pivotal in ensuring our clients' homes are clean and safe.

Key Responsibilities:

Customized Cleaning: Tailor your cleaning approach to meet the unique needs and preferences of each client, including tasks like dusting, vacuuming, mopping, and maintaining bathrooms and kitchens.
Household Assistance: Lend a helping hand with laundry, ironing, and changing bed linens.
Companionship: Offer friendly interaction and support, enhancing our clients' day-to-day life.
Health and Safety Vigilance: Report any changes in clients' conditions or concerns to your supervisor promptly.


Why Choose This Role?

Travel Support: We cover your travel time and mileage, ensuring a stress-free commute between clients.
Convenient Client Location: Enjoy a structured schedule with clients' homes situated close to each other.
Supportive Management: Our home care cleaning team is backed by a management that prioritizes your needs and offers comprehensive support.
Attractive Compensation: Earn $28.80 per hour plus superannuation. This part-time position includes benefits like sick leave, annual leave, and more.
Consistent Client Interaction: Develop lasting relationships with clients through a fortnightly roster.
Comprehensive Induction: Receive thorough training and detailed information about your role to ensure your success.

Requirements:

Background Check: Current Police Check.
Reliable Transportation: Own a dependable car/vehicle.

Ka rere a kupu mihi ki te mata o te whenua e tau ai ki tēnā, ki tēnā huri noa – e mihi atu ana. I tēnei wa tonu nei e tonoa ana ō pūkenga nui, ō wheako me ō mōhiotanga kia whakaeke mai ki te waka whakatutuki kaupapa e mea nei ko Te Taurapa Tūhono. Kua takoto te mānuka, ā, tautoko mai, ārahi mai i ngā pakihi hohoko o Aotearoa kia whāia nei ngā pae tawhiti hōu, hihira anō hoki.   

To those near and far, greetings to you all.  We look forward to you bringing your valuable skills, experience and knowledge to join our team aboard the forever moving waka, Te Taurapa Tūhono | New Zealand Trade and Enterprise (NZTE). This is the call, to rise to the occasion, and help guide New Zealand export businesses to exciting new horizons. 

This role is based in Auckland.

New Zealand Trade and Enterprise (NZTE), Te Taurapa Tūhono, is Aotearoa's international business development agency, we help companies grow bigger, better, faster, for the good of Aotearoa.

We are seeking applications for our Research Specialist to join our Customer Capability team, within Customer Solutions group. Our Customer Solutions mission is to provide fast and flexible matching of expertise, knowledge, and experiences to our customers, enabled by digital. Our promise is for a customer with a growth opportunity or challenge, we provide access to the right people (know-who) and knowledge (know-how) to enable them to grow bigger, better, faster. Our teams are interdependent, collaborating closely to deliver value to customers.  We aim to do more for more customers, and this is your opportunity to play a key role and make a positive contribution to this exciting challenge.

He aha ō painga ki tēnei mahi | Why you will love working here:

NZTE is a global organisation where we work across 24 different time zones and 100 countries and offer flexibility because of this. We know that life isn’t all about work so we will give you the right technology to allow you to work anywhere and balance your time. Work life balance is truly important to us. On top of this, we also offer 5 weeks annual leave so you can have that extra time in the year to enjoy what you love doing!

Career development is another huge part of working at NZTE and we will help you with your aspirations and work with you to get you there – being a learning environment that encourages adventure and experimentation, what better place to grow your career!

He aha tāu e mahi ana | What you'll be doing:

  • Provide specialist market research and analysis to achieve greater impact and insight for our customers
  • Collaboratively develop research proposals in conjunction with NZTE’s Customers, Customer Managers and International teams 
  • Conduct extensive and targeted primary and secondary market research from initial scoping and planning phases to analysis and storytelling of recommendations
  • Analyse and interpret trends, patterns and correlations within data to create thought-provoking customer insights underpinned by a sound commercial understanding
  • Produce thorough and well organised reports, presentations and graphics to summarise and explain research findings and their implications
  • Be a champion for developing a research community across NZTE and collaborating across teams and borders

He aha e whai ake nei | What's next:

For more information please read the position description - Research Specialist and apply online attaching your CV and cover letter by 9am Friday 11th February 2022 (NZDT).

NZTE has a vaccination policy, further details will be available through discussions with a Talent Acquisition Specialist if we progress your application.

NZTE is committed to uplifting the mana of Māori as tāngata whenua and recognise Te Tiriti ō Waitangi/ the Treaty of Waitangi as Aotearoa’s founding document.

About UOB

United Overseas Bank Limited (UOB) is a leading bank in Asia with a global network of more than 500 branches and offices in 19 countries and territories in Asia Pacific, Europe and North America. In Asia, we operate through our head office in Singapore and banking subsidiaries in China, Indonesia, Malaysia and Thailand, as well as branches and offices.

Our history spans more than 80 years. Over this time, we have been guided by our values — Honorable, Enterprising, United and Committed. This means we always strive to do what is right, build for the future, work as one team and pursue long-term success. It is how we work, consistently, be it towards the company, our colleagues or our customers.

About the Department

The Retail function provides Personal and Business Banking customers with financial solutions tailored to their needs. We help them manage their money wisely and meet their financial goals through an extensive range of products and services. These include deposit, insurance, secured and unsecured loans, investment and wealth advisory services.

Personal Financial Services

We design and provide products and services that empower our customers to enjoy greater banking convenience while they extract more value from their money. In particular, we are focused on promoting and developing healthy saving and investment practices across generations.

Job Responsibilities
  • In charge of the strategic acquisition of new customers for mortgage / housing loan products through the available marketing channels. Role includes advising, preparing, and delivering suitable mortgage packages for the customer
  • Grow the bank's current customer portfolio in providing product solutions in accordance with the Bank's prescribed standards and regulatory requirements
  • Contribute to the profitability and growth of the branch by developing and maintaining customer relationships through utilising the full spectrum of banking services
Job Requirements
  • Minimum 2 years of working experience in business-to-consumer sales with proven track record
  • Sales experience in Banking Retail Products preferably in mortgage sales will be an added advantage
  • Demonstrate effective written and verbal communication skills
  • Possess own transport and willing to travel
  • Result driven and comfortable dealing / interacting with all levels of people
  • Fresh graduates are welcomed
  • Committed, confident, determined, self-motivated and a team player

job_title: Process Manager (Process Utilities System) - Based in KL
job_ad_details:
about the job

  • Lead and oversee a team of engineers responsible for Process utilities system;

  • Mentor and coach team members, supporting their professional growth and development, and ensuring a high level of technical competency within the team;
  • Provide technical leadership and expertise in the design of process utilities system, including process gases, process chemical, UPW, industrial wastewater;
  • Develop detailed engineering designs, drawings, and specifications, ensuring compliance with industry standards, regulatory requirements, and client specifications;
  • Conduct engineering analysis and simulations to optimize design solutions for efficiency, safety, and reliability;
  • Lead the planning, execution, and delivery of design projects related to process utilities system, ensuring adherence to project timelines, budgets, and quality standards;
  • Collaborate with internal stakeholders, including projects managers, procurement teams, and clients, to define project requirements, scope, and deliverables.

job requirements and qualitfications

  • The ideal candidate will have a minimum of 10 years' experience in engineering and construction, with a focus on process utilities system and tools hook up.
  • Degree in Engineering or equivalent;
  • At least 10 years of working experience in engineering design, focusing on process utilities system for industrial projects;
  • Experience in the semiconductor industry is advantageous;
  • Strong leadership and team management skills;
  • Proficient in problem-solving and decision-making;
  • Able to prioritize tasks and work effectively under pressure to meet strict deadlines;
  • Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.

Description

pelangggan

job_title: Health and Security Assistant - Incentives Offered
job_ad_details:
There’s never been a better time to join Hunter New England Local Health District! This vacancy is eligible for a NSW Health Rural Health Incentive package of up to $10,000 per year in addition to award entitlements (paid on a pro-rata basis for part time employees). Apply now and enquire about an incentive package that will benefit you and your family!
 

Remuneration: $58008.48 per year (Pro-Rata for Part Time) + Super + Salary Packaging + Rural Incentives
Location: Narrabri District Hospital
Employment Type: Permanent Part Time
Position Classification: Health and Security Assist
Hours Per Week: 20
Requisition ID: REQ421524
Applications Close: Monday, 14th August 2023
 

About the role:
 

  • As the Health and Security Assistant, you will be responsible for assisting in patient care, inner facility patient transfer, maintaining a high degree of cleanliness, dealing with security issues, including patient restraints to support the effective and efficient functioning of the health service.
  • To be successful in this role, you will need to be reliable, able to work in a team environment and independently as required. You will need to have good communication skills, and you must be honest and trustworthy.
  • In your role, you will be supported by the management team, and education and training will be available as needed.
  • Master Licence Number: 407686382
     

Where you will be working:
 

  • Narrabri Health Service work as a team to ensure service delivery is maintained and deliver in accordance with agreed plans and priorities.
    Applicants invited to interview will be required to undertake pre-employment screening involving psychometric testing as part of the recruitment process.
  • Narrabri is located in the beautiful Namoi Valley of New South Wales, near the spectacular Mount Kaputar – a great base for outdoor adventure. Mount Kaputar National Park is just east of the town and is a popular spot for camping, cycling, horse riding and birdwatching, with the Swan Rocks walking track showing evidence of Kaputar’s volcanic past. Narrabri is located midway between Sydney and Brisbane, approximately a 6-and-a-half-hour drive from either city, with flights operating from both cities to Narrabri 3 days per week.
     

Benefits with working in HNE Health:
 

  • You will meaningfully contribute to the safe operation of Narrabri District Hospital
  • 4 weeks annual leave (pro-rata for part time employees)
  • Superannuation contributions
  • Salary packaging options
  • Fitness Passport
  • Employee Assistance Program (EAP) for staff and family members
  • Opportunity to work and collaborate with a range of non-clinical and clinical professionals.
     

Additional Information

  • An eligibility list will be created for future permanent part time and temporary part time vacancies. 
  • Job share arrangements may also be considered.
  • To be eligible for permanent employment in this position you must be an Australian Citizen, or a permanent resident of Australia, or a New Zealand citizen with a current New Zealand Passport. Employment of a temporary visa holder may only occur if no suitable local candidate is identified for the position; in this instance, you may only be offered employment in line with the conditions and expiry date of your visa.
  • We are unable to accommodate visa sponsorship for applicants requiring a visa for this position.

 
Need more information?

1) Click here for the Position Description
2) Find out more about applying for this position
For role related queries or questions contact Suellen Stove on Suellen.Stove@health.nsw.gov.au

We have a permanent role for an experienced and qualified Peer Support Worker to work as a Wellbeing Facilitator (Lived Experience Practitioner) within our Integrated Practice Teams. 

 You will use your excellent relationship skills, resilience and flexibility to provide community-based support to people across West Auckland. Using your own personal lived experience of mental distress and/or addiction challenges and recovery, you will support people to achieve positive goals in their lives.  

If you want to make a difference in people’s lives using the Strengths model and the Recovery approach, and work for a well-established and respected award-winning provider of mental health services based in West Auckland, please contact us.

This is a full-time role working Monday to Friday  8:30am-5pm. Hourly rate for the role is $23.38 per hour to $29.10 per hour.

 We would welcome applications from people who have: 

  • Their own lived experience of utilising mental health and/or addiction services
  • A NZ Certificate in Health and Wellbeing Level 4 (Mental Health and Addictions) or Certificate in Peer Support (Mental Health, Level 4) or equivalent qualification
  • A proven ability to work effectively with peers from various cultures, especially Maori and Pasifika
  • A positive and professional attitude 
  •  Ability to role model how to move forward in a journey to wellbeing
  • Good computer and record keeping skills  
  • Familiarity with the West Auckland community  
  • Excellent communication, relationship and advocacy skills  
  • Creativity, enthusiasm and persistence  
  • A mature, empathetic personality, and a sense of humour  
  • A full, clean, NZ driver's licence

We can offer you: 

  • A positive, supportive and stimulating working environment  
  • Training opportunities and support for professional development such as external supervision
  • A day off for your birthday 

If you are seeking a challenge at the cutting edge of mental health service delivery and wish to positively contribute to our vision of Healthy Lives Shaping Healthy Communities, we look forward to hearing from you. Please visit our web site www.walsh.org.nz for more information about WALSH Trust. 

Applicants for this position should have an entitlement to work in New Zealand. 

WALSH Trust conducts Police vetting checks for all successful candidates. Under the requirements of the Children’s Act 2014, new candidates that are identified as coming under this act are required to undergo further safety checks as part of the recruitment process. For current employees these checks are repeated every three years. 

WALSH Trust is an equal opportunity employer and supports a smoke free environment.

 We will be interviewing before the closing date and this advertisement may close sooner if a suitable candidate is found.  

For a copy of the Job Description visit 2.37-Wellbeing-Facilitator-LXP.pdf

About us

Waste Management NZ Limited is New Zealand's leading resource recovery, recycling, and waste management, provider. We’re committed to safeguarding our beautiful environment through sustainable management of our valuable resources. Put simply, sustainability is what we do.

Due to our successful bid to supply the Taranaki region with waste disposal and recycling we require additional drivers to help keep our region clean.

Job Description

About the role

As a driver, you will be responsible for operating one of our new trucks with up-to-date equipment to ensure a safe and timely collection of service throughout the Taranaki region. You’ll also be required to keep accurate records and paperwork and undertake vehicle safety checks.

This is a physical role, collecting/sorting glass as well as food, so you will need to have a reasonable level of fitness.

From previous experience, you’ll already know the importance of health and safety in the workplace, and contribute to our goal of making sure everyone gets home safely.

Qualifications

You are customer-focused and enjoy interacting with customers and colleagues. You’re comfortable working independently and pulling together as part of the team.

  • Aware, responsible and skilled

The JBS Dinmore Processing Plant is the largest beef facility in the southern hemisphere. Located near Ipswich in South East Queensland, the facility has a daily production ability of 3,400 cattle and employs approximately 1,500 people. Cattle are sourced from the finest cattle producing regions to produce a diverse range of pasture fed and grain beef products, from commodity to premium. The renowned AMH brand, the award-winning Yardstick, the highly marbled grain fed Pure Prime and our state’s brand, Queenslander Beef and more are all produced at Dinmore.

With the expansion of JBS Dinmore's afternoon shift opening in January 2024, this is a great opportunity to enter into a career at an entry level with no experience necessary. With endless opportunities within the company it’s up to you how far you go!!

#Itallstartshere

As a Process worker you will have experience in or be eager to train and work in various areas of our meat processing plant. This is a fast-paced physical role with a focus on safety and quality.

Afternoon shift | Monday to Thursday - 3.00pm to 1.00am daily

job_title: AVP/Manager, Business Wealth Acquisition/Relationship Mgr, Bu, Business...
job_ad_details:
About UOB

United Overseas Bank Limited (UOB) is a leading bank in Asia with a global network of more than 500 branches and offices in 19 countries and territories in Asia Pacific, Europe and North America. In Asia, we operate through our head office in Singapore and banking subsidiaries in China, Indonesia, Malaysia and Thailand, as well as branches and offices.

Our history spans more than 80 years. Over this time, we have been guided by our values — Honorable, Enterprising, United and Committed. This means we always strive to do what is right, build for the future, work as one team and pursue long-term success. It is how we work, consistently, be it towards the company, our colleagues or our customers.

About the Department

The Retail function provides Personal and Business Banking customers with financial solutions tailored to their needs. We help them manage their money wisely and meet their financial goals through an extensive range of products and services. These include deposit, insurance, secured and unsecured loans, investment and wealth advisory services.

Business Banking

We develop integrated products and services targeted at helping small and medium-sized enterprises across the region progress through different stages of growth. These include innovative solutions and initiatives in areas of working capital loans, operational efficiency and currency exposure.

Job Responsibilities

  • For Business Wealth Acquisition Manager

  • Responsible for sales and marketing of deposits and FOREX; meet financial needs of small and medium-sized enterprises (SME)
  • Acquire new to bank business account and also managing the portfolio growth of assigned high depositor under SME
  • Actively drive for deposits, identify business opportunities and ensure targets allocated are met.
  • Monitor and executive the action plans in achieving overall deposit target allocated

For Business Wealth Relationship Manager

  • Responsible for sales and marketing of deposits and FOREX; meet financial needs of small and medium-sized enterprises (SME)
  • Deepen relationship with customer via cash management solution and also managing the portfolio growth of assigned high depositor under SME
  • Actively drive for deposits, identify business opportunities and ensure targets allocated are met.
  • To work closely with Branch Manager and Team Head

job_title: Executive/Senior Executive (Administrative Support - Science Dean's Office)
job_ad_details:
Job Description

The incumbent will provide administrative support to the Undergraduate Studies Section in the Dean's Office, Faculty of Science. Duties and responsibilities include, but are not limited to the following -

1) Faculty Co-ordinator for Study Abroad Programmes (SAP)

  • Plan, manage and coordinate SAP which covers university-wide and faculty-level global partnership with overseas universities.
  • Work closely with Global Relations Office (GRO) on the student exchange programme (SEP) allocation and student placement.
  • Manage the administrative processes that include student recruitment, selection interview, pre-departure briefings, module mapping and credit transfer for outgoing students in all SAP.
  • The range of programmes that the team handles include the following: Student Exchange Programmes (SEP), French Double Degree Programme, Global Classroom, Summer/Winter Programmes, Global Science Summer Programmes, Incoming/Outgoing Summer Undergraduate Research Opportunities Programme in Science (UROPS), Non-graduating, non-exchange programmes, Financial Assistance Schemes (e.g., NUS Awards for Study Abroad, Science Student Overseas Exposure Fund)

2) Student support for outbound and inbound students

  • Handle student enquiries/appeals efficiently.
  • For inbound students, to also assist in the logistics required (e.g., accommodation).

3) Publicity

  • Manage the Faculty's SAP publicity materials
  • Update collaterals, website, student portal etc to ensure information is accurate and timely.

4) Others

  • Coordinate and answer enquiries (counter, telephone, email) from students and the public.
  • Take minutes for Undergraduate Studies/Student Life meetings.
  • Provide assistance at University/Faculty level events such as Open House, Freshmen Orientation Briefing, and Commencement.
  • Any other duties as assigned by the Vice Dean.
Qualifications/Requirements/Other Info
  1. Degree holder with a positive learning attitude.
  2. Proficient in Microsoft applications.
  3. Ability to work under pressure and multi-task in a fast-paced environment with multiple timelines and demands.
  4. Ability to exercise tact and discretion in handling sensitive and confidential information.
  5. Possess effective oral and written communication skills.
  6. Mature, independent, adaptive and meticulous.
  7. A team player with the ability to interact well with all levels of stakeholders.
  8. Willing and able to do overseas travel to partner universities

- The incumbent will be emplaced at an appropriate appointment grade based on his/her individual merits.

You'll play an important role in:

  • communicating schedule and HR progress, performance, and forecasts on a regular basis

Join a global leader in renewable energy

Shape the future with us

What will your day look like

Application development and support in a production environment providing solutions to the business that adds value, and delivers benefit by releasing capacity, eliminating process steps and or automate manual activities.

  • Manage identification of automation opportunities while ensuring overall consistency with the Bank's technology strategy and architecture.
  • Improve and maintain performance of existing automation solutions along the dimensions of efficiency, control, fitness for purpose and ease of use.
  • Manage production outages for solutions supported by the team.
  • Manage an agile application development process.

  • A Business OR IT professional with experience in using business acumen to define/deliver technology based solutions
  • A strong knowledge and understanding of the Scrum Methodology and Automation Governance
  • Technical skills required:
    • Intermediate to expert proficiency in Visual Basic for Applications

    • 3 years experience in building web applications following MVC framework
    • Intermediate proficiency in Python

    • 1 year experience on RPA Technologies preferably Automation Anywhere
    • Knowledge on APIs is an advantage
    • Knowledge on React and Node.js
  • Has high proficiency in problem solving, root cause analysis, defect management & resolution delivery
  • Experience with working in a core system Production environment (understanding of risks, managing customer information)
  • Demonstrable openness to new ideas and innovation coupled with a desire to translate them into real business solutions
  • Tertiary qualifications in Information Technology preferred but not essential
So, why join us?

At ANZ, everything we do boils down to 'why' - our purpose - to shape a world where people and communities thrive. We're just as focused on seeing our people thrive as well as our customers. We'll give you every opportunity to develop your career.

We are responding faster to changing customer requirements, focusing on the things that matter the most, energising our people, eliminating waste and reducing bureaucracy.

A happy workplace is a thriving one. So in order to attract and keep the best talent, and say thanks for the hard work, we make sure all our employees are rewarded.

We work flexibly at ANZ and encourage you to talk to us about how this role can be flexible for you and any adjustments you may require to our recruitment process or the role itself. If you are a candidate with a disability, let us know how we can provide you with additional support.

International Fintech Company is looking for a pioneering Cloud DevOps Engineer to drive innovation.

Your new company

Your new organisation is an International Fintech Company, specialising in asset management for several High Nett Worth individuals in the region. They are currently exploring a new opportunity to move some of their services over to blockchain and other digital platforms. With their current direction in digitalising their business, they need talented and forward-thinking individuals in the Cloud and DevOps space to enhance their current and future setup.

Your new role

As the first DevOps hire for the team, you will be playing a key role in working closely with the Technology Director to consult, strategise and implement the DevOps framework based off their current setup. You will need to be dynamic, forward-thinking and open-minded to play a massive part in ensuring success in this organisation. You must also be ready to get your hands dirty, as the organisation is on a journey to slowly build their abilities from the ground up.

What you'll need to succeed

Requirements:

  • Degree holder in Accountancy / Finance or related disciplines
  • Member of HKICPA/ACCA or equivalent
  • A minimum of 6 years post-qualification experience with exposure in the Big Four
  • Self-motivated, independent, and strong analytical skills
  • Familiarity with GAAP and IFRS accounting standards
  • Excellent communication and reporting writing skills in both English and Chinese
  • Well-versed in MS Office and experience in using Oracle Cloud or Cloud

Interested parties, please send your CV to Ivy Yeung Ivy.Yeung@connectedgroup.com for more details. For other available opportunities, please visit www.connectedgroup.com.

BACKGROUND

ArtScience Museum is the cultural institution in Singapore that explores the intersection between art, science, technology and culture. It is the cultural component of Marina Bay Sands.  Since opening in February 2011, the museum has staged large-scale exhibitions by some of the world’s most famous artists, including Leonardo da Vinci; Salvador Dalí; Andy Warhol; Vincent van Gogh and M.C. Escher.  The museum has also commissioned new work as well as presenting significant exhibitions that explore aspects of science such as big data, particle physics, paleontology, marine biology and space exploration.

The museum presents exhibitions and programmes about art and science using a combination of intellectual discussion, education, innovative design and interactive content.   Featuring 21 gallery spaces totaling nearly 5000m2, the architect-designed lotus-inspired building has played host to major international touring exhibitions from renowned museums and galleries around the world, including the British Museum and the Science Museum in London; the American Museum of Natural History in New York; Centre de Cultura Contemporània, Barcelona; the Ambrosiana, Milan; the Mori Art Museum, Japan and many others.  ArtScience Museum also originates and produces exhibitions in-house and runs a full programme of education, events, activities and learning opportunities for a wide range of audiences.

The Exhibitions Department at ArtScience Museum is responsible for developing and implementing the programme of temporary and permanent exhibitions that reaches over 500,000 visitors annually.  

Please refer to our website for more details about our exhibitions and our work.

 

JOB SCOPE

The Registrar/Senior Registrar at ArtScience Museum will be responsible for effective exhibition and collection management practices that will include negotiation and procurement of art logistics/transport; insurance; packing and unpacking supervision; management of couriers and maintaining records of movement, storage, exhibition and location of artworks and artefacts in order to meet or exceed international standards relating to collections and exhibitions.

 

Summary of Key Responsibilities:

  • Coordinates with lenders (institutional and/or private) and manages loan requirements including environmental, security, showcase alarm systems, lighting and mounting methodologies.
  • Coordinates and manages all logistics for crating and shipping, locally and internationally, including insurance and tenders.
  • Oversees and documents loading and unloading of collections, artwork quarantine (if necessary), handling, packing, crating and installation of objects.
  • Work with curators, exhibition producers and exhibition design/build contractors on exhibition layout requirements.
  • Work with the Senior Conservator to monitor collection/exhibition whilst on display and completes weekly inspection reports.
  • Work with the Senior Conservator to maintain records, condition reports and documentation of all artworks/objects/artefacts in transit and on display at the museum including: visual examination, condition reporting and photographic documentation as necessary.
  • Updates the museum’s facility reports and annexes.
  • Prepares artworks/artefacts for exhibition and/or storage, working with curators, exhibition producers, Senior Conservator and contractors to agree mounting and demounting, labeling, packing and cleaning of artworks/artefacts.
  • Maintain storage facilities, manage space utilization and supervise storage reorganization as necessary.
  • Monitors environmental conditions for exhibitions galleries and storage facilities.
  • Leads collections/exhibitions emergency preparedness and recovery plan.
  • Manages budgets for collection/exhibition supplies, art handlers and shipping of objects.
  • Manages and supports the work, training and development of an Assistant Registrar.
  • Reviews and where necessary develops museum-wide systems and procedures for effective exhibitions management in consultation with the senior team.
  • Some experience of preparing and managing exhibition tours (outward).

 

Development:

  • Follow-up on tender and develops the collection/exhibition management system.
  • Updates collections management policies.
  • Manages improvements to collections/exhibitions housing and storage areas.

 

JOB REQUIREMENTS

Qualifications and Experience

  • Professional and motivated with at least four years’ working experience within a museum environment in a registrarial role or collection management.         
  • Experience of museum collections management practice i.e. storage, conservation, packing, transportation / customs documentation etc.
  • Some experience of commissioning of artworks and exhibition design.
  • A postgraduate degree, preferably in collections management or museum studies.
  • Additional formal qualifications in management or a field relevant to the museum’s areas of endeavor an advantage.
  • Experience of acting as a courier, with the potential to travel nationally and internationally.
  • Willingness to work flexibly.

Competencies

  • Excellent negotiation skills and a diplomatic approach to problem solving.
  • Able to initiate and maintain excellent relationships with artists, lenders, museums and institutions nationally and internationally as well as across the museum and Marina Bay Sands.
  • Ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously.
  • Ability to work effectively under pressure.
  • Forward thinking with the ability to anticipate problems before they arise.
  • Strong teamwork and management skills.
  • Strong organisational skills and a meticulous attention to detail.
  • IT literate specifically Windows applications.
  • Excellent spoken and written English, other languages an asset.

 

You agree that it is a condition of employment that you adhere to and abide by all rules, regulations, policies and procedures including without limitation the rules of conduct of the Company.

Job description:

Your key responsibilities will include, but are not limited to:

What we offer:

WHO ARE WE?

Crowned ‘Disruptor of the Year’ 2019 at the Mumbrella Travel Marketing Award, we operate as My Holiday Centre & Holiday Exclusives, providing holiday packages with everything taken care of. From flights & transfers to accommodation & experiences, we’re destination experts & hand-select the best inclusions for both our customers & partners alike. We’re one of Australia’s fastest-growing travel companies & one of the largest private corporations on the beautiful Gold Coast, where we employ a team of 200 fantastic people.

We’re currently amidst an exciting growth phase, so we’re looking for talented professionals to join us for the ride. 

WHO ARE WE LOOKING FOR?

Our Product Manager is responsible for

  • Delivering accurate product information to marketing team & customer consultants via Operations Manager & Reservations Training Manager
  • Working closely with the Product Team to develop staff, identify & introduce process improvements


WE’D LOVE TO HEAR FROM YOU IF YOU HAVE:

  • A performance driven attitude along with exceptional communication & presentation skills
  • Strong leadership skills & proven strategic thinking experience
  • A proven ability to manage campaign timelines with key internal stakeholders
  • A supportive, positive attitude & customer focus


WHAT'S IN IT FOR YOU?

  • Free & confidential access to your own health consultants & financial advisors
  • Beachside offices located in beautiful Broadbeach on the Gold Coast

job_title: VP, Financial Information Management, Group Finance
job_ad_details:
About UOB

United Overseas Bank Limited (UOB) is a leading bank in Asia with a global network of more than 500 branches and offices in 19 countries and territories in Asia Pacific, Europe and North America. In Asia, we operate through our head office in Singapore and banking subsidiaries in China, Indonesia, Malaysia and Thailand, as well as branches and offices.

Our history spans more than 80 years. Over this time, we have been guided by our values — Honorable, Enterprising, United and Committed. This means we always strive to do what is right, build for the future, work as one team and pursue long-term success. It is how we work, consistently, be it towards the company, our colleagues or our customers.

About the Department

Group Finance

Group Finance fulfils a dual role of governance and value-add in support of UOB's performance and strategic objectives. We are responsible for the financial, regulatory and performance reporting of UOB Group, and fulfilling our mandate as stewards of the Bank's resources by ensuring the right levels of controls and oversight over the use of the Bank's resources. At the same time, we support senior management and the businesses by providing insights into the performance of the Group and its businesses and geographies in order to support enhanced decision making over both the short and long term in order to achieve optimal and sustainable financial outcomes for our shareholders.

Financial Information Management (FIM), Group Finance

Financial Information Management (FIM) drives the strategic roadmap for the Bank's financial systems and partners with stakeholders and GTO Technology specialists to deliver solutions to support the growth of UOB.​ We aim to protect and enhance Group Finance value through optimizing the use of our systems and tools as we implement a controlled Finance architecture.

Job Responsibilities

The candidate will be part of Financial Information Management (FIM) within Group Finance under the Change Management organization structure. Your key responsibilities include:

  • End-to-end delivery of assigned project while ensuring strong risk management and project governance
  • Represent Finance in cross stream projects and collaborate with partners in various work streams to ensure successful delivery of the assigned project
  • Day-to-day management of project risks and issues
  • Lead and guide team members during project execution; guide your team in defining Finance requirements, performing functional impact assessment, risk assessment and defining User Acceptance Test Strategy
  • Transition project to production support teams with proper documentation and training
  • Provide support in resolving post implementation issues during warranty period
  • Strengthen business analysis capabilities in your team
Job Requirements
  • Degree in Accounting / Finance/ Business or its equivalent professional certificates
  • At least 8-10 years of relevant experience Financial Services industry; of which, at least 4 years as a project manager
  • Prior work experience as a business analyst / project manager with proven track record of managing projects in any of the following areas is a plus :
    • Front-to-back projects for Trade Finance or Treasury Products
    • Financial Accounting, Financial Reporting or Performance Management reporting
  • A relevant project management certification (e.g. Agile, PMI) is preferred
  • Aptitude for system related work, good knowledge of project planning and implementation including requirement gathering, impact assessment and test planning
  • Experience and confidence in dealing with various levels of management
  • Proven team leader with strong interpersonal skills and possesses drive to lead and guide team members
  • Self-starter with resilience and resourcefulness
  • Possess strong analytical and organizational skills
  • Strong communication skills
Be a part of UOB Family

UOB is an equal opportunity employer. UOB does not discriminate on the basis of a candidate's age, race, gender, color, religion, sexual orientation, physical or mental disability, or other non-merit factors. All employment decisions at UOB are based on business needs, job requirements and qualifications. If you require any assistance or accommodations to be made for the recruitment process, please inform us when you submit your online application.

Apply now and make a difference.

Company Description

About SEEK

SEEK’s portfolio of diverse businesses, which includes Jobstreet and Jobsdb in Asia, make a positive impact on a truly global scale! Our purpose is to help people live more fulfilling and productive working lives and help organisations succeed. We create world-class technology solutions to connect more people to relevant employment, education, small business and volunteer opportunities. We have a culture of high-performance in our workplaces and celebrate the diversity of our employees who contribute to the success of our organisation.​

Why join us?

Be part of a multinational tech company with strong core values to help us solve complex challenges while building a flexible, exciting career – one that could take you anywhere. We’re looking for people who thrive in dynamic teams and enjoy tackling regular new challenges in a large-scale, modern, and agile environment.

As one of Asia Pacific’s largest tech companies, you’ll contribute to multilingual systems, solving high-impact problems to the benefit of millions of people within the region. Be part of a fast-growing company with a strong culture and clear purpose, innovation and strong investment in responsible AI. SEEK offers you the opportunity to be involved in impactful work and be part of a great team.

Expect a great investment in your career development with access to workshops, conferences & courses while you work alongside seasoned experts.

Job Description

Jora aggregates job opportunities from thousands of sites, offering job seekers the largest real-time source of opportunities. We're a diverse, digitally remote organization focused on innovation and cross-functional collaboration.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Define and drive product vision and strategy for candidate-side experience, aligning with business goals
  • Lead job aggregation operations, ensuring Jora has comprehensive market coverage
  • Collaborate with AI teams to craft and test bold, groundbreaking ideas
  • Develop product roadmaps, prioritize goals, and navigate performance metrics
  • Lead and mentor a team of product and operational professionals
  • Champion cross-functional teamwork and maintain stakeholder relationships
Qualifications
  • Demonstrable  cross-disciplinary experience in strategy, product, innovation, and AI
  • Critical thinking with a data-driven, analytical approach to problem-solving
  • Strong intuition for business and stakeholder management skills
  • Passion for digital marketplaces and products
  • Proven record as an encouraging people leader
  • Experience in search engine optimization preferred but not required
Additional Information

At SEEK we offer:

  • Support of flexible working, including a mix of office and work from home days depending on your role.
  • The opportunity to work from anywhere for up to 4 weeks per financial year
  • Tailored career development planning

At SEEK, we are passionate about fostering a culture of inclusion and wellbeing that embraces and values the diversity of our people. We are a purpose driven business that works with heart.

We know teams with diverse ideas, experiences and perspectives are more creative and are critical to ensuring effective delivery and innovating to enable our future success. As such, we welcome applications from people with diverse backgrounds and life experiences, especially as they relate to gender, sexual identity, culture, faith, disability and life stages. If you have the skills, curiosity and an adaptable mindset but don't meet every responsibility or qualification listed in this advertisement, please still get in touch with us.

Should you require any specific support or adjustments throughout the recruitment process and beyond, please advise us and we will be happy to assist.

For this role, only those with eligible right to work will be considered.

SEEK kindly requests no unsolicited resumes or approaches from recruitment agencies and will not be responsible for any associated fees.

What you'll be doing
 

To provide expert clinical consultancy and services within the Alcohol and other Drugs (AOD) Service, practicing within the CNC Domains, up to and including the functions of the CNC 3 role, and to demonstrate leadership in promoting contemporary nursing / midwifery practice within the Mid North Coast Local Health District.

This position will work closely with the AOD stream managers and provide timely and expert advice to the AOD District Manager and Clinical Director on all matters related to nursing.

 

All NSW Health workers are required to have completed a primary course of a COVID-19 vaccine which has been approved or recognised by the Therapeutics Goods Administration (TGA). Additionally, Category A workers are required to receive a booster dose three months after completing the primary course of COVID-19 vaccinations.

New applicants must have completed the vaccination course prior to commencement with NSW Health, or provide an approved medical contraindication certificate (IM011 immunisation medical exemption form) certifying the worker cannot have any approved COVID-19 vaccines available in NSW.

Acceptable proof of vaccination is the Australian Immunisation Register (AIR) Immunisation History Statement or AIR COVID-19 Digital Certificate. Booster doses are highly recommended for all health care workers who have completed the primary course of COVID-19 vaccinations.

Salary will be accordance with NSW Health State Awards for the advertised classification/s.  These awards are available at http://www.health.nsw.gov.au/careers/conditions/pages/default.aspx.

AN ELIGIBILITY LIST FROM THIS RECRUITMENT ACTIVITY MAY BE CREATED FOR FUTURE VACANCIES

  1. Current registration with the Nursing and Midwifery Board of Australia with at least 7 years full time equivalent post registration experience and post graduate qualifications with at least 5 years full time experience in the Alcohol and Other Drugs field.
  2. Evidence of significant contribution to the direction of clinical nursing education within the Alcohol and Other Drugs Service and experience in the provision of education to peers, clients and other service providers.
  3. Demonstrated evidence of extensive contemporary knowledge of Alcohol and Other Drug treatment.   
  4. Demonstrated evidence of leading research and making a contribution to nursing / midwifery science
  5. Excellent interpersonal skills and proven ability to implement change and practice development across a multidisciplinary team and a range of stakeholders using current evidence and research
  6. Demonstrated evidence of leading and managing complex projects relating to significant practice change for the organisation
  7. Proven ability to consult, review, and develop, both new and existing policies and procedures.
  8. Current NSW driver's license and ability and willingness to travel for work purposes.

job_title: Paediatric Oncology Drug Access Navigator - Kids Cancer Centre
job_ad_details:
Employment Type: Temporary Part Time, up to 30 June 2024
Position Classification: Pharmacist Gde 3
Remuneration: 123870.36 - 127316.75 full time equivalent base salary range (excludes super, leave loading and salary packaging)
Hours Per Week: 32
Requisition ID: REQ400896

Sydney Children's Hospitals Network is the largest paediatric health care entity in Australia. We care for thousands of children each year in our hospitals and in their homes — with one purpose in mind — to help young people live their healthiest lives.

Click here to learn more about our Network


Opportunity to join the Kids Cancer Centre as a Drug Access Navigator, as part of a leading precision medicine program.

What you'll be doing
The Kids Cancer Centre (KCC) located at the Sydney Children’s Hospital Randwick, in partnership with the Children’s Cancer Institute (CCI) have developed the Zero Childhood Cancer program (Zero). Zero is one of the most sophisticated precision medicine programs in the world, bringing together all major Australian clinical and research groups working in childhood cancer to offer Australia’s first ever personalised medicine program for children with high-risk or relapsed cancer.
The KCC is currently seeking to appoint a Paediatric Oncology Drug Access Navigator to manage the pharmaceutical care of patients enrolled on Zero at a national level. This includes patients accessing:
• Standard treatments
• Novel drug treatments and combinations that have been recommended following comprehensive molecular profiling.
Drug access for paediatric patients in Australia is an ongoing challenge, particularly with the recommendation of many new, targeted agents coming from the comprehensive molecular analysis undertaken in the Zero program. The Paediatric Oncology Drug Access Navigator will be based at the Sydney Children’s Hospital Randwick and will work closely with CCI as the research and clinical leads of Zero. They will coordinate drug access on a national scope, assisting children, adolescents, and young adults at all paediatric oncology treatment centres across Australia.
This role will be required to develop positive cross-team relationships with a wide variety of stakeholders, including clinicians, allied health professionals, scientists, pharmaceutical companies and drug regulatory bodies.



  1. Pharmacist with AHPRA registration with no restrictions and or with suitable experience to meet the NSW Health Employees’ Pharmacists (State) Award criteria of a Pharmacist Grade 3.
  2. Significant clinical experience and a demonstrated high level of competence, expertise, skill and application of clinical judgement in clinical pharmacy services relevant to paediatric oncology.
  3. Demonstrated ability working with families, pharmaceutical companies and other external stakeholders. Demonstrated high level communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to interact effectively with clinical staff and senior managers.
  4. High level of written and verbal communication, organisational and leadership skills with the ability to effectively problem solve.
  5. Proven ability to be self-directed and motivated, with ability to manage conflicting priorities and meet deadlines.
  6. Prior experience working with clinical trials desirable.
  7. Prior experience accessing compassionate use of drugs from pharmaceutical companies desirable.

 

SCHN is an Equal Opportunity Employer that values diversity - we acknowledge the vibrancy that a diverse workforce brings to enhance both our workplace culture and our service delivery to children, young people and their families and carers. We encourage all suitably qualified applicants to apply. If you identify as an Indigenous Australian or as a person with a disability, please contact us if you would like some more information about our recruitment process.

 

Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people are encouraged to apply. We recognise the value of Aboriginal staff providing health care to Aboriginal children and families that access the services we provide at the Sydney Children’s Hospitals Network. Aboriginal job applicants are encouraged to visit the NSW Health Aboriginal Recruitment tool, Stepping Up to assist in preparing your application.

 

Please refer to the Application Guide and NSW Policy Directive PD2022_030 Occupational Assessment Screening and Vaccination Against Specified Infectious Diseases for vaccination requirements.

 

All NSW Health workers are required to have completed a primary course (2 doses) of a COVID-19 vaccine which has been approved or recognised by the Therapeutics Goods Administration (TGA). Additionally, as this is a Category A position, workers are required to receive a booster dose three months after completing the primary course of COVID-19 vaccinations. New applicants must have completed the vaccination course prior to commencement with NSW Health, or provide an approved medical contraindication certificate (IM011 immunisation medical exemption form) certifying the worker cannot have any approved COVID-19 vaccines available in NSW.​

Acceptable proof of vaccination is the Australian Immunisation Register (AIR) Immunisation History Statement or AIR COVID-19 Digital Certificate. Booster doses are highly recommended for all health care workers who have completed the primary course of COVID-19 vaccinations.

 

This position requires a Working with Children Check (WWCC) issued by the Office of the Children’s Guardian.  For more information on how to apply for the clearance, please visit the Office of the Children’s Guardian Website https://www.kidsguardian.nsw.gov.au/

 

Need more information?

  2) Find out more about applying for this position

For role related queries or questions contact Jessica Theng on Jessica.Theng@health.nsw.gov.au

If you are Aboriginal or Torres Strait islander wishing to apply for this role and want to speak with an Aboriginal person/representative from the Sydney Children’s Hospital Network please contact Wayne Dargan on 0486012545.
