Company description:

KiwiRail Ltd



Job description:

NEW YEAR! NEW JOB?! NEW YOU? We are looking for a committed person to start their Rail Career in this role in early February 2023 and become part of our One Winning Team!

Check out what it's like to work as a Rail Operator at KiwiRail - click here it's time to join us!

  • Excellent learning opportunity with career progression opportunities
  • Training rate starting at $26.24 per hour rising once qualified to $28.67
  • Shift work with in advance planned rosters to allow work-life balance

Your role:

First and foremost, we want you to succeed and grow at KiwiRail. This is why we will invest into your initial and ongoing training to build your competencies and confidence to make the right decisions and work safely in our safety critical environment. Our Rail Operators are a hugely important part of our business. Our teams work outside in our freight rail yards in all weathers in a physically challenging role where safety is of the utmost importance.

You'll see yourself performing shunting duties. This means you'll link and unlink wagons, direct train drivers when coupling wagons and locomotives, place wagons into customer sidings (railway parking tracks). You'll be an essential part of conducting safety checks ensuring that all vehicles in the train are in a fit state to commence the journey. You will be working in a small team and also be communicating via radio, so clear communication skills are essential.

Your skills:

You'll be a team player that enjoys the challenge of a physical role while working outdoors. This role involves some heavy manual handling and a reasonable amount of walking. You'll be working on a 24/7 rotating roster, so previous experience working shifts is advantageous, along with experience working outdoors in all-weather conditions.

  • You could come from any background, as long as you have had exposure to physical labour where H&S was at the core of what you did.
  • Health & Safety is critical in our organisation, so you will need to have a strong safety focus and genuinely care about the well-being of your team and yourself at all times.
  • Teamwork is second nature to you, and you can easily communicate to people from all walks of life.
  • Full NZ Drivers Licence and own transport

Your Benefits:

  • A competitive hourly rate of $26.24 + time and a half Saturdays & double time Sundays
  • Extensive support and ongoing training.
  • KiwiRail will support your development if you are willing to expose yourself to the opportunities and you are keen to learn and grow with us. The more experience in the yard you gain the more opportunities open up to you with pay increases and with job progression opportunities. Your training is universally recognised.
  • Heavily discounted travel and health insurance
  • 5 weeks annual leave

Looking for a career path not just a dead end job? Want job stability with a company that invests in your future and pays you while they train you to succeed? Apply now and start your journey today!

Applications close: 30th May 2023

job_title: 2DHB COVID Response MIF & Community Quarantine Service Coordinator
job_ad_details:
Nau mai, haere mai ki Ūpoko ki te uru hauora.

Location: Wellington Regional Hospital

Service:  2DHB Covid-19 Response

Contract: Full Time - Fixed Term to July 2022

About the role:

This role will support the Operations Lead – COVID19 Response and Executive Director to achieve equity, improve health outcomes, drive and support innovation and meet performance targets and objectives by providing logistic support as part of a responsive, pro-equity COVID-19 immunisation programme across our communities. You will: 

  • Work with the Managed Isolation and Community Quarantine Service Lead to ensure delegated tasks which support the provision of resources required to ensure the delivery of the agreed production plan for the COVID 19 vaccination program are delivered
  • Support management activities as directed
  • Assist with the monitoring of activity to ensure the planned delivery is occurring and resources are in place to meet operational needs
  • Support Managed Isolation and Community Quarantine staff to ensure delivery and performance meets agreed specifications as directed
  • Maintain effective and collaborative working relationships with service providers to support Managed Isolation and Community Quarantine activity, reduce duplication, enhance effectiveness of services, and achieve maximum benefit within allocated resources.

Essential qualifications, skills and experience:

  • Previous experience in operations coordination or administration
  • Understanding of the operational requirements, including common obstacles and effective solutions
  • Quick critical thinking and problem solving ability
  • Excellent organisation and customer service skills
  • Previous experience implementing technical business processes
  • Ability to build and maintain effective working relationships
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills

About us

Capital and Coast DHB (CCDHB) is located centrally in Wellington and has over 6,000 full-time equivalent staff, making us one of the major employers in the Wellington region. CCDHB operates two hospitals – Wellington Regional Hospital in Newtown and Kenepuru Hospital in Porirua – as well as the Kapiti Health Centre at Paraparaumu. 

Here at CCDHB we embrace diversity and welcome applications from people of all gender identities, ages, ethnicities, sexual orientations, disability and religions. A workforce that is diverse and inclusive means that we are better positioned to understand and serve our community.

CCDHB is a pro-equity Health Organisation, with a particular focus on Māori, Pacific Peoples, and the Disability Community.

CCDHB provides a range of specialist services including neurosurgery, oncology, neonatal intensive care and community-based services including district nursing, rehabilitation services, social work, alcohol and drug services, and home support services to a population of around 900,000 people.

How to apply

Applications close Sunday 12 September 2021. For further information on this role please email recruitment@ccdhb.org.nz and indicate the job title and vacancy number in the subject line.

You will oversee the Gippsland Performing Arts Centre technical team to deliver exceptional customer service and back of house services exceeding community expectations whilst maintaining a safe work environment.

Go Further at Latrobe City Council

Diversity and Inclusion

At Latrobe City Council we are committed to providing positive employment opportunities for Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people and welcome employment applications from candidates of Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander background. Pathways Residences is a luxury Residential Aged Care provider across Sydney. We are looking for night shift Registered Nurses to join our team in our Cronulla NSW 2230 residence.

Permanent full-time and part-time positions available!

Our culture

We pride ourselves in respecting staff, residents, their family members, and other stakeholders who visit our facility.

The role of a night shift in-charge RN

As an experienced RN, the role will see you lead AINs during night shift. Responding to wounds, falls, medication, dementia, deterioration, staff roster, conflict-resolution and facility-wide communication are all in a night's work for a Registered Nurse. You will be the go-to person and so must have confidence in yourself, your abilities, your understanding, your clinical and management skills and your experience.

About you:

  • We are happy to negotiate  a combination of overnight and day shifts
  • Have the capability to be in-charge
  • Experience in aged care/geriatrics required
  • Understanding of the Aged Care Quality Standards 
  • Able to manage AINs on shift, be computer literate, have sound verbal and written communication abilities
  • Analytical, a problem solver, and friendly to work with

A few requirements of the role:

  • Relevant experience and qualification in nursing + AHPRA registration
  • COVID vaccine + 1 booster
  • Police Check + NDIS Worker Check
  • Right to work in Australia + 100 Points of ID

What we can offer:

  • $40-$46/hour + super + shift loading
  • Other applicable allowances (e.g. laundry allowance, in charge allowance)
  • Additional annual leave + sick leave + picnic day + other leave entitlements
  • Have the opportunity to grow into senior roles or branch out to specialist roles
  • A harmonious, trusting and respectful workplace
  • A rewarding industry looking after our elderly Australians
  • Tap into our network of health professionals
  • Experience a luxury Aged Care home 

If you are excited to make a difference in the lives of our elderly Australians, click ‘apply’ and we look forward to receiving your application.

job_title: Duty Store Manager - Northcote / Airport West -35 hours p/w
job_ad_details:
Start your Retail Management Career with ALDI. Bring your management potential and we’ll teach you the rest.

As an ALDI Duty Store Manager, you need to be able to juggle multiple things at once, motivate others and keep calm under pressure. 

Previous management or supervisory experience in a fast paced environment is a bonus, but not essential. Our Duty Store Manager will be responsible for safety, compliance, merchandising, customer service, administration, stock ordering, inventory management, rostering and people management. Everything you need to be a key member of the team managing a multi-million dollar business!

Our high performing Duty Store Managers form a part of our succession planning for leadership roles. High performers may be selected to progress to Assistant Store Manager and Store Manager roles in the future.

What's in it for you? 

  • Market leading remuneration - $29.96 per hour + penalties*
  • 35 hour per week contract 
  • Rotating roster including weekends and early mornings
  • Comprehensive management training 
  • 5 weeks annual leave
  • Be a part of a leading international retailer
  • Career opportunities to progress to Store Manager in our growing store network for the right candidate
  • High levels of self-direction and responsibility
  • Working with a retailer who has been recognised as an Employer of Choice (as voted in 2022, 2021, 2020, 2019 and 2018)
  • Excellent team culture where you work alongside friendly and supportive colleagues
  • Complimentary access to MyALDI Wellbeing program giving you support and exclusive benefits in wellness from discounted gym memberships to healthcare plans
  • An EAP program that you and your immediate family can use which is 100% free and confidential
  • Complimentary access to our Injury Support Program, where you can access free physiotherapy to treat both work and non-work-related aches, pains or niggles**

    •  You will be responsible for:

  • Learning every aspect of running a store
  • Serving customers and taking payments
  • Assisting store management in driving sales and achieving targets
  • Help develop, guide and motivate a capable team of store staff of the highest quality and standard
  • Minimise costs by tightly controlling inventory losses, quality of contractor’s work, minimising staff turnover and maximising productivity

    • * As a Duty Store Manager you will need to work in the evenings and on weekends as part of the store management team. 

    ** Conditions apply

As a General Manager, you will be responsible for overseeing all aspects of the coworking space operation, ensuring an exceptional experience for members, fostering a vibrant community, and driving business growth. This role requires strong leadership skills, operational excellence, and a passion for creating a collaborative and inspiring work environment.

Client Details

We are currently representing one a notable coworking development in Bali. They are currently in growth mode and actively seeking a General Manager to assist them in bringing the development to a new height.

Description

Team Management

  • Oversee performance management and help your team grow and develop
  • Motivate team and hold them accountable for responsibilities and goals across all key areas of the business (sales, operations, finance, member experience, hospitality, and more)

Operations

  • Manage day-to-day community operations to exceed member expectations and uphold high quality and standards of the coworking space
  • Supervise move-ins and move-outs for quality experience
  • Oversee relationships with third-party partners (building, facilities, F&B, etc.) to ensure efficient and effective operations while trying to minimize costs without compromising quality
  • Solve member-related issues and conduct feedback analyses to address opportunity areas
  • Oversee space operations including daily walkthroughs and inventory management

Hospitality & Events

  • Provide proactive, warm service that goes above and beyond to retain members.
  • Oversee development of community initiatives and event strategy designed to create connections between members (i.e., member intros, networking, engaging & fun events)
  • Develop innovative ways to surprise and delight members to create a unique experience
  • Meet regularly with senior member stakeholders to discuss objectives and gather feedback
  • Oversee event budget to ensure it is maximized by increasing partnerships to decrease spend

Business Development

  • Own full sales cycle of your location in order to meet and maintain buildings target occupancy
  • Includes touring, pitching, negotiating, and contract execution
  • Generate new sales pipeline and own current member retention
  • Create campaigns to lease-up space as needed
  • Achieve high member retention rates including setting renewal meetings and negotiating renewal terms
  • Coach and mentor direct reports including training, development, and ongoing support

Finance

  • Own the monthly profit and loss statement. Oversee all budget lines to ensure the business is operating as projected, track all expenses, and discuss monthly P&L with business leaders
  • Review accounts payable invoices and identify trends and ways to reduce costs
  • Consistently analyze spend to determine ways to cut costs while still maintaining standards
  • Conduct monthly bill run, ensuring accurate invoices produced and distributed on time
  • Oversee all accounts receivable and ensure member invoices are paid each month

Profile

  • Bachelor's degree in hospitality, business management or equivalent
  • 3-6 years of experience in coworking, hospitality, sales, or operations
  • Sales and business operations experience required
  • Financial literacy and experience managing a team preferred
  • Due to the nature of the role this position requires onsite presence

Job Offer

  • High impact, high visibility role
  • Great career prospects as the growth opportunity in the company is tremendous

To apply online please click the 'Apply' button below. For a confidential discussion about this role please contact Oswin Ersyanda on +62 21 2958 8829

As a Financial Control Analyst, you will be responsible with the following:

  • Supporting Cost COE Related accounting and reporting function to support onshore finance control teams including provision of accurate and timely financial information and ensuring that all processes and reporting obligations are adequately met.
  • Responsibility to maintain financial integrity and controls in Cost related hub processes
  • Deliver end to end accountability for centralised country agnostic processes e.g. journals, recs etc.
  • Develop process expertise but maintain flexibility across processes within Cost & Consolidation team
  • Ensure quality at source by implementing process level controls
  • Support the Cost COE data sourcing, accounting and reporting processes
  • Support the implementation and ownership of centralised, standardised processes and controls within the Data & Reporting team
  • Accurate and timely delivery of standardised outputs to country that are flexible enough to meet local regulatory reporting requirements, month-end delivery requirements, registers, schedules, reconciliations, trial balance, and ensuring accounting services are completed to support financial reporting and successful audit completion
  • Support the BU change agenda, incl. Elimination/Simplification/Automation of relevant financial control activities, partnering with Manila Digital & Automation Team where applicable
About You

To be successful in this role, you will ideally bring the following -

  • A bachelor's degree in a related field of studies and be a qualified Chartered Accountant (CA) / Certified Practicing Accountant (CPA)
  • Proven experience in financial services roles
  • Solid working knowledge of financial control within a financial services environment
  • Supporting continuous improvement initiatives
  • Experience in presenting finance matters, including issues and resolutions to stakeholders
About ANZ

At ANZ, everything we do boils down to 'why' - our purpose - to shape a world where people and communities thrive. We're just as focused on seeing our people thrive as well as our customers. We'll give you every opportunity to develop your career.

We are responding faster to changing customer requirements, focusing on the things that matter the most, energising our people, eliminating waste and reducing bureaucracy.

A happy workplace is a thriving one. So in order to attract and keep the best talent, and say thanks for the hard work, we make sure all our employees are rewarded.

We work flexibly at ANZ and encourage you to talk to us about how this role can be flexible for you and any adjustments you may require to our recruitment process or the role itself. If you are a candidate with a disability, let us know how we can provide you with additional support.

We are looking for Sr. Financial Analyst to support Change Healthcare, an international healthcare company located in BGC, Taguig.


Change Healthcare is seeking Sr. Financial Analysts who will create value for the Decision Support finance team, acting as a key advisor by providing accurate and data-based recommendations to drive business performance improvement.  You will be responsible for supporting the financial planning and analysis activities for the Decision Support finance team within Change Healthcare. In this role, you will provide full finance support to VP and/or SVP business partners.


What will be my duties and responsibilities in this job?
  • Financial Analysis - Analyze and communicate the key metrics and drivers against history, budget, forecast, and strategic plan.
  • Planning & Forecasting – Support the financial planning activities in a manner that yields challenging, but achievable, strategic plans, budgets and forecasts and provides clear understanding of requirements and results.
  • Modeling – Develop/maintain financial models to enable analytics around trends, performance, and outlook
  • Support – Support field operations in analysis of their financial performance and determining areas of improvement.
  • Special Projects - Carry out special projects as required. 

What are the requirements needed for this position?
  • Typically requires 3-5 years progressive experience in finance or investment banking sectors.
  • Bachelor of Science in Accounting, Finance or Business.  CPA/MBA a plus
  • Experience modeling business scenarios or tracking performance metrics that will be used to  support decision making by executive leadership
  • Proficient at analyzing, interpreting, and succinctly synthesizing large amounts of financial data.
  • Advanced experience with ERP system (SAP or similar) and financial planning system (TM1 or similar).
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills  Will drive discussions with functional senior leaders on their reporting, planning, and identify/recommend efficiencies.
  • Demonstrated ability to manage competing priorities, strong organizational skills and attention to detail with the ability to prepare a variety of financial reports in a timely and effective manner.
 
What other skills/experience would be helpful to have?
  • Tableau, Alteryx, or SQL experience is nice to have
  • Healthcare industry experience a plus
  • Experience managing multiple P&L’s or multiple Businesses
  • Advanced knowledge of Microsoft Office products especially PowerPoint
  • Demonstrated ability to manage competing priorities.
 
What's in it for you?
  • Competitive salary package
  • Full-time employment
  • Job stability
  • Work-life balance
  • Exciting benefits such as Retirement plan with investment
  • HMO, Life insurance
  • WFH until further notice

job_ad_details:
Kyna Pte. Ltd. (Kyna English) is an online education company based in Singapore, providing online English learning solutions with quality tutors for learners of all ages. With over 4 years of operation, Kyna has delivered over 5 million lessons to more than 100,000 students in Vietnam, Thailand, and Indonesia. In order to expand our offering, Kyna English is looking for Online English Teachers from Thailand.
Your responsibilities:
- Teach English online in a 1-on-1 or 1-on-4 format for Thai students
- You can choose to teach children (ages 5-17), adults (ages 18-50), or both
Your benefits:
- Teach from the comfort of your home.
- Flexible teaching time, classes are assigned after you set up your schedule.
- Ready-made teaching materials on a teacher-friendly platform
- Performance bonus for each qualified class.
- Gross rate from 100 - 250 THB/ hour.
- There will be an extra bonus for each qualified and completed class. Golden hour bonus for teachers who teach in our peak hours (6:00 - 9:00 PM) (Thailand time - GMT +7)

Employment Type: 1 x Temporary Part Time (Up to 27/10/2024)
Position Classification: Registered Midwife
Remuneration: $35.32 - $49.60 per hour
Hours Per Week: 20
Location: Blacktown Hospital
Requisition ID: REQ450516

 

 

Where you'll be working
Western Sydney Local Health District (WSLHD) is responsible for providing primary and secondary health care for people living in the Auburn, Blacktown, and The Hills Shire, Holroyd and Parramatta Local Government Areas (LGAs) and tertiary care to residents of the Greater Western Region. We are committed to our vision of 'better health services for the people of western Sydney and beyond' and to the delivery of health care or related services in line with our core values of collaboration, openness, respect and empowerment.

 

Find out what it’s like to work at Blacktown Hospital and why we think you’d love working with us. Some of our staff share their experiences in this short video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=3sRBCQLiUSE

 

Benefits of working for Western Sydney Local Health District 

  • Paid Allocated Day Off (ADO) every month, in addition to your annual leave (For full time staff)
  • Salary Packaging - lowers your taxable income and increases your take-home pay. (Applicable for eligible employees)  http://wslhdintranet.wsahs.nsw.gov.au/salary-packaging-with-smartsalary  
  • Meal entertainment lowers your taxable income and increases your take-home pay.  (Applicable for eligible employees) http://wslhdintranet.wsahs.nsw.gov.au/salary-packaging-with-smartsalary
  • Employee Assistance Program (EAP) professional counselling and coaching service that offers confidential, short-term support for work-related and personal issues, which you and your immediate family can access
  • Managers Support - Employee Assistance Program (EAP) professional consultative service for all managers, HR or senior staff that is confidential and unlimited for people management support
  • Fitness Passport - permanent employees and their immediate family members can sign-up for this affordable membership which allows access to an extensive range of gyms, pools and fitness services from multiple providers across NSW, (not available for temp employees- remove if position temporary)
  • Generous leave conditions in accordance with NSW Health (State) awards
  • Recognition of prior relevant service may be considered toward commencing salary 
  • Leave may be transferrable from other public sector agencies in accordance with leave mobility provisions

 

 


What you'll be doing
Provide individualised excellent patient/client care within a health service environment to maximise the health outcomes for a patient/client, within a multidisciplinary team to achieve identified goals and outcomes.

  

People with disabilities who meet the selection criteria are encouraged to apply; and where required, WSLHD will implement reasonable adjustment consistent with industry standard.

 

Stepping Up aims to assist Aboriginal job applicants by providing information about applying for roles in NSW Health organisations.  For more information, please visit https://www.steppingup.health.nsw.gov.au/ Aboriginal and/or Torres Strait Islander people are encouraged to apply.

 

Blacktown hospital car parking allocation model is changing. There is a managed waitlist for parking for new staff commencing at Blacktown Hospital. This does not apply to staff with a disability parking permit.

 

Please note: A person who is not an Australian citizen or a permanent resident is only eligible for temporary employment for a period not longer than the duration of their current visa or a period not shorter than the duration of the advertised position.

 

 

 Please be aware that due to the Christmas / New Year period, there may be a delay in the progress of your application.  The convenor of this position may not be in contact with you until the new year if you are successful in obtaining an interview.

 



Essential Requirements

Registration: Current Registration with AHPRA as a Registered Midwife

Selection Critieria

  1. Previous relevant clinical experience in speciality.
  2. Demonstrated ability to organise and prioritise work.
  3. Demonstrated effective communication skills both written and verbal.
  4. Ability to work as a member of a multidisciplinary team.
  5. Commitment to continuing professional development.
  6. Effective interpersonal skills showing initiative and leadership to junior members of the team .

Pine Rivers Private Hospital

Clinical Nurse - Mental Health

  • Perfect location in Brisbane's Northern Suburbs - Avoid the city commute!
  • Free Parking on site + public transport close by
  • Key leadership opportunity at a leading hospital dedicated to Mental health
  • Free morning tean and afternoon tea daily + discounted buffet lunch and dinner
  • Uniforms provided

Pine Rivers Private Hospital are seeking a Clinical Nurse (Mental Health) to join our team in this permanent part time opportunity (64-72 hours per fortnight) across a 7-day roster including evenings and overnights.

As a Clinical Nurse, your responsibilities will include:

  • Facilitate quality nursing care to our patients in collaboration with the NUM
  • Partner with VMO's and other health care team member to identify patient care needs, plan interventions and review outcomes of care
  • Maintaining appropriate documentation
  • Act as a role model to lead, coach, develop and mentor our team of nursing professionals

About us:

Located on the bank of the South Pine River, our 70 bed mental health facility provides comprehensive inpatient and day programs for our Queensland community. As a leading provider, we specialise in addiction, bipolar and depressive disorders, mood disorders, OCD, PTSD and complex PTSD management, psychosis and chronic pain management. We also deliver specialised therapies in EMDR, TMS and ECT.

About you:

To be successful in your application, you will need to meet the requirements below:

  • Current nursing registration with AHPRA
  • Extensive experience working within a mental health setting
  • Proven ability to assess, plan, coordinate and evaluate care delivery needs of patient
  • Comprehensive clinical knowledge, particularly to medical and rehabilitation related health issues
  • Ability to show your lead, coach, mentor and support our team of clinical professionals

Desired criteria

  • Prior leadership experience
  • Post graduate in mental health nursing

Remuneration

  • This position will be paid in accordance with the Healthscope - Queensland - Nurses and Midwives - Enterprise Agreement 2021. Salary range: $51.38 - $54.98 per hour.

Why Healthscope?
We care about your career at Healthscope.

No matter where you go within our community of care, you'll be supported by great team leaders, be part of strong, innovative teams who always strive for better and have the opportunity to flourish and grow.

Our people are at the heart of our organisation - no matter the role, every day our people make a difference to the lives of our patients and their families. We work together to create positive, memorable experiences, alongside our quality care, in every moment of every day.

We are the only national private hospital operator and healthcare provider in Australia. But why does that matter? Our team is made up of over 19,000 highly experienced people working across a range of roles and specialisations. Supported by some of the best doctors in nationally, we come together to strive for better, sharing learnings, supporting each other, celebrating successes and facing challenges together.

Joining us opens the door to endless opportunities. We encourage the pursuit of continuous professional development, specialisation and education, and support our people to grow and flourish.

Come and be the difference in our patient's lives.

Applications close: 21 July 2023

To Apply: Please click on the 'Apply' button to be taken to our online application form. For any questions, please reach out prv.enquiries@healthscope.com.au

Requirements: Our commitment to quality and safety for our patients, staff and visitors is our highest priority. Applicants will be required to provide a current National Police Check and proof of immunisation to infectious diseases prior to appointment.

job_ad_details:
Job Description:

  • Record day-to-day financial transactions and complete the posting process.
  • Verify that transactions are recorded in the correct ledger, supplier ledger, customer ledger, and general ledger.
  • Bring the books to the trial balance stage.
  • Perform partial checks of the posting process.
  • Enter data, maintain records, and prepare reports and financial statements.
  • Process accounts receivable/payable and handle payroll in a timely manner.
  • Prepare bank reconciliations and ensure accuracy.
  • Assist in the preparation of budgets and financial forecasts
  • Perform day-to-day financial transactions, including verifying, classifying, and recording accounts payable data
  • Prepare verify supplier bills, sales invoices.
  • Reconcile the accounts payable ledger to ensure that all bills and payments are accounted for and properly posted.
  • Monitor vendor payments and ensure that all invoices are paid accurately and on time.
  • Research and resolve invoice discrepancies and issues
  • Correspond with vendors and respond to inquiries in a timely manner.
  • Assist with month-end closing activities.
  • Maintain accurate historical records.

Requirements/Skills needed:


  • Proven bookkeeping experience (minimum 2- 5 years).
  • Come from working experience as an Accounts Payable Specialist or in a similar role
  • Solid understanding of basic bookkeeping and accounting payable/receivable principles
  • High degree of accuracy and attention to detail
  • Proficiency in MS Office, particularly Excel
  • Experience with accounting software (e.g., Xero)
  • Excellent analytical, problem-solving, and organizational skills
  • Ability to prioritize and manage multiple responsibilities
  • Strong written and verbal communication skills
  • Strong analytical skills.
  • Ability to work independently and as part of a team.
  • Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
  • Ability to manage multiple tasks and meet deadlines.

Digital Marketing & Event, Senior Manager(Lifestyle)

About the client:

Our client is a prestigious organization headquartered in Hong Kong, dedicated to promoting local culture and driving regional economic development. They provide extensive resources and services to support diverse industries and businesses, fostering growth within the region.

To support their business objectives, our client is currently seeking a highly experienced and accomplished Digital Marketing & Event, Senior Manager to join their dynamic team.

Main Duties & Responsibility:

Under the guidance of the Director, your role will involve:

  • Leading the strategic development and execution of digital initiatives on websites to enrich visitor interactions and stimulate business opportunities for our partners.
  • Taking the lead in coordinating and overseeing global trade events (B2B) and consumer shows (B2C) for both the Head Office and International Offices, ensuring flawless implementation and optimal engagement.
  • Supervising the successful implementation of key consumer events across multiple countries to bolster campaigns and promotions in alignment with the overarching marketing strategy.
  • Contributing to the creation of tailored trade show modules and consumer show modules for international markets, catering to the specific requirements and preferences of diverse regions.
  • Collaborating closely with agencies to craft and supervise the production of compelling, top-tier marketing materials that effectively showcase our brand and offerings.

Candidate Profile:

For interested candidates, the following qualifications are desirable:

  • Bachelor's Degree in Marketing, Journalism, Public Relations, Communications, or a related field.
  • A minimum of 8 years of substantial experience in digital projects and event coordination.
  • Proven proficiency in strategizing and executing comprehensive integrated marketing projects and promotional events on a large scale.
  • Thorough understanding of digital technologies and applications, with a strong ability to leverage them for marketing purposes.
  • Excellent command of written and spoken English, Cantonese, and Mandarin. Proficiency in additional languages is considered a plus.

What to expect:

Our esteemed client offers a comprehensive compensation package, thereby enabling candidates to operate within a renowned organization. As candidates join the client's company, they will have the opportunity to integrate into a highly esteemed professional environment.

For other available opportunities, please visit www.connectedgroup.com

Attachments:

Senior Evaluator - Permanent

We are looking for a Senior Evaluator to join Te Pūkenga subsidiary Institutes of Technology and Polytechnics (SITP) and Degree Approval Team in the Approvals and Accreditation business unit.

Whakatairangatia ngā kete o te mātauranga ki te ao mārama! E te tai whakarunga, e te tai whakararo – nau piki mai, nau kake mai ki te Mana Tohu Mātauranga o Aotearoa.

May the baskets of knowledge (education) be brought into the world of light. We welcome one and all to join us at the New Zealand Qualifications Authority.

About the role 

We have a vacancy for a senior evaluator in the Approvals and Accreditation business unit in the Quality Assurance Division (QAD) of NZQA. The unit is responsible for managing the New Zealand Qualifications Framework (NZQF) and ensuring the quality of (non-university) qualifications and programmes delivered across New Zealand. We do that using an integrated quality assurance system as part of our evaluative quality assurance framework (EQAF).

To complement the strength of our team, we are looking for a Senior Evaluator to join Te Pūkenga subsidiary Institutes of Technology and Polytechnics (SITP) and Degree Approval Team in the Approvals and Accreditation business unit.

A central part of your role will be the evaluation and quality assurance of complex degree programmes underpinned by your advanced reporting capability. You will be an excellent communicator and possess first class relationship management skills to support our existing partnerships with SITPs and PTEs to help us achieve high-quality relevant outcomes for learners, especially at the degree level.

Skills and experience

If you hold a relevant postgraduate degree, have current or recent experience in pedagogy,  expert knowledge of curriculum and assessment design at degree level, along with applied understanding of educational quality assurance, we want to hear from you. 

The workload is challenging, and we are looking for people who have the aptitude and attitude to perform to an exceptionally high level in an evolving environment that is target driven. 

About us

NZQA is a te reo Māori learning organisation and is committed to equity and lifelong learning. We welcome candidates from diverse backgrounds that will enrich our understanding of the education system. We prioritise the importance of understanding tikanga in building a culturally responsive workplace.  NZQA is dedicated to providing a welcoming environment to Māori and Pacific staff and has active Māori and Pacific staff networks which contribute to NZQA's strategic action plans - Te Kōkiritanga and Takiala Pasifika.

What we can offer:

  • A supportive team / whanau environment
  • A role with lots of variety
  • Development and career progression opportunities
  • To find out more click here NZQA Staff Benefits

Apply Now!

For more information about this role and NZQA please refer to the job description, NZQA's Customer Charter and Organisational Values. If you are applying/viewing through Seek, please click ‘apply now' to access these links.

If you would like to discuss further, please call Nuzhat Sohail on 027 242 7883.

Applications close at 5.00 pm on Monday 18 April 2022.

The Head of Engineering will oversee all engineering activities for the upstream palm oil business, including managing PKS production, civil, and MEP projects. Key responsibilities include developing strategies, managing budgets, ensuring compliance with ISO, RSPO, and ISPO standards, and optimizing operations. The role requires at least 10 years of experience in palm oil mill operations and strong leadership in engineering project management.

Client Details

The client is a prominent player in the palm oil plantation sector, managing both upstream and downstream operations. Their upstream business focuses on plantation management, palm oil production, and processing through Palm Kernel Crushing Stations (PKS). Meanwhile, the downstream side handles refining, distribution, and other value-added activities. They are committed to sustainable practices, adhering to international standards like ISO, RSPO, and ISPO to ensure environmental and social responsibility.

Description

  • Oversee the development and execution of the Engineering Work Plan and Budget (RKA) to ensure timely completion, efficient resource allocation, and adherence to company guidelines.

  • Develop strategies and implement production plans for Palm Kernel Crushing Stations (PKS), ensuring targets for schedule, volume, and quality are met. Oversee all civil and MEP engineering tasks to ensure they comply with standards.

  • Strategize and manage civil and MEP projects, ensuring timely and cost-efficient completion in line with contracts and specifications. Evaluate budget plans, equipment, and material usage for ongoing and future projects.

  • Ensure all engineering processes adhere to ISO, RSPO, and ISPO standards. Drive continuous improvements by optimizing methods, proposing new technologies, and revising SOPs for efficiency.Implement health, safety, and environmental programs to minimize work-related risks and manage waste in compliance with regulations.

  • Lead, develop, and mentor the engineering team. Set individual KPIs, foster a culture aligned with company values, and ensure continuous development through training and knowledge sharing.

  • Review and sign off on all operational documents and reports, ensuring accuracy and preventing errors or fraud. Establish quality objectives and monitor performance metrics across engineering operations.

Profile

  • At least 10 years in the palm oil industry, with a minimum of 3 years as Chief Engineering/Head of Engineering or 7 years as Regional Mill Controller/GM Processing
  • Proven experience managing civil and mechanical engineering projects in large-scale operations.

  • A Bachelor's degree in Mechanical, Civil, or Electrical Engineering.

  • Strong leadership abilities, capable of managing large teams and complex engineering projects across multiple disciplines (civil, mechanical, and MEP).

  • Demonstrated ability to develop and implement strategies that optimize operations, ensuring cost-effectiveness and adherence to safety and environmental standards.

  • Deep understanding of PKS (Palm Kernel Crushing Station) operations and related engineering processes.

  • Familiarity with ISO, RSPO, ISPO, and other sustainability standards, with the ability to ensure compliance.

  • A track record of driving continuous improvement initiatives and implementing innovative solutions to enhance operational efficiency.

  • Strong analytical and decision-making skills to handle complex engineering and operational challenges.

  • Excellent communication skills, able to provide clear direction to teams and collaborate with other departments and stakeholders.

  • Capable of fostering a collaborative, results-driven work culture aligned with the company's core values.

  • A commitment to mentoring and developing the engineering team, ensuring skill enhancement and preparing internal candidates for leadership roles.

Job Offer

  • A market-aligned salary, complemented by a comprehensive benefits package that includes health insurance, retirement plans, and other perks.

  • The chance to lead a critical engineering division in a well-established and expanding palm oil business, with significant influence over strategic decisions and operational outcomes.

  • The opportunity for career advancement within the company's hierarchy, with potential pathways to higher executive roles in the future.

To apply online please click the 'Apply' button below. For a confidential discussion about this role please contact Aphrodita Darmadion +62 21 2958 8914.

Responsibilities:

  • Coordinating the development of and providing continuity of support of operating activities including review of daily plant operations for quality, capacity, yield, and cost efficiency.
  • Support the Technology / Plant Operations team by developing functional strategies, setting new standards, and developing and implementing new processes that have a short to mid-term impact on the organization and achieve the mission, vision, and goals of the organization.
  • To ensure that the quality management system (QMS) is fully implemented in an organized and efficient manner.
  • Provides a proactive and effective plant training program to meet business, plant, function, and individual goals.
  • Efficiently and safely execute the production plan for Laboratory.
  • Monitor the performance of machines, Technician, and product quality monthly to meet requirement and customer satisfaction, in an environment of continuous improvement and cost effectiveness.


Qualifications:

  • Bachelor of Engineering or Sciences Major Chemistry or related field in Chemical.
  • At least 10 years' experience in Quality Control/ Quality Assurance procedures, processing lab equipment or equivalent experience at a petrochemical plant or chemical plant.
  • Experience in implementing ISO management standards (ISO9001, 14001, 17025) and QMR role as well as setting up and starting up QC laboratory.
  • Able to operation of laboratory equipment such as MFI, HPLC, Oven, Chemical storage, etc.
  • Familiar to use SAP or other Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP) system.
  • Experience with GMP, HACCP, HALAL, Kosher and Food Safety.
  • Have a certificate of Safety Officer Management level.
  • Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
  • The primary environment is a combination of office, control room, laboratory, plant environment and some travel required.
  • Good command of spoken and written English.

job_title: Part Time Weekend Merchandiser - Palmerston North
job_ad_details:
• Looking for part time, permanent work that offers work/life balance?
  • Like the sound of a job where you can exercise and keep fit while working?
  • Want to join an iconic kiwi FMCG company who is committed to growing you?

Here at The Griffin’s Food Company, we’re proud of our heritage and being New Zealand’s largest snack food company, producing many iconic kiwi brands, including Griffin’s, Huntley and Palmers, ETA and Nice & Natural.

We’re looking for a self-motivated and physically fit person to join us as a Part Time Weekend Merchandiser, working a guaranteed 8 hours per week (with the opportunity to pick up additional hours in a range of areas including sampling, relays, covering leave and peak season support) at the Pak'nSave Palmerston North store.

Reporting to the Territory Manager Central Lower North Island, the successful candidate will be a brand ambassador in store and will play a key role within our Sales team – ensuring that our much-loved products are looking amazing on shelf and are in easy reach, so our customers can purchase and enjoy their favourite snacks all year round!

What locations, days and hours would you be working?
  • Saturday: 4.00am - 8.00am
  • Sunday: 4.00am - 8.00am

What you’ll be responsible for?
  • Unloading pallets and restocking shelves (this could involve lifting boxes of up to 20kg and working at heights)
  • Checking pricing and best before dates, rotating and moving stock as needed
  • Following plans/planograms to ensure all product is laid out as per guidelines
  • Building promotional displays
  • Creating strong working relationships in store
  • Providing feedback from a store level and sharing new ideas/suggestions with your leader

What you’ll bring to the role?
  • Previous merchandising experience isn’t required but would be an extra tick!
  • Your own car and drivers license (that will allow you to legally drive at the times needed to get to/from your shifts)
  • Accountability, honesty and reliability - if you say you will be there you'll be there and can be trusted to work autonomously
  • Excellent communication and relationship building skills
  • Attention to detail – you like to get things right the first time and always double check your work
  • Willingness to roll up your sleeves and make it happen
  • Passion and interest in our company and products – you’ve been known to enjoy a good snack!
  • Positivity and a solutions-focused approach– nothing is ever a problem

Although we’d love you to bring the listed skills and experience to the role, we’re up for developing our people so if you think you tick a few of the boxes and are passionate about our brands, purpose and values, then we are keen to hear from you!

What can you expect in return? Full training to set you up for success, a supportive team and leader, the tools you need to do your role (including safety knife, uniform, hand sanitiser, mask and bum bag!), a focus on health & safety, exposure into the world of FMCG – giving you the opportunity to kick start your career in this space and the chance to play a pivotal role within an large food manufacturing business, ensuring kiwi’s can purchase their favourite snacks every day!

If you would like to be a part of a fun, collaborative and supportive team, working together to write Griffin’s next winning chapter, please apply now and submit your application form!

Here at The Griffin’s Food Company, the health and safety of our people is our top priority. We are reviewing and responding accordingly to COVID-19 government guidance and as a result, our recruitment processes can take a little longer than usual. We thank you for your patience as we do our best to care for all of our people - employees, future employees and customers!

job_title: Financial Planning and Analysis Support Manager
job_ad_details:
Responsibilities:

  1. Business Partnering :

    • Collaborate closely with the marketing team to provide financial insights and support for strategic decision-making.
    • Analyze marketing initiatives, campaigns, and promotions to evaluate their financial impact and effectiveness.
    • Provide financial guidance on pricing strategies, product launches, and market trends.

  2. Closing & Forecasting:

    • Lead the monthly, quarterly, and annual financial closing processes.
    • Prepare accurate and timely financial forecasts, including revenue, expenses, and cash flow projections.
    • Analyze variances between actual results and forecasts, identifying key drivers and providing actionable recommendations.

  3. Budget Control:

    • Assist in the development of annual budgets in collaboration with various departments.
    • Monitor budget performance, track spending against targets, and provide regular updates to management.
    • Implement cost control measures and initiatives to optimize resource allocation and improve profitability.

  4. Internal Control:

    • Establish and maintain robust internal control procedures to ensure compliance with company policies and regulations.
    • Conduct regular audits and reviews of financial processes to identify areas for improvement and mitigate risks.
    • Work closely with internal audit teams to address any findings and implement corrective actions.

  5. Process Improvement:

    • Identify opportunities to streamline financial processes and improve efficiency.
    • Implement best practices and standardize procedures across finance and other relevant departments.
    • Drive initiatives to enhance financial reporting capabilities and data analytics tools.

Qualifications:

  • Bachelor's degree in Finance, Accounting, or related field; MBA or professional certification (e.g., CPA, CMA) preferred.
  • Minimum of 3 years of experience in commercial finance, with a strong understanding of financial analysis, planning, and reporting.
  • Experience working in the FMCG industry is highly desirable.
  • Previous experience in a Big 4 accounting firm is advantageous.
  • Proven track record of business partnering with cross-functional teams, particularly in marketing.
  • Strong analytical skills with the ability to interpret financial data and trends.
  • Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to influence stakeholders at all levels.
  • Native Thai speaker with Good command of English

Argyll Scott Asia is acting as an Employment Agency in relation to this vacancy.

Paraplanning role

Years of experience candidate: 1-3 yrs

Key tasks:

-Provide support to the financial adviser in providing advice to clients including workflow

management and compliance management to ensure all processes and documentation

comply with relevant legislation and our procedures

-Provide support during client meetings by taking comprehensive notes and recording follow

up actions

-Assist with preparing / Prepare Statements of Advice and Records of Advice and maintaining

compliant client files

-Update client data and investment details in System

-Preparing client engagement letters and organising planning meetings with clients

-Update client insurance details in system

Systems:

-Class

Personality traits:

As a Para Planner, primary focus is to provide support to the Advisers ensuring that all financial plans

and strategies are of high quality, meeting the complex needs of clients and complying with agreed

policies and procedures.

-Attention to detail

-Excellent communication skills - verbal and written

-Self-motivated / goal oriented

-Ability to multi-task and easily switch between open jobs as per requirement.

About your company:

Optimus, located in Subiaco, Western Australian, comprises 2 main areas of expertise: Private Clients

and Private Equity.

Our Private Clients division provides a full range of financial services and business solutions to highnet-worth individuals, families, business owners, or self-managed super fund investors.

For clients who wish to take things a step further and truly build their wealth, our Private Equity arm

provides them with access to a unique deal flow borne out of the wide network of business

relationships created by Optimus founder Shane Thompson.

Development of the role over time:

-Input of data and portfolio modelling of client strategies through systems

-Monitor/execute corporate actions for distribution entitlements of shares and managed

funds, etc.

and cash flow analysis

job_title: Kaiako - Te Rōnakitanga ki te Reo Kairangi (L5)
job_ad_details:
Kaiako –Te Rōnakitanga ki te Reo Kairangi L5

Permanent Full-time

Raroera Campus

Hamilton

 

He karanga tēnei! E rapu ana mātou i tētahi tangata māna e whakaako Te Rōnakitanga ki te Reo Kairangi L5, tētahi kaupapa reo rūmaki o roto o Te Wānanga o Aotearoa.

 

Ko tōna tino whāinga he whakawhanake i te mātau o te hunga ako ki ngā tūāhuatanga o te reo Māori, kia ū, kia pakari tōna reo.  Me matatau rawa tēnei tangata ki te reo Māori kia pai ai tāna ārahi i ngā ākonga kia kōtihitihi rawa te aronga.  Me mātanga te tangata nei ki ngā kaupapa ka whakaakona arā ko te hokinga mahara, ngā āhuatanga o te reo, kōrero nehe, te taiao, te hekenga o ngā waka, whakapūrongo, kupu whakanikoniko, te marae.

 

Ngā pūkenga me ngā wheako a te tangata:

  • Kua pūkenga, kua wheako te tangata nei ki te whakaako ki te reo Māori anake me te whakaako i te hunga pakeke.

     

  • Kua whakawhiwhia kētia ki te tohu paetahi, ki tētahi tohu ōrite rānei te taumata e whakaaturia ana tōna tohungatanga i roto i ngā kaupapa o te reo me ngā tikanga Māori, otirā ao Māori.

     

  • Kua whakawhiwhia kētia ki tētahi tohu whakaako e whakaaturia ana tōna tohungatanga i roto i ngā āhuatanga o te mātauranga whakaako, te whakaako hoki i te hunga pakeke. 

 

Tonoa tēnei tūranga mā te rīhita me te tono ki te pae tukutuku nei:

https://twoa.careercentre.net.nz/

As a Head of International Trade at group level, you will be responsible for the development and management of the company's global trade operations. You will oversee the business and team, ensuring compliance with regulations and achieving strategic objectives.

  • Excellent leadership and team management skills.
  • Strong analytical and decision-making abilities, with the capability to provide accurate market insights.

  • Ability to identify and manage risks associated with international trade.
  • Strong organizational and communication skills.

job_title: Manager/Snr Officer, Business Wealth Acquisition Mgr, Business Banking...
job_ad_details:
About UOB

United Overseas Bank Limited (UOB) is a leading bank in Asia with a global network of more than 500 branches and offices in 19 countries and territories in Asia Pacific, Europe and North America. In Asia, we operate through our head office in Singapore and banking subsidiaries in China, Indonesia, Malaysia and Thailand, as well as branches and offices.

Our history spans more than 80 years. Over this time, we have been guided by our values — Honorable, Enterprising, United and Committed. This means we always strive to do what is right, build for the future, work as one team and pursue long-term success. It is how we work, consistently, be it towards the company, our colleagues or our customers.

About the Department

The Retail function provides Personal and Business Banking customers with financial solutions tailored to their needs. We help them manage their money wisely and meet their financial goals through an extensive range of products and services. These include deposit, insurance, secured and unsecured loans, investment and wealth advisory services.

Business Banking

We develop integrated products and services targeted at helping small and medium-sized enterprises across the region progress through different stages of growth. These include innovative solutions and initiatives in areas of working capital loans, operational efficiency and currency exposure.

Job Responsibilities
  • Responsible for sales and marketing of deposits and FOREX; meet financial needs of small and medium-sized enterprises (SME)
  • Acquire new to bank business account and also managing the portfolio growth of assigned high depositor under SME
  • Actively drive for deposits, identify business opportunities and ensure targets allocated are met.
  • Monitor and executive the action plans in achieving overall deposit target allocated
Job Requirements
  • Strong business acumen, proactive and a highly motivated self-starter.
  • Good sales and customer relationship management.
  • Minimum 1 to 2 years working experiences in business-to-consumer sales with proven track record
  • Experience and exposure in credit marketing will be an added advantage.
Be a part of UOB Family

UOB is an equal opportunity employer. UOB does not discriminate on the basis of a candidate's age, race, gender, color, religion, sexual orientation, physical or mental disability, or other non-merit factors. All employment decisions at UOB are based on business needs, job requirements and qualifications. If you require any assistance or accommodations to be made for the recruitment process, please inform us when you submit your online application.

Job Description

The incumbent is required to perform administrative tasks and coordination for the GRIP Programme to ensure smooth operation for various programmes under NUS Graduate Research Innovation Programme (GRIP).

    Duties and Responsibilities

    At NUS, the health and safety of our staff and students are one of our utmost priorities, and COVID-vaccination supports our commitment to ensure the safety of our community and to make NUS as safe and welcoming as possible. Many of our roles require a significant amount of physical interactions with students/staff/public members. Even for job roles that may be performed remotely, there will be instances where on-campus presence is required.

For a national medium sized provider of energy saving solutions to large commercial businesses. For an eager less experience hunter OR a more seasoned professional with b2b experience interested in selling 0.5 to 16MW solar solutions to prestigious sports venues and large commercial sites.

  • Requires experience selling b2b solutions
  • Salary guide: Base $100,000 - $130,000, $225000 - $250000 OTE
  • Inner Melbourne location

A normal day includes selling Solar solutions to Sports centres and Commercial businesses by prospecting, hunting, and building up a pipeline
There will be a certain level of pipeline available immediately to leverage off.

  • Assess prospects needs by going on daily Site visits and attending client meetings
  • Use a system to generate proposals
  • Presenting PPA options

We are open to any industry it's all about aptitude and attitude Your next employer has been in business for over 12 years.
They specialize in solar solutions, with a large focus on commercial lighting for sports venues and general lighting for healthcare providers, manufacturing and commercial sites. The solar industry is experiencing significant growth, with energy prices on the rise and solar panel costs decreasing considerably, leading to an oversupply in the market. National subsidies are further fuelling this growth, making solar installations more attractive than ever.
As a result, the typical payback period for solar investments has shortened to just 2-3 years. 
Many businesses are taking advantage of this opportunity by selling excess energy back to the grid through Power Purchasing Agreements (PPAs). These agreements allow them to enjoy electricity cost savings of 30-40% while ensuring that their solar systems are fully maintained and monitored for the duration of their contracts, which can span anywhere from 10 to 30 years.

Driving decarbonization and digitalization. Together.

Infineon designs, develops, manufactures, and markets a broad range of semiconductors and semiconductor-based solutions, focusing on key markets in the automotive, industrial, and consumer sectors. Its products range from standard components to special components for digital, analog, and mixed-signal applications to customer-specific solutions together with the appropriate software.

We are on a journey to create the best Infineon for everyone.
This means we embrace diversity and inclusion and welcome everyone for who they are. At Infineon, we offer a working environment characterized by trust, openness, respect and tolerance and are committed to give all applicants and employees equal opportunities. We base our recruiting decisions on the applicant´s experience and skills.
Please let your recruiter know if they need to pay special attention to something in order to enable your participation in the interview process.

In your new role you will:

  • Conduct standard validations, time studies, method studies, data collection to determine IE standard and productivity improvement
  • Study operations sequence, material flow, labor utilization and cost analysis to promote manufacturing efficiency
  • Apply statistical methods and perform mathematical calculations to determine manufacturing processes, staff requirements and production standards
  • Drive process improvements and work within a team to resolve problems
  • Update / review / maintain of IE database (iBID, iTFM)
  • Draft and design layout of equipment, materials and workspace to illustrate maximum efficiency, using drafting tools and computer

You are best equipped for this task if you have:

  • Preferable Bachelor of Science in Industrial Engineering / Manufacturing Engineering
  • More than 4 years of related semiconductor assembly experience in Industrial Engineering / Manufacturing Engineering
  • Experience in work study, plant layout, material standard and headcount modeling
  • Excellent interpersonal skills, ability to interact with individuals at various levels of the organization
  • Highly organized with the ability to manage multiple and concurrent priorities
  • Good analytical skills, communication and presentation skills

job_title: Teacher Aides | Assisting Student Learning | St Patrick's School, St George
job_ad_details:
St Patrick’s School | St George | P-6 

  • Fixed Term | 27.5 hours per week
  • Term Time 41 weeks for the 2024 school year
  • Commencing 15 January 2024
  • School Officer Level 2 | $29.29 - $29.99 per hour plus super
  • Positions arising due to enrolment growth

 

About the school

St Patrick’s School encourages all students to unlock their full potential by developing curiosity and a thirst for knowledge and achievement. Students are encouraged to explore and learn about the Catholic faith and grow their understanding of and love for Jesus. The supportive staff inspire and challenge students to do their best and engage with each other as a strong, united professional learning community. With a motto of ‘Unity is strength’, St Patrick’s is a school community achieving more by working together. Find out more about the school on Facebook.

 

The opportunity

In these roles, you will have the opportunity to apply your knowledge to assist teachers and other staff members with preparing, implementing, and supervising learning programs to support classroom learning experiences.

You will proactively work hand in hand with teaching staff to provide a high quality faith-based education for students. 

Further details can be obtained from the Role Description.

 

Grow with us 

As a Teacher Aide with Toowoomba Catholic Schools, you will be joining a network of 32 schools, who, with the Toowoomba Catholic Schools Office form Toowoomba Catholic Schools. Through our shared purpose, enabling full and flourishing lives we support staff and students to reach their potential. 

You will receive regular support from teachers, visiting Education Officers and Allied Health Professionals; all who will help you to grow your skills and knowledge to be able to professionally support students to achieve their potential. You will also be a part of a network within your own school and beyond; and given the opportunity to attend targeted professional development hosted by the Toowoomba Catholic Schools Office.

 

The community you will be joining

St George is a thriving country town nestled on the banks of the Balonne River. It is known for its strong sense of community, with welcoming locals and plenty of things to do. Grab a takeaway coffee and indulge in a scenic walk or check out one of the local pubs or restaurants for a meal. St George is rich with scenic countryside making it the ideal location for outdoor activities like hiking, fishing and camping.

Live outside St George? We encourage you to visit the Explore St George Region website to discover what living in St George has to offer.

 

How to apply

Please address your application to James Wren, Principal. 

Click ‘apply’ to submit and include

  • a written response, of no more than two pages, highlighting your demonstrated skills and experience as they relate to the Key Result Areas in the Role Description
  • your resume, to include the names of two professional referees (one must be your current or most recent Supervisor/Manager)

If you require further information about this role, please contact Principal, James Wren by email James.Wren@twb.catholic.edu.au  or phone 07 4625 3058.  

Applications close Monday, 6 November 2023. 

For more information about Toowoomba Catholic Schools visit our website.

Employment will be in accordance with the Catholic Employing Authorities Single Enterprise Collective Agreement – Diocesan Schools of Queensland 2019 – 2023.

Employment Type: Permanent Part Time, 16 hours per week Location: Bankstown-Lidcombe Hospital Position Classification: Administration Officer Level 2Remuneration: $31.20 - $32.24 per hour

Requisition ID: REQ503955

Application Close Date: 28/07/2024Interview Date Range: 31/07/2024 – 07/08/2024Contact Details:
Paul Tsimbakis – (02) 9767 4187 | paul.tsimbakis@health.nsw.gov.au

About the Opportunity Bankstown Hospital is seeking an Administration Officer to deliver excellent customer service and manage administrative tasks in the Peri-operative Services department.

Key duties include preparing Endoscopy/Theatre lists, handling Pre-Admission clinic tasks, managing patient bookings, and maintaining patient medical records (eMR/PAS) with strict confidentiality.

Responsibilities also include processing financial billing and reconciliation for various patient categories, ensuring data accuracy on SurgiNet and ProVation, and following procedures during eMR downtimes.

The role involves assisting with staff training, backfilling positions as needed, and complying with SWSLHD Core Values and NSW Health Code of Conduct. Staff must adhere to workplace safety policies and report any hazards or incidents.

Additional duties may be assigned as per the Health Employees Administrative (staff) award.

Where You'll Be Working Bankstown-Lidcombe Hospital is located in the city of Bankstown and is in one of the most multicultural local government areas (LGA) in Australia, with residents speaking more than 120 different languages.

Bankstown-Lidcombe Hospital is a principal referral group A1B hospital with tertiary affiliations to the University of New South Wales, University of Sydney and Western Sydney University providing a wide range of general medical and surgical services and sub-specialty services to the Bankstown/Canterbury community.

The Hospital offers great opportunities for professional development and advancement. The team fosters improvement and innovation, and attract staff who share the core values and can help us achieve our goals.

How to ApplyTo be considered for this position, please ensure you address the below questions as thoroughly as possible. View our application guide for information on how to respond to criteria and improve your application.

  1. Demonstrated excellent verbal, written communication and interpersonal skills
  2. Demonstrated ability to work in a multidisciplinary team environment and under minimal supervision
  3. Ability work under pressure in a busy and demanding environment including the ability to organize and set priorities
  4. Ability to deal effectively with health care professionals and the general public
  5. Demonstrated experience with Endoscopy Systems (Provation), Theatre Lists (SurgiNet) and/or other hospital data systems or willingness to learn
  6. Demonstrated high level computer skills, word processing and experience with MS Office applications
  7. Medical terminology course or willingness to undertake

Need more information?

  1) Click here for the Position Description
  2) Find out more about applying for this position

Additional Information

Stepping Up – Close the Gap Stepping Up aims to assist Aboriginal applicants understand how to apply for roles with NSW Health by clarifying the recruitment and onboarding process. If you are an Aboriginal person and wish to obtain more information about applying for a role within South Western Sydney Local Health District, please contact the SWSLHD Aboriginal Workforce Team on SWSLHD-AboriginalWorkforce@health.nsw.gov.au  

Salary Packaging South Western Sydney Local Health District employees are able to enjoy the benefits of salary packing. Visit Smart Salary for more details.

Health & FitnessSouth Western Sydney Local Health District employees  receive discounted Gym Membership/Corporate Wellbeing Programs, including Fitness Passport.

Transforming Your Experience Transforming Your Experience (TYE) is SWSLHDs key strategy to always positively transform your, our patients, our consumers, our staffs and our communities experiences across our organisation and services. Our vision is that our care is always safe, high quality and personalised and all our staff are supported and empowered to achieve their full potential. SWSLHD upholds the CORE Values – Collaboration, Openness, Respect and Empowerment.

To be eligible for permanent appointment to a position in NSW Health, you must have an Australian citizenship or permanent Australian residency.

At South Western Sydney Local Health District we are proud to be an equal opportunity employer, where we don’t just accept differences but we honour and support it. Committed to providing a working environment that thrives and values diversity, we encourage people of ⚫️ 🟡 🔴 Aboriginal and/or Torres Strait Islander ⚫️ 🟡 🔴 background, people with a disability and people from the LGBTQI+ community to apply.

SWSLHD is committed to driving a child safe culture that upholds children and young people’s rights. We strive to ensure children and young people feel safe, supported and included in their care. Existing staff of SWSLHD and those seeking employment are required to take the safety, welfare and wellbeing of children and young people seriously while taking action to keep them safe from harm and abuse.

Connect with us on Twitter, Facebook and LinkedIn.

job_title: IT Project Manager (System Integration) - NIGHT SHIFT and TEMP WFH!
job_ad_details:
PROJECT MANAGER (CARDIOLOGY UPDATES)


ABOUT OUR CLIENT: CHANGE HEALTHCARE PHILIPPINES, INC.:

Change Healthcare Philippines is a captive center in the healthcare industry- they are a registered business entity here in the Philippines but their headquarters is in the US. They are a global healthcare company operating in over 120 locations in the world, one of which is the Philippines. They operate primarily in Picadilly Star in BGC with over 600 employees already but they are expanding their workforce here, which will more than double their current headcount- that means opportunities for growth as they are pioneering new roles and creating better career development paths for talents in healthcare and BPO sectors.

Department:  Cardiology Support Operations
 
 
Job Summary: 

The Cardiology Updates Team is focused on the need to provide regular software Updates to our installed base.  The Cardiology Updates Project Manager will be responsible for leading all coordination and management of these Updates starting from the update request, through testing, training, scheduling and finishing upon successful completion of the update. The Cardiology Updates Project Manager will monitor the progress of the project activities, provide a primary continuous point of contact to the customer, and manage internal project teams in the successful execution of project activities.
 
Responsibilities: 

 Project Lifecycle Management; Initiation, Planning, Execution, Closure.
 Project Planning for Medium to Large Sites/Site with High Complexity
 Slotting, Project Assignment and Schedule Management to drive customers to newer versions
 Plan and Manage execution of remote deployments of software to customer sites
 Manage customer communications to provide clear planning and direction
 Coordinate internal resources to execute on projects, meeting downtime estimates and limiting impact on customer operations 
 Document management to ensure all information relevant to the deployment is captured
 Track deployment progress through existing tools, providing Status Reports and Tracking time.
 Case and Issue Tracking and Resolution
 Own the Updates Project Process and Contribute in continually improving a standardized model for planning and executing Updates.
 Assist in the development of new tracking tools and workflows
 Work with R&D and Product Management on process enhancements, software deployment tools and strategies
 Support management with strategic initiatives
  
Authorities: 

 As delegated by the reporting manager.
 Provide direction to Technical resources assigned to projects
 
Job Challenges:

JO 15067 | HubSpot Specialist for AU Capital Investment Company

Working Hours: Monday to Friday 8:30 AM to 5:30 PM Australian Eastern Time (6:30AM to 3:30PM Philippine Time)

Why choose Remote Staff?
  • 100% Work from Home. No office-based setups. Manage your time efficiently and enjoy work-life balance.
  • 15+ years in the remote work industry. We’ve helped more than 8K Filipinos establish virtual careers with international clients since 2007.
  • Competitive and negotiable compensation (depending on skill level & experience)
  • 100% coverage on Government Contributions Remittance* to SSS, Philhealth and Pag-ibig. Traditional employment set-ups cover only 50%, while you shoulder the other half as a salary deduction.
*Terms and conditions apply. Responsibilities:

  • Oversee and execute small projects related to HubSpot setup and integrations for a key client.
  • Manage and maintain custom integrations using Zapier and bespoke solutions, including integration with Student Management Systems (RTOManager and Wisenet).
  • Build, define, and run workflows, automations, and optimizations to improve platform efficiency.
  • Serve as the primary contact for HubSpot-related issues, offering guidance and resolution support.
  • Provide training and support for new and existing users on HubSpot best practices, authentication, authorizations, and troubleshooting.
  • Build custom reports and dashboards to meet the business needs.
  • Liaise with HubSpot support and external suppliers as needed to resolve ongoing issues.
  • Support marketing and outbound campaigns, working closely with various teams to ensure HubSpot is being used to its full potential.
Qualifications:

  • Highly proficient in HubSpot, including its tools, workflows, and automations.
  • Experience with Zapier and managing integrations.
  • Basic coding knowledge (e.g., HTML, JavaScript).
  • Strong skills in Excel and experience managing data models within HubSpot.

  • Excellent project management skills, with the ability to report on schedules and meet deadlines.
  • Strong communication skills and ability to foster relationships with clients and stakeholders.
Nice-to-Have:

  • Familiarity with RTOManager and Wisenet.
  • Experience in platform security management and data governance within HubSpot.
  • Previous experience supporting marketing campaigns and outbound strategies.
What Success Looks Like:

  • You are in full control of your HubSpot projects, with a clear understanding of all facts and figures.

  • Client stakeholders trust you as the "custodian of HubSpot", relying on you for guidance and problem resolution.

Personal Carer | Surrounding areas of Hervey Bay Community Care

  • Employment Status: Permanent Part-time available to suit your lifestyle
