  • Remuneration: $32.80 + 11.5% Super + not for profit Tax Benefits (Increases your take home pay) + allowances & travel reimbursements (KM’s) + employee discount program.

Job Summary

We’re looking for personal carers who want to make a meaningful difference for people in their local community. You will be part of a BlueCare Neighbourhood - a supportive and close-knit team delivering care and companionship for BlueCare clients, helping them to live life their way. 

No two days are ever the same. You’ll spend your time on the road interacting with clients and their loved ones within their homes, providing care in line with clients' individualised Care Plans, supporting with:

  • In home personal care, including showering & personal hygiene
  • Meal preparation, house cleaning, laundry & ironing 
  • Transportation & accompanying clients on social activities, shopping or to appointments

What we need 

  • Certificate III Aged Care, Home and Community Care, Disability Support, or an equivalent qualification
  • Relevant checks and clearances
  • Current Australian drivers licence and roadworthy vehicle as required
  • Basic experience with technology incl. smartphones, tablets, laptops etc

What we can offer you

  • Save tax and increase your take home pay by salary packaging living expenses and bills (up to $15,900) and meal entertainment (up to $2,650) per annum 
  • A recognition and rewards platform, providing employee discounts at hundreds of retailers, including everyday expenses, holidays, health insurance, annual awards celebration, wellbeing and employee assistance programs 
  • Flexible work arrangements to support work-life balance 
  • 12 weeks paid parental leave and 2 weeks paid partner leave, available after 6 months service, on top of the government scheme 
  • Paid gender affirmation leave and cultural leave options (paid and unpaid) for those who may celebrate Lunar New Year, Diwali, Ramadan, NAIDOC weeks and other significant cultural events
  • Career development opportunities  

BlueCare is proudly part of the UnitingCare Family, we’d love you to be too

Joining the state’s largest network of aged care workers with its over 8,500 strong, bright team in blue, you’ll also be welcomed as part of the UnitingCare family. With more than 16,500 staff and 9,000 volunteers across our brands of BlueCare, Lifeline, ARRCS, The Wesley Hospital, Buderim Private Hospital, St Stephen’s Hospital, and St Andrew’s War Memorial Hospital, you are part of something bigger. 

Start making a meaningful difference today

Click the ‘APPLY’ button to be taken to our online application process. Our team are available to answer any questions you may have. 

Diversity & Inclusion 

Our approach is simple –everybody is welcome here.  At UnitingCare, diversity is at the core of our who we are, our mission and our values. We are committed to providing equal opportunities to all employees no matter their sex, race, culture, sexual orientation, disability or gender identity. UnitingCare strongly encourages Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander applicants for this position.  We are deeply committed to reconciliation and providing long-term employment opportunities for First Nations peoples. 

Safe workplace

We work hard to make our services welcoming and safe for every person. We are united in keeping children, young people and the elderly safe from harm, within our services, workplaces and the communities we support. We are committed to speaking up loudly for their safety.

job_ad_details:
Employment Type: Permanent Full Time
Location: Queanbeyan
Position Classification: Social Worker Level 4
Remuneration: $117544 - $120393 per annum
Hours Per Week: 38
Requisition ID: REQ498642
Applications Close: 7 July 2024Interview Details: Scheduled within 10 days of closing

Southern NSW Local Health District covers a large area of the southern half of NSW. Surrounding the ACT on three sides and all the way down to the Victorian border, it extends from the pristine beaches of the NSW South Coast, the farmlands of the Southern Tablelands, across the picturesque Great Dividing Range and the spectacular Snowy Mountains.

We have 18 facilities and our hospitals take care of more than 200,000 people.   As we are a major local employer, our staff are a part of our local communities.   To find out more on what it is like to live and work in Southern NSW LHD click here – We

Are Southern

What we offer:

  • Flexible work arrangements
  • Salary Packaging – up to $9k for living expenses + $2.6k meal & entertainment + Novated leasing
  • Corporate Health and Fitness program
  • 11% Superannuation on top of your gross income
  • Annual Leave Loading
Where you will be working

There is an abundance of lifestyle benefits available to you in country NSW and you will be amazed at what you will have access to - and it all comes without the queues and crowds of a big city.  Queanbeyan enviable lifestyle and affordable property surrounded by an eclectic mix of small towns and villages. With Canberra just a 5-minute drive away, you can enjoy all the attractions of the nation’s capital along with fabulous restaurants.

Connect easily and quickly with world through the Canberra International Airport, with the beach and ski fields just 2 hours away.

What you'll be doing

The Sustaining NSW Families (SNF) program is a  Nurse-led, structured sustained health home visiting program for children and families from pregnancy to 2 years of age.

The SNF Social Worker will provide specialist social work and counselling interventions as part of the SNF multidisciplinary team with an early intervention focus that aims to enhance parenting capacity, promote healthy family functioning, support families at a time of change and promote infant mental health. 

Selection Criteria

  1. Degree in Social Work from an accredited course providing eligibility for membership of the Australian Association of Social Workers (AASW).
  2. Extensive experience, with specialism working with families with complex clinical presentations in relevant clinical settings such as perinatal mental health, child protection, domestic violence, and substance misuse and able to form therapeutic relationships built on healthy boundaries.
  3. Demonstrated advanced specialist therapeutic skills in conducting complex psychosocial assessments and counselling with the ability to respond to the needs of vulnerable families in stressful situations
  4. Demonstrated ability to utilise problem solving skills and a multidisciplinary team approach in planning, delivery, and coordination of patient care.
  5. Extensive expert clinical experience providing clinical consultation and facilitating case reviews, in the contact of family centred casework within a community based multidisciplinary team
  6. Extensive demonstrated experience in developing and maintaining cooperative professional relationships, with other health teams, government, and NGO agencies through the use of well-developed interpersonal and conflict resolution skills.
  7. Demonstrated high-level verbal and written communication skills with high level time management,
  8. Evidence of current unrestricted driver's licence and the ability to maintain. Ability and willingness to travel as the role requires. This may involve driving long distances and overnight stays.

At Southern NSW Local Health District we are proud to be an equal opportunity employer, where we don’t just accept differences but we honour and support it. Committed to providing a working environment that thrives and values diversity, we encourage people of Aboriginal and/or Torres Strait Islander background, people with a disability and people from the LGBTQI+ community to apply

All new employees must agree to comply with the requirements outlined in this policy. OASV requirements also include proof of vaccination against influenza and is compulsory for NSW Staff that enter any Residential Aged Care Facility (RACF) or who work in NSW Health owned and operated RACFs.

As a Bancassurance Manager, you will be responsible for overseeing bancassurance distribution channel, maximizing revenue streams, and ensuring compliance with regulatory requirements. This role requires a blend of business development acumen, meticulous paperwork management, and strategic foresight.

Client Details

One of insurance companies that has become a major player globally

Description

  • Identify and pursue opportunities to expand the bancassurance business through strategic partnerships and alliances with insurance providers.
  • Develop and implement innovative strategies to drive sales of insurance products through the bank's channels.
  • Build and maintain strong relationships with key stakeholders including banking executives, insurance partners, and regulatory authorities.
  • Design and implement efficient workflows for the seamless integration of insurance products into the banking system.
  • Streamline paperwork processes to ensure compliance with regulatory standards while minimizing administrative burdens.
  • Continuously evaluate and improve workflow procedures to enhance operational efficiency and customer experience.
  • Analyze market trends, customer behavior, and competitor activities to identify growth opportunities and mitigate risks.
  • Develop long-term strategic plans for the bancassurance business, aligning with the company's overall objectives and vision.
  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams to execute strategic initiatives and drive business growth.
  • Lead and mentor a team of bancassurance specialists, providing guidance, support, and training as needed.
  • Foster a culture of collaboration, innovation, and excellence within the team to achieve collective goals.
  • Set clear performance targets and conduct regular performance reviews to ensure accountability and drive continuous improvement.

Profile

  • Bachelor's degree in Business Administration, Finance, or any related field
  • Proven experience in bancassurance or a similar role within the banking or insurance industry.
  • Strong business development skills with a track record of driving revenue growth and expanding market presence.
  • Exceptional organizational abilities with a keen attention to detail and a knack for setting up efficient paperwork processes.
  • Strategic thinker with the ability to anticipate market trends, identify opportunities, and develop actionable plans.
  • Excellent leadership and communication skills, with the ability to inspire and motivate teams to achieve results.
  • Proficiency in financial analysis, risk assessment, and regulatory compliance.
  • Adaptability and resilience in a fast-paced, dynamic environment.

Job Offer

  • Competitive salary package

About The Opportunity Campbelltown Hospital is recruiting for an Emergency Unaccredited Trainee. Life at South Western Sydney Local Health District is rewarding, progressive and diverse and is always focused on achieving our Vision of Leading Care & Healthier Communities.

Where You'll Be WorkingAt South Western Sydney Local Health District we are proud to be an equal opportunity employer, where we don’t just accept differences, but we honour and support it. Committed to providing a working environment that thrives and values diversity, we encourage people of Aboriginal and/or Torres Strait Islander background and people with a disability to apply.

What you'll be doing

To provide emergency medical care to patients presenting to the Emergency Department. This will involve the workup and assessment of patients and the undertaking of an initial management plan.

 
Please Note: The Position is for the Current Clinical Year: Start Date 1st July 2024 - 2 February 2025.

  1. MBBS or equivalent, currently registered or eligible for registration with the Medical Board of Australia.
  2. Completion of at least two postgraduate years.
  3. Recent and relevant experience working in an Emergency Department as a Medical Officer.
  4. Demonstrated ability to work independently in a supervised environment and work effectively as part of a multidisciplinary team.
  5. Demonstrated high level written and verbal communication skills and ability to communicate effectively and respectfully with patients, family members and others members of the health care team.
  6. Evidence of continued professional development and commitment to self-education.
  7. Ability and willingness to work at the facilities within the Network to deliver patient care and preparedness and ability to participate in a 24 hour shift work roster.
  8. Demonstrated commitment to quality improvement, patient safety and risk management.

Please Note: The Position is for the Current Clinical Year: Start Date 1st July 2024 - 2 February 2025.

Need more information?
  1) Click here for the Position Description
  2) Find out more about applying for this position
For role related queries or questions contact Richard Cracknell on Richard.Cracknell@health.nsw.gov.au

Applications Close:  11th July 2024

About Us: We are a leading healthcare agency specializing in remote area placements across Australia, including the breathtaking Northern Territory. Our mission is to connect highly skilled healthcare professionals with unique and rewarding opportunities to make a difference in remote and indigenous communities

Job Description: We are seeking an adventurous and compassionate Remote Area Travel Nurse to embark on an incredible journey through the vast and beautiful landscapes of the Northern Territory. As a Travel Nurse, you will have the opportunity to provide essential medical care and support to communities in remote and isolated regions, all while experiencing the stunning natural wonders and rich cultures that this area has to offer

Responsibilities

  • Deliver high-quality healthcare services, including assessments, treatments, and health education, to remote community members.
  • Provide emergency care and first aid in challenging, off-the-beaten-path locations.
  • Collaborate with local healthcare professionals, community health workers, and indigenous leaders to ensure comprehensive patient care.
  • Develop and implement health promotion and prevention programs to improve the overall well-being of the community.
  • Maintain accurate patient records and adhere to all relevant regulations and standards.

Requirments:

  • APHRA registration
  • 12months (min) experience working in remote locations
  • Flexibility to work full time across a rotating 7-day roster
  • Complete COVID Vaccinations & 2022 Flu Vaccination, Serology evidence of immunisation status
  • Bachelor's Or Masters
  • NPC & WWCC
  • ALS
  • REC & MEC

Benefits:

  • Pay Rates $90 - $100 (am) + shift penalties
  • Salary Packing!
  • We can expose you to a diverse range of clients and settings, with ongoing contracts.
  • Supportive consults that value its employees
  • Flexible work environment that allows you to prioritize your personal and professional needs.
  • We strive to retain our Candidates; we provide a Healthy retention bonus.
  • Travel and accommodation issues are something we negotiate with our clients, to provide our candidates the best.

How to Apply: If you're a nurse seeking a remarkable adventure while making a positive impact on remote communities, we encourage you to apply. Please submit your resume and a cover letter outlining your relevant experience and your motivation for taking on this extraordinary role.

Contact Information: For inquiries or to submit your application, please contact beth.summerfield@talentquarter.com

Company description:

IOOF Holdings Limited is an Australian financial services company which offers a range of products and services including financial advice, superannuation, investment management and trustee services



Job description:

  • ‘Work where it works' for you and your clients
  • Be part of a team where everyone belongs, and individuality is celebrated
  • Contribute to the financial wellbeing of our 2 million+ clients across Australia

The difference you will make at Insignia Financial

This is your chance to contribute to an organisation which focuses on it's people and culture, listening to our clients and developing our platforms to better serve our clients.

You will be responsible for providing quality and timely hardware and software support to Insignia Financial Limited staff and related entities. Also to create documentation that will assist the branch network. You will make a difference by:

  • Providing first and second level support of IOOF systems and applications to Insignia Financial Limited staff members
  • Participating in the Service Delivery Service desk, remote support, call centre and site support teams where required
  • Providing "Client First" service in line with Insignia Financial Limited principles
  • Managing escalation & resolution of helpdesk calls to both internal technical support & external vendors
  • Reviewing and updating procedures
  • Testing and implementation of software

A little bit about you

  • Excellent customer service skills, initiative & motivation, analytical & problem solving skills, team player with ability to work unsupervised
  • Phones and remote support experience
  • Ability & willingness to work under pressure & outside normal working hours to achieve critical target dates
  • Previous technical experience in a support role is essential
  • Working knowledge of Microsoft Active Directory & Microsoft Exchange
  • Proficiency in Office Suite applications
  • General knowledge of computer hardware, Operating System software, networking, software security
  • Experience with supporting remote sites and Backup software

Life at Insignia Financial

We're one of Australia's leading financial wellbeing organisations and we're transforming the way every day Australians interact with financial advice and their super. We're available to all and we look after every client like they're our only client. This is clearly reflected in our Purpose: Understand me. Look after me. Secure my future.

We know that people who get financial help live better lives, our ambition is to create financial wellbeing for every Australian. We've been helping Australian's since 1846 and we're currently contributing to the financial wellbeing of over 2 million+ clients.

Diversity and ensuring our people feel they belong is important to us, we take pride in putting our people, as well as our clients, first and value and celebrate diversity within our teams.


We have a Women in Technology community which exists to bring together female and non-binary people within the tech world at Insignia Financial. This supportive forum is eager to progress and make change in the technology space - does this sound like you?

With many of us now working from home more than the office, we understand the importance of flexibility. As we work in a hybrid environment, you'll ‘work where it works' for you, your team and our clients. We also offer varied and flexible leave offerings, including 12 weeks paid parental leave and an extra day of leave each year.

We encourage our people to have an impact on the broader community we serve through volunteering leave.


At Insignia Financial, it's important to us that our people feel secure about their own money. We have an extensive financial wellbeing offering available to our people, including access to financial advice, mortgage and insurance brokers, Will and estate planning services and more.

Join us and contribute to achieving our ambition of creating financial wellbeing for all Australians through living our Principles: be human, deliver what matters, stronger together, keep it simple and do what's right, not what's easy.

To apply

Please submit your resume with a covering letter by clicking on "Apply Now".

Insignia Financial is an inclusive and equal opportunity employer. We encourage applications regardless of race, ethnicity, age, religion, gender, national origin, disability status, or any other characteristic protected by law. If you need assistance or an adjustment during the application process, let us know.

We're committed to ensuring the health, safety and wellbeing of our people and clients. Our National COVID-19 Workplace Policy requires all team members to be fully vaccinated with an approved COVID-19 vaccine to work from our offices.

Applicants will be required to provide evidence of their eligibility to work in Australia, and at a minimum be required to undertake police and basic credit checks as a condition of employment.

Please note that applications from agencies will not be considered at this time.

Join Bayside City Council as a Care Worker and experience a new kind of workplace.

Make a real difference by helping our older community with domestic house cleaning to stay living safely and confidently in their own homes. You will provide general cleaning duties such as mopping, vacuuming, cleaning of bathrooms and other various light household duties to 3-4 clients a day.

Multiple permanent roles available now paying $31.42 p/h. No qualifications required.

What we can do for you:

  • $31.42 per hour with annual increases
  • Paid travel time, km reimbursement, paid leave sick and annual leave, public holiday penalty rates and superannuation 11.5%
  • Flexible days and hours
  • Paid training provided
  • Uniforms, mobile phone, cleaning products and PPE equipment provided

What we need from you:

  • Ability to pass police check and working with children check (we will pay for these)

Our client is a leading chemical distributor specialising in innovative solutions for various industries. We are dedicated to providing high-quality products and exceptional service to our clients. We are currently seeking a dynamic Business Development Manager to oversee our Personal Care & Home Care Ingredients business unit.

With this role, you will be responsible for identifying, building, and developing key supplier relationships for our Personal Care and Home Care Ingredients sector. This role is critical to expanding our product offerings and enhancing our market presence in Bangkok and beyond.


Your new role

  • Identify and engage with potential key suppliers in the Personal Care and Home Care Ingredients sectors.
  • Develop and maintain strong relationships with existing and new suppliers.
  • Negotiate and finalise supplier agreements to ensure favourable terms and conditions.
  • Conduct market research to identify trends, opportunities, and competitive landscape.
  • Analyse market needs and align supplier offerings to meet market demands.
  • Develop and execute a strategic plan for supplier acquisition and product development.
  • Collaborate with internal teams to integrate new suppliers into the company's portfolio.
  • Drive business growth by increasing sales through effective supplier partnerships.
  • Monitor and report on sales performance and supplier contribution to revenue.
  • Build and sustain long-term relationships with suppliers and clients.
  • Address any issues or concerns related to supplier performance and product quality.
  • Work closely with the marketing, sales, and product development teams to align supplier strategies with company goals.
  • Participate in industry events and conferences to network and stay updated on market trends.

What you'll need to succeed

  • Bachelor's degree in Business, Chemistry, Chemical Engineering, or a related field. MBA or advanced degree preferred.
  • Proven experience in business development or sales within the chemical distribution industry, with a focus on Personal Care and Home Care Ingredients.
  • Strong negotiation skills and experience in supplier management.
  • Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
  • The ability to work independently and as part of a team.
  • Proficiency in English and Thai (both written and spoken) is required.

What you'll get in return

  • Competitive salary and performance-based incentives.
  • Opportunity to work with a dynamic team in a growing company.
  • Professional development and career growth opportunities.

Company description:

Introduction

Dyson began twenty-one years ago with James Dyson and a handful of engineers questioning everyday products, thinking differently and making them better. We are now the world's number one vacuum cleaner manufacturer in the UK, US, Japan, Europe and Australasia.

We've even branched out to improving commercial technology that frustrates us. The Dyson Airblade hand dryer dries hands in ten seconds, it's also the most hygienic and energy efficient hand dryer available. And more recently a fan, Air Multiplier, with no blades or grille and a hair dryer

There are over 6000 in the world and we're all inventive and hugely passionate about what we do. At our Development Centre in Johor Bahru, Malaysia & Singapore there are almost 1600 of us, a mixture of engineers and support staff, we are Dyson people that are encouraged to think differently, challenge convention and be unafraid to make mistakes. Our teams there will rise to more than 2000 over the next 2 years.

We manufacture in Philippines, Malaysia and Singapore, this is the heart of operations for global distribution. We get to experience the launch of exciting new technologies straight from the manufacturing lines and are therefore a key contributor to a successful launch.

Our mission:

It is to make effective data-driven decisions part of the routine job for anyone working at Dyson


Job description:

Reporting to the Global Supply Centre of Excellence lead, the Senior Application Developer

This is a highly technical role within supply chain which can leverage great career developments.

Accountabilities

  • Develop design approaches and recommendations to meet specific business requirements.
  • Configure the Kinaxis Rapid Response interface according to business distinct needs as defined within the Agile user stories and blueprint designs.
  • Interact with business users to document enhancement requests and design solutions
  • Work with global business users on analysis business data and deriving business metrics and insights
  • Interact with Technical and COE team to get enhancements developed; Test and confirm the enhancements
  • Interact with senior business and IT stakeholders in the client organization to provide updates, jointly resolve issues, etc.
  • Provide creative solutions to complex business problems while maintaining best practices.
  • Guide and mentor the Dyson Authors and Contributors during project.
  • Drive stakeholders participation in project design activities.
  • Lead Deployment Workshops to help business achieve immediate value from the developed solutions.
  • Facilitating business process design and development that leverages Rapid Response capabilities.
  • Resolving complex data and analytic configurations to ensure that the solution is producing the expected results.
  • Working with BSD leadership and COE team to develop a roadmap to solve multiple supply-chain problems leveraging the power of Rapid Response.


What we offer:

Underlying characteristic/behavior required

  • High levels of attention to detail and accuracy
  • Solid understanding of the software development life cycle, including business requirements definition, review of functional specifications, development of test plans, testing, user training, and deployment
  • Well-developed computer skills and a working knowledge of the Windows environment including MS Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Power BI, Project, Visio, JIRA, Asana and Outlook Training in Agile and Scrum principles or Change Management Cycle considered
  • Organized and methodical. Applies and enforces agreed standards and ways of working
  • Well-developed problem solving skills
  • Able to work collaboratively and communicate effectively with key stakeholders
  • Works to high standards, Inquisitive and thorough in approach
  • Thirst to learn about new areas and develop new areas of expertise
  • Ability to think out of the box
  • Self-motivated, dynamic, results-driven and assertive
  • Good presentation skills at all levels of the organization
  • Enjoy challenges and thrives on them
  • Attention to detail without losing bigger picture
  • Exercises judgement in selecting methods, techniques, and evaluation criteria to make decisions
  • Able to co-ordinate and adjust own work tasks with others in order to meet deadlines
  • Self-motivated, yet knows when to seek assistance from more senior subject-matter-experts
  • Actively pursues learning and personal development.
  • Willing and able to adjust to multiple and changing work demands.
  • Handles more strategic challenges with confidence.
  • Seeks and welcomes feedback.

#LI-DYSON

 
 

Required profile:

KEY Skills / Experience required

  • Kinaxis Rapid Response Solution Configuration and Enhancements
  • 3-5 years of experience with Kinaxis Rapid Response solution.
  • Kinaxis Rapid Response certification in the role of Contributor, Author, and Admin. Rapid Response Author Level 3 certification preferred.
  • Ability to configure workbooks, Task Flows, Responsibilities, Alerts, Scheduled Tasks, Automation Chains, Widgets, Scorecards, Hierarchies, Forms and Scripts in Rapid Response based on solution design documents. Preference given to candidates with Rapid Response (Integration/Solution Development/Authoring) experience and understanding.
  • Foundational level understanding of Kinaxis data model, key control settings, and analytics.
  • Experience with integration of legacy data, or spreadsheets and data management in Kinaxis Rapid Response
  • Ability to communicate clearly with functional team members to understand requirement and discuss design options.
  • Development of test plans and test cases, unit testing of solution, issue resolution and user acceptance testing
  • Strong ability to evaluate new requirements coming from business stakeholders and work with technical teams/IT.
  • Strong ability to evaluate business impact of technical issues
  • Deep domain knowledge of one or more functional supply chain and planning processes such S&OP, Demand Planning, Inventory Management or Inventory Optimization and Master Production Scheduling or other APS solutions
  • Exposure in maintenance of Kinaxis solution. Hands on experience with Constraint planning, resource authoring.
  • Good understanding of Rapid Response Lead Time Calculations, Constraints, MPS, Range of coverage, BOM Level substitution, Distribution Planning.
  • Good understanding of Data Integration Server, data modelling and closed loop to SAP.
  • Previous implementation/execution experience of planning solutions in an industrials/manufacturing/ automotive/ high tech environment and knowledge of tools like SAP APO, SAP ECC, SAP Hana, MES, GCP, and Kinaxis Rapid Response is highly preferred

• Are you passionate about making a genuine difference in the lives of other people.
  • Full Time Position
  • $37.44 per hour plus generous salary packaging options to increase your take home pay.
  • A varied and interesting role with an established and respected community organisation.

About CatholicCare Central Queensland

CatholicCare Central Queensland is a leading community service provider local to Rockhampton. Specialising in the delivery of a wide range of quality social services including aged care, disability care, counselling, psychology, family relationship support and mediation and domestic and family violence response, CatholicCare Central Queensland offers diverse and rewarding careers in busy and dynamic environments.

Primary Objective

Supporting clients under the Home Care Package Program, and the Queensland Community Support Scheme, Case Managers support clients to set long term goals and implement the supports needed to achieve these goals.

To achieve this a Case Manager will provide a range of services to clients which include:

  • Providing information, support, referrals and complete appropriate intake and assessments for clients.
  • Support clients by developing a care plan with the client which addresses the individual needs of the clients and how care will be provided to achieve their goals.
  • Ongoing monitoring of client’s progress against the identified goals and undertaking reviews and assessments as needed to fully support the client.
  • Ensure supports are provided to clients which fit within the relevant standards and program guidelines.
  • Ensure the client can exercise choice and control within the framework and structure of their funded programs.
  • Manage clients' budgets to ensure services are provided as per Legislative guidelines.

Core Competencies

  • Demonstrated experience supporting individuals through the development of goals and supporting care plans.
  • Formal training in Case Management through a recognised course/program is desirable.
  • Experience working within the Community Care sector, or Aged Care sector is highly desirable.
  • Demonstrated experience implementing and maintaining client budgets.
  • Current C or CA class driver’s license (QLD).

Other Requirements

  • Understanding of program guidelines and ability operate within regulated environments
  • Ability to communicate complex matters to a variety of stakeholders including those with limited capacity
  • Understanding of clinical governance and a demonstrated ability to implement a clinical governance framework in an operational environment
  • Aptitude for sales techniques for selling and promoting CatholicCare Services to potential clients.
  • Demonstrated understanding of the Aged Care Standards as they apply to delivering Home Care Packages.

All offers of employment are subject to the satisfactory completion of relevant screening and background checks, including an Australian Federal Police check, an NDIS disability worker screening check, and attainment of a Blue Card for working with children, prior to commencement.

The successful candidate will also be required to demonstrate entitlement to work in Australia, and to disclose any pre-existing injury or disease which may be adversely affected by undertaking the inherent requirements of the position.

What to Do Next

To apply for this position, please submit the following documents:

  • Your current resume
  • A cover letter clearly addressing the key aspects and requirements of the role

job_title: Research Associate (Project Manager - NUS eHealth Projects)
job_ad_details:
Job Description

At the Telehealth Core we leverage technology & design to accelerate research and improve outcomes in behavioural health & chronic diseases. We focus on delivering tailored interventions in healthcare by building digital tools and harnessing the insights from users and patients.

We are looking for a Research Associate (Project Manager) who is excited about transforming care for older adults. In this role, you will lead the research and design of platforms that enable researchers and physicians to multiply the patients they can care for.

Job Description

  • Work with program teams to develop project plans which include requirements, scope, deliverables, budget and schedules.
  • Oversee and plan project demands, proof-of-concept/value initiatives with stakeholders.
  • Determine project goals to ensure the project supports business objectives and strategies
  • Single-Point-of-Contact for program teams and stakeholders for the projects.
  • Lead and drive business requirement gathering process and translate user requirements into technical requirements necessary for the implementation of the solutions.
  • Identify, manage and track issues, risks and dependencies that affect the delivery of the project outcome.
  • Collaborate closely with Software Engineers.
  • Present project updates to stakeholders on a regular basis.
Qualifications
  • Excellent written and oral communication skills.
  • Academic publication history is a plus.
  • Has relevant hands-on experience working with software development in a team.
  • Good grasp of research methods and design communication.
  • Hands-on experience in user research including but not limited to observation, interviews and focus groups.
  • Experience in one or more of the following types of project implementations: web-based and mobile application.
  • Possess leadership qualities and strong interpersonal skills with the ability to work with different groups of stakeholders
  • Possess a can-do attitude towards complex challenges
  • Experience in healthcare industry is an added advantage
  • Masters in Psychology, Human Computer Interaction, Human Factors and related fields
Covid-19 Message

At NUS, the health and safety of our staff and students are one of our utmost priorities, and COVID-vaccination supports our commitment to ensure the safety of our community and to make NUS as safe and welcoming as possible. Many of our roles require a significant amount of physical interactions with students/staff/public members. Even for job roles that may be performed remotely, there will be instances where on-campus presence is required.

In accordance with Singapore's legal requirements, unvaccinated workers will not be able to work on the NUS premises with effect from 15 January 2022. As such, job applicants will need to be fully COVID-19 vaccinated to secure successful employment with NUS.

More Information

Location: Kent Ridge Campus

Organization: National University of Singapore

Department : Saw Swee Hock School of Public Health

Have a look at our other great benefits at www.people.downergroup.co.nz/downer-benefits/

Te kowhiringa | The Opportunity

Downer Energy work with some of New Zealand’s largest asset owners and energy providers to maintain their critical networks and assets across the country. Our whole-of-life approach creates positive outcomes for all New Zealanders as we help to reduce carbon emissions, optimise energy, and build a better Aotearoa. There are more than 500 of us in the Energy team and we are committed to being kaitiaki – guardians of New Zealand’s future.

About the role

As an experienced Cable Jointer, you will be responsible for the provision electrical fitting services including equipment repairs and installation of new network equipment throughout the Wellington region.  You also be working on the construction and maintenance of network equipment and installations.  You will work to establish stakeholder relationships, identify and implement risk control measures and complete other tasks within the team as required. 

Based in Lower Hutt, this a full-time permanent job opportunity. 

Nga pukenga matua | Important Skills

You will be a proven cable jointer, ideally with previous experience in the power distribution industry.  You will also offer:

  • Relevant EWRB Registration and current Practising License as a Cable Jointer
  • Current Class 1 full Drivers Licence, ability to drive a manual vehicle and ideally a Heavy Traffic Licence
  • Knowledge of the Wellington network would be beneficial
  • Sound knowledge of electrical test equipment, systems and procedures
  • Underground and substation equipment skills

It goes without saying that you have a key focus on safety in all aspects of your work and are adept at following established work instructions. You’ll be a strong team player who enjoys sharing your knowledge as well as drawing on your colleagues’ expertise. We pride ourselves on delivering results for our customers and are looking for someone who understands the value of their work, shares our strong work ethic and commitment to timeframes.

Ko wai matou | Our Organisation 

Want to know more about what it is like to work at Downer? Then head to our People Site copy and paste the following link into your browser: people.downergroup.co.nz/join-our-utilities-team/

Me pehea ki te tono | How to apply 

  • If this sounds like the opportunity for you, click Apply Now to submit your application! The reference number for this role is 603631.
  • We are committed to a safe working environment for everyone - all successful applicants will be required to undertake a pre-employment drug test, medical and a Ministry of Justice check prior to starting employment. If you need support with this requirement, please talk to our team

We are looking for determined and hardworking individual.

We welcome all homemakers and individuals with entrepreneurial mindset.

Job scope include:

- Communicating with new prospects and arrange sales appointment

- Follow up with existing clients to ensure that they are satisfied with our service

- Coordination work for marketing of products

- You are expected to work independently , so you must be disciplined and independent

You can expect to work from home some days of the week

Monthly salary range : 4000-8000

job_title: IT Governance and Control Senior Manager
job_ad_details:
Argyll is helping the client looking for a detail-oriented IT Governance and Quality Control Specialist to ensure our IT practices meet regulatory requirements and industry standards.

Role Overview:
Manage and enhance IT governance frameworks and quality control processes. Ensure compliance with policies, standards, and regulations, and drive continuous improvement in IT service delivery.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Develop, implement, and maintain IT governance frameworks, policies, and procedures to ensure alignment with organizational goals and regulatory requirements.

  • Establish and oversee quality control processes for IT projects and services. Ensure that IT deliverables meet defined quality standards and performance metrics.

  • Monitor and enforce compliance with internal policies, external regulations, and industry standards. Prepare for and support audits and assessments.

  • Identify and assess IT risks. Implement risk mitigation strategies and controls to protect organizational assets and data.

  • Generate reports on IT governance, risk management, and quality metrics. Maintain comprehensive documentation related to governance and quality control activities.

  • Analyze performance data and feedback to drive improvements in IT governance and quality control practices. Promote best practices and foster a culture of excellence.

Key Qualifications:

  • Bachelor's degree in Information Technology, Business Administration, or a related field. Certifications (e.g., CISA, ITIL, COBIT) are advantageous

  • 10-15 years of experience in IT governance, quality control, or related areas. Proven track record in managing governance frameworks and quality assurance processes

  • Strong understanding of IT governance frameworks, quality control methodologies, and regulatory compliance. Excellent analytical, organizational, and communication skills

  • Preferred Consulting Background

Argyll Scott Asia is acting as an Employment Agency in relation to this vacancy.

job_title: EWRB fully qualified Electrician - New Plymouth
job_ad_details:
Electrician

  • Are you passionate about the electrical industry and looking for a company who cares about their staff and clients?
  • Are you focused on quality workmanship, health safety and communication?

Read on……………………..

About us:
JLE is one of New Zealand's leading providers in Electrical Services to the industry sector and operates in multiple locations throughout New Zealand. 

Due to a high demand and expansion for services and small projects, our service division is seeking someone that can prove themselves to deliver professional and quality workmanship; be totally health and safety focused, and be interested in teaching apprentices as part of our staff development. 

The job:
This position is for general maintenance and small projects, based in New Plymouth. Our clients operate in industrial sites, manufacturing, food processing, water and waste facilities, etc and require a variety of day to day tasks that may include;

  • small to large switchboard replacement
  • mains/submains upgrades
  • working on and maintaining hazardous area equipment
  • shift cover

Training & upskilling provided.

This position reports to the Branch Coordinator

Along with a positive attitude, you must have:

  • Full NZ EWRB registration with a minimum of 3 years NZ experience
  • A dedication to quality workmanship
  • Experience with industrial maintenance
  • Strong English communication skills
  • Excellent time management and organisational skills
  • Being able to work independently/unsupervised, or comfortable in a team
  • A high level of customer service
  • Be self-motivated with a positive attitude
  • Full driver's license, with good driving record
  • The ability to be part of an on call after hours roster for breakdowns
  • Legal entitlement to work in NZ - NZ citizen/resident or valid work visa.

Other advantages

  • Working knowledge of PLC I/O and instrumentation
  • Hazardous area experience with EEHA (or equivalent)
  • Patience to work at a problem until a solution is found.

Here's why you should work with JLE:

  • We pay top rates to top electricians
  • Overtime after 9hours per day and on weekends
  • A huge variety of interesting work 
  • Training provided with ongoing encouragement to upskill
  • use of company vehicle & smart phone
  • Yearly reviews
  • A paid day off on your birthday
  • A boss who looks after you as part of the team, with family coming first!
     

Check us out at:  www.jle.co.nz [link removed] 

If this sounds like you, don't delay - apply today! 

Applications close at 4pm on Friday 30th April

To apply for this position please email your CV and cover letter to humanresources@jle.co.nz [link removed] or via Seek.

We are currently looking for an Accountant to join our ever growing team on a 12 month contract.

In this role as Accountant your responsibilities will include, but are not limited to;

  • Responsible for the accounting and financial functions, including month/quarter/year-end close, variance analysis, cash flow management, operational accounting, planning and budgetary control and tax related issues (property tax and GST) for a portfolio of entities/assets
  • Work closely with asset management, property management and shared service teams, and handle day-to-day operations to ensure accurate and timely management reporting
  • Manage a robust planning cycle, including annual budget and forecasts. Monitor revenue and expenses and enforce budget accountability when necessary
  • Ensure effective ongoing liaison with IM team/ REIT/ Trustee and manage relations with treasury, corporate departments, and other service providers such as tax agents, legal advisors.
  • Ensure that all internal controls are adhered to in accordance with Group and local policies. Review internal controls, policies and systems on an ongoing basis and recommend improvements as necessary
  • Responsible for liaising with internal and external auditors, ensuring timely completion of audits and closing out of financial actions
  • Oversee a team of finance professionals and ensure smooth finance operations
  • Communicate effectively with the various stakeholders and work well with the finance and operational teams
  • Support system implementation / improvements as necessary

To be a success in this role it is desirable, but not essential to have;

Lendlease is a globally integrated real estate group with core expertise in shaping cities and creating strong and connected communities.

For more than 60 years, we have created thriving places. Safety is always our first consideration, boldness and innovation characterise our approach and doing what matters defines our intent.

Lendlease provides a wide range of benefits to support our employees through their everyday lives. Our flexible work arrangements make it possible to shape your working day accordingly. We embrace the value of a vibrant and diverse workforce and recognise that our people have different experiences and needs at different times.

Main Tasks

Core job responsibilities include:

  • Primary Responsibilities:

    o Personal assistant tasks for the Partners:

     Organisation of Partner Inbox including saving all incoming client emails into MYOB AE document manager

     Preparation of draft Timesheets

     Preparation of monthly WIP reports for billing purposes

     Review of monthly WIP and drafting client invoices for same, identifying amounts to be written-off

     General assistance to the Partners as directed from time to time
  • Overflow Responsibilities:

    o Electronic Collation of client final packages:

     Financial Statements &/or Income Tax Return/s

     SMSF - Financial Statements and Annual Return

     SMSF - External Audit Management Letter & Independent Audit Report

    o Processing correspondence received via email, mail + ATOmate (both internally from accountants and externally from clients/ATO/suppliers)

     (ATO Tax Agent Portal) Account Statements

     Copies of past year Financial Statements & Income Tax Returns

     Copies of Trust Deeds, Constitutions, Registration Certificates

     ASIC company extracts

    o Issue of client invoices and posting of disbursements

    o Uploading, mapping and sending DocuSign (electronic signature) packages to clients, and reviewing list weekly

    o Monitoring the Internal inbox for allocated tasks (as directed)
  • Supplementary Responsibilities:

    o Database Management

     MYOB AE database additions/closures

     Processing changes/updates (e.g. client address changes) & ensuring any required internal and external databases are also updated for each individual/entity affected, including:

     MYOB AE (AMG's primary database)

     Tax Agent Portal (Online Services for Agents)

     Australian Business Register (ABR)

     Class (superfund and superfund member administration database)

     CAS360 (company secretarial database)

    o Producing internal client/management reports as required, such as:

     Due Lodgment Reports

     Work In Progress (WIP) Reports

     Timesheet + Missing/Incomplete Timesheet Reports

     Client Detail Reports

    o Preparing and sending bulk standard & custom emails, such as

     Invoices

     Quarterly ATO instalment notices

    o Processing Client Onboarding procedure for newly acquired clients.

    o Monitoring the return of signed new entity establishment documents and ensure required tax registrations are recorded

    o ASIC / corporate compliance secretarial tasks

    The above list is not exhaustive and the role may change to meet the overall objectives of the company.

About the role 

In this role, youll provide essential and practical care to help older people live independently in their homes and directly improve their quality of life. The role requires travel to clients homes using your own car for which you'll be paid $0.96 cents per km plus paid travel time.

We're looking for Specialist Carers - Home Care to join our team in the following areas: North Sydney, Berowra, Wahroonga, Lane Cove, Mosman, North Turramurra, Hornsby and Chatswood including surrounding suburbs.

 The care work you'll be doing may include:

  • Providing personal care - helping with showering and dressing
  • Helping around the home - meal preparation and light house cleaning
  • Providing transportation to appointments and assisting with shopping
  • Assisting with medication

About you 

  • You can relate to people and you're patient and solutions-focused.
  • You may have previous experience in aged or community care or are looking to start your career in aged care.
  • You have a valid Drivers Licence and access to an insured, reliable car (min. Third Party Property Insurance).
  • Ideally, you'll have a Certificate III in Aged Care or Individual Support. If you're not currently qualified and would like to be, then we can help you.
  • You'll be flexible around meeting the changing needs of home care clients.

Benefits

  • $28.70 to $31.50 per hour plus 96c/km + paid travel time + mobile phone provided
  • Full training is given to all our Care Workers, no experience is necessary
  • Secure employment on a 14 day perm part-time roster so you can plan ahead
  • Salary packaging - up to $15,900 tax free
  • Fitness Passport membership
  • First Aid Certificate provided and paid for by us
  • Paid Certificate III in Aged Care training available if you want to progress

How to apply 

If this sounds like you, please click Apply now and submit your details. Once youve applied, well keep you updated on your application progress. 

All short-listed applicants for these positions will be asked to consent to a criminal record check, reference checks and must provide evidence of current Flu and 2 COVID vaccinations. The preferred applicant will also be asked to attend a pre-employment functional assessment.

HammondCare is committed to creating an inclusive workplace that promotes and values diversity and inclusion. We strive on creating an equal employment environment where everyone from any background can be themselves.
salary_additional_text: $28.7-$31.5 per hour + 96c per km and travel time

job_ad_details:
About the Role

  • Excellent opportunity to be part of a growing team
  • Deliver positive outcomes to stakeholders backed up by your expertise and skills
  • Reports to MTM Settlement Manager

Role Location: Solaris One Building, Makati

Role Type: Permanent, Full-time, 3 positions available

Shift Schedule: Dayshift schedules will be adhered to

As the Process Specialist, your role is to support Global Markets by facilitating the settlements of Fixed Income, Derivatives, Equities, and Money Markets products in the domestic AU, NZ and Asian Markets.

The Fixed Income settlements are responsible for the settlements of Bonds and REPOs (Repurchase agreements on Bonds) through multiple clearing parties. These Bonds are traded by multiple trading desks around the world for ANZ. The FI team contact traders, dealers, counterparties, customers and clearing houses by phone and email as well as Service and Post Trade. Derivative and Equities Settlements are responsible for the processing of payments of SWAPS and other derivative and equities transactions through multiple settlements systems. The team contacts traders/dealers, customers, Post Trade and ANZ Vostro/Nostro teams. The Money Markets team is responsible for the processing of payments of Money Markets instruments traded with our Corporate and Interbank counterparties.

You will be responsible for the accurate and timely entry of product transactions into the various settlements systems and be required to liaise with traders/dealers and external parties to ensure completion of settlements.

About You

To be successful in this role, you will ideally bring the following -

  • Graduate of any banking or financial related discipline
  • Proven experience banking industry particularly in Markets Operation or settlements
  • Good experience in SWIFT and local payments systems
  • Sound knowledge and understanding on Markets products and local regulations
  • Experience in Markets operation areas in the commercial bank, investment bank and security company
  • Understanding of bank processes, including payment, settlement, inter-bank clearing etc.
  • Knowledgeable in ANZ payment systems (e.g. Payplus, MERVA, MIDS, MIDANZ, Webvoucher)
  • Sound communication skills both written and verbal and coupled with organising and prioritising skills
  • Well versed in Microsoft Office tools and applications
About ANZ

At ANZ, everything we do boils down to 'why' - our purpose - to shape a world where people and communities thrive. We're just as focused on seeing our people thrive as well as our customers. We'll give you every opportunity to develop your career.

We are responding faster to changing customer requirements, focusing on the things that matter the most, energising our people, eliminating waste and reducing bureaucracy.

A happy workplace is a thriving one. So in order to attract and keep the best talent, and say thanks for the hard work, we make sure all our employees are rewarded.

We work flexibly at ANZ and encourage you to talk to us about how this role can be flexible for you and any adjustments you may require to our recruitment process or the role itself. If you are a candidate with a disability, let us know how we can provide you with additional support.

To find out more about working at ANZ or to view other opportunities visit https://careers.anz.com/ [link removed]

job_title: MGR, Branch Service Manager-Operations Officer, Puchong Branch Operations (1...
job_ad_details:
About UOB

United Overseas Bank Limited (UOB) is a leading bank in Asia with a global network of more than 500 branches and offices in 19 countries and territories in Asia Pacific, Europe and North America. In Asia, we operate through our head office in Singapore and banking subsidiaries in China, Indonesia, Malaysia and Thailand, as well as branches and offices.

Our history spans more than 80 years. Over this time, we have been guided by our values — Honorable, Enterprising, United and Committed. This means we always strive to do what is right, build for the future, work as one team and pursue long-term success. It is how we work, consistently, be it towards the company, our colleagues or our customers.

About the Department

The Channels & Digitalization function enables end-to-end seamless connectivity for UOB customers across all physical and digital touchpoints of the Bank. Designed to be in tune with our customers' banking preferences, we strive to enhance engagement and deliver exemplary experiences across our network of branches, self-service machines and digital platforms. We collaborate with FinTech ecosystem partners to keep abreast of developments in the FinTech innovation space and to embed ourselves in our customers' lives. We also harness customer insights to help us deliver new business models and digital innovations, and to build deeper relationships with our customers.

Job Responsibilities
  • Responsible for ensuring the smooth running of daily branch operations which include front line supervision and authorisation of banking transactions through a robust branch sales and service floor management.
  • Manages staff performance and development, providing coaching / mentoring / guidance and training.
  • Maintains a high standard of operational control / audit compliance.
  • Provides efficient service in meeting customers' banking needs.
  • Works together as a team in achieving sales targets / initiatives.
  • Responsible for ensuring timely submission of regulatory reporting.
  • Complies with the Bank's policies, guidelines and regulations at all times.
  • Maintains good relationship with internal / external stakeholders.
Job Requirements
  • A recognised Degree in any field.
  • Minimum 2 years of working experience in branch operations.
  • Demonstrates personal leadership by being positive under any circumstances.
  • Good empathy, interpersonal & communication skills (communicate clearly & confidently).
  • Passionate about Customer Service & delivering superior experience to customers.
  • Good problem-solving & critical thinking skills.
  • Possesses knowledge of process, products & services.
  • Energetic, self-motivated & work under minimal supervision.
Be a part of UOB Family

UOB is an equal opportunity employer. UOB does not discriminate on the basis of a candidate's age, race, gender, color, religion, sexual orientation, physical or mental disability, or other non-merit factors. All employment decisions at UOB are based on business needs, job requirements and qualifications. If you require any assistance or accommodations to be made for the recruitment process, please inform us when you submit your online application.

Apply now and make a difference.

ตำแหน่งงาน:** Interior Designer (นักออกแบบตกแต่งภายใน)

สถานที่ทำงาน:** 66/2 หมู่ 3 ตำบลมะเร็ต อำเภอเกาะสมุย จังหวัดสุราษฎานี 84310

 หน้าที่และความรับผิดชอบ:**

- สร้างแบบแปลน 2D และ 3D โดยใช้โปรแกรมออกแบบ (เช่น AutoCAD, SketchUp, CAXA)

- สามารถประสานงาน อธิบายแบบกับทีมงานช่าง ผู้จัดการฝ่ายทั่วไป (ใช้ภาษาอังกฤษ 100 เปอเซนต์)และสามารถทำงานร่วมกับพนักงานออกแบบด้วยกันได้

- ตรวจสอบและติดตามงานติดตั้งเพื่อให้แน่ใจว่างานตรงตามแบบและคุณภาพที่กำหนด

 

 

### **คุณสมบัติ:**

- จบด้านการออกแบบภายใน สถาปัตยกรรม หรือสาขาที่เกี่ยวข้อง

- จบหลักสูตรระยะสั้น ด้านการออกแบบภายใน

- ยินดีรับนักศึกษาจบใหม่ 

เงินเดือน เริ่มต้น 25000 บาท ผ่านโปร 30000 บาท รวมถึงโบนัสสิ้นปี 1 เท่าของเงินเดือน

About the Company

Although relatively new to Australia, TK Maxx has now been in the market for 4 years, with almost 100% store growth in that time.  TK Maxx is part of The TJX Companies, Inc., the leading off-price retailer of apparel and homewares in the U.S. and worldwide - with over 4,400 stores in 9 countries.

We offer customers great value, with Big Brands at Small Prices, on a rapidly changing assortment of merchandise. Our mission is to deliver great value to our customers every day, which we achieve through the passion and thinking of our growing team.

What's on Offer?

With the potential to go permanent, this 18 month contract position is part of the Supply Chain and Distribution function and supporting the Program Manager. The Project Manager will lead teams of Business and Operational resources through the establishment of a Distribution Centre, from design through to procurement and commissioning.  

You will provide guidance through experience to various teams through all aspects of the project. The Project Manager ensures all business and operational streams remain aligned to common outcomes, through detailed project plans and clear reporting. The role will also be accountable for delivering new capabilities that drive business results on one or more small, medium sized and complex projects from initialisation through to project close

 As Project Manager your responsibilities include:

  • Efficient implementation and execution of all project management fundamentals, such as time, scope, control, budget, risk, resource management and dependencies.
  • Transparency and escalation of major activities, decisions across all levels of the Business and Project
  • Accountability for day to day project admin and supporting larger strategic projects
  • Decision making and recommendations on resource requirements, project schedules, solution options, and project budgets
  • Supervision and delegation of multiple, concurrent tasks
  • Management of project change control process with the Program Manager ensuring any requested changes to scope are reviewed to assess impact on schedule, cost and resources

You are able to demonstrate:

  • Proven experience (3-5 years+) in Change, Transformation or Project Management
  • A genuine aptitude for strategy and experience in making insight driven decisions
  • Ability to engage with and influence stakeholders at all levels
  • An authentic style and can exhibit the use of your initiative
  • Ability to multi-task, meet deadlines, and work in a fast-paced environment

We're all about our people. We understand that it is critical to our business that we stay focused on developing talent and supporting our people in order for us to meet the demands of the world today and in the future. Your success is our success. That's why when you join, you'll begin a Journey of Personal and Professional Development.

job_title: Research Fellow (Electrical & Electronics Engineering / Computer Engineering)
job_ad_details:
A Research Fellow position is available in the Centre of Integrated Circuits and Systems, School of Electrical & Electronic Engineering, Nanyang Technological University, Singapore.

Job Description:

The Research Fellow will be responsible for research and development of Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Machine Learning (ML) algorithms and systems for imaging and display applications etc.

Job Requirements:

  • A PhD degree in Electrical & Electronics Engineering or Computer Engineering

  • Relevant experience and knowledge in one or more of the following areas: 1. AI/ML algorithms and systems; 2. Signal and image processing; 3. Optics and Display

  • Knowledge and/or experience in using some of tools such as Matlab, Python, Zemax, CodeV etc

  • Good interpersonal skills with the ability to work independently and also in a team environment

  • Fresh graduates with strong interest in AI/ML are also welcomed

We regret that only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

The Office of Academic Services plays a key role in advancing the University's educational goals through implementing and administering the academic policies established by the University's academic body. We provide academic services for students from the time of their matriculation to their graduation.

The job holder will manage the day-to-day operations for the graduation functions.

Responsibilities:

1. Manage the monthly preparation and issuance of degree certificates, official transcripts and Second Major certificates (including hardcopy and electronic formats such as eTranscripts, OpenCerts) and validate the accuracy, security and quality of these official documents issued to graduates of the Undergraduate Education (UE) and Graduate Education (GE) programmes.

2. Handle the annual procurement of the UE and GE degree certificates and transcript papers, and liaise with the appointed vendor on printing of the UE and GE degree certificates

3. Liaise with partner universities on graduation document requirements for Joint Degrees and prepare submissions to seek approval from the relevant authority for deviations from policies.

4. Liaise with various Departments/Colleges/Schools to handle out-of-norm appeals, requests and enquiries for the following areas on a day-to-day basis in accordance with established guidelines and protocols:

  • Daily transcript requests by alumni and students

  • Degree certificate mailing and replacement

  • Certification letters

  • Degree verification requests from external organisations including reporting of academic document forgery cases

5. Support review and integration of processes, guidelines and policies pertaining to graduation matters, and assist in the implementation of new initiatives, process improvements, system enhancements

6. Liaise with appointed OpenCerts and Student P-Files system vendors and CITS to implement system updates or troubleshoot issues encountered

7. Support SMS implementation including gathering and provision of requirements to appointed vendor, performing UATs and data/document migration for past graduates

8. Maintain and update webpages and FAQs on graduation matters

Requirements:

  • A recognised university degree (in any discipline) with at least 3 years of relevant working experience in administration, preferably in the tertiary education sector

  • Service-oriented mind-set with excellent interpersonal and communication skills

  • Meticulous and organised with an eye for detail

  • System and data-saavy; comfortable handling large volume of data records and documents

  • Proficient in proposal and report writing, office IT applications and Microsoft Office suite of applications

  • Knowledge of SQL would be an added advantage

  • Able to multi-task and work with minimum supervision and tight deadlines

  • Familiar with the Personal Data Protection Act, in relation to collection, use and disclosure of students and graduates' personal data

Mayalu Pty Ltd is a hospitality company located at 3/20-22 Jubliee Ave, Carlton, NSW. They offer a range of services including a mini market, street food, travel & tours, and entertainment. Specializing in Nepalese cuisine, their food and beverage department provide high -quality and delicious food products. Customers can enjoy a one-stop service experience with their various offering. 

About the Role:

The position will report to our Head Chef/Kitchen Manager. The position will be required to work at two locations: Strathfield and Hurstville. Your duties and responsibilities include but are not limited to the following:

  • Daily food production of approved menu supervision and participation
  • Menu planning within the firm budget, based on client demand and market requirements.
  • Ordering and managing food supply, food portion control, waste management, and stock procurement are all responsibilities (receipt and storage)
  • Ability to cost menu items appropriately and track production efficiency throughout different stores.
  • Ability to accurately monitor food supply and kitchen equipment par levels, as well as notify management of any additional stock required.
  • Ensuring that all food is cooked to perfection, served on time, and presented professionally.
  • Work to set guidelines and ensure food preparation, cooking, plating, and presentation are always maintained to a high standard
  • Maintain high kitchen standards in all areas of operation, food hygiene and safety, food quality, and preparation.
  • To mitigate risks and problems, and ensure compliance obligations are met, interpret and analyse all kitchen information, including kitchen reports, audits, and paperwork.
  • Train and educate kitchen staff to ensure they are aware of the quality standards required and maintain these standards on site
  • Marketing of food items from the menu.

About you

The successful candidate must satisfy the following criteria:

  • Trade Certificate IV of Cookery
  • At least 3 years’ experience in a chef’s position

OBJECTIVE OF POSITION

To supervise and control all catering outlets in the hotel to the required standards, within agreed budgetary limits and parameters of the law, particularly liquor law.

REPORT TO General Manager

RESPONSIBLE FOR All restaurant, room service, function, stores and back of house staff

RELATIONSHIP WITH Head Chef, Housekeeper, Front of House Manager, Security Manager, Personnel Manager, Maintenance Manager, Accountant, Local Authorities (ARLA, Police, RPH etc)

DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES

  • Ensure the prompt and efficient service of all meals, snacks, beverages and functions to the required standards
  • Ensure profit margins are maintained and agreed costs are not exceeded through effective control systems, including: auditing against dockets, sales analysis, menu costings and cash checks
  • Ensure staffing rosters are prepared weekly
  • Work with Head Chef on menu design
  • Ensure restaurant/s, bar/s and cloakrooms are clean, well maintained and stocked with the stipulated requirements
  • Ensure that table appointments are impeccable
  • Ensure that waiters are always correctly and smartly dressed, they offer professional and courteous service to their customers, and they comply with the required standards
  • Act as Duty Manager as required
  • Ensure consumable and non-consumable goods are ordered, correctly stored and issued to the various departments
  • Ensure maximum security in all areas under your control and staff are fully aware of the importance of key security
  • Ensure company and statutory hygiene standards are maintained in all areas
  • Seek customer opinion about the served food and attend promptly to any customer complaints.
  • Take the necessary steps in the event of theft, burglary or fire
  • Ensure reports and administration requirements are promptly submitted
  • Ensure Back of House departments operate effectively and efficiently

 

  • Hold regular performance appraisals with all management staff, identifying areas for development and training needs, and ensure this training is effected
  • Be fully conversant with all statutory requirements regarding food and beverage operation, that all licences, including special licenses, are applied for and the conditions affecting the issues of a liquor license are not jeopardized
  • Ensure regular stock-takes are conducted and recorded
  • Prepare and submit in the required format all information necessary for accurate budgeting purposes
  • Ensure an effective table reservation system is in operation
  • Hold regular staff meetings
  • Be fully aware of trends in the industry and make suggestions for improvement of the catering operation
  • Attend meetings as required
  • Carry out, or ensure regular on-the-job training is taking place to agreed standards
  • Ensure the most suitably qualified person is appointed in the event of a vacancy
  • Any other duties the employer may reasonably require

RELEVANT QUALIFICATIONS

  • Level 5 National Diploma in Hospitality (Food and Beverage)
  • Hold a General Managers License

PERSONAL ATTRIBUTES

  • Good communication skills
  • Leadership skills
  • Excellent customer service
  • Able to work alone as well as part of a team
  • Honest and reliable

job_title: Finance Manager, Electrical Automation Company, Jakarta
job_ad_details:
Overseeing all financial aspects of the company's operations, including budgeting, forecasting, financial reporting, and risk management. Additionally, the role involves providing strategic financial guidance to support business decision-making and ensuring compliance with relevant regulations and internal policies.

Client Details

Our client is an Electrical Automation Company based in Jakarta, Indonesia. With a focus on technological advancements and efficiency, the company aims to streamline processes and enhance productivity for their clients. They likely have a diverse portfolio of products and services, ranging from automation systems and components to maintenance and support services.

Description

  • Oversee financial planning, budgeting, and forecasting processes to ensure alignment with organisational goals and objectives.
  • Manage cash flow, liquidity, and financial risk, implementing strategies to optimise financial performance and mitigate risks.
  • Provide financial analysis and insights to support strategic decision-making by senior management.
  • Ensure compliance with accounting standards, regulations, and internal policies.
  • Ensure accurate and timely recording of financial transactions, preparation of financial statements, and reconciliation of accounts.
  • Coordinate external audits and tax filings, liaising with auditors and tax authorities as required.
  • Develop and implement tax strategies to optimise the company's tax position while ensuring compliance with tax laws and regulations.
  • Prepare and file tax returns, including corporate income tax, value-added tax (VAT), and withholding tax, ensuring accuracy and timeliness.
  • Administer compensation and benefits programs, ensuring competitiveness and compliance with labor regulations.

Profile

  • Bachelor's degree in finance, accounting, or a related field.
  • Professional certifications such as CPA, CMA, or CFA are highly desirable.
  • Minimum of 8+ years of progressive finance, accounting, and tax management experience, preferably in a multinational manufacturing environment.
  • Strong knowledge of international and local tax regulations.
  • Exceptional leadership and team management abilities.
  • Effective communication and interpersonal skills.

Job Offer

  • Opportunity to expand portfolio into a key strategic role within the organisation
  • Excellent remuneration package based on experience

To apply online please click the 'Apply' button below. For a confidential discussion about this role please contact Nurul Habibah on +62 21 2958 8915.
