• Key leadership role
  • Outstanding role for a passionate CEO whose values align with ours

Help develop Heretaunga Tamatea Settlement Trust as a key player in the Heretaunga Tamatea region.

Heretaunga Tamatea Settlement Trust is the Post Settlement Governance Entity for Heretaunga Tamatea established to receive the redress negotiated by He Toa Takitini in settlement of the historical Treaty grievances of Heretaunga Tamatea against the Crown. Established in 2016, Heretaunga Tamatea Settlement Trust are a hapū based settlement where each hapū are mana whenua within their respective takiwā. Te Rohe o Heretaunga Tamatea is considered the richest and most fertile soil in all of Aotearoa where the traditional rohe comprises of 1.475 million acres spread amongst lofty mountain ranges, deep construing valleys and large vast alluvial plains with five main river systems fuelled by the Heretaunga and Ruataniwha aquifers. 

To continue with the great work of the outgoing Primary Chief Executive Officer (CEO) and to build on our strengths, Heretaunga Tamatea Settlement Trust is seeking a new CEO that will provide a blend of thought-provoking leadership, vision, strategic insight, and commercial acumen, as well as ‘hands on’ management to further develop Heretaunga Tamatea Settlement Trust as a key player in the Heretaunga Tamatea region.

Reporting to the Board, the CEO will be accountable for effectively leading and managing the Heretaunga Tamatea Settlement Trust operations and activities ensuring that the outcomes of the strategic directions are met. This includes a high level of cultural awareness and affinity to the values of Heretaunga Tamatea Settlement Trust and the ability to reflect the voice and kaupapa of marae and hapū.  The CEO is expected to build strong relationships with a range of stakeholders for the benefit of Heretaunga Tamatea Settlement Trust, including local and central government agencies and have a history of enhancing operational performance of a business. 

To be successful, you will lead from the front by understanding the value of strong relationships, have empathy for others, a strong customer service approach and the capacity to make things happen.  You will have a track record of developing successful teams and building a strong culture through a nurturing leadership style, political savvy and strong personal values that align with Heretaunga Tamatea Settlement Trust values. Proven experience in a senior management position that reports to a Board, with solid financial acumen and strategy development are also essential. A relevant tertiary qualification is required. 

This exciting opportunity will appeal to someone interested in taking Heretaunga Tamatea Settlement Trust from its infancy. Building upon your professional networks and being passionate in asserting Heretaunga Tamatea Settlement Trust tino rangatiratanga is intrinsic in this role. 

If this resonates with your background, passion and vision for the future, then please apply online with a full CV and covering letter. 

To request a copy of the position description please contact martin@engagers.co.nz.

If you have any questions about this position you are welcome to contact Liz Graham our Board Chair on 027 325 0527 or lizgraham@xtra.co.nz.

Please note applications for this role will now close COB Tuesday, 6th of April.

• Calls for deep internal comms experience & experience working with senior leaders
  • Fixed-term full-time role based at Whare Kaupapa Atawhai, Wellington 

 

Toitū te marae a Tāne-mahuta, Toitū te marae a Tangaroa, Toitū te tangata. If the land is well and the sea is well, the people will thrive.

 

We are looking for an experienced senior internal communications professional to join the Department of Conservation, Te Papa Atawhai's Internal Communications team, based in Wellington, for a six-month fixed term period.

 

He angitūtanga: About the Role

Reporting to the Internal Communications Manager, this important role will be supporting senior leaders by providing credible advice and by planning, leading and delivering communications and engagement on our key priority pieces of work. Importantly you will be taking a lead role in our COVID-related communications and engagement and as a result need to be someone who can remain calm, provide sound advice under pressure and deliver high quality written work to tight deadlines. You will need to support senior leaders and project leads to communicate effectively and have a good understanding of our operating context including our media, political and organisational environment in order to advise senior leaders how and when to best land their comms.

 

He kōrero mōu: What we are looking for

We are looking for an experienced senior internal communications expert who is:

  • Knowledgeable when it comes to internal comms channels and leader-focussed comms with deep experience of best practice, what practically works well and what doesn't;
  • Able to develop clear, compelling communications and comms plans (both strategic and tactical) on time and to a high standard that also show an understanding of our operating context and an understanding of the project/piece of work (including risks and opportunities);
  • A good writer and story-teller who can draw stories and information out of our people and tell them in a clear and compelling way that engages the reader/viewer and makes the reader think or feel something;
  • Able to work in partnership with internal stakeholders as a trusted advisor and tease out the information required in order to develop plain English, clear communications;
  • Able to quickly develop a deep understanding of the audiences to be communicated with and demonstrate a tone and style that meet the needs of the audience;
  • Looks for opportunities to enhance how communications land with our people and at times thinks outside the square to come up with innovative ways to engage with our people and senior leaders;
  • Strives for excellence, measures outputs and constantly looks for ways to exceed expectations; consistently delivering high-quality advice and comms and to deadline will be second nature;
  • Values people and kindness, and are passionate about learning and delivering excellent results that enhances the reputation of the Organisational Comms Team;
  • A resilient person who keeps going, even when there are bumps in the road and shows composure under pressure;
  • Able to relate well to others in the team and stakeholders at all levels of the organisation and build effective working relationships;
  • Sound incident management or crisis comms experience and ability to think on their feet under pressure;
  • Driven to make a positive difference and make things better.

 

Tono ināianei | Apply now

To apply, submit your CV and a tailored cover letter (PDF) online that describes your interest and that highlights your relevant skills, experience and personal qualities essential to this role.

Applications close 5 pm Sunday 30 January 2021.

For any queries, please contact Debbie Fahey Senior Recruitment Advisor on 027 286 2746 or dfahey@doc.govt.nz, quoting vacancy TEMP 600/5700/4.

COVID-19 Vaccination requirement - All employees are required to be vaccinated in line with our Vaccination Policy.  New employees will be required to provide proof of COVID-19 vaccination prior to commencing employment. 

Eligibility to work in New Zealand is mandatory, including a valid work visa covering the whole period of employment if applying internationally.

This is a regional manager position overseeing a team of 200 people across 50 stores. The role requires maximising sales and profitability while ensuring efficient operations and following company regulations

Client Details

Global Retailer Company

Description

Responsibilities:

  • You will be responsible for leading a large team of at least 200 people, including a team of capable area managers.
  • Managing day-to-day operations of at least 50 stores within the region.
  • Maximising the sales of each store, and ensuring that general and daily operations of his stores are conducted according to the company's rules and regulations.
  • Ensuring the lowest possible costs and highest productivity for all operations and procedures.
  • Working and collaborating with all other departments (logistics, purchasing, finance, HR) in order to achieve the company's goals.
  • Forecasting the manpower planning for each stores' operations (includes everyday operation and new expansion). Recruiting, hiring, training and developing store staff members through setting performance expectations, and conducting performance evaluation.
  • Developing and executing strategies to achieve sales targets and maximise profitability.
  • Involved in decision making such as location of the new store, recruitment of the employees, deciding price changes on the categories assortment.
  • Coordinating and negotiating with suppliers and vendors to ensure timely and accurate product deliveries and providing reports to higher management on financial performance and inventory status.
  • Evaluating store performance against set KPIs and sales targets by developing strategies to optimise sales and profitability across multiple stores.
  • Developing and managing budget for the region, controlling costs while maximising revenues.

Profile

Requirements:

  • At least 10 years of working experience in a sales-related or stores-operation related role, ideally from retail background. You should have the experience in managing at least 30 stores (regional scope)
  • Industry experience: other retail stores, or F&B chains with at least 50 stores across region
  • Complete fluency in both English and Indonesian, spoken and written as well as strong business acumen, communication and presentation skills
  • Fast-paced, and ability to learn things fast. Or, if you have worked in start-up environment, you are also welcomed to apply
  • Good leadership skill, be a team player and is able to work under pressure with minimal supervision
  • Ability to prioritise, meet challenging deadlines and perform under pressure. Flexible and adaptable to work in a high-paced growth
  • Results-driven and being able to work with minimum supervision
  • Willingness to work on Monday - Saturday, around Bekasi area
  • Not title driven

Job Offer

  • Excellent opportunity to expand on your career
  • Be a key driver of the branding in Indonesia
  • Other allowance: car, laptop, mobile phone

To apply online please click the 'Apply' button below. For a confidential discussion about this role please contact Nabila Ananda on +62 21 2958 8815.

JAWATAN KOSONG: Pembantu Farmasi
Gaji Bulanan: RM2000-RM2800 (Gaji Pokok + Elaun + Komisen + …)
Adakah anda sering rasa tidak selesa dengan perubahan kerap dalam kerja? 
Adakah anda rasa tertekan dengan persekitaran kerja yang terlalu kompetitif? 
Adakah anda ingin bekerja dalam suasana yang rendah tekanan dan menggalakkan keseimbangan kerja dan kehidupan? 
Adakah anda mencari pekerjaan yang dapat memberikan kestabilan harian? 
Kami adalah sebuah farmasi yang telah beroperasi selama 12 tahun, stabil dan penuh dengan tenaga. Oleh kerana perniagaan kami semakin berkembang, kami sedang mencari individu yang bersemangat dan positif untuk menyertai pasukan kami dan maju bersama!
Tugas:
  •  Menjawab soalan pelanggan dan memberikan cadangan tentang ubat-ubatan dan produk kesihatan.
  •  Mengurus dan menambah stok rak serta menyelenggara paparan barang.
  •  Membantu merancang dan melaksanakan promosi dalam kedai.
  •  Membantu menguruskan stok ubat-ubatan dan barang-barang lain.
  •  Menjaga kebersihan dan kekemasan dalam kedai.
Syarat Permohonan:
  •  Sekurang-kurangnya 1-2 tahun pengalaman dalam peruncitan atau perkhidmatan pelanggan, sebaik-baiknya di farmasi atau industri berkaitan.
  •  Pengetahuan asas mengenai ubat-ubatan tanpa preskripsi dan produk kesihatan (jika tiada, latihan akan diberikan oleh syarikat).
  •  Kemahiran jualan yang baik dan kemampuan mempromosikan produk.
  •  Kemahiran komunikasi lisan dan tulisan yang cemerlang, mampu berkomunikasi dengan pelanggan dan rakan sekerja dengan berkesan.
  •  Kemahiran asas komputer, mampu menggunakan sistem jualan dan mengendalikan transaksi.
  •  Semangat kerjasama yang baik, mampu bekerja dalam persekitaran yang pantas.
  •  Penguasaan bahasa Inggeris, dan Bahasa Malaysia untuk komunikasi.
Jika anda mempunyai ciri-ciri berikut:
  •  Bermotivasi, sanggup belajar, dan berpendirian baik.
  •  Mampu bekerja untuk jangka masa yang panjang.
  •  Suka bersosial dan boleh bekerja dalam pasukan.
Anda adalah calon yang kami cari! Kami menawarkan:
  •  Skim gaji dan komisen jualan yang menarik.
  •  Diskaun pembelian ubat-ubatan dan produk kesihatan untuk pekerja.
  •  Peluang latihan untuk meningkatkan pengetahuan dan kemahiran profesional.
  •  Jadual kerja yang fleksibel atau sistem kerja bergilir.
  •  Elaun atau subsidi pengangkutan untuk pekerja yang tinggal jauh.
  •  Laluan kerjaya yang jelas dan peluang kenaikan pangkat dalaman.
Lokasi Kerja: TBS, Bandar Tasik Selatan
Waktu Kerja: Sistem kerja bergilir
Cara Menghubungi: Sila email resume anda ke arison.pillbox@gmail.com atau hantar WhatsApp ke 0163225964 (Arison). Kami akan membalas dalam masa 3 hari bekerja. Terima kasih!
Perhatian: Jika anda sering mengambil cuti, lambat datang kerja atau balik awal, sila jangan hubungi kami.

Hours Per Week: 38hrs
Requisition ID: REQ381660

  Child and Adolescent Mental Health - Tweed is seeking a Clinical Psychologist to provide services within the ‘Clinical Psychologist’ scope of practice as defined in the Health and Community Employees Psychologists (State) Award 2017, and within the legislative and policy requirements of NSW Health and statutory authorities to ensure safe clinical practice and client/patient focused outcomes.
 

If you have:

  • Current registration with the Australian Health Practitioner Regulation Authority (AHPRA) as a Psychologist
  • Post graduate qualification at Masters level or higher in Clinical Psychology, Clinical Neuropsychology or other relevant specialty
  • Recent experience in clinical psychology and the ability to apply recognised and relevant evidence based psychological assessment techniques and therapeutic interventions
  • Commitment to provide/participate in supervision in accordance with the Health and Community Employees Psychologists (State) Award 2017

 

We can offer you:

  • Flexible and supportive work environment
  • Diverse career pathways
  • Professional and personal development
  • Opportunities to start or build a career, or re-enter the workforce
  • Challenging, inspiring and rewarding roles, and
  • The opportunity to make a difference!

 

Northern NSW Local Health District embraces the diverse skills and perspectives that our people bring to the workplace. We foster inclusiveness and diversity to help us deliver quality care to our community.

 

NNSWLHD is committed to reconciliation and strongly encourages Aboriginal & Torres Strait Islander people to apply for this position. All applications from Aboriginal & Torres Strait Islander people will be viewed most favourably.  For help with your application to this role visit Stepping Up, our online recruitment resource for Aboriginal people.

job_title: [Part-time job] Native Thai Online English Teacher
job_ad_details:
Kyna Pte. Ltd. (Kyna English) is an online education company based in Singapore, providing online English learning solutions with quality tutors for learners of all ages. With over 4 years of operation, Kyna has delivered over 5 million lessons to more than 100,000 students in Vietnam, Thailand, and Indonesia. In order to expand our offering, Kyna English is looking for Online English Teachers from Thailand.
Your responsibilities:
- Teach English online in a 1-on-1 or 1-on-4 format for Thai students
- You can choose to teach children (ages 5-17), adults (ages 18-50), or both
Your benefits:
- Teach from the comfort of your home.
- Flexible teaching time, classes are assigned after you set up your schedule.
- Ready-made teaching materials on a teacher-friendly platform
- Performance bonus for each qualified class.
- Gross rate from 100 - 250 THB/ hour.
- There will be an extra bonus for each qualified and completed class. Golden hour bonus for teachers who teach in our peak hours (6:00 - 9:00 PM) (Thailand time - GMT +7)
- Depending on your skills and availability, you can make up to 40,000 THB/ month.
❗️❗️ Teachers must have a valid passport. (Compulsory for the contract and salary process)
Requirements:
- Having a good command of English; TESOL and teaching experience are a plus.
- Love sharing English knowledge.
- Patient and supportive.
- Able to teach a minimum of 2.5 hours from 6:00 - 9:00 PM, at least 3 sessions per week (Thailand time - GMT +7)
- Have a stable internet connection.

job_title: Senior Officer, SME Lending Specialist, Business Banking (Klang Valley)
job_ad_details:
About UOB

United Overseas Bank Limited (UOB) is a leading bank in Asia with a global network of more than 500 branches and offices in 19 countries and territories in Asia Pacific, Europe and North America. In Asia, we operate through our head office in Singapore and banking subsidiaries in China, Indonesia, Malaysia and Thailand, as well as branches and offices.

Our history spans more than 80 years. Over this time, we have been guided by our values — Honorable, Enterprising, United and Committed. This means we always strive to do what is right, build for the future, work as one team and pursue long-term success. It is how we work, consistently, be it towards the company, our colleagues or our customers.

About the Department

The Retail function provides Personal and Business Banking customers with financial solutions tailored to their needs. We help them manage their money wisely and meet their financial goals through an extensive range of products and services. These include deposit, insurance, secured and unsecured loans, investment and wealth advisory services.

Business Banking

We develop integrated products and services targeted at helping small and medium-sized enterprises across the region progress through different stages of growth. These include innovative solutions and initiatives in areas of working capital loans, operational efficiency and currency exposure.

Job Responsibilities
  • Enhance SMEs portfolio of the bank through new sales acquisition of SME customers, package the requirements for business loan applications.
  • Interview applicants to determine financial eligibility and feasibility of meeting the bank's product criteria
  • Responsible for processing of loans application and submission for an approval, closely follow up on the acceptance until disbursement of the loans.
  • Ensure cross selling of bundled product together with each of loans application
  • To achieve sales target of all assigned products.
Job Requirements
  • A recognized Diploma/ Degree holders in any discipline
  • Min 1 year of sales experience in business-to-business OR business-to-consumer industry
  • Has min 1 year of Banking/ Finance/ Accounting experience will be an added advantage
  • Possess prior experience and exposure in processing of business loan application, will be an added advantage & preferred
  • Strong business acumen, proactive and a highly motivated self-starter
  • Good sales and customer relationship management.
  • Possess own transportation and willing to travel.
  • Fresh Graduates are encouraged to apply
Be a part of UOB Family

Apply now and make a difference.

job_title: Associate, Finance, Financial & Statutory Reporting (3 years renewable contract)
job_ad_details:
A*STAR is an Accredited Training Organisation (ATO) that has been certified by the Singapore Accountancy Commission (SAC) to process the appropriate standards of staff training, accountancy resources and development for Singapore CA Qualification candidates to fulfil their Practical Experience required to qualify as a Chartered Accountant of Singapore.

A*STAR is also a Recognised Employer Partner with CPA Australia, affirming our commitment to excellence in professional development, and to fostering the growth of our employees in the field of Finance and Accounting.

The shortlisted candidate will be joining A*STAR Research Entities (ARES) Financial & Statutory Reporting (FnSR) Team that is responsible for accounts closing, consolidation and financial reporting for all Research Institutes in accordance with Financial Reporting Standards (FRS).

 

Candidate is responsible for:

  • Month end and year end closing of accounts for the Research Institutes as allocated.
  • Timely posting and review of Grant Utilisation entries for all Research Institutes. ARES' expenses are mostly funded by grants and the grant utilisation process recognises the grant income to match the expenses incurred.
  • Timely review of month end and year end closing of accounts as well as preparation of and follow up on monthly accounting schedules.
  • Handling InterCo confirmation and IntraCo reconciliation and following up with counterparts for closure.
  • Supporting audit fieldwork with spontaneous response to auditor on selected samples.
  • Supporting the consolidation of ARES' accounts to produce mid-year and final ARES financial statements.
  • Supporting adhoc tasks as assigned.

 

Job Requirements

  • Possess Diploma in Accountancy.
  • Possess at least 1 to 2 years of relevant experience in finance role.
  • Strong analytical, communication and time management skills.
  • Experience with SAP will be advantageous.
  • Good command of MS Office applications.
  • Good team player.

Salary:

  • Basic $500 - $600 (Weekly gross up to $875 ++ with OT)


Other Information:

  • Work Location: Tuas (both way company transport provided at Lakeside MRT)
  • Working hours: 4-3-3-4 (830am - 830pm) / (830pm - 830am) can choose day shift or night shift
  • Fully air condition environment
  • OT Payable after official working hours


Job Benefit:

  • ✅AWS,VB and 15 days of annual leave


Job Responsibilities:

  • Picking and Packing
  • Loading and unloading
  • ad-hoc duties


Job Requirements:

  • No experience
  • Able to work with friends
  • Start immediately
  • Immediate arrangement, immediate offer


Additional Information:


Applicants who possess relevant experience for the above responsibilities are most welcome to apply. If you do not possess the above experience, your application will still be considered on individual merits and you may be contacted for other opportunities.


Please submit your updated resume in MS Words format by using the APPLY NOW BUTTON


For more information, you may contact +65 6018 4681


By submitting your personal data and/or resume, you give consent to collection, use and disclosure of your personal data and/or resume by the company (or its agent) for the purpose of the processing and administration by the company relating to this job application.

job_title: Level 3 Occupational Therapist - Neurology - St George Hospital
job_ad_details:
Level 3 Occupational Therapist - Neurology - St George Hospital

Organisation / Entity:
South Eastern Sydney Local Health District

Health - Allied | Occupational Therapy

Sydney Region / Sydney - South

,
Employment Type: Permanent Full Time
Position Classification: Occupational Therapist Level 3
Remuneration: $108,595 - $112,114 per annum plus superannuation 
Hours Per Week: 38
Requisition ID: REQ489619

Are you ready for your next career step as an Occupational Therapist in Neurology?

This is a fantastic opportunity for an experienced, enthusiastic and motivated occupational therapist to be permanently appointed to our Level 3 Neurology position. You will have the opportunity to contribute clinical expertise in the management of a range of acute neurological patients in St George Hospital. The role is also responsible for providing clinical supervision and daily support of Level 1-2 occupational therapists, rostered allied health assistants, and students. We look forward to welcoming an enthusiastic and effective leader to enhance our occupational therapy team!

St George Hospital Occupational Therapy Department

Our vision is "Empowering you to live the life you want through creativity, collaboration and choice". We are a supportive department focused on person centered, compassionate care. We have a strong focus on clinical and leadership skill development, and strive to provide consistent high quality occupational therapy services across the campus. Our department consists of 34 occupational therapists and support staff, and we work across a variety of inpatient, outpatient and community services. Clinically we provide services to aged care, acute surgical and medical, trauma, neurological, rehabilitation, palliative care, lymphoedema and hands patients. We coordinate a robust student program, and provide a variety of professional development opportunities. We support flexible work practices, protected time for non clinical tasks (quality improvement, continuing professional education, and leadership development) and enjoy a positive and supportive workplace culture.


What you'll be doing

The vision for South Eastern Sydney Local Health District (SESLHD) is ‘exceptional care, healthier lives’. SESLHD is committed to enabling our community to be healthy and well, and to providing the best possible compassionate care when people need it.
As a Level 3 Occupational Therapist you will plan, coordinate, and implement in-depth levels of clinical expertise and extensive specialised knowledge within Occupational Therapy in order to provide high quality occupational therapy care to patients consistent with NSW Health and SESLHD policies, procedures and standards.

Employment of a temporary visa holder may only occur if no suitable permanent resident or citizen of Australia has been identified for this position following suitable labour market testing.

All Category A workers and new recruits are required to receive one dose of the seasonal influenza vaccine annually to be considered compliant.

Category A workers and new recruits who are non-compliant with seasonal influenza vaccination or have a medical contraindication to influenza vaccinations must comply with all other infection control risk reduction strategies as directed while working in a Category A position.

SESLHD is committed to creating a workplace that reflects the diversity of our community. This will help ensure our employees, our patients and their carers, feel supported. We encourage people from different backgrounds to apply.

Support for Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander candidates

We welcome applications from Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander candidates and we have an Aboriginal Employment Consultant that can provide support. If you have any questions or would like guidance on the recruitment process, please contact the SESLHD Aboriginal Employment Team via email to: SESLHD-AboriginalWorkforce@health.nsw.gov.au

  1. Qualifications in accordance with Schedule C of the NSW Health Service Health Professionals (State) Award and Current Registration with AHPRA.
  2. Extensive post graduate clinical experience in the acute management of neurology patients.
  3. Excellent negotiation, decision making and advocacy skills including the ability to interact constructively and collaboratively with a diverse range of stakeholders, throughout all organisational levels.
  4. Ability to provide in-depth advice and education to enhance service delivery and to guide and support others in providing service excellence, with the capacity to provide clinical supervision to other staff.
  5. Ability to work as part of a multi-disciplinary team and to apply advanced reasoning skills and independent professional judgement when dealing with situations of a novel, complex or critical nature.
  6. Ability to initiate, lead, complete and share quality improvement initiatives and service evaluation processes and lead ongoing quality improvement activities with other staff.
  7. Demonstrated commitment to ongoing clinical and professional learning.
  8. Current Class C Drivers Licence.

  2) Find out more about applying for this position
For role related queries or questions contact Elise Klumpes-Grant on Elise.KlumpesGrant@health.nsw.gov.au

#Warehouse Operations #Tool Crib Management #Forklift Driving #CNC Workshop Tools and Equipment #Inventory Management Software
Salary Package: RM5300 - RM9100
Job Location: Multiple Locations
Job Types: Permanent, Full time, Onsite, 5 days, 5.5 days, Night shift
Business Sector: Machinery Manufacturing Company provides Turnkey Manufacturing Services : Large Format Engineering, Fabrication & Assembly
Job Responsibilities:
1. Receiving and Deliveries:
• Receive and inspect incoming shipments for accuracy and completeness.
• Unload, organize, and store received materials in designated warehouse locations.
• Prepare outgoing shipments, ensuring accurate documentation and packaging.
• Coordinate with vendors and carriers to schedule deliveries and pickups.
• Conduct regular inventory checks and update records to ensure accuracy.
• Maintain a clean and organized receiving area.
2. Tool Crib Management:
• Oversee the tool crib, ensuring it is well-stocked and organized.
• Monitor tool usage and reorder supplies as needed.
• Issue tools to CNC operators according to established procedures.
• Conduct regular inventory checks and update records to ensure accuracy.
• Collaborate with the production team to understand tool requirements.
3. Documentation and Record Keeping:
• Maintain accurate records of all incoming and outgoing shipments.
• Update inventory systems regularly to reflect stock levels and movement.
• Generate reports on inventory status, tool usage, and procurement needs.
• Document any discrepancies and report them to the appropriate personnel.
4. Safety and Compliance:
• Adhere to safety guidelines and protocols during all warehouse activities.
• Ensure compliance with company policies and procedures.
• Participate in regular safety training sessions.
Job Requirements:
• Proven experience in warehouse operations, receiving, and tool crib management.
• Familiarity with CNC workshop tools and equipment is a plus.
• Strong organizational and time management skills.
• Detail-oriented with excellent record-keeping abilities.
• Ability to lift and move heavy materials.
• Know how to drive forklift is a plus
• Proficient in using inventory management software.
• Effective communication skills and the ability to work in a team.

Chief People and Reputation Officer

Aussie Broadband’s Executive Team is really a disguise for a bunch of friends who like to do things the unconventional way. Given that we’ve grown from 60 to 1000staff in the last six years, this appears to be working so far, touch wood.

Sadly, one of our bunch is attempting to break up the band due to some excuse about retiring. We’re now on the hunt for someone awesome who can not only filltheir shoes, but teach us some new tricks.

We’re calling this role Chief People and Reputation Officer (although if you prefer the acronym CRAPO, we can always swing it the other way).

What we’re really after is someone who:

  • Can lead with gravitas, coach with clarity and advise with wisdom – but, obviously, also has a great sense of humour
  • Can co-create and champion Aussie’s unconventional culture
  • Is a masterful story teller and Plain English fanatic
  • Loves the idea of changing the telco game in Australia
  • Knows (or can quickly learn) their way around functions including Comms, People and Culture, Inclusion and Diversity, Community Impact, Corporate Servicesand Canine Relations
  • Can challenge norms if they make no sense, both within and without Aussie
  • Is excellent at getting stuff done

There’s a somewhat more serious Position Description available. For more information on the opportunity, please contact our retained search consultant,Shaun Daly at Socius on 0404 085 949 or email shaun@sociusrecruit.com.au

At ALDI, our people are the key to our success.

Our business couldn't operate without our quick-thinking, energetic Warehouse Pickers / Operators. Working in our fast-paced Warehouse environment, our Pickers select products accurately, safely and efficiently for delivery to our stores. Sound reading and numerical skills are a must. It's physical work and can be tiring but it's also great exercise and you'll soon find your rhythm. There's great camaraderie and you'll feel like everyone's working towards the same goals; to meet deadlines and challenging targets.

We are looking for people that not only ensure their work is completed to the highest standard, but can do so whilst balancing different priorities, tight deadlines and unexpected challenges. Because this role is physically challenging, we need Operators that are able to remain productive and energetic. A love for hands-on, physical work is a must, as is a strong sense of team spirit and a can-do attitude. Sound like you? Then ALDI might be the right fit.

What’s in it for you?

  • Market leading remuneration - from $31.67 per hour + penalties
  • Four weeks annual leave
  • Flexible work arrangements and different levels of guaranteed contract hours available
  • Career opportunities within our Distribution Centres
  • Comprehensive training and development
  • First Class equipment and Distribution Centres
  • Be a part of a leading international retailer
  • Excellent team culture - work alongside friendly and supportive colleagues

You will be responsible for:

  • Providing accurate and prompt picking, receiving and dispatching of goods
  • Managing orders
  • Controlling stock levels
  • Operating machinery in a safe and efficient manner

Selection Criteria:

  • Demonstrated ability to work autonomously and as part of a team
  • Good attention to detail
  • Confident and engaging communication skills
  • Adaptability and flexibility

ALDI as an employer: For the planners, the coordinators, the ones who strive for every efficiency. A role in one of our distribution centres will place you in ALDI's engine room - disciplined, structured, and constantly striving to achieve goals. With all the challenges of supporting a rapidly growing operation, you'll be supported by great conditions, generous remuneration and a culture that'll bring out the best in you.

Job Duties:
You will be managing refuelling-related billing admin such as creating of Purchase Requisitions, receipting of orders, Purchase Order creation and bill management in both the Oracle system and internal billing system. You may also be required to support the department in carrying out day-to-day administrative duties.

Requirements:
• Higher NITEC / NITEC in any discipline
• Willing to work on a 5-day work week, in an office environment

McConnell Dowell South East Asia is looking to hire a BIM Modeller in our Singapore SEA office. The successful candidate will demonstrate a broad range of experience leading the cross-discipline development and monitoring of BIM Technical Specifications, Processes, Procedures, and deliverables.

About the Business
  
McConnell Dowell is a major engineering, construction, building and maintenance contractor delivering infrastructure to the building, mining, oil and gas, petrochemical, power, social & public infrastructure, transport and water sectors.

The Group, which operates under the brands of McConnell Dowell and Built Environs, offers a broad construction capability with complete multi-discipline capability in building, civil, fabrication, electrical, maintenance and mechanical works with specialist engineering capabilities in the pipeline, tunneling, marine, and rail construction.

Working at the forefront of the industry, we provide our people with a stimulating environment that challenges them to think laterally and excel beyond even their own expectations. We equip, inspire and empower our people to be their very best, to learn through experience, and to help us reach the highest standards in all areas of the business. We make sure all our people are made for the job.

About the Role
  
Responsibilities include
  • Creation of BIM/CAD deliverables and ensuring their consistency and accuracy for the 3D information.
  • Maintaining the Quality Assurance and Quality Control of models and drawings.
  • Assist the BIM Manager and BIM Coordinator on working with site project teams, their consultants and contractors to coordinate BIM issues with design teams to develop and reinforce standards with the goal of refining the models and BIM deliverables.
  • Integrate the BIM/CAD applications including Scheduling, Cost, Asset Management, and O&M programs into the BIM models.
  • Reporting to the BIM Manager and BIM Coordinator. Minimum content to include: BIM Issue Tracker, Audit Reports results Status of Model Development, submittal/shop drawing integration, and project close-out requirements.
  • Assist with the upskilling of existing CAD, Engineering & Project Management staff.
About You

To be successful in this role you will need the following:
  • Bachelor's degree in any relevant Engineering or Architectural field, or equivalent experience 4+ years of experience and background in modelling and knowledge of best practices in BIM.
  • Minimum of 2 years broad experience in design, drafting and BIM management.
  • Mandatory proficiency in Autodesk Revit and BIM authoring tools.
  • Proficiency in Autodesk Civil 3D would be an added value for Civil BIM Modeller.
  • Proficiency in AutoCAD Plant 3D would be an added value for MEP BIM Modeller.
  • Proficiency in Autodesk Navisworks.
  • Proficiency on MS SharePoint and Aconex platforms would be an added value.
  • Good English communication and interpersonal skills.
  • Ability to effectively prioritize tasks and solve problems when working under pressure.
  • Passionate about McConnell Dowell’s values of safety & care, honesty & integrity, customer focus, working together, and performance excellence.
  • Strong commitment to the safety promise of “Home Without Harm”.

Interested candidates, please email your resume to our recruitment team to apply directly at Recruitment.Singapore@mcdgroup.com

Due to the volume of applications and replies received, we regret to inform only suitable candidates who apply directly will be notified upon successful applications, and applicants referred by the recruitment agency will not be considered. We will still consider your profile for near-future opportunities again. Thank you for your understanding and interest!

rhi is recruiting for a Tech Lead for SOX and Compliance for our client based in KL, Malaysia on a contract basis until 31st December 2025.

The ideal candidate will have extensive experience in audit, risk management, internal controls, and compliance, particularly focusing on identity. This role involves identifying key risks and controls, optimizing Sarbanes-Oxley (SOX) readiness controls, and configuring controls around security and business processes within the GRC modules. The candidate should be adept at working with regulatory requirements and industry standards (e.g., SOX, GDPR, PCI - DSS, NIST, ISO17799 & ISO19011, GRC PC) related to SAP systems and leading a team for audit-related activities.

Responsibilities:

  • Lead and manage the audit, risk management, internal controls, and compliance activities focusing on SAP systems.
  • Identify key risks and controls, optimize SOX readiness controls, and configure controls around security and business processes within the GRC modules.
  • Ensure compliance with regulatory requirements and industry standards in relation to Identity.
  • Lead a team of resources for audit-related activities, including monitoring, audit testing, and evidence gathering.
  • Handle interactions with internal and external auditors and push back on certain audit requests when necessary.
  • Provide technical guidance and support to ensure SOX control compliance and optimization.
  • Senior stakeholder management, great communicator

About you:

  • 7-10 years' experience in IT audit space
  • Extensive experience in audit, risk management, internal controls, compliance, or a related field, with a focus on SAP systems.
  • Proven track record in identifying key risks and controls, optimizing SOX readiness controls, and configuring controls within the GRC modules.
  • Experience working with regulatory requirements and industry standards (e.g., SOX, GDPR,NIST,PCI_DSS, ISO17799 & ISO19011, SNOW IRM, GRC PC) related to identity

  • Deep understanding of audit processes and principles.
  • Ability to handle internal and external audits and effectively manage audit requests
  • Strong technical knowledge and understanding of SOX controls
  • Leadership skills to manage and guide a team for audit-related activities
  • Excellent communication and interpersonal skills to engage with auditors
  • Senior stakeholders management.
  • Continuous improvement mindset
  • Project management background

About rhi

rhi is a professional services provider with global expertise. Tracing our history back to the 19th century, we have spent the last 50 years as a global leader to the energy industry.

We combine efficient systems and processes with a deep understanding of client challenges and market insight. We work with our clients to deliver information and resources that will support every stage of their operations. We deliver value to our employees, our clients and the countries that we work in.

Snowy Hydro is a dynamic, integrated energy business that has been providing on-demand, reliable energy to Australia for over 70 years. Snowy Hydro owns and operates a powerful combination of generation assets, including the 4100-megawatt Snowy Mountains Scheme, gas and diesel plants, and has recently contracted wind and solar energy. We also provide electricity and gas to more than 1.1 million retail customers through Red Energy and Lumo Energy. 

An exciting opportunity exists for a customer-focused, detail-driven individual to join our Finance team as an Accounts Payable Officer on a permanent, part-time basis. This role will be based in our Cooma office, working 3 days per week between Monday and Friday. 

Your key focus in this role is to maintain good supplier and employee relations through timely and accurate payments of invoices and entitlements. You will also be required to assist with coordinating the accounts receivable function. Reporting to the Finance Team Lead, some of your responsibilities will include;

  • Maintaining a high level of accuracy while processing finance correspondence for the Snowy Hydro Group of companies, pay suppliers and staff 

  • Managing the Accounts Payable inbox 

  • Reviewing reports and statements to identify and act on outstanding invoices

  • Process daily payment (EFT) and weekly cheque runs

  • Identifying and escalating ambiguous, difficult, or complex issues

  • Analysing and interpreting the reporting provided by our Finance Systems

  • Monitor Corporate Banking activities, reconcile and receipt daily transactions

  • Continuously providing a high level of customer service for both internal and external customers

To be successful in this role, you will possess;

  • Availability to work 3 days per week (Flexible days)

  • A high level of accuracy and attention to detail

  • Customer focus, with excellent communication skills (written and verbal)

  • Strong ability to manage several tasks at once and maintain accurate financial records

  • Excellent time management skills, with the ability to work to strict deadlines

  • Experience in accounts payable, or similar roles is beneficial, but not essential

  • Strong commitment to process improvement

  • An ability to work effectively within a small team and a proactive approach to assisting the team to cover fluctuations in workloads when required

Service Delivery Associate Fixed Term

We are Fujitsu

We use technology to make happier lives. We are a global leader in technology and business solutions that transform organisations and the world around us. We have a long heritage of bringing innovation and expertise, continuously working to contribute to the growth of society and our customers.

About the role

We are currently seeking an enthusiastic Service Delivery Associate with experience managing stakeholders and clients to join our growing team on a 12 month fixed-term basis. The role will be responsible for providing a high level of support to multiple customers and senior stakeholders as well as assisting in the development of new business across Fujitsu.

About you

Responsibilities and Accountabilities:
 

  • Work closely with internal and external stakeholders in order to ensure high customer satisfaction and service delivery.
  • Act as the primary point-of-contact for Fujitsu clients and provide a high level of communication to both Fujitsu and external stakeholders.
  • Ensure contractual and SLA obligations are clearly defined, understood, and met by Fujitsu technical teams and external providers.
  • Facilitate on-going reporting and meetings to ensure customer satisfaction and develop effective communication channels.
  • Provide an initial escalation point for all service delivery and problem resolution.
  • Manages, motivate & develop a team directly and indirectly ensuring the team achieve their objectives & to constantly improve quality of service.
  • Control elements of service risks, service costs & improve the productivity of low complexity contracts for Clients.

 

Requirements and Experience:

  • 4 years + experience of IT development and support
  • Previous experience engaging and managing multiple stakeholders.
  • Tertiary level education or equivalent, Ideally within computer studies.
  • Basic understanding of financial and contractual reporting.

 

Why Fujitsu?

We are an organization with a strong set of values and a history of respecting fairness and equality, whilst promoting diversity, equity, and inclusion. We constantly push ourselves to do better and strive to bring together a diverse mix of perspectives and talents in an inclusive environment, where we encourage our people to bring their full selves to work. We call this Be Completely You.

  • We put people first. We believe in the power of diversity to drive innovation and our Work180 accreditation, AWEI (Australian Workplace Equality Index) Gold Employer status, and Rainbow Tick certification for LGBTI+ inclusion show that we value an inclusive culture.
  • We offer tailored career paths across our global organization to support your professional and personal growth.
  • Our customers trust us. We have an excellent reputation across the region and globally.
  • Best in-class reward and recognition programs flexible work, volunteering leave, and more.
  • We live our values of aspiration, trust, and empathy, all day, every day.

 

As an inclusive employer, Fujitsu aims to recruit a diverse range of talents to help us achieve our purpose. In line with our diversity, equity, and inclusion strategy, we welcome applications from women and gender-diverse people; Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people; Māori and Pacific people; LGBTI+ people; people with a disability; culturally and linguistically diverse people; and veterans and emergency responders. Transgender and gender-diverse applicants can request a copy of our Frequently Asked Questions to assist with the recruitment journey by emailing Oceania.Purpose@fujitsu.com.

If you don't tick every box in this job description, please don't rule yourself out. Research suggests that women and other people in underrepresented groups tend to only apply if they meet every requirement. We focus on hiring people who value inclusion, collaboration, adaptability, courage, and integrity, rather than ticking boxes so if this resonates with you, then please apply. For more information, please email careersapac@fujitsu.com.

Search Firm Representatives Please Read Carefully

Fujitsu does not accept unsolicited assistance from search firms for employment opportunities. All CVs or resumes submitted by search firms to any employee at our company without a valid written agreement in place for this position will be considered the sole property of our company. No fee will be paid if a candidate is hired by Fujitsu due to an agency referral where no existing agreement is in place with the Fujitsu Talent Acquisition Team. Where agency agreements are in place, introductions must be through engagement by the Fujitsu Talent Acquisition Team.

With a diverse range of roles we have a passion for helping our people be their best. Let us get you there with free myki travel.

 

Reporting to the Track Ganger, could you be our next Medium Rail Plant Operator?

 

Based in Regional Victoria in a town called Ouyen, this position is responsible for carrying out tasks operating / driving trucks and or plant in the medium category associated with the maintenance and renewal/upgrade on track for the Victorian Rail Network.

 

About the role

  • Operate a truck or plant in the medium category which will include but not be limited to loading and unloading plant for transportation
  • Other role responsibilities also include participating in the replacement of rail, ballast and fastenings as directed as well as the cleaning and maintaining, general maintenance and ensuring services are completed as per their scheduled dates for the medium truck and other medium plant equipment
  • There may be a requirement to work away from home, working day, afternoon or night shifts in various locations as required

 

To be successful in the role

  • Demonstrated alignment to V/Line’s values of responsiveness, integrity, impartiality, accountability, respect, leadership and human rights
  • Certificate II Rail Infrastructure or willing to obtain within the first 6 months of employment
  • Must hold a valid MR truck licence
  • Experienced in the operation of medium rigid trucks, loaders, backhoes, and excavators
  • Highly reliable, Strong team Player and safety conscious
  • Be open to working overtime, travel away for work when required

 

What we can offer

  • Workplace Flexibility
  • Personal Development 
  • Commitment to Culture 
  • Inclusive Environment 
  • Career Opportunities 
  • Contribute to Connecting Victorians 
  • Free Myki Travel 
  • Paid Parental Leave 

 

The salary for this position will be paid in accordance with the current V/Line Asset Management Enterprise Agreement 2019 IMW (TRACK) 2.1 at $40.6839 per hour.

 

Shortlisted applicants will be contacted to complete a Safety Profile and Verbal and Numeric testing to progress.

 

A police check and Cat Risk 1 Medical will also need to be completed prior to successful employment.

 

To apply for this position, please click ‘Apply for this Position' below. 

 

V/Line is an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to providing an environment of mutual respect and we welcome applicants from any background. We value diversity and are continuously working towards creating a flexible and inclusive environment that is representative of the Victorian community.

Maintenance & Plant Manager

About us

We are a privately owned Australian manufacturer. Our team has a firm commitment to excellence in production and quality to ensure our customers receive only the best.

Located in Sydney and keeping traditions alive for the past 30 years we still employ some of the staff that have been with us from the very beginning. 

 

 

The Role

 

We have an opportunity for a Plant & Maintenance Manager to join our Team based at our SYD premises. 


Reporting to the Managing Director, you will be responsible for providing coverage for production machinery, attending to various breakdowns in the factory and improving the level of service in repairs and maintenance by reducing downtime, improving efficiency and continuity.

 

 

Tasks & Responsibilities 
• Perform fault finding on a range of machines
• Ensure that the plant operates with maximum achievable uptime
• Plan work including ordering parts, equipment and supervising/carrying out jobs as well as completing jobs where possible yourself.
• Investigate equipment failures and implement improvements
• Conduct detailed inspections and carry out any corrective action
• Assist with the development of preventative maintenance schedules
• Ensure that the site achieves its WH&S objectives and QA standards

• Understand equipment technical specifications and application to processing systems

  • Install and plan new equipment.

 

 

Qualifications & Experience
• Electrical Trade Qualification
• Minimum of 4 years experience in an FMCG environment
• Any post trade qualifications especially in industrial facilities.
• Industrial Electrical Background
• Able to read and interpret technical drawings and electrical schematics
• Ability to work with little or no supervision
• Has a strong continuous commitment to safety


If this role sounds like the next step for you, we've love to hear from you! Please submit your application (resume and cover letter) through Seek.

Key Skills: Sales, Water Treatment, Management, Business Development

Our client is a global market and technology leader in Engineered Joining Technology solutions, with over six decades of manufacturing and product development experience. They are seeking an Area Sales Manager to join their team in Manila. This role offers the opportunity to grow sales revenue through the establishment of distribution networks within defined market sectors such as Plumbing, Flow Management, Agriculture & Irrigation, and Channel Distribution. The successful candidate will have full responsibility for the appointed country - Philippines for Water Management.

  • Global market and technology leader in Engineered Joining Technology solutions
  • Opportunity to grow sales revenue through the establishment of distribution networks
  • Full responsibility for the appointed country - Philippines for Water Management

What you'll do:

As an Area Sales Manager in Water Treatment, you will be responsible for growing sales revenue through establishing distribution networks within defined market sectors. You will take on full commercial responsibility including financial planning, forecasting, budgeting and strategic planning. You will also be responsible for customer and account management including receivable collection. Your role will involve developing the Water Management market segment by defining market structures, identifying key customer targets and their potential.

  • Take on full responsibility for the appointed country - Philippines for Water Management
  • Interface into the group through regional meetings, common visits and daily use of an eCRM tool
  • Take on full commercial responsibility including financial plans, forecasting, budgeting and strategic planning
  • Responsible for customer and account management including receivable collection
  • Develop the Water Management market segment by defining market structures, identifying key customer targets and their potential
  • Work with State Authority Board, Consultants and Architects on project design and project management
  • Identify from the portfolio of products and brands, the target product ranges that fit to the market needs
  • Develop/set-up distribution partners and customers
  • Establish Brands in the market based on innovation, value to customers, service and quality

What you bring:

The ideal candidate for this Area Sales Manager role will bring a basic degree in Engineering along with a postgraduate qualification in sales and marketing. You should have more than five years' experience in a similar position within a multinational company environment. Experience in setting up distribution networks is essential as well as proven experience in Project Management. A demonstrated ability to penetrate new markets and close deals is crucial.

  • Basic degree in Engineering and a post graduate qualification in sales and marketing
  • More than 5 years' experience in a similar position and environment
  • Previous experience working in a multi-national company
  • Experience in or setting up distribution networks
  • Experience in Project Management
  • Demonstrated ability to penetrate new markets and to close deals

What sets this company apart:

Our client is a global market and technology leader in Engineered Joining Technology solutions, with over 60 years of manufacturing and product development experience. They have a global network of manufacturing facilities and numerous sales and distribution sites across Europe, the Americas and Asia-Pacific. The Group manufactures a very comprehensive range of innovative joining-technology products in the clamp, connect and fluid categories and occupies a leading position as a solution provider. Their dedication to quality and technological leadership has won them the confidence of over 10,000 customers in more than 100 countries.

What's next:

If you're ready to take your career to the next level with an industry leader, we want to hear from you!

Apply today by clicking on the link!

Due to the high volume of applications we are experiencing, our team will only be in touch with you if your application is shortlisted.

Isentia is the Asia-Pacific region's leading media intelligence company; empowering clients to understand their brand and reputation. Our clients are diverse, ranging from globally renowned brands right through to start-ups and not-for-profit organizations. On September 1st, Isentia will become part of Access Intelligence. This will be an exciting phase as we join forces to become a global leader in media intelligence. 
 
Our regional Talent Acquisition team is growing and we're looking to add to our Manila team. Working in the regional team, you'll support a wide variety of roles in Southeast Asia (Philippines, Vietnam, Singapore, and Malaysia), as well as supporting regional Continuous Improvement projects for the APAC region. 
 
We're looking for an experienced Talent Acquisition Specialist, ideally with a mix of Agency and In-house experience, who is looking for an opportunity to own their roles, build strong relationships with stakeholders, becoming a trusted advisor to the business.  Stakeholder management is a key requirement in this role, the ability to advise hiring managers and P&C on all recruitment-focused initiatives, strategies, and market conditions, as well as advising and shaping the process of recruitment projects to ensure an exceptional candidate experience. You'll be supported by a great TA tech stack, and access to all relevant job boards, a LinkedIn recruiter license, a supportive, flexible environment, and a team that succeeds together.
 
Key responsibilities
  • Responsible for delivery on a broad array of roles within Southeast Asia (Vietnam, Philippines, Malaysia, Thailand, Singapore) with a focus on delivering incredible candidate experience.
  • Undertake the full recruitment process in accordance with policy
  • Assist hiring managers & HR create compelling and accurate job descriptions that reflect the roles they are trying to hire
  • Write and publish captivating job advertisements that represent the employer brand
  • Creative sourcing of candidates to fill positions
  • Support HR & Marketing with awesome social content reflecting the Employer Value Proposition
  • Ensure all data relating to candidate interaction with the business is recorded accurately
  • First round interviewing of candidates (and joining managers on later rounds where required)
  • Writing, producing and submitting honest & clear candidate briefs to hiring managers
  • Responsible for creating a happy and engaged group of hiring managers
  • Establish and build strong relationships throughout the business
  • Coordinating with other colleges/universities and local government for employment partnerships, and career fairs
Job Qualifications:
  • Candidates must be a college graduate of Bachelor of Science in Psychology, Human resource management and other related courses.
  • At least 4+ years recruiting in house with agency background
  • Ability to recruit across a broad array of positions
  • Experience working in a nimble fast paced business
  • Experience in data led environments
  • Good knowledge of recruitment processes and talent attraction strategies
  • Demonstrated ability to build a local and regional contact network (candidate)
  • Strong HR / Recruitment technology skills – ATS / CRM / Social search tools
  • Coachability and the desire for continuous improvement
  • Proficient in verbal and written communication in Vietnamese language.
  • Can start as soon as possible.
  • Temporary work from home setup.
 At Isentia we value the safety and well-being of our team members, suppliers, and clients and have adopted a ‘no jab, no office’ policy regarding the ongoing management of Covid-19 in the workplace. It is a condition of employment to be fully vaccinated at all times in order to work for Isentia, regardless of the role or whether to work flexibly/remotely during employment. Isentia may require you to provide vaccination evidence at the commencement of employment, and at any time throughout employment to confirm your compliance with this requirement.

job_title: Facilities Senior Manager, Technology and Innovation
job_ad_details:
JOB SCOPE

Summary of Role 

  • The Senior Manager Technology and Innovation works collaboratively to identify, develop, and deploy innovative technologies to enhance the effectiveness of the facilities department’s activities
  • The Senior Manager Technology and Innovation will work with internal team, vendors, and partners in the adoption and implementation of system innovations and implement appropriate strategies, practices, and protocols to successfully deploy such technology.
  • This position is expected to monitor best practices and trends in emerging technologies and to proactively research, recommend and develop/adapt/implement innovative and appropriate solutions to enhance the management of the property.

 

JOB RESPONSIBILITIES 

  • Collaborate and drive the successful implementation of Maximo mobile. Identify and evaluate appropriate field technology for use across the platform.
  • Contribute to the rollout of RCM – Reliability Centered Maintenance and the Health and Predict modules for Maximo.
  • Adapt and integrate sensor technology throughout the rollout of Maximo Health and Predict
  • Drive analysis based on available information and make recommendations
  • Identify and implement opportunities for the application of Robotic Process Automation (RPA) in existing processes.
  • Develop strong relationships with Corporate Engineering and Corporate Innovation on emerging design changes and innovations to meet the goals of future and current developments.
  • Identify and select innovative products and technology that enhances efficiency, accuracy, and guest experience based on rigorous market analysis and research – best fit perspective
  • Identify key trends and emerging technologies to further enhance MBS’s SMART Building status
  • Review current manual processes and identify opportunities to deploy technology to streamline existing processes, move towards digitization and enable more granular life-cycle analysis
  • Collaborate with the quality management team in the implementation of quality management system and relevant technologies to support
  • Review future development projects to ensure alignment with the departments move toward digitization, and to confirm design parameters are aligned with future systems and technology.
  • Identify skill competencies arising from the rollout of new technology and collaborate with the Senior Manager Training to develop training programs raising the competency of our technicians
  • Manage the planning, design, development, piloting, and quality assurance phases of projects as identified through research.
  • Manage timelines, monitor budgets, manage contract negotiations with vendors, and obtain/monitor requests for internal resources for identified projects.
  • Prepares business presentations and proposals for internal consideration

 

JOB REQUIREMENTS

  • Bachelor's degree in (Science, Engineering) required. 
  • 5-10+ years of related industry experience to include product management/development, R&D, operations management and/or technically relevant roles within building services field.
  • Demonstrated experience within the Facilities Management industry, with understanding of building services and operations including BMS, CMMS systems
  • Must clearly demonstrate superior communication, interpersonal, influencing and presentation skills, with the ability to interact with key decision makers at all levels at both customers and internal management including executive levels.
  • High level understanding of emerging technologies in building services
  • Strong problem-solving skills, ability to design and implement effective and appropriate solutions.
  • Ability to think critically, with strong interest in innovation, user experience and customer service.
  • Strong verbal/written communication and data presentation skills, including an ability to effectively communicate with both business and technical teams 
  • An ability and interest in working in a fast-paced and rapidly changing environment

 

You agree that it is a condition of employment that you adhere to and abide by all rules, regulations, policies and procedures including without limitation the rules of conduct of the Company.

Confident. Energetic. Love working nights? If you are ready for the next step in your hospitality career, this could be your moment. 

Welcome to Copthorne Hotel & Apartments Queenstown Lakeview, together with Millennium and Kingsgate Hotels we are one of New Zealand's largest hotel operators and part of an expanding international network of hotels. We are known for creating memorable guest experiences that start from the moment our guests walk through the door and continue 24/7 during their stay with us.

We need a confident Night Manager to ensure everything front office is perfect for our guests. That's where you come in.

Here's what you can expect when you join our team in one of our three Queenstown Hotels:

  • Career development and nationally accredited training opportunities
  • Discounted hotel rates nationwide and internationally
  • Staff meal on duty
  • Discounted health insurance with Southern Cross

In this key role, you will assist the day staff in ensuring the smooth and efficient operations of the Front Desk and assist guests with any late night enquiries, reservations, housekeeping requests. 

You have at least 6-12 months of hotel front office experience. Experience completing the Night Audit process will be an advantage, as will knowledge of Opera. You pride yourself on your ability to communicate at all levels and maintain your cool head whilst solving problems under pressure. You are looking for a role where guest comfort, safety and security is paramount and you are respected for your high standards. You will need your LCQ, GM and First Aid Certificates or the ability to attain.

We will look after you with regular night shifts 30+ hours per week, a friendly team and the prestige of being part of one of NZ's leading hotel brands. $27-$31ph.

If you're ready for the next step in your career in a relaxed and sophisticated environment, apply now.

Working for Ballantynes

At Ballantynes we are all about delivering exceptional customer service. Our people are essential to our goal of providing a warm and welcoming environment for customers and staff.

 

About the role

We have a fantastic opportunity for a passionate fashion lover working mainly in our Contemporary Lounge and Atrium area.

This area of the store has a focus on high fashion for those among us who demand the latest looks. We have concept stores from top New Zealand designers including Karen Walker, Twenty Seven Names, Huffer, as well as international brands such as Ted Baker and C+M. If you shop this area of the store and know its reputation for offering covetable brands that appeal to a broad range of customers, maybe you’ve had thoughts of becoming one of our brand experts. 

The permanent part time role is 28 hours per week, working Monday 11-5.30, Thursday 11-5.30pm, Friday 8.30 -5.30 and Saturday 9-5.

 

Successful Candidate

To be successful in your application, fashion retail experience is essential. If you have a track record of delighting customers through your genuinely kind advice, bubbly personality and exceptional fashion knowledge to achieve retail sales targets we want to hear from you.

You will enjoy interacting with our customers, having the confidence to provide that one on one Styling service to advise on the latest trends and create outfits for any occasion.  You will be brand savvy, able to show off your product knowledge and provide sound advice. 

You will use your initiative to keep on top of tasks, ensuring the area is kept well-presented and stocked.  You will be adaptable and have great teamwork ethic. Whilst your focus will be the Contemporary Lounge and Atrium you will be required to work across the whole Womens Apparel range and happy to help other departments when required. 

The ideal applicant will have the following attributes:

  • Previous retail experience
  • A genuine love for fashion 
  • Outstanding customer service skills
  • An enthusiastic, engaging and warm nature 
  • Great teamwork skills 

Apply now,  applications close on the 26 May 2022.

Job Description

You will lead a team at NUS College working closely with the Vice Dean (Outreach) to plan, manage, and execute the communications strategy for NUS College. The job involves brand, web, and media management.

Duties and Responsibilities:

  • Develop and implement strategies to publicise NUS College.

  • Develop and implement a brand strategy for NUS College, as well as manage a range of brand assets. This involves working with external agencies on specific brand/marketing projects and producing collaterals, etc.

  • Develop and manage content for NUS College website, news portal, and social media. This involves the creative use of text, videography, photography, graphics, and infographics.

  • Develop and pitch stories to local and international media, sometimes in joint projects with communications colleagues across the larger NUS.

  • Lead and mentor a team to execute the communication strategy developed for the college

  • Liaise and support the communications and outreach need of the other units within the college (eg admissions, development)

  • Manage queries from local and international media.

  • Work with other administrative teams in NUS College and NUS on cross-functional and shared duties.

Qualifications

  • A good university degree

  • At least 10 years of experience working in public relations, corporate communications, or related areas

  • Possess an excellent command of English, with strong writing and editing skills

  • Savvy in the use of digital communications and social media

  • Strong attention to detail, and a good eye for design and creatives

  • Able to work independently while being a good team leader and player

  • Able to multi-task as well as work within tight deadlines

  • Enjoy working and collaborating with people at all levels and of different backgrounds

Covid-19 Message

At NUS, the health and safety of our staff and students are one of our utmost priorities, and COVID-vaccination supports our commitment to ensure the safety of our community and to make NUS as safe and welcoming as possible. Many of our roles require a significant amount of physical interactions with students/staff/public members. Even for job roles that may be performed remotely, there will be instances where on-campus presences are required.

In accordance with Singapore's legal requirements, unvaccinated workers will not be able to work on the NUS premises with effect from 15 January 2022. As such, job applicants will need to be fully COVID-19 vaccinated to secure successful employment with NUS.

  • 空缺咭展示的職位空缺資料，包括職位名稱、職責內容、工作時間、薪金等，均是由僱主提供。如果求職人士在面試時，僱主提出不合理的要求，或所提供的僱傭條件與本處登記的資料不符，請盡快通知本處。為免墮入求職陷阱，在面試時應注意聘用條件（包括計薪方法、工資期、休息日安排等），了解職位的工作範圍及入職要求，並留意工作環境。此外，請特別留意工作性質及內容會否抵觸現行法例，切勿因急於求職而接受聘用從事非法工作。
  • 僱主及職業介紹所向本處遞交職位招聘表時，已承諾會按照《最低工資條例》的規定，就任何工資期，支付不少於法定最低工資水平的工資予受聘有關職位並受《最低工資條例》涵蓋的人士 。
  • 如你有合理懷疑僱主未有遵守《僱傭條例》、《僱員補償條例》、《最低工資條例》，可致電熱線2717 1771（由1823接聽）或電郵至enquiry@labour.gov.hk 查詢。至於涉及《性別歧視條例》、《殘疾歧視條例》、《家庭崗位歧視條例》或《種族歧視條例》的查詢，請聯絡平等機會委員會。
  • 根據《最低工資條例》的規定，僱主須就任何工資期，確保支付僱員不少於按下列方法計算的最低工資：

    最低工資=僱員於工資期的總工作時數 x 法定最低工資水平（即每小時40元1）
    1由2023年5月1日起，法定最低工資水平已調升至每小時40元。

    • 如就工資期須支付予僱員的工資少於最低工資，僱員有權就該工資期獲付這差額（即「額外報酬」）。該僱員的僱傭合約須視為他有權就該工資期獲得額外報酬，而該額外報酬亦適用於計算根據其他相關法例所應獲得的款項。
    • 有關法定最低工資的定義及計算詳情，請瀏覽 《法定最低工資：僱主及僱員參考指引》或致電 24 小時查詢熱線 2717 1771（由「1823」接聽）。

Mandai Wildlife Group is dedicated to caring for the planet and protecting animals and nature. Conservation education is intrinsic in all interactions with the Group, to inspire action for a healthier world.

 

Mandai Wildlife Group is the steward of Mandai Wildlife Reserve, a unique wildlife and nature destination in Singapore that is home to world-renown wildlife parks which connect visitors to the fascinating world of wildlife.

 

The Group is driving an exciting rejuvenation plan at Mandai Wildlife Reserve, adjacent to Singapore's Central Catchment Nature Reserve, that will integrate five wildlife parks with distinctive nature-based experiences, green public spaces and an eco-friendly resort.

 

Mandai Wildlife Group advocates for biodiversity, contributes leading wildlife research, develops innovative solutions to promote living sustainably, and collaborates with conservation partners in Singapore and Southeast Asia.

 

The Group provides funding and in-kind support to Mandai Nature for conservation work across Southeast Asia.

 

Mandai Global, an entity that is part of the Group, will establish and operate new lines of business anchored in creating positive outcomes for nature and wildlife.

 

In our efforts to ensure a safe workplace, Mandai Wildlife Group implements the Vaccinate or Regular Test (VoRT) regime for team members who are not yet fully vaccinated. This is aligned to guidelines from the Ministry of Manpower and more information can be found here: https://www.mom.gov.sg/covid-19/advisory-on-covid-19-vaccination-in-employment-settings [link removed]

 

The Emerging Products team is looking for a product growth manager to drive awareness, and acquisition of new and emerging products targeting the families with kids segment, via mainly social and digital channels .  You will be part of the Group Insights & Product Growth team and help in shaping and launching new products and features.  You will learn who are customers are, what they care about, what motivates them, and how we can best communicate with them to drive new product funnel growth and performance.  You will be responsible for taking new products to market, ensuring they reach the right audience with the right message at the right time.

 

Job Duties & Responsibilities

  • Drive awareness, consideration, and adoption for new and emerging products targeting the families with kids segment, through developing a strategy and executing it
  • Work with Product, Content, Creative, Experience Design, Commercial stakeholders as well as other cross-functional teams to develop and execute campaigns that drive product adoption
  • Set up social and digital campaign strategies to ensure engagement and conversions
  • Develop campaign strategies for product and new features
  • Engage with agencies and other external vendors to generate innovative ideas, narratives, collateral and execute campaigns.
  • Develop, track and measure the impact of our campaigns through detailed analytics and use insights/learnings to optimize initiatives for better impact

 

Minimum Qualifications:

  • Diploma or Bachelor's degree in Business, Communications or related fields
  • At least 3 years of relevant experience in driving new product funnel growth with tangible achievements
  • Experience running campaigns and projects with creative, digital and/or media agencies with a focus on social including driving earned and paid conversion on social media
  • Experience influencing and collaborating effectively with internal teams and external agencies

Preferred qualifications:

  • Experience with digital and traditional media analytics and paid social measurement
  • Experience with social listening tools and digital analytics tools (e.g. Sprinklr, Adobe Analytics, etc.)
  • Experience working in social and digital campaigns with global consumer brands
  • Experience with product marketing, product strategy or product management a strong plus

Attributes

  • Tolerance for ambiguity and ability to work in a fast-changing environment with an entrepreneurial approach
  • Strategic thinker with strong executional ability
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills
  • Creative problem solver who can amplify the impact of lean resources.
  • Strong interpersonal and project management skills with the ability to collaborate and influence in a cross-functional environment.
  • Self-starter with tenacity and drive to lead and execute upon multi-year projects.

Baker Wanted - Join Our Team and Make Delicious Treats

Do you have a passion for baking and creating mouth-watering goodies? Do you have experience in dough, pastry, slices, pies,? If yes, then you might be the perfect fit for our team!

We are a bakery looking for three bakers to help us prepare different kinds of bread, pastries, cakes, and pies for our customers. You will:

  • Follow recipes, measure and mix ingredients, bake items in an oven, and decorate cakes with various toppings
  • Maintain inventory levels of baking supplies and ensure that all equipment is clean and in good working order
  • Serve customers with a smile and a friendly attitude
  • Work on shifts from Monday to Friday, 4am to 4pm, with at least 30 hours per week
  • Earn $24 to $30 per hour, depending on your experience and skills

To succeed in this role, you must have:

  • Experience as a baker, pastry chef, or worked in a similar commercial position.
  • Knowledge of baking techniques and methods
  • Ability to follow recipes and instructions accurately
  • Attention to detail and time management skills
  • Team spirit, reliability, and willingness to learn and help out your team members
  • Flexibility to work in early morning shifts
  • Certification from a culinary school is a plus

If you are interested in this position, send your cover letter and CV to us. Good Luck!
