Registration Number: R23113873

EA License No : 06C2859 (MCI Career Service Pte Ltd)

• PERM ROLE (8:00AM - 4:00PM) SOME OVERTIME MAY BE REQUIRED | TUE-SAT ROSTER
  • MUST BE ABLE TO DRIVE AUTOMATIC AND MANUAL VEHICLES
  • LEVEL 1 STARTS FROM $24.69 PER HOUR + SUPER

THE COMPANY

Our client is offering an Auto Glazing Apprenticeship in their Brooklyn branch. In the end you will become a fully qualified Automotive Technician - Certificate 3. Through our client, this can take up to 2 years, moving up from a Level 1 to a Level 5. Levels of pay will go up as they are signed off by the Technical Trainers ideally every 3-4 months. Technical Trainers work collaboratively with the Branch Managers and team, so you have their full support. Uniforms will be provided; you will just need to supply safety boots.

THE ROLE

Reporting directly to the Branch Manager, with a dotted line reporting into the Auto Technician (Leading Hand), the purpose of this role is to apply technical knowledge and practical skills in the repair and replacement of Automotive Glass vehicles of all types. Automotive Glaziers/ Technicians deliver this service in a professional, timely and safe manner, observing the principles of customer focus and operational excellence in all tasks undertaken.

DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILTIES

  • You will start off learning chip repairs, then learn the replacement of windscreens and sunroofs. Moving on to recalibration on the windscreens (new vehicles have auto stop, rain sensors).
  • Communicate clearly and confidently when speaking with customers and maintain a high level of personal presentation.
  • Ensure all documentation of customer details/transactions are entered correctly.
  • Assist the Branch Manager to comply with requirements of the health, safety, and wellbeing legislation for their region.
  • Ability to put the customer first and ensure quality standards are met and exceed customers' expectations.
  • You must be able to drive Manual and Automatic vehicles. Most of the work will be 52% in branch and 48% on the road, depending on the branch.
  • You must be able to work every Saturday, if not at least every second Saturday.

JOB REQUIREMENTS

  • School Certificate.
  • Driving License and be able to drive Manual and Automatic vehicles.
  • Exceptional interpersonal skills with a reputation for positively engaging and influencing others.
  • Strong attention to detail and accuracy.
  • A high level of self-awareness and desire for ongoing personal development.
  • Desire to succeed, with an energetic and enthusiastic approach.
  • A high degree of flexibility with the ability to operate in a dynamic/changing environment.
  • Good organisational & time management skills with the ability to prioritise conflicting tasks.
  • All successful candidates will need to pass a full medical plus a urine drug and alcohol test.
  • Due to the physical nature of the role, you will be required to bend, lift, squat with up to 22kg (this will be part of the medical).
  • Our client will cover the medicals and apprenticeship.

Job Duties and Responsibilities:

  • Monitor Identify cybersecurity risk to systems, assets, data, and capabilities and be prepared to respond immediately to any of such incidents.
  • Perform cybersecurity assessments (Vulnerability Scans) and work with relevant teams to ensure patching and updating is done.
  • Conduct phishing and cybersecurity awareness training and education. Produce newsletters and advisories.
  • Track and update reports of weekly trends, incidents, security events and analysis of security logs.
  • Assist to implement the appropriate detection measures and tools to identify cybersecurity threats and perform continuous monitoring of network and systems to detect security anomalous activities and other threats
  • Ensure compliance to IT Standards and Policies.

 

Job Requirements:

·       Diploma/ Degree in Computer Science, IT/Engineering or equivalent 

·       Strong knowledge and experience in Information and Cybersecurity risks, controls, vulnerability assessment, compliance and Cybersecurity best practices preferred 

·       Good analytical, problem solving and critical thinking skills  

·       Strong communication and written skills  

·       Comfortable in interacting with various stakeholders to achieve business goals 

·       Professional accreditation such as CISSP would be an added advantage

Job Summary:


As a Mechanical Engineer, you will play a vital role in the design, development, and implementation of mechanical systems and components. Collaborating closely with multidisciplinary teams, you will be responsible for delivering high-quality solutions that meet project requirements and industry standards.

  • Designing and analyzing mechanical systems and components using CAD software and simulation tools.
  • Conducting feasibility studies and technical evaluations to support project planning and decision-making.
  • Developing detailed engineering drawings, specifications, and documentation for manufacturing and assembly.
  • Providing technical expertise and support to project teams throughout the product lifecycle, from concept to production.
  • Collaborating with suppliers and manufacturers to source components and materials and ensure compliance with specifications and quality standards.
  • Participating in design reviews, risk assessments, and continuous improvement initiatives to enhance product quality and efficiency.

Requirements/Skills Needed:

  • Bachelor's degree in Mechanical Engineering or a related field.
  • Proven experience in mechanical design and analysis, preferably in water treatment, wastewater treatment, food and beverage or process industries.
  • Proficiency in Autodesk Inventor software and finite element analysis (FEA) tools.
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to translate complete requirements into practical engineering solutions.
  • Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams.
  • A proactive mindset, with a passion for innovation and continuous learning.

Additional Job Details:

Set-up and Location: Office-based (Ortigas, Alabang, Pampanga, or Cebu)
Work Schedule: 9:00 AM to 6:00 PM (AEDT) | 7:00 AM to 4:00 PM (PH Time)
Employment Type: Full-time


All interviews and other hiring requirements are done virtually or through video calls or emails.

ACRWORLD are working with a fire contractor who are looking for a Dry Fire Installer, they are an established company who have a fantastic reputation in the industry and very low staff turnover!

Looking to grow by an additional 15/20 staff by the end of 2024!

Company:

Established in 2003 after its founders recognised a need for more qualified, experienced and customer focused people in the Essential Service / Fire Protection industry. Ensuring properties are thoroughly protected by the best technologies and skill-sets in the industry became their mission!

Role:

The ideal candidate with have 2 years experience within the fire trade and have the following experience:
  • ACA cabling licence or Electrical Trades licence.
  • Experience with installing fire alarm systems.
  • Experience with EWIS systems.
  • Good knowledge of AS1670.
Duties:
  • Installation of EWIS, OWS and FIP’s
  • Programming of Fire Panels is advantageous however the client will ensure relevant programming courses are booked in for suitable candidates.
Location: Sydney
Hours: Monday - Friday 40 hours per week + RDO's
Salary: $50/h - $55/h EBA rates + allowances

About Us

Founded in 1999 and listed on NASDAQ in 2003 and HKEX in 2021, Trip.com Group is a leading global travel service provider comprising of Trip.com, Ctrip, Skyscanner, and Qunar.

Across its platforms, Trip.com Group integrates travel resources from industry partners and helps travellers worldwide pursue the perfect trip with exceptional travel products and services.

We have four Customer Service Centres for Trip.com established in Japan, Korea, the UK, and the Philippines, providing 24/7 customer service in 19 different languages.

We have more than 30,000 employees scattered across 30 countries in Asia, Europe, the Americas, and Oceania, striving to expand our global markets and aiming to be the world's leading and most trusted family of online travel brands that aspire to deliver the perfect trip at the best price for every traveller.

In this Role, you'll get to

  • Compete the tasks assigned by Operation Manager/Group Leader in time.
  • Cooperate closely with other team leaders.
  • Deal with emergencies.
  • Propose projects that optimize the working procedures and complete them.
  • Arrange rational shift by estimating the volume of business.
  • Conduct communication concerning the monthly performance appraisal with staff.
  • Communicate with staff regularly.
  • Deal with the complaints.
  • Train and convey new procedures and monitor the implementation and performance.
  • Host daily meetings
  • Supervise the staff KPI and take precautions to enhance the ability of the staff.
  • Properly distribute the daily for staff within the team.
  • Supervise the operational data of the call center and conduct proper onsite management.
  • Responsible for daily work of the team and ensure the normal operation.


What you'll Need to Succeed

  • Ability to create an atmosphere of effectiveness, unity and activeness.
  • Ability to lead and motivate teams.
  • Excellent experience in project management.
  • Good ability in data analysis.
  • Good self-management skills.
  • Good sense of responsibility
  • Good team work spirit.
  • Good communication skills.
  • Good English and Malay skills in listening, speaking, reading and writing. Good strain capacity.
  • Good ability in minority language (according to the language mastered).
  • Experience in internet companies, call centers, or tourism industry preferred.
  • Two years managerial experience in customer service team preferred.
  • Bachelor's degree or above.


Why Trip.com Group

We offer a stage to unleash your full potential and drive global impact. As an international team, we embrace an open and inclusive culture that supports and respect team members in and out of the workplace. Everyone is on a trip, whether it's a career trip or a life trip. At Trip.com Group, you can define your own trip by setting a goal and celebrate your success by recognizing the progress you have made.

What's more?

  • Our rapid business growth in global offers abundant career opportunities at various levels and in multiple functions
  • Internal transfer is encouraged, and global job rotation program enable you to pursue a global career path and make global impact
  • We provide learning opportunities to further your career in areas of leadership capability, soft skill and professional expertise.
  • We encourage flexible work arrangement
  • Have fun with company-sponsored greetings and activities at holidays, birthdays, and colorful team events.

Have a good trip, and see you soon!

About Grampians Health

Grampians Health was established 1 November 2021, bringing together Edenhope and District Memorial Hospital, Stawell Regional Health, Wimmera Health Care Group and Ballarat Health Services to deliver safe, sustainable, healthcare tailored to changing workforce and community needs, for the long term.

This partnership follows years of strong collaboration and close partnerships between the four health services. Together, we will deliver better healthcare, enhance services and advance careers, closer to home, now and into the future.

A career with Grampians Health means you are connected and are part of a team providing quality healthcare to rural and regional communities. Our communities are diverse, as is our workforce, with expert clinical staff from across the world choosing to live and work in our beautiful region.

Grampians Health provides acute, maternity, mental health, allied health, aged care, administration and support services.  This means your career will be as diverse and rewarding as you strive to be.

 

About the role

We are seeking a motivated Podiatrist to join our Podiatry team. Our Podiatry department places a strong emphasis on quality improvement and professional development and offers a supportive team environment.  This fixed term full time position is available for start in January 2024 until January 2025, and includes working Monday to Friday. 

Key Responsibilities:

  • Provision of high quality, evidence based clinical Podiatry services across a diverse caseload including high risk foot, wound care, pressure injury prevention, falls prevention, paediatrics & biomechanics, within a range of settings, including community outpatients, acute and sub-acute.
  • Supervision and mentoring of Grade 1 Podiatrists / undergraduate Podiatry students.
  • Actively contribute to Podiatry quality improvement. 

Skills and experience

 Essential:

  • Bachelor of Podiatry or equivalent
  • Current Registration: Australian Health Practitioner Regulation Agency
  • Current Victorian Driver’s Licence
  • Excellent skills in oral and written communication
  • Well-developed interpersonal skills
  • Effective time management

 

 Desirable:

  • Commitment to quality and evidence-based practice
  • Demonstrated ability to work effectively as part of a multidisciplinary team
  • Membership with the Australian Podiatry Association
  • Experience in student supervision
  • Experience working in a Public Health setting
  • FIM Credentialing

Grampians Health Culture & Benefits

At Grampians Health, we recognise our staff are our greatest asset.  We are committed to providing a safe and healthy environment for our staff, patients, residents, visitors, volunteers and contractors at all sites.

  • Flexible work arrangements and purchase leave opportunities
  • Salary packaging for living expenses such as rent/mortgage plus meals, entertainment & holidays
  • Staff rewards and recognition programs
  • Professional development and education programs
  • Employee Assistance Program
  • Comprehensive orientation program
  • Flexible rostering
  • Opportunities for career progression
  • Free parking

Horsham Region

Located on the banks of the Wimmera River, Horsham is the retail, business & service centre of the Wimmera region.  With a growing population of approximately 20,000, Horsham is a vibrant city in which to live, work and play.  With all the facilities that you would expect from a regional city, Horsham offers affordable housing, education and accessible community services alongside a vibrant combination of food, art, shopping, culture and nature. 

With legendary natural attractions such as the Grampians National Park, world renowned Mount Arapiles and the Little Desert National Park nearby, there are many amazing natural features to see and explore.  Food lovers will delight in the opportunity to sample from the restaurants, farm gates and cellar doors of some of Australia’s best and most awarded venues.

If you are dreaming of a career change with country lifestyle, and want to swap expensive urban dwelling for stunning natural landscapes, Horsham is the place for you.

How to apply

Click APPLY or contact Sara Coats, Deputy Manager Podiatry (West), on 03 5381 9020 for a confidential discussion.

All appointments are subject to a satisfactory police records check, immunisation clearance and Working with Children check and/or NDIS Worker Screening Check.

All employees must be willing and able to wear Personal Protective Equipment (PPE) when required, which at a minimum is a surgical mask.  Additional PPE requirements are role-dependent.

Grampians Health is a child safe organisation, committed to the safety and wellbeing of all children and young people.

Grampians Health is committed to providing a diverse and inclusive workforce. We encourage applications from Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people, people with disability, people from culturally and linguistically diverse backgrounds, mature age workers and lesbian, gay, bisexual, transgender, queer (or questioning), intersex and asexual LGBTQIA+.

Job description:

A Day in the Life

Senior Trainer/ Education Specialist
Reporting to the EM Training and Education Therapy Leader. The position requires close collaboration and working alignment with the local commercial and marketing teams for program prioritization and implementation.The position focuses on creating and implementing programs that support Sales Force Training and Medical Education Pathways. The aim is to develop therapy knowledge and application skills of sales and health care professionals involved in the management of focus therapy in Neuroscience assigned portfolios. The role will require also execution of procedural and clinical education programs for targeted group of HCPs in alignment to OUs strategic objectives.Strong engagement with key local key opinion leaders is also a foundational pillar to this role.Serves as an expert in designing local context educational programs and raises the bar by creating and implementing new strategies and educational programs to help drive procedural adoption through safe & effective use training.

Responsibilities

  • Create and implement Medical Education strategies that are aligned with business requirements. Participation in OUs monthly/Quarterly/ Yearly business review to ensure alignments and representation of T&E plans and outcomes.
  • Develop and manage Local and regional and KOL relationships that create and conduct education programs (both live and online).
  • Recruit, contract and partner with faculty in each target specialty to develop procedural content and assets
  • Develop and implement advanced training curriculum for Neuroscience's portfolio education strategy
  • Review current Medical Education offering and gaps and to design events that support learning pathways from awareness to advocacy. Analyze program feedback for continuous medical education opportunities; work with Commercial Teams for appropriate follow-up
  • Implement and maintain T&E data base together with the T&E Operations Team
  • Identify and pilot innovative education tools for realistic training scenarios, that can lead to enhancing learner engagement and allow assessment of program effectiveness for both internal MDTs stakeholders and external HCP

Together, we can change healthcare worldwide. At Medtronic, we push the limits of what technology, therapies and services can do to help alleviate pain, restore health and extend life. We want to accelerate and advance our ability to create meaningful innovations - but we will only succeed with the right people on our team. Let's work together to address universal healthcare needs and improve patients' lives. Help us shape the future.

About us:

LifeLinks facilitates Disability Support Services for people aged between 0-65 years who have an intellectual, physical, sensory or neurological disability (or a combination of these) and their families/ whānau/aiga/care givers who reside in Canterbury, South Canterbury and the West Coast. Each year LifeLinks partners with over 8,500 disabled people and their whānau to develop outcomes-focused personalised plans and facilitate their access to a tailored range of supports that contribute to their achievement of the outcomes they seek for their lives.

What you will do:

Working across the organisation, the Training Manager role will identify and respond to training and development needs and develop and administer tailored role-based employee and team training plans, programmes and modules that enhance employees’ skills and performance. 

What we need from you:

  • Proven work experience as a Trainer and at least two years’ experience in training roles.
  • Confidence in presenting and facilitation.
  • Strong knowledge and application of a wide range of teaching techniques and methods. 
  • Experience designing and delivering training based on individual, team or company needs relevant to roles.
  • Demonstrated ability to interact with and respond to a variety of stakeholders productively and positively. 
  • Ability to recognise and understand the principles and practice of the Treaty of Waitangi and the implications for LifeLinks services
  • Current NZ Driver’s Licence.

You’ll need to be able to:

  • Develop appropriate training programmes and lead and implement new and existing programmes.
  • Identify trends from evaluations and actively contribute this feedback to the improvement of training programmes and delivery.
  • Use your specialist knowledge and experience to innovate/significantly improve the organisation’s ability to achieve its goals.
  • Keeps technical knowledge up-to-date and is able to learn new information and skills quickly. 

It would be helpful if you have:

  • An awareness of health and disability community agencies and organisations.

Who you are:

The way we work at Lifelinks is as important as what we do.  We want to ensure our team model our values and demonstrate personal behaviours and qualities that allow them, and their colleagues, to do their best work.

We want you to:

  • Have an open, respectful, approachable manner that helps put people at ease, and the ability to establish and maintain rapport and trust with colleagues and stakeholders.
  • Work cooperatively with others across the organisation to achieve shared objectives.
  • Display highly developed communication and influencing skills, with the ability to communicate possibilities to people in a way that promotes enthusiasm and commitment for taking up opportunities.
  • Assist people to determine and achieve their goals.
  • Be able to understand the need along with any possible barriers and challenges related to addressing the need when determining what learning and development programmes are required.
  • Value and celebrate diversity.

This is a 40 hour a week role, Monday to Friday, 8:30 to 5pm. It is office based - we have a lovely office, with car parking, and sometimes you might find your colleague for the day is a friendly dog (or two).  For your 40 hours a week, the salary will be $85000 a year.

If this sounds like a bit of you, and you want to know more, you can find the job description on our website, or email hr@lifelinks.co.nz

Ready to apply? Click apply now and send us a cover letter and your CV – we can’t wait to hear from you! The closing date is 21 February 2024 at 5pm but we may interview suitable applicants sooner, so don't hesitate to apply.

Drummond & Etheridge is a leading supplier of John Deere equipment throughout the South Island. Through our extensive network of 11 branches, we supply a range of quality brands to the agricultural, construction, and forestry industries. We are a company that is passionate about our people, our customers, and our industry.

Our Ashburton dealership is seeking an experienced Service Technician to join their team. The successful candidate will be involved in servicing a range of agricultural machinery whilst providing exceptional customer service.

Apart from your technical know-how and nous, we are looking for an exceptional individual who is a strong team player that can adapt to any situation. You must also fit well into the wider business and not be averse to learning more about our full line-up of Ag, Construction & Forestry products.

We provide a supportive environment that promotes personal and professional development to ensure you have the skills and knowledge to succeed in your career.

 

In this role you will:

  • Complete servicing on all machinery efficiently and effectively, exceeding the expectations of the customer;

  • Complete all paperwork associated with the servicing of machinery;

About the position

The Customer Experience Officer provide the highest level of frontline customer service to the community, and perform administrative tasks to ensure effective business processes. The Customer Experience Officer position is responsible for positively representing Council’s brand and improving relationships with the community via a range of face to face and online channels.

About Muswellbrook

Muswellbrook Shire is one of NSW's most dynamic local government areas. For over four decades it has been at the heart of the State's energy industry, and we are now on the transition to being a renewable energy hub. We have the two largest thoroughbred horse studs in the southern hemisphere, a healthy viticulture industry, and a large part of the world heritage listed Blue Mountains National Park within the Shire. We are also central to Newcastle, Tamworth and Dubbo.

Muswellbrook Shire Council is a vibrant workplace with a commitment to excellence in all facets of its operations, and we are committed to employee welfare and development.

求職人士請注意：
  • 空缺咭展示的職位空缺資料，包括職位名稱、職責內容、工作時間、薪金等，均是由僱主提供。如果求職人士在面試時，僱主提出不合理的要求，或所提供的僱傭條件與本處登記的資料不符，請盡快通知本處。為免墮入求職陷阱，在面試時應注意聘用條件（包括計薪方法、工資期、休息日安排等），了解職位的工作範圍及入職要求，並留意工作環境。此外，請特別留意工作性質及內容會否抵觸現行法例，切勿因急於求職而接受聘用從事非法工作。
  • 僱主及職業介紹所向本處遞交職位招聘表時，已承諾會按照《最低工資條例》的規定，就任何工資期，支付不少於法定最低工資水平的工資予受聘有關職位並受《最低工資條例》涵蓋的人士 。
  • 如你有合理懷疑僱主未有遵守《僱傭條例》、《僱員補償條例》、《最低工資條例》，可致電熱線2717 1771（由1823接聽）或電郵至enquiry@labour.gov.hk 查詢。至於涉及《性別歧視條例》、《殘疾歧視條例》、《家庭崗位歧視條例》或《種族歧視條例》的查詢，請聯絡平等機會委員會。
  • 根據《最低工資條例》的規定，僱主須就任何工資期，確保支付僱員不少於按下列方法計算的最低工資：

    最低工資=僱員於工資期的總工作時數 x 法定最低工資水平（即每小時40元1）
    1由2023年5月1日起，法定最低工資水平已調升至每小時40元。

    • 如就工資期須支付予僱員的工資少於最低工資，僱員有權就該工資期獲付這差額（即「額外報酬」）。該僱員的僱傭合約須視為他有權就該工資期獲得額外報酬，而該額外報酬亦適用於計算根據其他相關法例所應獲得的款項。
    • 有關法定最低工資的定義及計算詳情，請瀏覽 《法定最低工資：僱主及僱員參考指引》或致電 24 小時查詢熱線 2717 1771（由「1823」接聽）。

H2O Engineering is a New Zealand company specialising in the Design and Construction of specialist industrial Chemical Handling systems, Water and Steam instrumentation systems as well as Industrial Water treatment systems.

H2O is an Auckland based business looking for an experienced installation specialist to join the team to deliver our project work. 

The role is best suited to proven self motivated candidates who enjoy building industrial Electrical and Mechanical systems from start to finish. The projects are never the same so there is always fresh challenges with our amazing clients, the role suits some with good problem solving and a positive approach to working with the existing team.

 

  • You have a Trade Qualification in a Mechanical or Electrical Trade.
  • You are legally entitled to work in New Zealand 
  • +5 years work experience in industrial project environments, preference with installation of Piping, Mechanical Equipment, Instrumentation or Electrical Systems.
  • Have proven experience working autonomously, directing subcontractors and co-ordinating with other contractors. 
  • Strong hand skills
  • Good computer literacy with a preference for Instrumentation and / or PLC programming.
  • Have a high level of attention to detail, accuracy, and good organizational skills.
  • Be a confident, effective communicator and a strong team player
  • Be passionate about your work and always strive for the best and take pride in your work.
  • Be able to comply with a strong safety and quality culture
  • Be flexible and adaptable
  • Have a Full NZ Drivers licence and be available to work around the Auckland region with occasional work around the Upper North Island.

 

This is a full time (+45 hours per week) position with a rate $37 to $42 /hr depending on experience. 

The role includes a Vehicle, phone and laptop computer. 

Medical insurance through Southern Cross is provided subject to approval.

Specialist training will be provided within the existing team along with training for Confined Space, EWP and Working at Heights. Additional training is encouraged and supported by the business.

Counter Sales – Palmerston North

What does the Counter Sales person do?

Our Counter Sales people are involved in everything from.

  • Serve customers on the counter, answer phones and email enquiries
  • Prepare accurate quotes for customers
  • Develop relationships with customers
  • Be a product knowledge expert to help customers find products they need
  • Actively work as a member of the team to ensure our branch is presented in the best way

How? By welcoming them to the branch, listening to their needs, and providing them with sound advice every time. Is that you?

What do you need to bring to Corys?

Your passion! We want you to bring passion and energy to your role every day. You will be excited by the opportunity to get to know customers and their needs and present them with solutions and products that showcase precisely why Corys are the leading Electrical Wholesaler!

How can I tell if this is for me?

  • Customer and sales focused with experience in a similar role
  • Excellent problem-solving skills - support our customers to find what they need
  • Proficient with computer technology and systems – we will train you
  • A positive and optimistic attitude
  • A high level of initiative to support your team members and customers – no job is too big or too small
  • A strong sense of urgency - the ability to multi-task in a fast-paced environment
  • Experience in a trades environment will get you off to a flying start, but it is not essential if you’re passionate about learning our industry and product range

What Corys can offer you?

  • Local meets global – we are part of Sonepar, global leaders in electrical wholesaling
  • A bright future – career path & development opportunities
  • A culture of achievement and fun – together we have fun and work hard as a high performing team
  • Financial incentives – we reward our people with an attractive salary package, employee benefits & incentive opportunities

Are you ready to make a difference?

How to Apply?

If your experience reflects the criteria outlined above, apply now, and tell us why you're interested in our Counter Sales role. Applications close 7 March 2023

 

Who are we?

We are a part of Sonepar, an independent family-owned company with global market leadership in B-to-B distribution of electrical products, solutions, and related services. We are an industry leader that employs exceptional people who share a passion to deliver the best products and services to our customers. Since 1920 we have been supplying electrical products to customers across multiple market sectors, including residential, commercial, and industrial. We have a national network of 47 branches providing quality products, backed by expert advice, technical and logistical support, and e-commerce solutions.

At Corys Electrical, our people are at the heart of all we do. We encourage applications from all backgrounds, ages, genders, and communities. We are committed to providing a diverse, equitable and inclusive workforce environment, celebrating differences, and supporting people to succeed.

Website - www.corys.co.nz [link removed]

Customer Experience Librarian: Saturday Services

About the role 

We are currently looking for a Customer Experience Librarian: Saturday Service to join our growing team and help shape the future of our region. You will be well supported by a team that prides ourselves on nurturing an inclusive workspace that embraces innovation and creativity, so bring your passion and leading-edge ideas to Gisborne District Council.

A bit about you: You will be a positive, customer focused ‘people person’.  The concept of change will not phase you and you will be technically adept.  In addition you will have a keen interest in literacy and the role public libraries play as community spaces.

Your day will look like: Fast paced and focused on providing, promoting, and delivering high quality front-line customer service and circulatory services to our community.

You’ll recognise the importance of the role as a Treaty partner and understand how that underpins Gisborne District Council’s work.  

What we offer:

  • A permanent role of 4 hours per fortnight
  • Career progression, training and development to continue your learning and inspire those that come after you.
  • A career path that can adapt as you grow new skills and discover fresh interests.

Skills & experience 

  • Exceptional customer service skills
  • The ability to work as part of a team

Anyone from a customer service background will suit this role.

Benefits

  • Allocated training budget for career development

About the company

Here at Gisborne District Council, we pull our values from the community we serve. It makes sense then that we are enthusiastic about culture in our workplace. Family and inclusivity are deep seated in our ethos.  With Treaty partnership front of mind, we’re serious about building a workforce that enhances our commitment to deliver.  We work hard together to make our people proud and our whanau are why we are so passionate about what we do for the community. 

How to apply 

We will start the process when suitable candidates apply, please submit a resume / cover letter.

Click APPLY or contact Lois Haddon (Lois.Haddon@gdc.govt.nz) – Library Services Leader for a confidential discussion.  

Applications Close 10am, Friday 26 May 2023.

As a Project Manager focusing on data center projects, you will play a pivotal role in overseeing the successful execution of these initiatives. Your primary responsibility will involve managing the life cycle of various data center projects, ensuring their timely delivery, adherence to quality standards, and compliance with project specifications.

Client Details

We are currently working with one of the leading technology company who is looking for a competent Data Cenetr Project Manager to help them in this time of growth.

Description

  • Lead and oversee the end-to-end management of data center projects from initiation to completion, ensuring strict adherence to timelines, budgets, and quality standards.
  • Collaborate closely with cross-functional teams, including engineering, construction, procurement, and other stakeholders, to ensure seamless project execution.
  • Develop and maintain project plans, schedules, and budgets, regularly monitoring and reporting on project progress to stakeholders.
  • Utilize your strong background in electrical engineering to provide technical expertise and guidance throughout the project lifecycle.
  • Manage project risks, issues, and change requests effectively, implementing mitigation strategies as necessary to ensure project success.
  • Serve as the main point of contact for project-related communications, fostering clear and effective communication channels among all stakeholders.
  • Work closely with the expat Project Director, providing regular updates and ensuring alignment with project objectives and strategies.

Profile

  • Bachelor's degree in Electrical/Mechanical Engineering or a related field.
  • Proven experience (8 years) as a Project Manager, specifically in data center projects.
  • Strong understanding of data center infrastructure, including power distribution, cooling systems, and networking.
  • Exceptional project management skills, including the ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously.
  • Proficiency in English (verbal and written) is essential, as this role involves reporting to an expat Project Director.
  • Excellent communication, leadership, and interpersonal skills to effectively collaborate with diverse teams and stakeholders.
  • Demonstrated ability to work in a fast-paced environment, delivering results within tight deadlines.
  • PMP, CDCP and other relevant certification is a plus.

Job Offer

  • Great career prospects as the growth opportunity in the company is tremendous.
  • The chance to really impact the decisions of a very successful business and input into process, procedures & systems

To apply online please click the 'Apply' button below.
For a confidential discussion about this role please contact Veny Adilia on +62 21 2958 8846.

job_title: First VP, Enterprise Architect (CRM), Group Technology
job_ad_details:
About UOB

United Overseas Bank Limited (UOB) is a leading bank in Asia with a global network of more than 500 branches and offices in 19 countries and territories in Asia Pacific, Europe and North America. In Asia, we operate through our head office in Singapore and banking subsidiaries in China, Indonesia, Malaysia and Thailand, as well as branches and offices.

Our history spans more than 80 years. Over this time, we have been guided by our values — Honorable, Enterprising, United and Committed. This means we always strive to do what is right, build for the future, work as one team and pursue long-term success. It is how we work, consistently, be it towards the company, our colleagues or our customers.

About the Department

The Technology and Operations function is comprised of five teams of specialists with distinct capabilities: business partnership, technology, operations, risk governance and planning support and services. We work closely together to harness the power of technology to support our physical and digital banking services and operations. This includes developing, centralising and standardising technology systems as well as banking operations in Singapore and overseas branches.

Job Responsibilities
  • Partnering with and acting as a trusted advisor to stakeholders in both business and IT to assist in defining and delivering high quality enterprise capable solutions
  • Working closely with stakeholders to develop practical roadmaps to move the enterprise towards the future state vision, while taking into account business, technical and delivery constraints
  • Analyzing stakeholder requirements, current state architecture, and gaps to create a future state architecture vision for one or more parts of the enterprise with a focus on reduced complexity, cost efficiencies, reuse, convergence, reduced risk and/or improved business capabilities
  • Participating in defining and operating the architecture governance process to ensure change initiatives align to the vision and roadmaps
  • Working closely with Domain Architects across key initiatives and projects to apply architecture principles and standards, and develop reference architectures and design patterns
  • Communicating the principles, standards, vision and roadmaps to stakeholders and proactively addressing any questions / concerns identified
  • Providing thought leadership on architectural or other topics, developing a forward looking view of current and emerging technologies and their impact on the Enterprise Architecture
  • Embedding Platform Thinking in everything
Job Requirements
  • Bachelor Degree in Engineering, Computer Science or equivalent; Formal architecture certification (TOGAF or equivalent); Master Degree in Business or Technology is an advantage;
  • At least 15 years' experience in the IT industry, preferably in large, complex enterprises
  • At least 7 years' experience in Enterprise Architecture in a large, complex, multi-location, multi-national environment
  • Deep experience delivering mission critical, enterprise scale IT solutions in a heterogeneous technology environment
  • Familiarity with best practice methodologies and tools for the entire solution lifecycle from ideation to requirements, design, development, testing, deployment and operations
  • A deep understanding of all domains of Enterprise Architecture, including the business, data, application, infrastructure and security domains
  • Familiarity with one or more formal Architecture frameworks / methodologies (TOGAF, Zachman, BIAN, etc.)
  • Familiarity with architecture governance frameworks
  • Practical experience in data modelling, object modelling, design patterns and Enterprise Architecture tool or other software modelling tools.
  • Practical experience to use business capabilities model
  • Familiarity with heterogeneous technology platforms such as AS400, Unix/Linux, Windows
  • IT Strategy consulting experience will be an added advantage
  • Functional Expertise required in at least two of the below domains:
    • Wholesale Cash & Payments
    • Trade & Financial Supply Chain
    • eChannels and CRM
    • eco-system partnerships and API (Open Banking)
  • Competencies
    • Demonstrate deep domain expertise in CRM Domain

job_title: Payroll Specialist - ITA - Roma - Viale Carmelo Bene 70, HQ
job_ad_details:
Ricerchiamo urgentemente un Payroll Specialist per la nostra sede di Roma.

La risorsa verrà inserita con contratto a tempo indeterminato nel dipartimento Risorse Umane nella gestione delle seguenti attività:

  • Controllo delle presenze ed eventi, elaborazione e controllo cedolini dipendenti e parasubordinati;
  • Gestione degli adempimenti periodici: Uniemens, F24, predisposizione pagamenti per fondi di previdenza complementare e assistenza sanitaria;
  • Gestione degli adempimenti annuali: CU, elaborazione autoliquidazioni INAIL, elaborazione modelli 770;
  • Elaborazioni di fine anno: TFR, calcolo acconto e saldo imposta sostitutiva, IRAP, studi di settore;
  • Predisposizione reportistica post paga: file consuntivazione costi, contabilità del personale, budget, quadratura imposte, contributi e similari;
  • Gestione ferie, straordinari, maternità, congedi, aspettative; pensioni e liquidazioni; gestione dei rapporti previdenziali;

Requisiti minimi:

  • Laurea triennale e/o magistrale in Economia o Scienze Giuridiche
  • Esperienza di 3-5 anni nell'elaborazione di paghe e contributi presso Studi Professionali o in contesti aziendali strutturati
  • Ottima conoscenza della lingua inglese
  • Conoscenza delle nuove disposizioni normative
  • Perfetta padronanza del pacchetto Office con particolare riferimento ad Excel ad un livello avanzato
  • Costituisce titolo preferenziale la conoscenza del sistema payroll ADP e E-time ADP
  • Precisione, organizzazione e autonomia operativa
  • Riservatezza, affidabilità e senso di responsabilità
  • Capacità di lavorare in team e abilità relazionali per essere punto di riferimento nel supporto a colleghi e direzione
  • Problem solving, time management e orientamento al risultato.

Inserimento immediato con contratto a tempo indeterminato

job_ad_details:
We are looking for Casual Support Workers to help the people we support in our Rotorua residential services. This is a 24/7 roster Monday to Sunday which includes working overnight and alternate weekends. This will suit people who are looking for flexibility and more regular longer shifts in one place.

What does a Support Worker do?

As a Support Worker you can be part of our team to enable people with a disability to live a life of choice, freedom and independence. Support workers are part of a team who work shifts or specific rosters providing 24/7 cover with responsibilities including aiding with personal care, community outings and integration, and other aspects of daily living - enabling our people to be as independent as possible.

What's in it for you?

As a company we are committed to our employees. We're proud to employ and train the best people in all areas of our organisation and we enjoy a vast degree of diversity within our staff teams.

  • Geneva Healthcare works closely with ACC, the Ministry of Health and DHBs to provide personalised care to clients in their own homes and to assist them in achieving the best quality of life.
  • Earn competitive pay rates between $22.70 up to $28.25 per hour.
  • Earn while you learn with free training towards NZQA Health & Wellbeing
  • FREE Employee Assistance Program, job security, Employee benefits, sick/annual leave and more

What are we looking for?

  • A desire to support our people to learn new skills and achieve outcomes
  • Prior experience supporting others with aspects of daily living, preferably those living with intellectual or physical disabilities
  • Full driver's license and confidence to safely transport passengers in our disability vans (training provided)
  • Flexibility to work overnight shifts across a roster, including weekends

Please bear in mind all applicants must be a NZ Resident/Citizen or have a valid NZ work permit.

job_title: Senior Officer/Assistant Head, Corporate Communications, Internal Communications
job_ad_details:
The corporate communications (CC) division at A*STAR showcases the organisation???s R&D collaborations and outcomes and communicate how our discoveries translate into meaningful outcomes for the public, industry and scientific community through a dynamic, multi-channel approach.

 

Within A*STAR, the internal communications team works on shaping organisational culture, keeping employees connected and informed, and cultivating employees as advocates for A*STAR. As a member of this team, you will play a role in crafting and amplifying A*STAR's narratives and success stories, managing and creating content for internal platforms, and facilitating organisational-wide dialogue through events such as townhalls.

 

Key Responsibilities

 

??? Plan and implement staff engagement initiatives to shape organisational culture and enhance engagement, belonging, and pride

??? Plan, and produce content for the organisation???s internal communications platforms 

??? Guide and assist A*STAR Research entities with message crafting and staff engagement initiatives

??? Track and report performance on internal platforms through relevant metrics

??? Perform secondary role of an executive assistant to assist CC leadership in managing schedules

 

This role reports to the Head, Internal Communications.

 

Job Requirements

 

??? Bachelor???s degree in communications with 3 years of experience in corporate communications, content creation or employee engagement

??? Possess good written communications skills to develop impactful internal communications content

??? Persuasive and collaborative, with the ability to empathise with others and craft messages that resonates 

??? Resourceful with strong people engagement skills to uncover stories that support internal narratives

PWR’s Personnel division are currently seeking a highly experienced and qualified Safety Advisor for a large chemical processing site located in Kwinana.

This is a three month contract for an immediate start.

Applicants will need to have knowledge of a chemical plant and the requirements.  This role is 40-50 hours a week Mon - Fri with the casual Saturday.

  • Management of change – risk assessment

job_title: Assistant Director / Senior Assistant Director, Office of Grants Administration
job_ad_details:
Job Description

 

The Office of Grants Administration serves to provide oversight in grants management and compliance, in order to promote effective stewardship of RIE funds managed by A*STAR either as an Implementing Agency, or a Grant Intermediary.

 

This role includes, but is not limited to, the following:

·       Managing a team to oversee the day-to-day administration of academic and talent funding initiatives.

·       Formulating, reviewing and refining of policies and processes for effective management and running of the funding initiatives.

·       Working with the National Research Foundation in the implementation of the funding initiatives.

·       Resolving issues arising during pre-award and post-award of the grants

·       Tracking and collation of data relating to research funding and outcomes and impact of funding initiatives.

·       Tracking of awarded programmes' KPIs, milestones and cash utilisation.

 

Requirements

·       Good tertiary degree

·       Minimum 3 years' experience in public sector policy/planning/governance

·       Strong problem solving, analytical and systems thinking abilities required

·       Experience in managing operations teams is an advantage

·       Experience in grants management and administration is an advantage

·       Experience in data analytics and visualisation tools (R/Python/Tableau/PowerBI) will be an advantage

·       Able to work independently and collaboratively with internal and external stakeholders

Job Description

The Store Assistant plays a vital role in the efficient operation of the warehouse by assisting with the receiving, storage, and distribution of goods. The position requires close attention to detail, effective communication skills, and adherence to safety and organizational procedures. The Store Assistant will ensure that inventory is managed accurately and that goods are handled with care.

Details of the key responsibilities as follow:

1. Inspect incoming shipments, verify quantity and quality, and label cartons.

2. Store items in designated warehouse locations following inventory protocols, ensuring proper stacking and storage to maximize space and prevent damage.

3. Pick and verify items for orders (consignment or purchase), pack them securely, and label them correctly for delivery.

4. Inspect and process returned goods, update inventory records, and follow company policies for restocking, disposal, or returns to suppliers.

5. Maintain warehouse cleanliness and organization, adhere to 5S principles, and promptly address housekeeping issues to ensure safety and efficiency.

6. Monitor inventory levels, collaborate with other departments, participate in stock audits, and maintain effective communication and organizational skills.

7. Perform any additional tasks assigned by the company.

Job Requirements

1. Basic computer knowledge

2. Must be trustworthy

3. Physically fit

Salary Package

Basic ($60 to $73 per day depending on skills and working experiences) + Incentives + Variable bonus

Staff Welfare

Up to 18 days of annual leave + More than $500 medical and wellness benefits + Staff purchase with a minimum discount of 50% + $200 birthday voucher + Lunch provided

Our Client:

Located in Auckland, our client is a leading provider of fire protection systems, and we're seeking a skilled and experienced Sprinkler Fitter to join our dynamic team. As a Sprinkler Fitter, you will play a crucial role in ensuring the installation, maintenance, and repair of fire sprinkler systems, ensuring the safety and protection of properties.

We are looking for someone with a proven background in sprinkler fitting, ideally having progressed through an apprenticeship to become a qualified Sprinkler Fitter. Experience working on both commercial and residential systems is highly desirable.

This role is for a 6 month contract based at Auckland Airport commencing on  Monday 23rd September.

The Benefits:
  • $35 - $45 p/hr rate!
  • Ongoing training and professional development opportunities
  • A supportive and collaborative work environment
  • Opportunities for career advancement
  • Secure Full-Time Role: Monday to Friday
  • Night Shift, 8pm-4am, 40 hours per week with Overtime available

The Role:

As a key member of the team, you will be responsible for installing, maintaining, and servicing fire sprinkler systems in accordance with industry standards and safety regulations. Your role will include performing system inspections, troubleshooting issues, and collaborating with other technicians and clients. Attention to detail, compliance with safety standards, and delivering excellent customer service are essential parts of the job.


About You:
  • Proven experience working as a Sprinkler Fitter
  • Relevant trade qualification or no less than 3 years of experience in fire protection systems
  • Strong understanding of mechanical and hydraulic systems
  • Ability to read and interpret technical plans and drawings
  • Valid NZ driver's license with a clean driving record
  • Ability to work independently and meet high standards of workmanship
Applicants for this position should have NZ residency or a valid NZ work visa.

在接受聘用前，你應清楚知道僱主的身份，詳情可參閱「保存僱傭紀錄---僱員參考手冊」。

求職人士請注意：
  • 空缺咭展示的職位空缺資料，包括職位名稱、職責內容、工作時間、薪金等，均是由僱主提供。如果求職人士在面試時，僱主提出不合理的要求，或所提供的僱傭條件與本處登記的資料不符，請盡快通知本處。為免墮入求職陷阱，在面試時應注意聘用條件（包括計薪方法、工資期、休息日安排等），了解職位的工作範圍及入職要求，並留意工作環境。此外，請特別留意工作性質及內容會否抵觸現行法例，切勿因急於求職而接受聘用從事非法工作。
  • 僱主及職業介紹所向本處遞交職位招聘表時，已承諾會按照《最低工資條例》的規定，就任何工資期，支付不少於法定最低工資水平的工資予受聘有關職位並受《最低工資條例》涵蓋的人士 。
  • 如你有合理懷疑僱主未有遵守《僱傭條例》、《僱員補償條例》、《最低工資條例》，可致電熱線2717 1771（由1823接聽）或電郵至enquiry@labour.gov.hk 查詢。至於涉及《性別歧視條例》、《殘疾歧視條例》、《家庭崗位歧視條例》或《種族歧視條例》的查詢，請聯絡平等機會委員會。
  • 根據《最低工資條例》的規定，僱主須就任何工資期，確保支付僱員不少於按下列方法計算的最低工資：

    最低工資=僱員於工資期的總工作時數 x 法定最低工資水平（即每小時40元1）
    1由2023年5月1日起，法定最低工資水平已調升至每小時40元。

    • 如就工資期須支付予僱員的工資少於最低工資，僱員有權就該工資期獲付這差額（即「額外報酬」）。該僱員的僱傭合約須視為他有權就該工資期獲得額外報酬，而該額外報酬亦適用於計算根據其他相關法例所應獲得的款項。
    • 有關法定最低工資的定義及計算詳情，請瀏覽 《法定最低工資：僱主及僱員參考指引》或致電 24 小時查詢熱線 2717 1771（由「1823」接聽）。

Your new company

You will be working for a global manufacturer, specialising in manufacturing various ranges of product categories and applications with innovative manufacturing processes and technologies to drive the industry forwards. With an aggressive growth plan and current plant expansion in Thailand, they are seeking a dynamic and well-experienced Sr. Process Engineering Manager to be based at their state-of-the-art manufacturing facility in Bangkok.

Your new role
  • Oversee all aspects of the wafer sawing and grinding processes, including scheduling, quality control, safety, and resource allocation.
  • Manage process engineering team to successfully launch NPI project
  • Implement & maintain Quality Control Plan / Tool / FMEA / SPC / Standard Work
  • Execute new product introductions from concept to production by DOE methodology
  • Support customer audits and 8D problem-solving activities, collaborating with customers and internal teams to analyze and resolve issues promptly, and ensuring compliance with quality standards and regulatory requirements.
  • Drive continuous improvement projects in Quality, Productivity and Cost by collaborating with cross-functional teams to implement cost-saving initiatives and enhance process efficiency.
  • Develop and maintain process documentation, including work instructions and standard operating procedures.

What you'll need to succeed
  • Bachelor Degree in electronics, electrical engineering, or relevant fields
  • Minimum 10 years of experience in electronics manufacturing and at least 5 years of experience in a managerial or supervisory role.
  • Comprehensive manufacturing processes - wafer sawing and grinding
  • Excellent people leadership and communication skills, with the ability to develop, manage, motivate, and inspire team members.
  • Familiarity with Lean manufacturing principles and continuous improvement methodologies.
  • Excellent English written and spoken communication.

What you'll get in return
 You will be rewarded in your employment with:
  • Opportunities for professional development and career advancement.
  • A supportive and inclusive work environment.
  • Competitive salary and benefits

What you need to do now

Click "apply now" if you are interested in this role. For further details or a confidential discussion on the other opportunities in Manufacturing & Supply Chain, please contact Jiaranai (Mai) at Hays Recruitment on 02 460 6450 or email jiaranai.udompraphasab@hays.co.th

At Hays, we value diversity and are passionate about placing people in a role where they can flourish and succeed. We actively encourage people from diverse backgrounds to apply.

Sydney Children's Hospitals Network is the largest paediatric health care entity in Australia. We care for thousands of children each year in our hospitals and in their homes — with one purpose in mind — to help young people live their healthiest lives.

Additional Information:

•    An eligibility list may be created for future permanent full or part time and temporary full or part time vacancies. 


What you'll be doing

The Registered Nurse provides safe, compassionate, person-centred care to patients and families of Sydney Children's Hospital Network.
The Registered Nurse acts as a role model by demonstrating behaviour and interacting with patients, their families and employees in a way that promotes a culture and standards that reflect the NSW Health CORE values of Collaboration, Openness , Respect and Empowerment.

  1. Current Authority to Practice as a Registered Nurse with the Australian Health Practitioner Regulation Agency (AHPRA).
  2. Demonstrated excellent verbal, written and interpersonal skills.
  3. Demonstrated ability to work effectively in a multidisciplinary team.
  4. Recent paediatric experience as a registered nurse in a hospital setting.
  5. Effective time management skills
  6. Computer literacy.

SCHN is an Equal Opportunity Employer that values diversity - we acknowledge the vibrancy that a diverse workforce brings to enhance both our workplace culture and our service delivery to children, young people and their families and carers. We encourage all suitably qualified applicants to apply. If you identify as an Indigenous Australian or as a person with a disability, please contact us if you would like some more information about our recruitment process.

Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people are encouraged to apply. We recognise the value of Aboriginal staff providing health care to Aboriginal children and families that access the services we provide at the Sydney Children’s Hospitals Network. Aboriginal job applicants are encouraged to visit the NSW Health Aboriginal Recruitment tool, Stepping Up to assist in preparing your application.

This position requires a Working with Children Check (WWCC) issued by the Office of the Children’s Guardian.  For more information on how to apply for the clearance, please visit the Office of the Children’s Guardian Website https://ocg.nsw.gov.au/ 

Applicants holding visas with working rights may be considered for temporary appointment (up to the expiry date of their visa) where no suitable local applicant is identified.

Please note: To be eligible for permanent appointment to a position in NSW Health, you must have an Australian citizenship or permanent Australian residency.

Need more information?

  2) Find out more about applying for this position

For role related queries or questions contact Michelle Bolding on michelle.bolding@health.nsw.gov.au

If you are Aboriginal or Torres Strait islander wishing to apply for this role and want to speak with an Aboriginal person/representative from the Sydney Children’s Hospital Network please contact Wayne Dargan on wayne.dargan@health.nsw.gov.au

For technical support please contact the customer services team on 1300 679 367 and select option 3.

The Earthquake Commission (EQC), Kōmihana Rūwhenua, is a Crown entity with a mission to reduce the impact on people and property when natural disasters occur.

Our country's natural hazard risk profile is complex, so we are focussed on supporting a healthy and prosperous New Zealand through readiness for and recovery from natural disasters, risk financing, and building New Zealand's resilience to the impacts of natural disasters.

Te Whiwhinga Mahi | The Opportunity

The purpose of this position is to design and deliver Business Intelligence (BI) and analytical content across EQC's platforms incorporating geospatial and other data from EQC and third parties. The role has a focus on working with geospatial data across BI and analytics platform architecture layers e.g. from data replication, to transformation, and visualization.

Ko wai koe | About You

  • You'll be a qualified and experienced Geospatial Data Engineer/Data Scientist, who has the ability to work well within public sector administrative processes and structures.
  • You'll have a sound knowledge and understanding of geospatial data lifecycle, including data pipelines, analytics, and presentation techniques and methods, in an Azure environment.
  • You'll have strong understanding of GIS data lifecycle best practices, including data profiling and data quality.
  • You'll have experience working with geospatial data in both ESRI ArcGIS and SQL server.
  • You'll have experience in designing, developing, and testing geospatial pipelines, for example using PostgreSQL and PostgREST. 
  • You'll have the capabilities of producing/reviewing technical documentation, e.g. design documentation including data models and design decisions, 'as-built', user guides, testing plans.

Why EQC is a great place to work

EQC recognises that our people are our greatest asset, and we prioritise their wellbeing. Along with a competitive salary, five weeks annual leave, an employee wellbeing fund and ongoing professional development, we provide an inclusive, engaging and purpose-driven culture.

Our commitment to a diverse and inclusive workforce is because we know our culture thrives when we get this right, and that our customers get the best from us. We work to draw on the differences in who we are, what we've experienced, and how we think. We make a difference for all New Zealanders and strive to increasingly reflect the diversity of communities we serve by including and valuing perspectives from all backgrounds including ethnicity, religion, gender, age, accessibility needs, sexual orientation, and national origin.

How to apply

For a more detailed understanding of the position or if you're ready to apply, please visit our Careers website by clicking Apply. If you have any questions about the role or require further information or assistance, please contact us at askhr@eqc.govt.nz or 0800 326 243. 

Applications close Wednesday, 18 May 2022 at 5PM.

WSP is one of the world’s leading engineering and professional services firms. Our 67,000 trusted professionals are united by the common purpose — to create positive, long-lasting impacts on the communities we serve through a culture of innovation, integrity, and inclusion.

With over 150 years of experience in Aotearoa New Zealand. We are proud to have the blueprint of Aotearoa New Zealand, in our DNA and be involved in the projects that will continue to connect and support us for future generations. We value our people, our reputation, and our impact on the future.

Civil Technician - Taupō

Working with the Transport Team, you will assist in the delivery of a variety of Civil Projects by partaking in engineering design, investigations, documentation and supervision.

You'll play a key role in contributing to the success of the business unit in meeting its business plan through the provision of appropriate technical support.

You'll also carry out construction site walkovers and meetings with contractors, carrying out site management and MSQA duties.

About You

  • Degree or Diploma in a Civil Engineering or related field
  • 3+ years’ experience in an engineering consultancy environment

This position is full-time, 40 hours, and five days per week. The remuneration range for this position is $78000 - $90000, depending on experience

Why us? 

WSP NZ has proudly earned its place among the top five employers to work for in Aotearoa New Zealand, as recognised in Randstad's latest employer survey. In addition, WSP has been listed as one of TIME’s 2023 top 100 companies globally for employees. Our dedicated team is passionate about creating innovative, comprehensive, and sustainable solutions for a future that prioritises the well-being of our people, whānau, and communities. We contribute to complex and exciting projects addressing critical environmental and infrastructure challenges and have a solid pipeline of work across multiple disciplines.

At WSP, we prioritise a diverse, inclusive, and supportive environment that empowers our people and allows them to be in control of their time. We believe that this is essential for us to achieve our common goals and that great results can be achieved through collaboration and by allowing everyone to bring their authentic selves to work. By fostering this environment, we inspire our team to strive for excellence and reach their full potential.

Our benefit package is highly competitive and includes the following: 

  • Flexible and hybrid working arrangements 
  • Comprehensive medical insurance 
  • Unspecified sick leave
  • Progressive parental leave policy 
  • Option to purchase up to 4 additional weeks of annual leave 
  • Reimbursement of up to 2 annual professional memberships 
  • Community day 
  • Employee Assistance Programme 
  • Multiple discounted products and services, and more.
We will review applications as they come in, so if this opportunity sounds like you, don’t wait to apply!

Sales Representative

Job Description: 
As a TMT Sales Representative, you play a pivotal role in expanding our community by engaging potential clients through personalized sales talks and guiding them through the discovery and booking process. Your goal is to enhance client satisfaction, maximize sales, and foster long-term relationships.

In this role, you will work closely with the Coach Support Specialists to ensure that the client's needs and preferences identified during the discovery phase are perfectly matched with the right instructor, facilitating a seamless transition from sales to service delivery.

Key Responsibilities:
  • Conduct outbound calls and follow-ups to leads generated from inquiries, ensuring a high level of customer engagement and conversion.
  • Utilize the TMT Sales Talk Track Guide to actively listen, build rapport, and create a buying atmosphere that aligns with the client's needs and preferences.
  • Collaborate with Coach Support Specialists to match clients with the best-suited coach based on the discovery phase outcomes, ensuring a tailored and satisfying learning experience.
  • Address any concerns or objections with grace and professionalism, providing alternatives and solutions to meet the client's needs, with the support of the Coach Support Specialists for any pro-related issues.
  • Collect payment details efficiently and securely, ensuring clients are well-informed about the post-payment steps and the features of our app for scheduling and communication with pros.
  • Perform courtesy follow-up calls after the first lesson to gather feedback, encourage package upgrades, and manage referrals, using insights from Coach Support Specialists to enhance service quality and client satisfaction.
  • Handle refunds that are requested based on conversion bookings done by the sales team, and each sales team member is responsible for their own conversion that result in a refund by attempting to save it and resolve the issue with the support of the Customer Experience team. 
Core Principles:
  • Customer Retention and Engagement: Prioritize active listening and personalized interaction to not only match clients with the ideal coach but also encourage repeat bookings. Emphasize the importance of understanding and acting on clients' long-term interests and goals, fostering loyalty and a sustained relationship.
  • Rapport Building: Enhance the connection with clients by not just addressing them by name but also recalling previous interactions and preferences. This deeper level of personalization ensures a seamless transition to Coach Support Specialists and signals to clients that their history and loyalty are valued, promoting a continuous engagement cycle.
  • Communication for Repeat Engagement: Adopt a communication strategy that goes beyond being friendly and informative to being anticipatory and responsive to past feedback. This involves acknowledging previous experiences, both positive and areas for improvement, to demonstrate a commitment to personalized service enhancement for returning customers.
  • Efficiency with a Focus on Long-Term Satisfaction: While closing deals swiftly remains important, place additional emphasis on ensuring that each transaction aligns with the client's ongoing learning journey. Leverage insights from Coach Support Specialists to proactively suggest future bookings based on past preferences and goals, streamlining the path to re-engagement.
  • Adaptive Flexibility: Beyond offering immediate solutions for concerns, incorporate a strategy for continuous improvement based on the specific feedback of returning clients. Utilize the detailed knowledge of Coach Support Specialists to adjust offerings, matching strategies, and communication based on what has been learned about clients' preferences over time, ensuring each experience is better than the last.
Qualifications:
  • 3+ Customer Support Experience
  • 4+ years of Sales Experience
  • Fluent English (Written and Spoken)
  • Weekend work. Needs to be able to work Saturday and Sunday PST each week, with either Thursday/Friday off or Monday/Tuesday off. (non-negotiable)

job_title: Kaiako - Te Pīnakitanga ki te Reo Kairangi (Taumata 7)
job_ad_details:
Kaiako - Te Pīnakitanga ki te Reo Kairangi (Taumata 7)

Permanent, Full-time

Raroera Campus

Hamilton

 

E kimihia ana mātou tētahi tangata māna e whakaako Te Pīnakitanga, tētahi kaupapa reo rūmaki o roto o Te Wānanga o Aotearoa.

 

Ko tōna tino whāinga he whakawhanake i te mātau o te hunga e mōhio kē ana ki te tuhituhi me te kōrero i te reo Māori, ēngari ia kāre anō kia mātau rawa. Me matatau rawa tēnei tangata ki te reo Māori kia pai ai tāna ārahi i ngā ākonga kia kōtihitihi rawa te aronga.  Me mātanga te tangata nei ki ngā kaupapa ka whakaakona arā ko ngā āhuatanga o te reo, te mahi aroā, te karanga me te whaikōrero, waiata/haka, te reo ōpaki/ōkawa, te whakamāori/whakapākehā, te pūrākau/pakiwaitara.

 

Ngā pūkenga me ngā wheako a te tangata:

  •  Kua pūkenga, kua wheako te tangata nei ki te whakaako ki te reo Māori anake me te whakaako i te hunga pakeke.

     

  • Kua whakawhiwhia kētia ki te tohu paerua, te tohu paerunga rānei, e whakaaturia ana tōna tohungatanga i roto i ngā kaupapa o te reo me ngā tikanga Māori, otirā ao Māori.

     

  • Kua whakawhiwhia kētia ki tētahi tohu whakaako e whakaaturia ana tōna tohungatanga i roto i ngā āhuatanga o te mātauranga whakaako, te whakaako hoki i te hunga pakeke.

 

Tonoa tēnei tūranga mā te rīhita me te tono ki te pae tukutuku nei:

https://twoa.careercentre.net.nz/

Job Scope

  • Manage and oversee the custody operation
  • Supervise the settlement of transactions, corporate action
  • Ensure that all services delivered consider current legislative and regulatory requirements
  • Drive operational changes and system enhancements to meet the changing need of the business
  • Participate in system setup, implementation and testing
  • Establish and implement procedures manuals, workflows and control measures related to asset custody services
  • Undertake ad-hoc projects as assigned.

Requirements

  • Bachelor Degree Holder
  • 6-8 years experiences in global custody and banking industry
  • Familiar with SWIFT, CMU, CCASS, Euroclear/Clearstream etc.
  • Strong knowledge of corporate action processes and procedures
  • Familiar with Hong Kong equities and fixed income securities, global stocks and bonds,
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
  • Proficient in Word, Excel, PowerPoint and other presentation applications, including the ability to produce neatly presented work
  • Excellent command of English and Chinese

Job Summary:

Field sales executive focused on customers to achieve revenue and margin goals in assigned accounts. Identifies customer needs and applies company's value proposition to drive sales growth and improved profitability. Develops strategic relationships and aligns customer and business goals, creating and managing a business and execution plan for shared success among the customer, vendor partners and the company.


Principal Responsibilities:

  • Serves as the primary point of contact for the customer interface to the company's resources that drives and supports high levels of customer satisfaction and loyalty, as measured in surveys and share of wallet.
  • Develops strong, strategic relationships with customer(s) to identify and leverage the customers' business goals, growth strategies and profit drivers to deliver the appropriate business value proposition sales solution strategy.
  • Provides leadership and guidance in critical customer planning and engagement.
  • Performs critical customer analysis to identify and leverage the partner's marketing programs to achieve growth in their customer's solutions capability.
  • Engages customer(s) in joint planning that integrates the company's services, programs and supplier partnerships securing customer commitment for the development of a comprehensive investment in strategies that advance the company's market position, entanglement and financial goals
  • Conducts regular business reviews with assigned accounts to track progress toward revenue and growth goals and owns execution of business plan.
  • Maintains and monitors pipeline and metrics for assigned customers, performs analysis and identifies improvement opportunities.
  • Supports supplier's strategies by aligning solutions with customer to maximize profitable growth, and customer expansion.
  • Prioritize customers and opportunities with greatest potential for success.
  • Closely manages profitability by minimizing profit leaks and maximizing gross profit.
  • Other duties as assigned.


Job Level Specifications:

  • Developing expertise of business, financials, products/services, the market, or account needs. Expanded knowledge of the industry, markets and sales processes; broadens sales capabilities. Further develops an understanding of the range of products/ services that the organization and its competitors sell and that assigned customers purchase.
  • Works with moderately complex territory/ assigned accounts, products/services, sales or account management processes. May refer to policies, practices and precedents for guidance; determines best course of action to achieve results. Solves sales problems in straightforward situations; analyzes possible solutions using sales experience, judgment and precedent.
  • Works independently within an assigned territory/account base with moderate sized accounts/opportunities. Has flexibility to set and negotiate terms within defined parameters; is beginning to plan own territory or account approach.
  • Collaborates with internal team, managers and support functions. Has direct contact with clients.
  • Impacts own sales quota and that of others; works within a defined territory or account list and to guidelines and policies.


Work Experience:

  • Minimum experience required is typically 3+ years with bachelor's or equivalent.


Education and Certification(s):

  • Bachelors degree or equivalent experience from which comparable knowledge and job skills can be obtained.


Distinguishing Characteristics:

You will be building footprint and acquire customers for the our client's expansion business to Indonesia.

Client Details

My client is an AI SaaS tool that helps mainly FMCG and other consumer goods companies with their platfrom to increase their sales revenue.

Description

  1. Land new customers and boost revenue: Hit your sales goals by bringing in new clients and securing contracts.
  2. Own your territory: Craft and execute plans to win over key accounts, land big projects, and smash your personal targets.
  3. Keep the pipeline flowing: Use top-notch time management and sales discipline to build a strong pipeline and maintain its health within the CRM system.
  4. Bridge the gap: Partner with Solution Architects, Product teams, and management to relay customer needs and steer opportunity development.
  5. Team up for leads: Collaborate with Marketing and Business Development folks to generate leads across the ASEAN region, especially for major accounts

Profile

  1. Thrive within the challenge: You're energized by fast-paced, ever-changing environments and ready to tackle any challenge head-on.
  2. Tech guru: You have 5+ years of experience selling Tech services to enterprises, FMCG or consumer goods companies preferred. Maxmimum of 10 years of working experience.
  3. Tech-savvy: You understand data, platforms and/or cloud computing, but don't worry, it doesn't have to be your life's passion.
  4. C-suite whisperer: You know how to impress and influence senior leaders, having navigated decision-making processes in large companies.
  5. Team player: You've collaborated with all kinds of folks, from marketers to architects, product managers, and account managers. Teamwork makes the dream work!
  6. Globe-trotter: You're comfortable with being on the road to close deals

Essentially, we're looking for a dynamic, experienced, and well-connected salesperson who can navigate the exciting world of enterprise tech sales.

Job Offer

  • Be a part of an exciting industry with exponential growth
  • Career growth within the company

To apply online please click the 'Apply' button below. For a confidential discussion about this role please contact Hashegi Hanjaya on +62 21 2958 8856.
