Description

Jawatan : Pembantu Teknikal - Teknologi Maklumat
Gred: D4 (RM 1500 - RM2345)
Kumpulan: Sokongan
Koperasi Tenaga Nasional Berhad (KOPTNB) ingin mempelawa warganegara Malaysia untuk memohon dan mengisi jawatan kosong seperti yang dinyatakan. Tawaran dibuka kepada calon yang mempunyai kelayakan seperti berikut.
Syarat & Kriteria Kelayakan:
1. Mempunyai kelayakan sekurang-kurangnya SPM, STPM, SKM Tahap 2 atau Diploma dalam bidang yang berkaitan.
2. Berpengalaman kerja 1-2 tahun dalam bidang teknologi maklumat adalah satu kelebihan.
3. Mempunyai pengetahuan, kemahiran dan kepakaran yang mendalam mengenai perkakasan, peralatan dan sistem komputer serta mengikuti perkembangan teknologi maklumat terkini.
4. Bertanggungjawab, amanah, proaktif, berdedikasi dan komited serta memiliki kemahiran komunikasi yang baik.
5. Lepasan Graduan digalakkan untuk memohon.
Skop Tugas:-
Bertanggungjawab dalam melaksanakan tugas-tugas merangkumi penyelenggaraan sistem komputer seperti penyelenggaraan pencegahan dan penyelenggaraan kelengkapan IT serta tugas-tugas penyelenggaraan aplikasi perkomputeran dan operasi sistem dalam koperasi. Seterusnya, menerima dan menyempurnakan tugas yang diberikan oleh pihak atasan dari semasa ke semasa
Faedah / Kelebihan:
- Persekitaran kerja yang baik
- Latihan dan kursus berkaitan disediakan
- Feadah Perubatan
- Kemudahan pengangkutan awam

Lokasi Kerja : HQ, Koperasi TNB, Jalan Bangsar, Kuala Lumpur.

Company

Pada awal tahun 1951, mesyuarat pertama diadakan yang dipengerusikan oleh Encik M. Pakianathan, Penolong Akauntan Lembaga Letrik Pusat telah bersetuju untuk menubuhkan sebuah Koperasi khusus bagi kakitangan Lembaga Letrik Pusat yang bergaji bulanan

Penubuhan Koperasi ini telah dipersetujui oleh Encik F.G. Egerton, Pengurus Besar Lembaga Letrik Negara pada masa tersebut.

Permohonan pendaftaran telah dibuat di Pendaftar Pertubuhan Koperasi pada 1hb Ogos 1951.

Maka rasmilah pendaftaran Syarikat Kerjasama Jimat Cermat dan Pinjaman Wang Lembaga Letrik Pusat Sendirian Berhad dengan nombor pendaftaran 261/51-1449.

Pada Jun 1965, Koperasi telah menukar nama kepada Syarikat Kerjasama Jimat Cermat dan Pinjaman Wang Lembaga Letrik Negara Sendirian Berhad, dimana perubahan ini adalah sejajar dengan pertukaran nama Lembaga Letrik Pusat kepada Lembaga Letrik Negara.

Objektif utama Koperasi adalah menggalakkan aktiviti jimat cermat serta menjalankan fungsi-fungsi pinjaman, pengguna, perkhidmatan dan perumahan.

Memandangkan sebutan nama ini yang agak panjang, pada tahun 1967, Koperasi telah menukar namanya kepada Koperatif Lembaga Letrik Berhad.

Pada September 1990, selaras dengan dasar penswastaan Negara yang turut melibatkan Lembaga Letrik Negara ditransformasikan dari sebuah Lembaga kepada Syarikat Korporat bernama Tenaga Nasional Berhad, Koperasi juga telah mengambil langkah yang sewajarnya untuk menukar nama kepada Koperasi Tenaga Nasional Berhad sehingga kini.

Description
  • Contribute towards production of daily news bulletins and specials. This will include stacking the rundowns, writing stories, integrating graphics & vision to tell a compelling, relevant story
  • Direct production of news programmes by assigning stories to writers, coordinating graphics requests, planning sequences with the studio crew and executing live programs
  • Produce news packages using wire agency materials, conceptualizing & writing the scripts, integrating relevant soundbites, and cutting the package
  • Break news on air quickly and accurately. React to developing stories, amend scripts and the rundown of the show to reflect the new line-up of stories
  • Conceptualise graphics, including Augmented Reality graphics, to tell the story in a more dynamic & interactive manner
  • Identify relevant topics for interviews, and potential analysts, CEOs, news makers. Research and develop a line of questioning with the presenters, aimed at breaking news and getting scoops
  • Maintain updated knowledge of global developments by monitoring trends, competitors' activities and viewers' feedback, and contextualising stories for an Asian audience
  • Uphold and maintain news programme quality by performing regular checks, reviewing feedback and identifying areas for improvement necessary
  • Ensure editorial guidelines of the Company and policies set by regulators are strictly adhered to
  • As needed, vet inserts, packages and reports put together by other team-members to make sure scripts are accurate, succinct, and ready for air

Requirements:

  • Possess a relevant Degree
  • At least 2 years of journalism experience
  • Working knowledge using news room editing systems
  • Excellent command of English
  • Excellent organisational, communication and interpersonal skills
  • Be prepared to work irregular hours

About the Role:

Our client is a Sydney-based Salesforce Summit Partner delivering exciting projects for our customers in Australia, across the whole Salesforce platform: Sales, Service, Field Service, Financial Services, Health, CPQ, Experience Cloud, MuleSoft, OmniStudio, etc.

We are looking for an experienced Project Coordinator to assist with the smooth running of larger programs and portfolios of work, participating in and running daily meetings and workshops, assisting with business analysis activities, as well as potentially acting as a project manager on smaller projects whilst being mentored by our existing team.

Working with and supporting a team of highly-skilled experts, you will be exposed to a variety of challenging projects across multiple sectors, assisting our team in delivering innovative Salesforce solutions that help clients solve real business problems.

Job Responsibilities:
  • A variety of project administration duties, including project scheduling (e.g. Gantt Charts, Jira or Trello), project tracking, and following up on project documentation.
  • Providing administrative support to the Head of Operations and project team as required.
  • Organising and running project meetings including scheduling, recording and taking meeting minutes and following up on action items.
  • Assisting in defining the project plan, activities, milestones, and resource requirements.
  • Maintaining the project / resource schedules.
  • Preparing and providing status reports.
  • Assisting with identifying scope changes and drafting change requests.
  • Using internal communication tools to provide visibility on current activities, challenges and milestones

Skills & Experience:

  • 1-4 years relevant work experience in a similar role.
  • Excellent stakeholder management skills.
  • Strong problem solving skills with the ability to work independently using collaborative web-based tools.
  • Excellent organisational skills with the ability to multitask.
  • Ability to understand business processes
  • Ability to work in fast-paced environment
  • Ability to quickly learn new technologies.
  • An understanding of Agile and Scrum.

Bonus points if:

  • You have any prior Salesforce / CRM knowledge
  • Previous experience of working in an Agile environment
  • Experience in or with Professional Services companies

Additional Job Details:

  • Set-up and Location: WFH/Remote
  • Work Schedule: 9:00 AM to 6:00 PM (AEDT) | 7:00 AM to 4:00 PM (PH Time)
  • Employment Type: Full-time

All interviews and other hiring requirements are done virtually or through video calls or emails.

job_title: MGR, Internet Banking and Reporting, Channels Operations Centre
job_ad_details:
About UOB

United Overseas Bank Limited (UOB) is a leading bank in Asia with a global network of more than 500 branches and offices in 19 countries and territories in Asia Pacific, Europe and North America. In Asia, we operate through our head office in Singapore and banking subsidiaries in China, Indonesia, Malaysia and Thailand, as well as branches and offices.

Our history spans more than 80 years. Over this time, we have been guided by our values — Honorable, Enterprising, United and Committed. This means we always strive to do what is right, build for the future, work as one team and pursue long-term success. It is how we work, consistently, be it towards the company, our colleagues or our customers.

About the Department

The Technology and Operations function is comprised of five teams of specialists with distinct capabilities: business partnership, technology, operations, risk governance and planning support and services. We work closely together to harness the power of technology to support our physical and digital banking services and operations. This includes developing, centralising and standardising technology systems as well as banking operations in Singapore and overseas branches.

Job Responsibilities
  1. Daily reconciliation of Paynet e-payment settlement against banks internal reports.
  2. Ensure the timely completion of daily and monthly payment reconciliation including identification and clearing of unreconciled items
  3. Log all non-reconciling items to ensure they are communicated via email to relevant department for investigation or correction for effective resolution.
  4. Attend promptly all queries, complaint from internal and external parties in resolving dispute and reconciliation issue within the regulatory timeline
  5. Process and ensure all the correct postings of all electronic channels and card transaction are accurate
  6. Ensure funds are recovered from external party timely and accurately as stipulated in the agreement between participating banks.
  7. Perform maintenances for e-banking services
  8. Conduct UAT and involve in Projects as and when required.

Job Requirements
  1. Recognized Degree or other equivalent qualifications.
  2. Demonstrate good working knowledge of MS Office suite, particularly advanced knowledge of MS Excel
  3. Must have the advance Excel skills to automate some operations, manage macro commands, able to work with multiple worksheets and usage of integrate functions.
  4. Experience and exposure of e-payment product ie MEPS/RPP/IBG reconciliation and dispute management
  5. Strong sense of ownership and good follow thru skills
  6. Able to be a team player as well as working independently within tight deadlines
Be a part of UOB Family

UOB is an equal opportunity employer. UOB does not discriminate on the basis of a candidate's age, race, gender, color, religion, sexual orientation, physical or mental disability, or other non-merit factors. All employment decisions at UOB are based on business needs, job requirements and qualifications. If you require any assistance or accommodations to be made for the recruitment process, please inform us when you submit your online application.

Apply now and make a difference.

job_title: Software QA Analyst (Manual/Automated Testing) | Night shift
job_ad_details:
We are looking for Software QA Analyst (Manual/Automated Testing) to support Change Healthcare, an international healthcare company located in BGC, Taguig.


Position Summary:

The Quality Assurance Analyst position within the ClaimsXten Implementation Services organization works as a member of the Quality Assurance team to provide both manual and automated testing services to various Client Services teams serving ClaimsXten and ClaimsXten Select customers.
 
The QA Analyst’s main responsibilities are installing, configuring and maintaining customer QA environments, as well as, performing testing activities, both manual and automated, related to new customer implementations and ongoing customer enhancements to ensure that deliverables are made in a timely manner and are of high quality. 
 
The role of the QA Analyst is to provide both manual testing and ongoing deployment, maintenance and execution of automated test suites.
 
    
Key Responsibilities:
  1. Define, develop, maintain and execute both manual and automated test scripts to ensure that functional requirements are met. Test and sign-off on releases.
  2. Set-up, install, test and maintain QA environments and test data.
  3. Coordinate with internal resources to clarify requirements, specifications, and issues, review test scripts, and manage test cycles.
  4. Manage defects and QA artifacts through an online tracking tool.

Minimum Job Qualifications:
 
Education/Training
  • 4-year degree in computer science, related field or equivalent experience
Business Experience (include minimum years of experience)
  • 5+ years experience in Software Quality Assurance.
  • 2+ years of test automation experience.
Specialized Knowledge/Skills
  • Must possess strong analytical skills for interpreting customer requirements.
  • Must have a strong background in software QA best practices, testing and validation concepts.
  • Must be able to work as an integral member of a distributed, collaborative team.
  • Must possess strong written and verbal communication skills for interacting within your team and customers. 
  • Must possess the ability to lead meetings with customers on QA related matters.
  • Must process the ability to learn and apply both in-house and off-the-shelf tools that assist in performing your job.
  • Must be a self-starter that requires little supervision to complete tasks.
  • Must be able to manage multiple projects simultaneously and prioritize work.
  • Must have direct experience creating and maintaining automated test scripts.
  • Must be proficient in at least one programming language - .Net is a plus
  • Should have experience troubleshooting technical issues that arise during the testing process.
  • Should have basic to intermediate SQL skills.
  • Should have experience Testing ETL functionality
  • Should have experience testing custom API’s
  • Should have experience working with command line utilities, remote desktop clients, Windows services and XML.
  • Should be proficient with Microsoft’s Office suite.
  • Experience working in a Datawarehouse Environment is a big plus
  • Experience with Jira a plus.
  • Experience with Fitnesse automation tool a big plus.

Recommend: 
  • Knowledge/experience within the healthcare industry.  Medical claims and/or coding experience a plus.
  • Basic software development lifecycle knowledge.
  • Familiarity with Linux/Windows server operating systems.
  • Experience working with Oracle Databases.
  • Experience working with Informatica or similar tools

 What's in it for you?
  • Competitive salary package
  • Full-time employment
  • Job stability
  • Work-life balance
  • Exciting benefits such as Retirement plan with investment
  • HMO, Life insurance
  • WFH until further notice

Plenty of work available in all suburbs, working in nice family homes helping busy families with house cleaning. This job suits everyone! Choose your own hours and work as little as 10 hours, up to 38+ hours. Plenty of work available Monday to Friday. No weekend or evening work available. Own car essential. 

 

As Australia's largest Agency for Domestic Cleaners, we have home cleaning jobs in all suburbs. Can’t get enough work in retail, hospitality, or tourism? Over the stress of the health industry? Wanting to be your own boss but don’t want to buy a franchise? Why not give house cleaning a go!  

 

This work is guaranteed and secure, providing you meet our client’s needs. It’s easy work, and you can work the hours that suit you. Be your own boss! 

 
 

Why join us?

You decide what jobs you accept  

Work the hours that suit you.

job_title: Senior Advisor | Enterprise | Business & Tax Advisory
job_ad_details:
Company Description

  • Flexible working arrangements | Work from home options | Part time opportunities (minimum of 4 days)
  • Mental health programs | 26 weeks paid parental leave
  • Promotion opportunities | On-the-job coaching

Job Description

More than ever before, tax is playing a vital role in shaping political and business agendas as the world faces rapid globalisation and increased competition. We are equipped to deliver new ways of thinking, big-picture perspectives and acute insights that help clients make informed choices to deal with complex issues.

 Your Opportunity

With continued growth, we are now looking to recruit a Senior Advisor or Assistant Manager to join our Business & Tax team in Brisbane.

As a Senior Advisor/ Assistant Manager, you will be involved in and exposed to the following:

  • Preparation of financial statements for all entities including sole traders, companies, trusts and partnerships for review by the senior accountant/ manager;
  • Preparation of income tax returns for all entities including individuals, companies, trusts and partnerships for review by the senior accountant/ manager;
  • Preparation of business activity statements for review by the senior accountant/manager;
  • Preparation of workpaper to support the completion of the above for review by the senior accountant/manager;
  • Processing of journals into client software
  • Contacting the ATO in relation to various client matters including payment arrangements
  • Review and sorting of client information
  • Assistance with research for the preparation of advice and file notes

Qualifications

How are you Extraordinary?

At KPMG, we believe diversity of thought, background and unique experience strengthens relationships and delivers meaningful benefits to our people, our clients, and communities.

As the successful candidates you will:

  • be CA or Part CA equivalent qualified
  • be able to demonstrate knowledge and experience your area
  • have a relevant tertiary or post-grad qualification
  • possess highly developed written and verbal communication skills, and interpersonal qualities
  • be able to present confidently
  • display initiative and be excited to help create innovative solutions in a changing world of service delivery.

Additional Information

KPMG is a professional services firm with global outreach and deep sector experience. We work with clients across an array of industries to solve complex challenges, steer change and enable growth. 

Our people are what make KPMG the thriving workplace that it is and what sets us apart is that we know great minds think differently. Collaborate with a team of passionate, highly skilled professionals who’ve got your back. You’ll build relationships with unique and diverse colleagues who will provide you with the support you need to be your best and produce meaningful and impactful work in an inclusive, equitable culture.

At KPMG, you’ll take control over how you work. We’re embracing a new way of working in many ways, from offering flexible hours and locations to generous paid parental leave and career breaks. Our people enjoy a variety of exciting perks, including retail discounts, health and wellbeing initiatives, learning and growth opportunities, salary packaging options and more.

Diverse candidates have diverse needs. During your recruitment journey, information will be provided about adjustment requests. If you require additional support before submitting your application, please contact the Talent Support Team.

At KPMG every career is different, and we look forward to seeing how you grow with us.

Registered Nurse (Day Surgery)

Strathfield Private Hospital

Permanent Full Time/Part Time basis.

 

About the Role

We are seeking experienced nurses to join our supportive team to provide our patients with specialised and dedicated care.  As a Ramsay Health Care Nurse, you will perform duties with the support and guidance of the Nurse Unit Manager, Clinical Nurse and Shift Leaders to ensure a high level of quality patient care is delivered within the ward.  In this role, you will be working across the day surgery unit, endoscopy unit and the pre-admission clinic.

The hospital’s Day Surgery Unit offers elective surgery or diagnostic procedures in a modern and comfortable setting with a private, peaceful recovery area where patients can recuperate under the care of trained nursing staff. 

About You

To be successful in the role you will demonstrate the following –

  • Highly organised individual
  • Excellent communication skills
  • Strong commitment to providing exceptional customer service.  
  • You will bring a strong clinical skillset in a hospital setting as a trained Nurse with a focus on procedural care.
  • The successful candidate will demonstrate excellent time management and organisational skills.
  • You will also be comfortable with effectively working in a team environment and independently.

Experience within an endoscopy or surgical unit will be highly regarded. The right candidate must be willing to be trained in endoscopy unit if they do not possess experience in this specialty.

You will also demonstrate;

  • Current registration with AHPRA
  • Minimum 2 years of post-graduate experience in a surgical ward
  • Previous recent experience in endoscopy (highly regarded)
  • Understanding of scope of practice in line with relevant registration

This position requires someone with flexibility and the ability work in a fast-paced environment.  

Remuneration

$34.43 - $48.33 + superannuation based on experience level and qualifications, exclusive of penalties or allowances. (NSW RN/Midwife gr1-gr8) [FTE 68,033.68 - $95,500.08]

About Ramsay

Strathfield Private Hospital has been servicing the community of Sydney’s inner west for over 30 years and is owned by global hospital group Ramsay Health Care. We cater for a broad range of health care needs from day surgery procedures to highly complex surgery.

Our facilities encompass 84 beds, 7 operating theatres, 1 endoscopy suite, 1 cardiac catheterisation lab, a 10 bed Intensive Care Unit and a Day Surgery Unit. We also have onsite radiology, pathology, café and specialist consulting suites.

The Hospital is operated by Ramsay Health Care, a global operator of private hospitals and primary care clinics with 72 Australian sites employing over 30,000 people. Ramsay focuses on maintaining the highest standards of quality and safety, being an employer of choice, and operating its business according to The Ramsay Way philosophy: "People Caring for People".

GMH Solutions

Cairns, Cairns & Far North QLD

Electricians (Trades & Services)

Full Time

GMH Solutions - Our Company - Your Future

General, Managed & Health - Electrical Solutions

 

Who are we?

GMH Solutions are a locally based Cairns electrical contracting company who understands the importance of electrical compliance and safety. GMH Solutions specializes in serving commercial, government and health clients by delivering quality outcomes, with peace of mind, and on time.

 

What are we trying to achieve?

It's our vision to be the most trusted of all electrical companies, aspiring to be recognised through our team’s dedication to always deliver value and customer satisfaction whilst setting the standard for excellence in service, innovation, and safety.

How are we trying to achieve this?

We prioritise communication, innovation, and attention to detail.

 

Does this sound good to you?

We’re looking for someone that’s wanting to make the most out of their career, to be a part of, grow with, and support our amazing and friendly team. If you think this is something you want to be a part of, we'd really like if you could:

Work well in team environments

Liaise with clients in a professional manner.  

Be self-motivated, with the desire to achieve.  

Liaise with suppliers in a professional manner.  

Be able to work unsupervised, with confidence.  

Be neat, organised, and efficient at completing tasks.

If you're good at most things though are needing some support within your current role and are wanting a change that will help you advance your career, we'll need you to:

Have the ability to adapt, learn, and integrate within new environments.  

Because we're here to help.

 

What we have to offer:

We strongly promote training and understanding of the work at hand to ensure confidence with whatever task is being completed, along with working in a team environment to allow everyone to achieve and rise together. We also have:

Full time work.

Company incentives.

Fantastic remuneration.

Great values and team culture.

Company vehicle / phone / overtime rates.

Opportunities to advance your skills with training for certificates.

Opportunities to grow and develop within a professional environment.

 

What type or work are you looking to be a part of?

Currently the majority of our work is evenly split between commercial new builds, commercial renovations and commercial maintenance. 

We complete a large amount of government work which will consist of anything from condition assessment audits, LED retrofits, emergency stop control system upgrades and switchboard replacements. 

We have also recently partnered with Schneider Electric and are now their North Queensland Representative for EV Charging Solutions, which is a really exciting, interesting and developing industry. 

 

Your must haves:

To be able to work with our team, the items below are a must have:

A current CPR/LVR certificate

A current Australian drivers’ licence.

Current QLD Electrical license – non-restricted

A current construction induction card (white/blue card).

Trade Tools

 

How to apply:

Simply ‘Apply for this job’ via SEEK or Email a copy of your cover letter and resume to info@gmhsolutions.com.au

Looking forward to hearing from you!

The Loan Doc & Proc Analyst 1 is a trainee professional role. Requires a good knowledge of the range of processes, procedures and systems to be used in perform assigned tasks and a basic understanding of the underlying concepts and principles upon which the job is based. Good understanding of how the team interacts with others in accomplishing the objectives of the area. Makes judgements based on the analysis of factual information. They are expected to resolve problems by identifying and selecting solutions through the application of acquired technical experience and will be guided by precedents. Must be able to exchange information in a concise and logical way as well as be sensitive to audience diversity. Limited but direct impact on the business through the quality of the tasks/services provided. Impact of the job holder is restricted to own job. Individual must be accountable, ethical, results oriented, trustworthy and credible.                             

This job description provides a high-level review of the types of work performed. Other job-related duties may be assigned as required.

Responsibilities:

  • This role will be reviewing loan documentation and process loan servicing related tasks. Activities will include independently processing and closing loans within a complex loan operations environment

  • Involved in providing day-to-day servicing, which may include booking cash transactions and making payments, input of general ledger entries and (complex) calculations

  • There may be possible interaction with other counterparties around positions and outstanding balances/claims               

  • Supports an expansive and/or diverse array of products (risk and control) /services

  • Follows established procedures to identify and resolve problems related to loan documentation/processing activities that require investigation or research and makes recommendations to management to support process improvement

  • Designs and analyze moderately complex loan documentation reports for management requirements, support/control activities, and the launch of products/services

  • Makes judgments based on the analysis of factual information, and provides assistance in the implementation of loan documentation process improvements

  • Minimizes risk to the bank through increased knowledge of procedural requirements - understands and monitors errors to suggest process improvements, and adhere to audit and control policies

  • Often related, but not limited to loan documentation processes

  • Timely management and escalation of all inquiries and issues related to loan processing

  • Demonstrates a sound level of understanding of products and processes, and of how duties relate/integrate with others in the team and closely related teams

  • Demonstrates an excellent knowledge of Bank related systems

  • Has direct interaction with external customers to disseminate or explain information

  • Individuals at this level exhibit strong executional capabilities

  • Utilizes strong communication, interpersonal and diplomacy skills to interact with colleagues and stakeholders, and to exchange potentially complex/sensitive information, while being sensitive to audience diversity

  • Appropriately assess risk when business decisions are made, demonstrating particular consideration for the firm's reputation and safeguarding Citigroup, its clients and assets, by driving compliance with applicable laws, rules and regulations, adhering to Policy, applying sound ethical judgment regarding personal behavior, conduct and business practices, and escalating, managing and reporting control issues with transparency.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   

Qualifications:

  • 0-2 years Experience

  • Elementary level knowledge of Business Processes, Systems and Tools used in the Loan Process

  • Demonstrate understanding of Loan Processes, Procedures, Products and Services

  • Basic awareness of managing, preparing, and reviewing loan documentation

  • Able to identify, mitigate, manage, resolve, and escalate risks and issues

  • Awareness of various risks, policies and control measures and processes

  • Comply with applicable laws, rules, and regulations, and adhering to Policies


Education:

About the team

The Educational Measurement and Assessment team implement large-scale national and international research studies that help us to know the health of the New Zealand Education system. We work with international partners such as the Organisation for Economic Cooperation and Development (OECD) and International Association for the Evaluation of Educational Achievement (IEA).

Senior Analyst

Are you looking for a large project to lead?

We are looking for an experienced and confident senior analyst with excellent leadership and personal organisation to lead and manage research and analysis in our Teaching and Learning International Study (TALIS).

Our Senior Analysts need excellent project and people management skills.

We are working with hundreds of schools, at any one time to implement research involving thousands of students and hundreds of teachers and principals. We work to strict international deadlines and quality standards. At times study leads will be directing the work of 20-50 temporary staff in order to achieve our collections.

Proficiency using statistical analytical packages such as R and SAS for quantitative analysis. Clear report writing, presentation, knowledge of survey and sampling design and project management are key skills required.

We highly value previous experience in educational research, especially working with policy colleagues and international partner agencies.

Fluency in Te Reo is not required but will be highly valued.

Note International travel may be required in the future.

If you have questions about the roles please phone or e-mail 027 403 5657 Barclay.anstiss@education.govt.nz

job_title: Customer Service: Client Support Specialist (FIXED TERM)
job_ad_details:
We're on the lookout for an empathetic, tech-savvy individual who thrives in delivering exceptional customer service with an eye for detail. If you’re passionate about combining your empathy and tech skills to meet customer needs, we’d love to have you join us at Streamline Business Group!

About Us:

Streamline Business Group Limited, based in the vibrant city of Auckland, is a front-runner in delivering comprehensive Business Process solutions across Australasia and the South Pacific.

Our Philosophy:

Why: We believe that everyone should be unleashed to operate in their zone of genius.
How: Exceptional people working together, designing efficient processes, and using enabling technologies.
What: The right information, at the right time, to the right people, to make the right decisions.

The Role:

As a Customer Service: Client Support Specialist in our team, you'll be pivotal in ensuring our clients' donors receive top-notch service. You'll join a growing team dedicated to nurturing and expanding our clients' donor community with every interaction.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Engaging in donor-centric communications, delivering exceptional experiences.
  • Implementing strategies to retain and grow our client’s donor base.
  • Handling administrative tasks with precision, ensuring accurate donor data management.
  • Contributing to the team’s weekly goals and objectives.

Your Daily Tasks:

  • Making retention calls to strengthen donor relationships.
  • Welcoming new donors and thanking long-term supporters.
  • Utilising CRM tools to keep donor information up-to-date and actionable.

About You:
As a vital team member, you'll dive into supporting our mission and making a positive impact on our client’s donor care initiatives. You’re a tech-savvy communicator, adept with CRM systems, and excel in empathetic communication.

Essential Personal Competencies:

  • Strong customer service skills with confidence in outbound phone-based activities.
  • Excellent team player, contributing to group growth and success.
  • Proactive in problem-solving and detail-oriented tasks.
  • Exceptional communication skills, coupled with high empathy.
  • Tech-savvy and comfortable with various software.

Join Us:

This role is your chance to leverage your empathy, technical know-how, and commitment to customer service excellence to shape the future of our clients' donor support. Based in our Wairau office in Auckland, this fixed-term role offers competitive remuneration of $27 per hour, Monday to Friday, 9 am-5 pm, until March/April 2024.

Interested?

Send your resume and a cover letter, sharing why this role is your Zone of Genius, to hr@streamlinebusiness.net by 07.01.2024. We can’t wait to see what you bring to our team!

We appreciate your interest in joining us and look forward to reviewing your application.

LSEG is an Equal Opportunities employer, we strive to establish teams that are diverse and encourage collaborative working and sharing of ideas!

Lead Software Engineer (GG11) – JAVA, Cloud

In this role, you will perform development activities in an agile team, leading on technical solutions, design and writing quality code as well as software testing. This role requires the delivery of good quality software to meet customers' needs. Coaching and mentoring team members alongside leadership skills are important for this role.

Responsibilities:

  • Engage with product owners, architects and other specialists in order to understand business requirement, technical requirement.

  • Translate business and technical requirements into detailed design specifications for application code and modules.

  • Provide design recommendations, developing and integrating programs per written specifications.

  • Occasionally responsible for writing moderate to complex design specifications.

  • Build and maintain efficient, reusable, reliable and secure code based on User Stories

  • Work within a multi-functional agile team and actively participate in Scrum meetings.

  • Participate in refinement and planning sessions, you'll work with other colleagues to analyze development requirements, provide design options and complexity estimates, and agree how to deliver the requirements effectively.

  • Work closely with team members to set timeframes of the assigned User Stories and details milestones to meet customer and business needs.

  • Demonstrating a consistent focus on your good quality of software through the creation and execution of automated tests using Agile/Scrum process

  • Coaching/mentoring junior team members.

  • Identifies ways to improve the operation of own area and the team and to achieve efficiencies and results.

  • Provide technical support to operations or other development teams.

  • Doing code review with junior staffs to ensure the good quality of code and drive on test automation.

Required Skills:

  • Graduate or post graduate degree or equivalent experience in Computer Science or Software Engineering

  • Proven experience working in software development or related filed.

  • Knowledge of Design Pattern, UML and Object-oriented Programming

  • Knowledge of Distributed System Design and Implementation

  • Knowledge of Web-based Enterprise Application Development and Web Service on platforms such as Tomcat

  • Experienced software engineer with excellent knowledge of Java J2EE and/or Python.

  • Experienced in Cloud technology, e.g. AWS, Azure.

  • Solid technical background with understanding of programming styles, frameworks, design patterns and unit testing.

  • Understanding of security implications and secure coding

  • Practical experience with agile development methodologies and tools (Scrum, JIRA etc.)

  • Skill for writing clean, readable code and reusable components.

  • Experience with Test Driven Development and / or Behavior Driven Development

  • Self-motivated, pressure-tolerant, and result-oriented personality

  • Good communication and interpersonal skills

  • Proficient in English for both spoken and written.

Sounds exciting to you? Apply now and get connected with us!

We believe that creating a diverse and inclusive organisation is fundamental to the way we deliver on our promise of creating essential partnerships and open opportunities. Our open culture is central to how we deliver our purpose - driving financial stability, empowering economies and enabling customers to create sustainable growth - in everything we do.

Working with us means that you will be part of a dynamic organisation of 25,000 people across 70 countries. However, we will value your individuality and enable you to bring your true self to work so you can help enrich our diverse workforce. You will be part of a collaborative and creative culture where we encourage new ideas and are committed to sustainability across our global business. You will experience the critical role we have in helping to re-engineer the financial ecosystem to support and drive sustainable economic growth. Together, we are aiming to achieve this growth by accelerating the just transition to net zero, enabling growth of the green economy and creating inclusive economic opportunity.

We offer a range of tailored benefits and support, including healthcare, retirement planning, paid volunteering days and wellbeing initiatives.

About UOB

United Overseas Bank Limited (UOB) is a leading bank in Asia with a global network of more than 500 branches and offices in 19 countries and territories in Asia Pacific, Europe and North America. In Asia, we operate through our head office in Singapore and banking subsidiaries in China, Indonesia, Malaysia and Thailand, as well as branches and offices.

Our history spans more than 80 years. Over this time, we have been guided by our values — Honorable, Enterprising, United and Committed. This means we always strive to do what is right, build for the future, work as one team and pursue long-term success. It is how we work, consistently, be it towards the company, our colleagues or our customers.

The Retail function provides Personal and Business Banking customers with financial solutions tailored to their needs. We help them manage their money wisely and meet their financial goals through an extensive range of products and services. These include deposit, insurance, secured and unsecured loans, investment and wealth advisory services.

We design and provide products and services that empower our customers to enjoy greater banking convenience while they extract more value from their money. In particular, we are focused on promoting and developing healthy saving and investment practices across generations.

At Only About Children (Oac) we like to do things a little differently. We have seasonal healthy menus designed by our own nutritionists and prepared by our campus chefs each day and an in-house Health team including speech pathologists and occupational therapists who can work directly with children, Educators and families where any developmental delays or issues can be supported.

Only About Children Warriewood West is a brand new purpose-built child care centre that has recently been recognized as Exceeding National Standards by ACECQA. This leading service offers six rooms and a magical playground for children to learn and grow under the supervision and teachings of our professional educators. To us, it’s important that our team is happy, not just in their individual careers, but working alongside one another. We are proud to reward the hard work of our Educators and team members, with a range of benefits such as; competitive pay, discounted childcare fees, wellbeing leave, learning and development, financial support for training or study, service recognition and access to our Employee Assistance Program.

Mater is Queensland’s largest and most innovative not-for-profit healthcare service, providing care for almost 700,000 patients a year across a network of 11 hospitals.

We are a leader in healthcare, education and research — and that’s because we employ exceptional people.

About the role

Mater Private Hospital Brisbane are seeking enthusiastic Registered Nurses with experience in Anaesthetics for permanent positions, full time or part time roles on offer an immediate start available. 

This is an exceptional opportunity to join Mater’s South Brisbane Perioperative department which boasts 13 operating theatres (including 3 Neuroscience theatres) across our private hospital settings. 

Salary range: $38.16 – $49.04 (Registered Nurse Level 1) per hour plus superannuation & Salary Packaging 

What you’ll be doing

Whilst displaying the highest level of clinical standards for the unit you will be responsible for:

  • Achieving optimal patient outcomes throughout the patient journey and continuum of care
  • Demonstrating exceptional clinical expertise and knowledge of procedures and the management of patients seeking outstanding care
  • Implementing strategies to ensure that quality and risk management are integrated into service provision
  • Working collaboratively with the nursing team to provide exceptional care every time
  • Maintaining current knowledge and skills to ensure continued professional growth

About you

You will be driven by a challenging yet rewarding environment where you can bring your energy and experience to this dynamic and exciting unit.

Other skills and experience include:

  • Current AHPRA nursing registration as a Registered Nurse (no restrictions)
  • Minimum 3 years’ experience as a Registered Nurse in an Anaesthetics setting
  • Ability to work in an ever-changing and fast paced environment
  • A strong work ethic, positive attitude and willingness to role model and promote the Mater values
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills and the ability to liaise with all levels of the multidisciplinary team
  • Demonstrated ability to operate both in a team environment and autonomously using initiative, sound reasoning and strong listening, negotiation and decision making skills
  • Strong attention to detail and organisational skills
  • Commitment to ensuring the levels of service is always delivered to patients at all times.

Why join us?

Joining a 10,000+ strong workforce, you will have the opportunity to work for an Australian leader in the field of Health, Education, Research and Foundation and work with a team who make a real difference to the lives of our patients, consumers and community. You will be a part of a workplace that offers compassionate care in the spirit of the Sisters of Mercy.

  • Via salary packaging arrangements allocate some living expenses directly from your pre-taxable income and ultimately increasing take-home pay
  • Access to package meal and entertainment expenses
  • Access to leading education via Mater Education
  • Flexible working arrangements, including work from home options were suitable
  • Access to our Employee Assistance Program and on-site pastoral care teams
  • Discounts to local and national business and venues for Dining/Retail/Travel & Accommodation and Other
  • Access to on-site, discounted parking
  • Discounted food and beverage at various campus cafés and coffee venues

    • 有關法定最低工資的定義及計算詳情，請瀏覽 《法定最低工資：僱主及僱員參考指引》或致電 24 小時查詢熱線 2717 1771（由「1823」接聽）。

job_title: Finance Team Leader (Full Time, Pioneer, Up $8k + AWS+VB)
job_ad_details:
Assistant Team Lead/ Team Lead (Finance dept)


Perm position

Location: Pioneer

Mon - Fri, 8.30am to 5.30pm

Salary: $6000 - $8000 + AWS + VB


Job Description

- You are expected to analyze financial and business operational information and perform meaningful analysis on the variances and performance against planned budget and prior periods.

- You will be responsible for performing monthly forecasting of the cash flow and financial figures of the Company, as well as involved in the yearly budgeting process.

- As a large portion of sales are arising from intercompany sales, you will be expected to perform quarterly review of transfer pricing calculation.

- You will be expected to connect to the needs of both internal stakeholders

(management, intercompanies, various business units) and external stakeholders (bankers. auditors, tax consultants, government authorities etc).

- You will be involved in various financial projects such as review of internal controls and procedures as part of risk management, integrated reporting and other projects (transfer pricing. license fee, warehouse solution implementation etc) whenever necessary.


Requirements

- At least a bachelor's degree in accountancy, preferably with 5 to 8 years of relevant

working experience in commercial and audit.

- Recognised professional accounting qualification.


Contact : 98254517 Or you may click 'Apply Now'


Only shortlisted candidates will be informed

Gracelyn Teo Jia En | R21101213

RecruitFirst Pte Ltd | EA13C6342

Conduct thorough financial analysis to assess business performance, identify trends, and evaluate budget and forecast variances, then develop and implement strategies to enhance business growth and profitability. Evaluate market trends and consumer behaviour to uncover revenue growth opportunities, and collaborate with department heads to develop and manage budgets and forecasts, ensuring alignment with overall business objectives.

Client Details

Our client is one of the leading suppliers of raw materials and intermediate products to the personal care business. They are committed to delivering high-quality products to consumers and driving sustainable growth in the market. Due to their expanding business structure and exciting development plans, they are offering a great opportunity for a dynamic and talented professional to join their organisation as the Commercial Finance Manager. In this role, you will be the key finance support driving the strategic and commercial growth agenda within the company.

Description

  • Conduct thorough financial analysis to assess business performance, identify trends, and evaluate budget and forecast variances.
  • Develop and implement financial strategies to enhance business growth and profitability.
  • Evaluate market trends and consumer behaviour to uncover revenue growth opportunities.
  • Prepare detailed financial reports, including monthly, quarterly, and annual statements, for presentation to senior management.
  • Collaborate with department heads to develop and manage annual budgets and forecasts, monitoring performance and providing actionable recommendations to achieve financial targets.
  • Work with cross-functional teams to understand their financial needs and offer guidance.
  • Collaborate with the executive team to ensure financial strategies align with overall business objectives.
  • Ensure adherence to financial regulations and standards.

Profile

Candidates will be shortlisted based on the criteria below:

  • Bachelor's degree in Finance/Accounting or related-field; MBA or CPA preferred
  • At least 8 years of working experience in similar roles
  • Broad understanding of business processes, process auditing and internal control concepts
  • Strong analytical skills necessary to identify risks and opportunities in the business
  • Demonstrated leadership abilities and highly driven overcome challenges
  • Excellent communication skills in both verbal and written English and Bahasa Indonesia
  • High level of ethics and integrity

This position is located in Jakarta and is open only to Indonesian nationals due to government regulations.

Job Offer

  • Opportunity to advance your portfolio into a vital strategic role within the organisation
  • Excellent remuneration package based on experience
  • Potential for professional growth and advancement
  • Collaborative and inclusive work environment

To apply online please click the 'Apply' button below. For a confidential discussion about this role please contact Stella Chandra on +622129588820.

What Software Engineering contributes to Cardinal Health

Software Engineering is responsible for designing, developing, implementing and supporting applications, systems and IT products required to achieve the company's business objectives.

  • Demonstrates knowledge of software development techniques and fluency in software languages and application programming interfaces.
  • Demonstrates general understanding of hardware/software platforms including but not limited to operating systems, databases, application servers, web servers and integration technologies.
  • Plans and executes system implementations that ensure success and minimize risk of system outages or other negative production impacts.
  • Demonstrates conceptual knowledge of architecture standards and database and operating systems.
  • Demonstrates problem solving ability that allows for effective and timely resolution of system issues including but not limited to production outages.
  • Analyzes production system operations using tools such as monitoring, capacity analysis and outage root cause analysis to identify and drive change that ensures continuous improvement in system stability and performance.
  • Demonstrates knowledge of software development, life cycle, modeling of business processes, application design patterns, business/functional documents. Estimates to high level business requirements and provide options analysis.

Qualifications

  • Bachelors Degree in related field or equivalent work experience
  • 4+ years experience in related field preferred
  • Working knowledge of Automation Anywhere required with with Migration experience from Blue Prism.

What is expected of you and others at this level

  • Applies comprehensive knowledge and a thorough understanding of concepts, principles, and technical capabilities to perform varied tasks and projects
  • May contribute to the development of policies and procedures
  • Works on complex projects of large scope
  • Develops technical solutions to a wide range of difficult problems. Solutions are innovative and consistent with organization objectives
  • Completes work independently receives general guidance on new projects
  • Work reviewed for purpose of meeting objectives
  • May act as a mentor to less experienced colleagues

Cardinal Health is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or protected veteran status.

The Client

Our client is one of Australia’s largest wholesalers of Industrial and Safety products having over 50,000 products across a huge range which covers; 

  • Power Tools
  • Hand Tools
  • Automotive
  • Building & Hardware
  • Electrical
  • Welding
  • Drilling, Cutting & Abrasives
  • Safety
  • Hose & Pipe Fittings
  • Lubricants & Oils

Due to an increase in demand of their products, they are seeking several experienced Order Picker Operators that have a valid High Risk LO license to join their team based at their main Warehouse Distribution Centre in Kewdale.

 

The Role

The work is standard DC Warehouse, where you will be operating an Order Picker (Requires High Risk LO License) either conducting;

  • LO - Oder Picking 
  • LO - Putting Away Receivables

Our clients use RF Scanners and specialized warehouse software where candidates need to be competent on computers to update the system of Picked Orders & Receivables

 

 

Shifts & Working Days

Our client has 3 main shifts available which include;

  • Day Shift: 7:00 AM to 3:00 PM 
  • Afternoon: 3:00 PM to 11:00 PM 
  • Night: 11:00 PM to 7:00 AM
  • Working Days: Monday to Friday 

 

The Candidate

We are seeking experienced warehouse operatives that have at least 6 months experience in either or all the following;

  • Operating Order Pickers (LO High Risk)
  • Experienced in Warehouse Pack & Pack
  • Are confident on Computers to update warehouse system

Essential Criteria includes;

  • LO - High Risk License
  • Are able to work Monday to Fridays either in Day Shift or Afternoon Shift 
  • Are physically fit and able to carry out regular physical tasks
  • Possess good written & verbal communication skills

 

Remuneration

  • Day Shift: 7:00 AM to 3:00 PM - $32.00 Per Hour + OT + Super
  • Afternoon: 3:00 PM to 11:00 PM - $36.80 Per Hour + OT + Super
  • Night Shift: 11:00 PM to 7:00 AM - $41.60 Per Hour + OT + Super

Job Summary:


Overall, this is diverse role with a scope of responsibility including recruitment, rostering and administration. The ideal candidate will work collaboratively with the local consultant team to source and attract nursing and allied health talent from a variety of geographies. When rostering, the placement of nurses and booking of shifts and in periods of downtime, general administration.

Key Responsibilities:


Recruitment and Sourcing

  • Utilize contemporary sourcing and attraction methodologies (CRM searches,
  • LinkedIn, Seek, other sourcing platforms, etc) to identify nurses and allied health professionals
  • Ability to undertake screening, interviewing, background checks and onboarding functions to streamline the candidate experience
  • Prepare, present and schedule candidate interviews for the local consultant and clinical team
  • Maintain candidate and client records in CRM's including collating and entering data and documentation to ensure accuracy and completeness
  • Collaborating with cross-functional teams (Nurseline & Pulse Nursing) to meet sourcing needs and provide regular updates and reports on sourcing activities and outcomes to stakeholders
Rostering Support
  • Undertake rostering functions in an afterhours, on-call or coverage capacity or as directed by the Rostering Coordinator

Administration Support
  • End-to-end onboarding and compliance administrative processes(Onboarded, WorkPro, Ausmed, AHPRA registration, work rights checks, police checks, reference checks, functional screening, etc.)
  • Interaction and communication with stakeholders in-line with company policies, procedures and relevant legislation
  • Uphold the requirements of Searson Buck's ISO 9001:2025 certification in the delivery of a quality service and seek to continually improve

Requirements

  • Highly organized and able to prioritize daily workload
  • Excellent attention to detail and ability to work under tight deadlines
  • Demonstrate an inquisitive learning mindset
  • Practical understanding of Acute, Aged Care, and Allied Health terminologies

Company Profile

The Food Bank Singapore acquires donated food, much of which would otherwise be wasted, from farms, manufacturers, distributors, retail stores, consumers, and other sources, and make it available to those in need through a network of member beneficiaries.

The Food Bank Singapore was set up by Nichol and Nicholas Ng, a pair of siblings running a food distribution business, FoodXervices Inc Pte Ltd. After observing the food industry for more than a decade, they realized the need for a food bank in Singapore. Founded in January 2012, we were given charity status in August 2012 (Co.Reg No: 201200654E) and IPC status in May 2015.

Our vision is to be the prevailing centralized coordinating organization for all food donations and to play a key role in the reduction of food wastage and ending food insecurity.

Job Description

  • Assist in receiving, sorting, and storing donated food items
  • Conduct regular inventory checks and stock-taking
  • Assist in packing and distributing food items to partner organizations and beneficiaries
  • Ensure food safety and hygiene standards are met
  • Maintain a clean and organized warehouse environment
  • Assist in the planning and execution of warehouse operations and logistics

About us

PCS Measurement has been servicing Australian and international customers since its formation in 1985. PCS Measurement is a family owned and operated business with a strong focus on providing outstanding customer support and service across Australia. PCS Measurement has a strong reputation in providing the below services:

  • Calibration of electronic and mechanical weighing equipment
  • Calibration of testing machines and force measuring equipment
  • Calibration of heat and temperature equipment
  • Calibration of dimensional metrology & measuring equipment
  • Calibration and maintenance of electrical test equipment
  • We also have a huge range of items on our scope of NATA Accreditation.

For more information regarding PCS Measurement visit the website: www.pcsmeasure.com.au .

This role is very hands on and will include:

  • We are looking for an experienced scale  technician based in our Newcastle office who has genuine, hardworking and has respectful values, a team-oriented person, with a passion for customer service. The role would include repair, routine maintenance and calibration of electronic and mechanical weighing equipment, including balances and scales, There will be an opportunity to enhance your career within our organisation, with training and experience in many of the other areas of our business.
  • The successful candidate will be offered an attractive package and working conditions including a fully maintained company vehicle.  This is an excellent opportunity to join a very friendly family owned business with an excellent team culture.
  • Undertaking repair, servicing and calibration activities across a range of electrical, mechanical, pressure, force and temperature equipment.
  • Must be outgoing and  have the initiative and ability to work unsupervised at times
  • Work will be based at our Sandgate NSW office and throughout Australia.
  • There will be much to learn with on the job training due to diversity of clients and equipment.
  • A good understanding of Excel and Windows based computer software for calibration reporting.
  • Mechanical or instrumentation experience, including calibration experience.
  • The capacity to be able to travel, sometimes at short notice, is required. Must be willing to travel away from home for work for periods up to 1 week at a time.
  • Someone who is a team player, reliable and a good communicator
  • As this role interacts with customers daily the ideal applicant will have a commitment to providing the best service possible for our clients.
  • Someone willing to learn.
  • A full Australian driver's licence is a requirement.
  • Construction white card is a requirement
  • Current police check is a requirement
  • Forklift licence would be an advantage
  • Any experience with NATA would also be a huge advantage.
  • A background in electrical, instrumentation  or fitting would be a huge advantage.

job_title: Head of Nursing - Tūmuaki Mahi Tāpuhi (Postgraduate or Undergraduate)
job_ad_details:
Wintec's Te Kura Mō Ngā Mahi Tiaki I Te Hapori (Centre for Health and Social Practice) is seeking a highly motivated Head of Nursing to join the Centre's inter-professional management team, based in Hamilton.

If you value working collaboratively with other health professional educators in a dynamic and rapidly changing environment, delivering nursing education for local, regional and international benefit, this is an opportunity not to be missed!

About the role

In this role you will be responsible for managing the day-to-day academic activities of the nursing team (Postgraduate or Undergraduate), and ensuring all resources are in place for a quality learning environment. You will guide and support staff to achieve agreed teaching, research and industry engagement outcomes and to grow professionally.

You will lead a team of nurse educators responsible for teaching bicultural programmes either Undergraduate or Postgraduate informed by an excellent understanding of Treaty-based practice. Maintaining productive working relationships within the nursing programmes and across Wintec will also be important. Similarly, maintaining current industry connections and fostering new ones is key.

Not only will you keep abreast of the latest information and technology, you will create valuable opportunities for students and manage the delivery and development of programmes for flexible delivery locally and internationally. You will be a strategic thinker who has a vision for the future of nursing.

Are you an ideal candidate?

Do you have relevant industry experience as well as a professional qualification(s) in nursing? With your highly developed communication skills, line management experience and the ability to build and maintain strong relationships with relevant industry sectors, you could find your next role in our Centre's energetic and future focused management team.

Ideally applicants will have the following:

  • Passion and clear vision for the future of nursing
  • Strong nursing background in both educational and clinical contexts
  • Proven leadership competence within a complex, fast paced, changing environment
  • Demonstrated understanding of Te Tiriti o Waitangi
  • A passion for supporting students to succeed
  • An understanding of the tertiary education sector

If applicable, appointment with a further title of Associate Professor or Professor will be considered, commensurate with relevant academic experience.

Working at Wintec

Wintec continues to be one of the leading tertiary institutes by keeping up with industry trends and focusing on innovation.

You'll be supported to stay industry connected and have generous opportunities to develop your career through the professional development opportunities available to you.

Working in Hamilton

Hamilton is one of New Zealand's fastest growing cities. It has an urban and semi-urban population of about 180,000, plenty of schools - public and private, a temperate climate and distinctive rural character. The city sits on the banks of the Waikato River, linked by a series of bridges.

The city is generally safe, quiet and without major traffic jams. House prices are more affordable than many of New Zealand's major centres (such as Auckland, Wellington and Christchurch). Hamilton has its own domestic airport and is 90 minutes away from the country's main international airport in Auckland. Hamilton's central location - in the middle of the North Island - makes it an ideal springboard for beaches, lakes and mountains. It's less than two hours' drive to the popular tourist destinations of Rotorua, Taupō and the Coromandel Peninsula.

Join the Centre for Health and Social Practice and take the next exciting step in your career.

Lead change, shape the world at Wintec - apply now and accept a leadership challenge.

As a Project Manager, you will be responsible for planning, developing and executing mining infrastructure and facility projects and programs site-wide in accordance to the company construction, engineering, environmental and safety standards. This job will be based in Kalimantan

Client Details

Our client is one of the major players in Indonesian mining industry. A well-respected company with presence in several areas and boasting a strong track record historically.

Description

  • Manage all activities related to construction works such as site infrastructure, earthwork, temporary facilities, civil work, etc. from beginning to the end including planning, execution, completion, and delivery.
  • Hire and manage team of contractors for construction.
  • Ensure compliance with health and safety regulations and codes
  • Provide support and input to several aspects of project process including material / equipment procurement, contracts, budget and cost control, and overall project management of construction works
  • Monitor and prepare reports regarding project status and progress to ensure projects are going according to plan including schedule, cost control, materials management, QC.
  • Coordinate with other related functions such as engineering, health and safety, permits, and environmental
  • Ensure projects are going according to plan and identify in advance any risk / crisis potential.

Profile

  • Minimum Bachelor's degree in Civil Engineering or related degree
  • Minimum 10 years of experience with portfolio handling mining infrastructure projects in managerial role
  • PMP or equivalent certification would be considered an asset
  • Previous experience in a leadership role with strong and proven leadership skills
  • Strong technical knowledge in design and construction methods including civil, structural, mechanical, and electrical works
  • Have an excellent understanding of mining business process and risk management

Job Offer

  • Great career prospects for a well-established company
  • Competitive remuneration package

job_title: Health Manager Level 1 - Clinical Trials - Tweed
job_ad_details:

Position Classification: Health Mgr Lvl 1
Remuneration: $78079 - $105030 per annum
Hours Per Week: 8

  The Tweed Hospital is seeking a Health Manager who will be managing all aspects of the primary coordination of clinical trials, and the management of patients on those trials. Organising the patients’ journeys on studies, ensuring accurate data collection and responsible for adherence to Good Clinical Research Practice (GCRP), Ethics and Research Governance policies.
 
 
If you have:
  • Degree in Science (preferably in social, biological, pharmacy or nursing healthcare sciences)
  • Knowledge and/or experience of clinical trial coordination and understanding and adherence of the WHO guidelines of Good Clinical Practice
  • Experience facilitating patient recruitment and follow up strategies with clinic personnel and operational problem solving

 

We can offer you:

  • Flexible and supportive work environment
  • Diverse career pathways
  • Professional and personal development
  • Opportunities to start or build a career, or re-enter the workforce
  • Challenging, inspiring and rewarding roles, and
  • The opportunity to make a difference!

 

Northern NSW Local Health District embraces the diverse skills and perspectives that our people bring to the workplace. We foster inclusiveness and diversity to help us deliver quality care to our community.

 

NNSWLHD is committed to reconciliation and strongly encourages Aboriginal & Torres Strait Islander people to apply for this position. All applications from Aboriginal & Torres Strait Islander people will be viewed most favourably.  For help with your application to this role visit Stepping Up, our online recruitment resource for Aboriginal people.

  • 空缺咭展示的職位空缺資料，包括職位名稱、職責內容、工作時間、薪金等，均是由僱主提供。如果求職人士在面試時，僱主提出不合理的要求，或所提供的僱傭條件與本處登記的資料不符，請盡快通知本處。為免墮入求職陷阱，在面試時應注意聘用條件（包括計薪方法、工資期、休息日安排等），了解職位的工作範圍及入職要求，並留意工作環境。此外，請特別留意工作性質及內容會否抵觸現行法例，切勿因急於求職而接受聘用從事非法工作。
  • 僱主及職業介紹所向本處遞交職位招聘表時，已承諾會按照《最低工資條例》的規定，就任何工資期，支付不少於法定最低工資水平的工資予受聘有關職位並受《最低工資條例》涵蓋的人士 。
  • 如你有合理懷疑僱主未有遵守《僱傭條例》、《僱員補償條例》、《最低工資條例》，可致電熱線2717 1771（由1823接聽）或電郵至enquiry@labour.gov.hk 查詢。至於涉及《性別歧視條例》、《殘疾歧視條例》、《家庭崗位歧視條例》或《種族歧視條例》的查詢，請聯絡平等機會委員會。
  • 根據《最低工資條例》的規定，僱主須就任何工資期，確保支付僱員不少於按下列方法計算的最低工資：

    最低工資=僱員於工資期的總工作時數 x 法定最低工資水平（即每小時40元1）
    1由2023年5月1日起，法定最低工資水平已調升至每小時40元。

    • 如就工資期須支付予僱員的工資少於最低工資，僱員有權就該工資期獲付這差額（即「額外報酬」）。該僱員的僱傭合約須視為他有權就該工資期獲得額外報酬，而該額外報酬亦適用於計算根據其他相關法例所應獲得的款項。
    • 有關法定最低工資的定義及計算詳情，請瀏覽 《法定最低工資：僱主及僱員參考指引》或致電 24 小時查詢熱線 2717 1771（由「1823」接聽）。

As a General Manager of Supply Chain, you will be given the opportunity to lead the supply chain team in formulating effective distribution strategies. You must demonstrate solid leadership and analytical skills, along with a strong business mindset.

Client Details

Our client is a multinational company within the construction world. Being one of the biggest players in Indonesia, they are currently looking for a senior leader to be their General Manager that will lead the growth in the company.

Description

  • Implement new systems / modules to increase overall productivity of the supply chain.
  • Oversee and lead the internal supply chain team, which includes Production Planning, Warehouse and Delivery
  • Implement various effective processes and strategies, along with operational improvement projects .
  • Ensures optimal utilization of the technology and lean solutions.
  • Works in liaison and collaborate with internal teams, such as Marketing, Sales, Finance, and Product Innovation team to achieve growth.
  • Ensure smooth flow of products in & out of the DC and manage the carriers.
  • Strong control of suppliers to ensure on time delivery of products for manufacturing.

Profile

  • Bachelor's Degree in business, engineering or a related field (MBA Graduates preferred).
  • Having leadership role in at least one of the following functions of Supply Chain: Demand Planning and Field. Operations, Manufacturing Strategy & Operations, Logistics & Distributions.
  • Well developed communication and problem solving skills.
  • Experienced in handling complex and detailed situations.
  • Comfortable with uncertainty.
  • Have one or more licenses/certifications in APICS, CPIM, CSSP, PMP or/and LEAN.

Job Offer

  • Stable Multinational Company
  • All-inclusive work environment with high level of work recognition
  • Work with people from different cultures

job_title: Online English Teacher (Guaranteed Hours, Adult Students) - WSE
job_ad_details:
ATTENTION GREAT TEACHERS & TUTORS!

Are you a really great teacher because you are passionate about inspiring those you teach?

Let The Really Great Teacher Company support your personal and professional growth on your journey to influence students through teaching English.

An opportunity with us also includes:

CAREER ADVANCEMENT: Many opportunities will be available in the future for growth and movement into more senior positions.

DEDICATED SUPPORT TEAM: We provide all the materials and the human support you need.

PROFESSIONAL DEVELOPMENT: Our Inspiration Academy has free courses available for our whole team, in various fields of study, to support your professional growth at your own pace.

PERSONAL DEVELOPMENT: Join our Evolve program and enjoy wellness, fitness, fun, and community events, from the comfort of your own home.

POSITION DETAILS

Start Date:

  • Immediate upon completion of the recruitment process.

Teaching Hours:

  • Guaranteed approximately 30 hours per week!

Students:  

  • Adult professionals over the age of 18.
  • Students are based throughout Europe, Asia, the Middle East, and South America.

Remuneration:

  • Set base rate of 10 USD per hour.

﻿Contract type:

  • You will be contracted by The Really Great Teacher Company as an Independent Service Provider.

Location:

  • Work from the convenience of your home.

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES

  • Deliver English lessons and guidance to students.
  • Create a fun and engaging classroom environment by facilitating one-on-one or group instruction & utilizing world-class teaching methods.
  • Lead discussions, assess student performance, and provide constructive feedback.
Requirements

Applicants must have:

  • Bachelor's Degree or higher (Any field)
  • Completed, accredited 120-hour or above TEFL, TESOL, CELTA
  • 6 months' teaching or tutoring experience
  • English first language speakers from USA/Canada/UK/Ireland/Australia/New Zealand
  • Must be based in Central America, South America, or South-East Asia (Mexico/Brazil/Cambodia/Thailand/Vietnam/Bali etc.)
  • Computer literate
  • Clear criminal record
  • Engaging and inspiring communication skills
  • Punctual and precise timekeeping
  • Available to fit into allocated teaching shift slots
  • You are aligned with The Really Great Teacher Company's values and a culture fit

TECHNICAL REQUIREMENTS (NON-NEGOTIABLE)

PC specifications: 

    • Processor: Intel ® Core™ i5 CPU @2.0GHz (4 CPUs) or greater. 
    • Memory: 8GB RAM or greater. 

Backup power:  

    • Uninterrupted Power Supply (UPS) with a battery life of up to 4-5 hours (2000VA) (or willing to purchase before commencing teaching). This is applicable and a non-negotiable requirement for candidates based in a country where regular power interruptions occur.

A stable fibre internet connection:

    • At a minimum of 20 Mbps upload and download speeds. 
    • PC is connected via a LAN cable and not via a Wi-Fi connection.  

Noise-cancelling headsets and HD web camera:

    • Backup headset is highly recommended. 

Tidy, well-lit, and quiet teaching environment.
