Role: Centre Director

Location: Western QLD

Centre: Goodstart Mount Isa

Employment Type: Full Time, Permanent 

Pay: $40-$45/hr + Super 

  • Use your experience in early learning to manage and develop your own centre, guiding the next generation of educators
  • Competitive pay – 12% above award + childcare discount + salary packaging available
  • Work for Australia’s largest early learning Not-for-Profit


Are you an experienced early learning professional who’s ready to take their career to the next level, honing leadership skills and building a successful business?

As part of the Centre Leadership team, you’ll play a pivotal role supporting and developing the Teachers and Educators in your centre. You’ll form strong relationships with children, families and communities, and understand the significance of your role in their lives.

In this role, you will:

  • Deliver our bespoke learning program developed in collaboration with global leaders in pedagogical practice
  • Build and encourage a talented team of early learning professionals, sharing your knowledge and contributing to a culture of reflective practice and ongoing improvement
  • Work with your team to plan for the future of your centre, building the attendance pipeline and maintaining a revenue-generating business
     

About Goodstart Mount Isa

Mount Isa is a 75-placement centre and caters the children from nursery to Kidergarten. Guided by the Early Years Learning Framework and National Quality Standards, our passionate educators ensure that every child receives the best possible start in their lifelong learning journey. We offer a funded and approved Kindergarten program, supporting children's development in the year before school using the Queensland Kindergarten Learning Guidelines. 

Embracing cultural diversity and fostering strong community ties, we aim to build meaningful relationship with families while respecting their unique cultures and values. 

What Goodstart can offer you:

  • We truly value you – that’s why we pay more. At Goodstart, Centre Directors get at least 12% above the award rate
  • Up to 50% discount off your childcare gap fees and 4 weeks paid parental leave – increasing to 6 weeks from December 2023 
  • Tax benefits through salary packaging – a great way to pay for expenses with money from your salary before tax is taken out
  • Paid professional development - we offer a range of opportunities to grow your skills and your career 
  • Wellbeing focus - you’ll get two wellbeing days included in your personal leave per year
  • Additional leave - you’ll have the option to purchase extra leave for even greater work life balance  
  • Retail discounts - you’ll save money on insurance, travel and technology
  • Uniform allowance and employee referral program 
  • Security and stability - as Australia’s largest provider of early learning and care and a not-for-profit social enterprise, we exist purely to improve the lives of Australia’s children and their families

You’ll need:

  • A Diploma or Bachelor in Early Childhood Education (or working towards)
  • Experience with leading and managing change within education, health or community services
  • Experience in delivering integrated early childhood services in areas of disadvantage
  • Proven commercial acumen with financial and operational performance management

How to apply

Click ‘Apply Now’ and submit your application.

We review applications as they are submitted. We encourage you to submit your application as soon as possible for your best chance to progress to the next stage of the process. We strongly encourage applications from Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander peoples for all positions.

• Extensive Training Provided, including free travel to Australia
  • New Office Space in KL Sentral
  • Competitive Salary and Travel Allowance

At TechnologyOne we are focussed on delivering customer-driven, innovative ERP software that transforms our customers' business and makes their lives simple. TechnologyOne is an industry leader in culture, leadership and strategy. We are recognised as an Employer of Choice, and for innovative learning and onboarding solutions. Our aim is to attract passionate, capable, and innovative people. Does this sound like you?

Innovation and creativity of our team are a key ingredient in our success. Due to an exciting phase of growth, TechnologyOne is looking for multiple Support Analysts to join our Fabric team, in the Kuala Lumpur office.

What does the Fabric team do? The Fabric team build the components which are integrated into our products providing low/no code solutions to our customers with an ever-evolving products offering. This provides a consistent enterprise experience for processes that are commonly required across all products. Customers, using the tools built by the Fabric team, are empowered to create functionality and augment their businesses processing requirements.

This exciting new role will be looking for someone to start in our office on April 22, 2024.

What you'll be doing...

As a Support Analyst, you will be the primary contact for our customers to ensure a great experience post product onboarding.

  • Owning and resolving assigned customer issues and questions in a timely manner
  • Understanding customer use cases, perform troubleshooting, and provide alternate solutions to customer issues
  • Creating knowledge base articles improve first call resolution and help customers self-serve
  • Providing a compelling customer experience on every customer interaction to make our customers feel valued and important.

Your Talents…

  • Experience with any of the following:
    • Analysis and Design o Enterprise Architecture
    • BPA & Forms
    • Crystal reports
    • ETL
    • Integration design & development
    • Web services
    • XLone
    • DocOne
    • Stored Scripts
    • Dashboards
  • A background with ERP systems, or other complex software products (SaaS products ideally)
  • Analytical and solutions oriented, make the impossible possible
  • Ability to build strong relationships, your communication skills are second to none and you're at your best when talking to customers
  • A background with ERP systems, or other complex software products (e.g. SAP, Oracle, Infor, CIVICA or other) would be highly regarded
  • Big plus if you have used TechOne's P&R software or have worked in a local council



TechnologyOne is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer who values diversity and an inclusive workplace. We aim to recruit a diverse range of people with a diverse range of talents to help us to deliver on our mission to better our community. If you meet a number of the requirements (and not all), we encourage you to submit your application.


Benefits…

  • Competitive remuneration package
  • Industry leading employee share plan
  • Amazing Culture - 8 x Australian Business Awards "Employer of Choice" winner.
  • We love our team events & celebrate diversity
  • Flexible hours - we are family friendly and value life outside of work.
  • Free gym membership in your region
  • Additional 2.5 days of leave per year dedicated to volunteering at a charity of your choice
  • Free breakfast and coffee on-site
  • Defined career framework - know what options you have in your career path and how you can get there




Who we are…

TechnologyOne (ASX: TNE) is Australia's largest enterprise software company and one of Australia's top 100 ASX-listed companies, with locations across six countries. We provide a global SaaS ERP solution that transforms business and makes life simple for our customers. Our deeply integrated enterprise SaaS solution is available on any device, anywhere and anytime and is incredibly easy to use. Over 1,200 leading corporations, government agencies, local councils and universities are powered by our software.

For more than 37 years, we have been providing our customers enterprise software that evolves and adapts to new and emerging technologies, allowing them to focus on their business and not technology.

Centre Relationship Manager – Full time

Are you passionate about netball and growing the game at community level?  Are you proactive, engaging and have great people skills?  Then Netball Northern Zone is looking for you!   We are seeking a Centre Relationship Manager to join the Community Team. This role is based in Auckland focused on servicing Centres within the Auckland Region. 

Netball Northern Zone is one of five Regional Sporting Organisations for netball in New Zealand.  Our Zone reaches from Waiuku to the Far North and we work with over 33% of New Zealand’s netball playing population. This role focuses on Centres within the Auckland regional boundary however our team work collaboratively across the whole Zone. 

The Centre Relationship Manager contributes to the Northern Zone by:

  • Being the key connector and advisor for netball centres in the Auckland region focusing on strengthening capability 
  • Assisting Centres to understand insights and barriers to participation and developing strategies to grow the game at grass roots level
  • Working collaboratively with Zone and Netball NZ personnel across all aspects of the game

Key Skills and Attributes required for this role include but are not limited to:

  • Relevant tertiary qualification and sport sector knowledge
  • Strong understanding of community netball and working with volunteers
  • Ability to build effective working relationships quickly across a diverse range of stakeholders
  • Ability to facilitate workshops or presentations that are clear, concise and influential 
  • Highly organised, enjoys multitasking and can prioritise workload

The position requires strong people engagement and stakeholder management skills, with interpersonal skills that generate mutual respect and trust. The role requires the ability and confidence to work closely with volunteers and be part of a dedicated, hardworking team. You can communicate strategies, inspire and ensure ‘buy in’ from the communities you work with.  You will be highly organised, confident and calm, with a can-do attitude. 

The role is full-time with a significant amount of evening and weekend work, but offers a high degree of flexibility around working times and practices. 

All applications including a Cover Letter and CV, are to be submitted via email to Netball Operations at netballops@netballnorthern.co.nz .

If you are interested and would like to read the full position description please see: https://www.netballnorthern.co.nz/zones/northern/useful-info/jobs/centre-relationship-manager.html 

Closing date for applications is 12noon, Friday 19th November 2021 or earlier at our discretion.

job_title: SEA Internal Audit Manager (SEA Risk Advisory)
job_ad_details:
What impact will you make?

At Deloitte, we offer a unique and exceptional career experience to inspire and empower talents like you to make an impact that matters for our clients, people and community. Whatever your aspirations, Deloitte offers you a highly inclusive, collaborative workplace and unrivalled opportunities to realize your full potential. We are always looking for people with the relentless energy to push themselves further, and to find new avenues and unique ways to reach our shared goals.

So what are you waiting for? Join the winning team now.

Work you'll do

  • Demonstrate understanding of business processes, internal control risk management, IT controls, and related regulatory and compliance standards.
  • Perform internal audit assurance activities (internal audits over financial, operational, compliance, IT, SOX and QARs), consult with engagement leadership and clients on strategic plans and other business matters, and help to anticipate emerging risks for our clients.
  • Use problem solving and critical thinking skills to quickly identify internal control deficiencies, evaluate their risk implications, and draw the appropriate conclusions to best advise our clients.
  • Apply a general knowledge of the technologies used to build complex IT environments.
  • Facilitate use of technology-based tools or methodologies to review, design, and implement products and services.
  • Support client engagements by helping plan the audit approach and scope, preparing the audit program, determining auditing procedures, seeing the audit process through completion, and applying internal audit standards in accordance with the Institute of Internal Auditors.
  • Actively participate in decision making with engagement management and seek to understand the broader impact of current decisions.
  • Build and nurture positive working relationships with clients, by providing high quality deliverables and communications.
  • Create internal control documentation for the engagement including narratives, process and data flows, and other supporting work papers.
  • Play a substantive role with project management by supporting engagement planning, economics, billing and staffing; providing regular status reports for the client, while supervising junior staff.
  • Exercise professional skepticism, judgment and adhere to the code of ethics while on engagements.


Your role as a leader

At Deloitte, we believe in the importance of empowering our people to be leaders at all levels. We expect our people to embrace and live our purpose and shared values, challenging themselves everyday to identify issues that are most important to our clients, our people and the communities, and to make an impact that matters. In addition to living our purpose, Managers across our Firm are expected to:

  • Understand the goals of our clients and Deloitte, align our people to these objectives by setting clear priorities and direction.
  • Influence clients, teams, and individuals positively. Lead by example and provide equal opportunity for people to grow, develop and succeed.
  • Establish positive relationship with senior stakeholders.
  • Delivers exceptional client service. Maximizes results and drives high performance from people while fostering collaboration across businesses and geographies.
  • Manage diverse teams within a highly inclusive team culture where people are respected and valued for their contribution.
  • Develop high-performing teams through challenging and meaningful opportunities and recognize them for the impact that they make.


Requirements

  • Must have 8-10 years of internal audit experience.
  • Must have Bachelor's degree (in Accounting, Business Administration, Computer Science, Information Systems, Management Information Systems, Accounting Information Systems or related field).
  • Having professional certifications ICAEW, ACCA, CIMA, CIA, CISA or related field are preferred.


Due to volume of applications, we regret only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

• Well-Established in F&B industry
  • Working Location: Redhill
  • Working Days & Hours: Mon - Fri (9am - 6pm)
  • Salary Package: $133 - $183

  • Manage the recruitment and selection process

We are Relaxology Massage, in Takapuna. 
We have been operating our clinic on Hurstmere Road for almost ten years, and are well established and known locally, with an excellent reputation. Our large base of clients have come to rely on us for friendly service and effective massage. We specialise in providing our unique style of relaxation massage, deep tissue massage, aromatherapy, hot-stone massage, and in assisting our clients in recovering from injury.

We are looking for an experienced massage therapist to work with our clients and assist in the smooth operation of the business.

We are seeking a positive, friendly person who is cleanly presented and a competent communicator.

Our team members support each other and strive to provide our clients with the most effective massage possible, whilst keeping a bright and enthusiastic attitude.


What We Need From you

  • Applicants must have a minimum of 6 months of experience in a massage therapy environment or hold a Massage Therapy related qualification or certificate.
  • Good communication skills and ability to serve the public in a friendly and effective way.
  • Must be available for weekend work.


Location, Salary, and Hours

  • Relaxology massage - 60B Hurstmere Road, Takapuna, Auckland 0622.
  • Pay rate: $26- $32 per hour, depending on your experience.
  • Minimum of 30 hours per week, up to 40 hours.


Responsibilities and Duties include, but not limited to the following

As a massage therapist at Relaxology, you will be confident performing the following tasks:

  • Providing massage therapy treatments to clients as required and requested by the client or management.
  • Massaging the soft tissues of the body, including muscles, tendons and ligaments, to assist healing,
    flexibility and relaxation; Professional, safety and academic standards shall be upheld to ensure no harm comes to clients. Uphold standards of hygiene as required by company policy and New Zealand law.
  • Performing a variety of massage techniques to enhance sports performance and prevent injury before an event or training, as requested by clients. Communicate with clients as required during treatments to ensure their comfort, safety and satisfaction with the service provided.
  • Employing sports massage techniques to assist maintenance and recovery after an event or training, as requested by clients.
  • Administering treatments to promote relaxation, improve circulation and relieve muscle tension.
  • Employing other techniques in which you are skilled, such as hot stone massage, Tui Na, Thai massage/stretching or the application of essential oils to assist recovery and promote relaxation
    and mental well-being.
  • Assisting the business in keeping track of the client's progress and any injuries, health or medical needs, by making notes in the database or other records kept with the client’s permission.
  • Maintenance of the premises in keeping them fit to conduct business.
  • Handling money and providing customer service. 
  • Following the training and guidelines provided to you upon commencement of your employment.
  • Occasionally performing other tasks required by management for the benefit of the clinic which lie within your capabilities.


Applying to be a Relaxology Massage Therapist

Applications may be submitted through this website or sent to relaxology.nz@gmail.com

Please supply a cover letter and brief CV and description of your qualifications and experience

job_title: Executive, Human Resource (Compensation & Benefits) (Based in Singapore)
job_ad_details:
The Role

In view of the growing needs of the business, we are expanding our Compensation and Benefits team! You will support the Group, Country and REITs' rewards programs in administering, evaluating and enhancing compensation and benefits programs in accordance with Company philosophy, statutory requirements and regulations, and to ensure competitiveness.

Job Responsibilities

  • Manage end-to-end benefits processes to ensure smooth delivery and compliance to local regulations.
  • Support in renewal of employee benefit insurances and administration of medical benefits with broker and third party providers.
  • Assist in benefits benchmarking surveys, analyze survey results and recommend relevant benefits changes to maintain market competitiveness.
  • Support the C&B team with data analysis pertaining to the compensation and benefits programs.
  • Consolidate and provide inputs to derive budget assumptions for annual manpower budgeting exercise.
  • Involved in the annual performance reviews, annual increment and variable bonus exercise, promotions, and its related communications.
  • Support the Time Management system as an administrator.
  • Handle ad hoc projects assigned from time to time, including but not limited to statutory and other industry surveys.
Job Requirements

  • Degree in Human Resources, Business Administration or equivalent.
  • Around 1 to 2 years' of experience in a compensation and/or benefits role.
  • Meticulous, numerically inclined with a keen analytical ability and excellent Microsoft Excel skills.
  • A team player with the willingness to learn, highly organized, resourceful and independent.

Interested applicants, please submit your resume and a cover letter by clicking APPLY NOW.

(We regret that only shortlisted candidates will be notified. Mapletree Investments Pte Ltd shall not be responsible or liable to any recruitment firm or agency in connection with the receipt of any unsolicited information on any prospective candidate.)

About UOB

United Overseas Bank Limited (UOB) is a leading bank in Asia with a global network of more than 500 branches and offices in 19 countries and territories in Asia Pacific, Europe and North America. In Asia, we operate through our head office in Singapore and banking subsidiaries in China, Indonesia, Malaysia and Thailand, as well as branches and offices.

Our history spans more than 80 years. Over this time, we have been guided by our values — Honorable, Enterprising, United and Committed. This means we always strive to do what is right, build for the future, work as one team and pursue long-term success. It is how we work, consistently, be it towards the company, our colleagues or our customers.

About the Department

The Retail function provides Personal and Business Banking customers with financial solutions tailored to their needs. We help them manage their money wisely and meet their financial goals through an extensive range of products and services. These include deposit, insurance, secured and unsecured loans, investment and wealth advisory services

Job Responsibilities

Strategic Marketing Communications

  • Manage customer marketing by focusing on directing and utilising customer insights to drive acquisition
  • Ensure consistent quality execution for all marketing initiatives

Usage and Engagement

  • Assist in driving, managing & marketing Internet (PIB) & Mobile (Mighty) Banking on customer lifecycle from acquisition, adoption to usage.
  • Manage internal stakeholders & all bank channels eg sales, branches, operations, call centre.
  • Providing reports for regulatory & management purposes.
  • Work with various stakeholders (legal, compliance, regulatory, strategic communications, brand, channels, demand, vendor, T&O and etc) pertaining to the development and implementation of PIB and Mighty campaigns and communications.
  • Ensure compliance to Group, Local & regulatory policies for Digital Banking
  • Assist in educating and training internal customer about PIB & Mighty services for them to provide the basic support to customer.
  • Manage inventory of collaterals, premiums and branch iPads

Reporting and Monitoring

  • Assist in ensuring that the existing features in PIB and mobile banking systems are functioning.
  • Report on any abnormality of the system to ensure seamless customer experience.
  • Assist in monthly reporting to management, Group and Regulators (ie Monthly Online Fraud Reporting, Monthly BNM Internet Banking Statistical Report and Digital Banking KORI), management and Group.
  • Annual Budgeting planning for CAPEX and OPEX.
  • Assist in managing annual audit review with internal audit and regulatory audit for Digital Banking.

Job Requirements
  • Demonstrate enthusiasm & willingness to learn and develop oneself.
  • Possess a positive attitude and strive to produce valuable deliverables.
  • Able to work under stress and take constructive feedback optimistically.
  • Ability to work on jobs assigned with minimum supervision.
  • Able to plan and manage time effectively.
  • Must demonstrate logical thinking with an independent and willing to learn attitude.
  • Entrepreneurial and resourceful by nature, an excellent communicator and influencer, with the ability to forge critical relationships.
Be a part of UOB Family

UOB is an equal opportunity employer. UOB does not discriminate on the basis of a candidate's age, race, gender, color, religion, sexual orientation, physical or mental disability, or other non-merit factors. All employment decisions at UOB are based on business needs, job requirements and qualifications. If you require any assistance or accommodations to be made for the recruitment process, please inform us when you submit your online application.

Apply now and make a difference.

The Allied Health Clinical Educators are positioned within the Allied Health Service Delivery Model (AH-SDM) but are delegated to deliver high level education services and leadership across the Sunshine Coast Hospital and Health Service. The Social Work Clinical Educator reports operationally and professionally to the Director of Social Work.  

Sunshine Coast Hospital and Health Service (SCHHS) is in southeast Queensland and extends through the coastal and hinterland areas from Caloundra in the south to Gympie in the north.

The SCHHS is a values-based organisation. We are committed to the maintenance of a culture in which we treat our colleagues with respect as we do our patients, consumers and the community. We respect, promote human rights in our decision-making and actions.

Key Responsibilities include: 

  • Planning, developing, facilitating, implementing and evaluating evidence based clinical education, including monitoring and reporting on relevant key performance indicators.
  • Collaborates and consults with the Professional Director, University partners and Student Hub regarding student planning, coordination and integration of student education across SCHHS.
  • Coordinate clinical education programs for graduate Social Work staff and support clinicians to undertake clinical education of pre-entry students and new graduates, including ongoing monitoring and identification of local clinical education needs. Provide clinical practice supervision to new graduate staff.
  • Actively contribute to the departmental clinical education agenda through engaging in professional development activities such as: facilitating orientation process for new staff, coordination of departmental in-service programs; facilitate the development and maintenance of learning and development pathways, participation at local/state-wide workshops/conferences; and contributing to Performance Appraisal and Development Plan (PaD) via professional development.

Remuneration value up to $91 665 p.a., comprising salary rates $62.75 - $67.53 p.h., employer contribution to superannuation (up to 12.75%) and annual leave loading (17.5%) (HP4) (part time position, 45.6 hrs p.f.). Applications will remain current for 12 months. Please note: only applications from candidates will be accepted (applications that may result in an agency fee will not be considered).

Why work for us?

We offer rewarding career opportunities across a wide range of clinical and non-clinical areas across our health service and pride ourselves on providing a work environment that is safe, satisfying, flexible, and promotes a healthy work-life balance.

As a Queensland Health employee, you will benefit from a higher than standard employer contribution to Superannuation of up to 12.75%, access to salary packaging, flexible working arrangements and competitive salary rates with annual incremental increases.
We are committed to providing a diverse and inclusive workplace for our people and our community. We encourage people of all genders, races, ages and abilities to apply for roles within our Health Service.
You can find out more about why it's so great to work at Sunshine Coast here: https://www.health.qld.gov.au/sunshinecoast/careers

As a Sunshine Coast Health employee, you will receive competitive remuneration and have access to:
• A wellness program;
• Generous superannuation;
• Flexible work arrangements;
• Career training and development; and
• Salary packaging.

Check out the latest updates here:

https://www.sunshinecoast.health.qld.gov.au/

About the role

Mater Private Hospital Brisbane are seeking enthusiastic Enrolled Nurses with experience in Anaesthetics for permanent positions, full time or part time roles on offer and immediate start available. 

This is an exceptional opportunity to join our Perioperative department which boasts up to 15 operating theatres (including Neuroscience & Paediatrics theatres) across our private hospital settings, our main centre of excellence specialties include. 

  • Paediatrics
  • Neurosciences
  • Orthopaedics 
  • Robotics 

Salary range: $34.84 - $37.10 (Enrolled Nurse) per hour plus superannuation & Salary Packaging 

What you’ll be doing

Whilst displaying the highest level of clinical standards for the unit you will be responsible for:

  • Achieving optimal patient outcomes throughout the patient journey and continuum of care
  • Demonstrating exceptional clinical expertise and knowledge of procedures and the management of patients seeking outstanding care
  • Implementing strategies to ensure that quality and risk management are integrated into service provision.
  • Working collaboratively with the nursing team to provide exceptional care every time.
  • Maintaining current knowledge and skills to ensure continued professional growth.

About you

You will be driven by a challenging yet rewarding environment where you can bring your energy and experience to this dynamic and exciting unit.

Other skills and experience include:

  • Minimum 3 years’ experience as a Enrolled Nurse in an Anaesthetics setting
  • Current AHPRA nursing registration as an Enrolled Nurse (no restrictions)
  • Ability to work in an ever-changing and fast paced environment.
  • A strong work ethic, positive attitude and willingness to role model and promote the Mater values.
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills and the ability to liaise with all levels of the multidisciplinary team.
  • Demonstrated ability to operate both in a team environment and autonomously using initiative, sound reasoning and strong listening, negotiation and decision-making skills.
  • Strong attention to detail and organisational skills
  • Commitment to ensuring the levels of service is always delivered to patients.

Why join us?

Mater is Queensland’s largest and most innovative not-for-profit healthcare service, providing care for almost 700,000 patients a year across a network of 11 hospitals.

We are a leader in healthcare, education and research — and that’s because we employ exceptional people. #MAKEYOURMATERMOVE

  • Increase your take-home pay via Salary Packaging by allocating applicable living expenses directly from your pre-taxable income
  • Access to package meal and entertainment expenses via Salary Packaging
  • Access to leading education and professional development through Mater Education
  • Access to our Employee Assistance Program and on-site pastoral care teams
  • Discounts to local and national businesses/venues for dining, retail, travel & accommodation, other
  • Access to on-site, discounted parking
  • Discounted food and beverage at various campus cafés and coffee venues

Please note, we will contact applications as they come in, please do not hesitate to APPLY NOW!

Please Note: We will not require any support from Recruitment Agencies at this time and kindly request no contact is made. Only direct applications will be considered.

It is now a mandatory requirement of employment at the Mater that you are and remain fully vaccinated against COVID-19.

job_title: Thailand based Online English Teacher (Guaranteed Hours, Adult Students) Expat
job_ad_details:

Hello Passionate Educators!

Are you a truly exceptional teacher, fueled by the desire to ignite a passion for learning in those you teach? The Really Great Teacher Company invites you to embark on a rewarding journey of personal and professional growth while making a positive impact on students worldwide through the art of teaching English.

🌟 PERSONAL DEVELOPMENT: Join our Evolve program and revel in wellness, fitness, fun, and community events—all from the comfort of your home.

🗝️ KEY RESPONSIBILITIES:

  • Deliver engaging English lessons to students
  • Create a dynamic and fun classroom environment
  • Utilize world-class teaching methods for group instruction
  • Lead discussions, assess student performance, and provide constructive feedback

Requirements

🎓 APPLICANT REQUIREMENTS:

  • Completed Bachelor's Degree or higher (Any field)

💻 TECHNICAL REQUIREMENTS:

  • PC specifications: Intel® Core™ i5 CPU @2.0GHz (4 CPUs) or greater, 8GB RAM or greater

  • Internet connection: Stable fiber connection, minimum 20 Mbps upload and download speeds

job_title: Primary and Secondary Science Tuition Teacher (Full-time)
job_ad_details:
Job Position Available [FULL-TIME POSITION - TUITION TEACHER]


  • Primary School Science
  • O Level Physics
  • O Level Chemistry
  • O Level Biology


Your Responsibility


[Classroom management]

  • Manage a class size between 4-10 students.


[Lesson delivery]

  • You will prepare your classes based on our Explorer Academy curriculum. (Lesson materials and training will be provided).


[Communication]

  • You will provide regular feedback and updates to parents on the student’s progress.


[Lesson material development]

  • Review and edit curriculum content and teaching materials when required.


Job Requirement

  • Have a Relevant SCIENCE degree
  • Familiar with Singapore MOE primary/secondary science syllabus
  • Added advantage to have past teaching experience (school/tuition centre/private tutoring)
  • Passionate in teaching and mentoring students


Working hours

  • 4 weekdays + 1 Weekend


Salary

  • Full-time: $3500-$4000/month

IMPORTANT DISCLAIMER

Customer Service is merely one interaction along the whole customer journey with any given company. It’s the help a customer needs and is a reactive approach. We're changing this. 

We are looking for two more candidates who will work collaboratively together and will get real joy out of watching one another grow. You will be delivering what clients didn’t know they needed and take a proactive approach.  

You will be someone who makes every customer interaction memorable and also encompass all touchpoints and champion the entire customer journey. 

Do you think you are someone who can help us deliver on one of our brand promises - Every Client Matters - and shape how customers perceive Watchful & Crosbies Security?

 

About Us

We're a true family-owned and operated security business based in Pukekohe. We've been operating for 5 years and have been experiencing substantial growth across all our service offerings, and we are keen to continue the momentum. 

Many people haven't worked in a small business growing that fast. One day you'll arrive at work, and three processes have changed overnight. That's how fast we change to keep up with 80-100% YoY growth. You need to be prepared.

 

About Watchful. 

Watchful. is a subsidiary of Crosbies Security Limited. Watchful makes clients question why post-incident CCTV investigations were ever a thing. Come and join us for an interview to see what this brand new and exciting service offering is all about!

 

So, what are we doing day in and day out?

We assemble and build our security technology and offer market-leading solutions to our clients. That's what ChatGPT wrote! Really, we stop bad guys from slowing down building sites across Auckland, and we do the best job of anyone in our market by a long stretch.

We continually work hard to achieve the best security outcomes for our clients. That's also what ChatGPT wrote. But what it didn't write were our values. Those were written by our team. They are:

• Determined - Don't show up unless you're going to actually give a damn to solve the tough challenges you'll face.

• Committed to whanaungatanga - Care about your clients (they pay your wages, really), and of course, your peers.

• Lateral thinker - In-the-box solutions will kill our business so if this is you, please, scroll on!

• Positive team player - Help out your buds to see them succeed and do it silently when no one is watching.

• Ground-breaker - Think of ideas to shape the future of the business.

• High standards - If you know what we mean when we say, “dress one standard higher than the audience you're addressing,” then you'll have no trouble with this one.

 

About the role

We can't teach attitude or cultural fit. So your interview will be to ensure you have a great attitude, and you'll fit within our culture. Bring drive, ambition, new ideas, and hunger to our team, and you'll be well on your way to delivering on our values. So what will you do day in, day out?

As part of our Customer Service Monitoring Team, you will be literally stopping bad guys (kind of like how they do it in the movies) by doing the following:

You will need to make quick, methodical decisions like how Neo had to choose between the red and the blue pill in the Matrix – Monitoring over 5000 camera activations a month and coordinating with your fellow Customer Experience Officers to deliver on our values and brand promises.

You will need to have an eye for detail and think of yourself as Sherlock Holmes – Liaising with the Police and other emergency services to provide evidence, information, and real-time updates on what and where the bad guys are so you can help the good guys.

You will possess the ability to be an excellent communicator and with that great power, comes great responsibilities – Coordinate with internal stakeholders (sales and service team) to make sure we are kept up-to-date on what is happening to our overnight operations. You will play an integral part in shaping the improvement of our customer experience, everyday.

 

What does "good" look like?

KPIs are a thing in our business, but for good reason: they set you and us up for a successful working relationship. You will be measured on the following key KPIs:

• Response times to camera activations
• Job open-to-closure rates
• Number of tickets logged
• Customer NPS: Apple's NPS is 72. Ours is 67. We don't have far to go! So yeah, this is a critical measure for your customers.

 

Benefits and Perks:

• We are offering a base of $24 - $26 per hour for the right candidate, with a review after six months of being employed with Crosbies Security.
• Shift work with the opportunity to pick up more shifts.
• Free life insurance benefit ($300k or 4x salary, whichever is lower) after three months of employment.
• Free private healthcare insurance benefit ($1,000 excess) including pre-existing conditions covered, through NIB, after three months of employment.
• Leadership development program available for those who wish to progress their career. Modules and presentations have to date included “How to Talk to Anyone”, “Having Tough Conversations”, “Atomic Habits”, “A-Players” and more.

 

Skills and Experience:

We are looking for someone who has the following skills and experience:

• The right to work in New Zealand.
• Excellent English communication, both written and verbal. Non-negotiable. Like seriously, non-negotiable.
• Restricted or full NZ Driver's license.
• Confidence in their telecommunication skills (ideal but not required).

 

Crosbies Brand Promises:

Finally, our offering is successful because of three things that you'll help maintain and grow:

  1. We keep site teams moving, every day.
  2. Every client matters.
  3. Provide solutions that are the most trusted in the market.
  4.  

As part of our interview process, you'll tell us what you think they mean for this role. So be prepared.

 

How to Apply:

If this sounds like you, then please apply now. Include your CV, plus a short covering letter stating why you think you will make an excellent Customer Service Representative.

 

Candidate Timeline:

• We are moving quickly. After application, if you are shortlisted, you will be contacted within 72 hours. Interviews will take place very quickly, as we are working on a deadline of appointing all candidates within 30 days or less. 

That said, we are cautious and selective with who we bring into our business and our due diligence will not be reduced due to our faster hiring timeline.

Casual

$34.82 per hour (please note that junior rates may apply)  

We are currently seeking a motivated Member Services Officer to enhance and support PCYC Bundaberg Youth Club operations by ensuring all patrons receive the highest level of customer service. If you are passionate about delivering excellence in customer service, then we need you!

What we can offer

  • In addition to your remuneration, enjoy generous not-for-profit salary packaging benefits of up to $18,550 per annum tax free!
  • Free PCYC Gym Membership
  • Flexible working options may be available!
  • Comprehensive online induction and site-specific orientation
  • Our work environment has a strong team work ethic where we live by our PCYC Queensland values - Respect, Leadership, Commitment, Passion and Teamwork.

Your New Role

You will be at the forefront responding to Club enquiries, providing advice and information as well as partaking in up-selling and cross-selling of PCYC products and services. You will also prepare point of sale devices including cash registers and electronic swipe devices in addition to some office administration. If this sounds like you, download our Position Description for more information.

About You

  • Intermediate skills in the Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, Outlook)
  • Current First Aid and CPR certificates (or ability to obtain)
  • Qualification in Fitness, Sport and Recreation or similar or interest in developing in this area (nice to have but not required)

Please note: Working With Children Check (Blue Card) No Card, No Start and Restricted Person legislation applies. All PCYC employees are required to complete a National Police Check upon commencement.

Applications close 10 March 2024 at 11:45pm.

PCYC is committed to achieving and supporting a diverse workforce. We strongly encourage applications from Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander peoples as well as people from culturally diverse backgrounds. 

Shortlisting for this position will commence immediately. We encourage you to apply promptly as the advertisement may close early should a suitable applicant be sourced.

An exciting opportunity has arisen for a Banking Officer to join the Finance team at Brandbank, a leading retail group operating the Seed Heritage and French Connection retail brands with over 300 store locations across 4 countries.
  
Reporting to the Financial Accountant, this role requires strong analytical and numerical abilities and will be responsible for capturing, reconciling and reporting on store banking and petty cash. This is a Full Time role working Monday to Friday. 

THE ROLE:
  • Manage high volume, high complexity data
  • Reconcile daily store banking
  • Reconcile store petty cash reports
  • General ledger bank reconciliations in both local and foreign currencies
  • Prepare monthly banking journals for GST reporting
  • Utilise multiple systems to obtain all required data
  • General administration and other ad hoc duties where required
  • Liaise with the Retail Operations department, store teams and banks 
THE REQUIREMENTS:
  • Prior experience in a similar role (retail environment preferred but not essential)
  • Intermediate Microsoft office skills, particularly Microsoft Excel

Culburra Beach Bowling Club is looking to appoint a Customer Relationship Manager. The Club aims to support its members by providing a welcoming environment for the community to enjoy. The Club is seeking a highly motivated, passionate and experienced professional for the Customer Relationship Manager role. The successful applicant will play a vital role in ensuring the efficient operation of the venue, provide a link between senior management and the Duty Managers, including rostering, coaching and supporting the Duty Managers, and to ensure
that compliance, service standards and operational objectives are met.
 

The Customer Service Manager position is a full-time role, working a flexible rotating roster. You will report directly to the Operations Manager.
 

The successful candidate will have:
 

  • Minimum 2 years experience in a similar customer service manager/duty manager based role.
  • Hold current RSA and RCG and Advanced RCG Competency Cards.
  • High level of integrity and personal ethics with a proven record of confidentiality, tact and discretion.
  • Excellent communication and leadership skills with the ability to effectively manage a team.
  • Strong knowledge of relevant legislation and regulations, relevant to Food, Beverage, Gaming and the Club Industry in general.

1.1           Engagement/Project Manager
 
One of the core competencies for a Manila based EM is to be able to run with the project once the requirements are documented and complete it and deliver to Download Connect.
This means:
  • The person should be able to draw up a project plan
  • Should be able to understand and work with JIRA
  • Work with all stakeholders to complete the project
  • Needs experience with Software SDLC
  • Should be proactive, follow up and drive the project
  • The person will work collaboratively with the EM onsite to mitigate risk and track the project.
 
We do expect this person to be client facing so those skills are important as well.
 
This is not a comprehensive list for all skills but the core ones that we will focus on while evaluating.
 
(a)              Required Qualifications:
(i)       Four (4) year degree in Business Administration, Health Informatics, Computer Science or related field or equivalent experience;
(ii)        Three (3) to five (5) years’ experience in IT Project Management with a minimum of two (2) years in Software Implementation Project Manager, preferably in a payor (Health Plan) environment with familiarity of claims processing and claims payment operations;
(iii)      Experience in Healthcare claims IT Project Management;
(iv)       Experience in software implementation project management including conflict resolution, resource allocation and prioritization;
(v)        Demonstrated experience managing highly visible strategic and demanding customers;
(vi)       Demonstrated ability to manage multiple concurrent projects with significant visibility to the client executive teams;
(vii)     Strong foundation in project management principles, processes and methodology;
(viii)   Strong influential management experience;
(ix)       Must have strong and effective communication and presentation skills for effective communication and presentation skills for external client facing as well as internal communications; and
(x)        Project Management Professional (PMP) certification strongly preferred.
(b)             Primary Responsibilities:
(i)            Lead the implementation and support of multiple, large, complex projects by working with a diverse, virtual, cross-functional team, including working closely with Account Management to manage the CHC Customer and to define the CHC Customer roadmap on an ongoing basis and leading the service delivery team to execute on the CHC Customer roadmap. This constitutes forty percent (40%) of the Engagement/Project Manager’s responsibilities.
(ii)        Manage the progress of the projects ensuring an on schedule, on budget delivery, effectively manage change and ensure that the project team is tracking to CHC contractual commitments. This constitutes twenty percent (20%) of the Engagement/Project Manager’s responsibilities.
(iii)      Coordinate and maintain interdepartmental relationships/dependencies associated with major software implementation projects, which includes the following and constitutes twenty percent (20%) of the Engagement/Project Manager’s responsibilities:
(A)       Strong foundation in Project Management principles;
(B)       Detailed and high-level knowledge of MS Office suite of products;
(C)       Meeting facilitation and leadership;
(D)       Project Management coaching and mentoring;
(E)        Issue and Risk Management;
(F)        Project metric and measurement;
(G)       Flexible time management and priority setting; and
(H)       Resource management.
(iv)       Utilize project management tools to facilitate planning and tracking of large, complex projects and communicating effectively with all stakeholders for regular status reporting and on escalations. This constitutes ten percent (10%) of the Engagement/Project Manager’s responsibilities.
(v)        Build team environment, assuring effective project communication, managing expectations with all levels, effectively managing conflicts and maintaining strong working relationships with team members and stakeholders at all levels.  This constitutes ten percent (10%) of the Engagement/Project Manager’s responsibilities.

Responsibilites:

* Drive the growth of project business by actively engaging owners and designers through direct specifications, collaborating closely with dealers.
* Actively manage the CRM Project Pipeline to maximize market coverage, specifications, and win rates.
* Cultivate strategic relationships with key developer accounts to enhance specifications rates and facilitate bulk purchases.
* Provide dealers with effective solutions and technical support to secure project commitments.
* Foster alliances with WC partners to leverage their networks and develop competitive packages.
* Lead initiatives for new product launches, promoting new offerings and upselling existing products.
* Explore opportunities in new market segments by researching client requirements and assessing competitors' products and pricing, specifically in hospital and commercial sectors.
* Conduct regular visits to dealers, developers, architects, and designers to maintain strong relationships and identify new sales opportunities.
* Contribute to retail business sales initiatives and promotions.

Qualifications:

* A minimum of a Bachelor's degree in Engineering, specializing in mechanical, piping, architecture, or economics.
* Possesses over 10 years of direct experience in project-related roles.
* Mandatory expertise in project business, specifically focusing on Piping Drainage systems.
* Proficient and articulate in both English and the local language (Thai).
* Demonstrated proficiency in MS Office applications (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, etc.).
* Capable of interpreting and understanding technical drawings.

My Client is seeking a dynamic and experienced FP&A Senior Manager to join their team. The FP&A Senior Manager will report directly to Finance Director, play a key role in driving financial planning and analysis initiatives, providing strategic insights, and ensuring the financial health and sustainability of our organisation.

Client Details

My client is a Reputable Global Player in Multifinance business.

Description

  • Lead the development and execution of the company's financial planning and analysis processes, including budgeting, forecasting, and financial modeling.
  • Create strategic business plans based on the analysis of the company's status and financial forecasts.
  • Provide strategic financial insights and recommendations to Board of Management and Board of Director to support decision-making and drive business performance.
  • Monitor financial performance against budgets and forecasts, identify variances, and implement corrective actions as necessary.
  • Analyze financial data and key performance indicators (KPIs) to assess business performance, identify trends, and drive operational efficiency.
  • Collaborate cross-functionally with various departments to gather financial data, provide analysis, and support business planning and strategy development; And provide report to Headquarter and Regional office.
  • Develop and maintain financial reporting frameworks and dashboards to communicate financial performance and insights effectively to stakeholders.
  • Stay abreast of industry trends, market dynamics, and regulatory changes to inform financial planning and analysis activities and support business growth initiatives.

Profile

  • Bachelor's degree in Finance, Accounting, or related field; MBA or advanced degree preferred.
  • Proven experience in financial planning and analysis, preferably in the financial services industry.
  • Strong analytical skills with the ability to interpret complex financial data and trends.
  • Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to present financial information clearly and effectively to diverse audiences.
  • Strategic thinker with the ability to translate financial insights into actionable recommendations.
  • Proficiency in financial modeling, budgeting, forecasting, and financial reporting tools.
  • Experience leading and developing high-performing teams.

Job Offer

  • Opportunity to work with a leading financial institution.
  • Competitive compensation package and benefits.
  • Career development and growth opportunities in a dynamic and collaborative work environment.

To apply online please click the 'Apply' button below. For a confidential discussion about this role please contact Selvitri Selvitri on +62 21 2958 8861.

The opportunity

At New Zealand Post, we are committed to making sure nothing gets in the way of delivering what our customers care about. Our parcel delivery business is booming and as a Service Delivery Manager, you will lead your team to ensure we deliver on this promise every day!

As a Service Delivery Manager, you'll be responsible for the management of both delivery employees and courier contractors, to ensure the delivery of all products and services offered by NZ Post meets customers' expectations. It's a proactive role where you'll be tasked with driving performance whilst ensuring cost optimisation, health and safety and customer service outcomes are achieved.

This is a fast paced and challenging job, where you will also be a key point of contact for customers and community stakeholders, including dealing with escalations and proactively seeking out opportunities for business growth and customer service improvement. 

We currently have two exciting opportunities for Service Delivery Managers (SDM)  to join the NZ Post teams in Wellington:

SDM Porirua - this role covers two physical sites in Porirua, supporting our Delivery Agents, Courier Contractors & a processing team

SDM Johnsonville - this role supports our large team of 45+ Delivery Agents (used to be known as Posties) for the Khandallah, Kilbirnie and Johnsonville areas. 

These key roles are both fast paced and challenging logistics roles with oversight of either our contractors, employees, or both. 

What are we looking for? 

  • Experience managing employees and / or contractors
  • Experience leading people and processes, ideally in an operational environment
  • Leadership style that drives a safe, high performing, customer-centric culture
  • Customer service and relationship management skills
  • Strong commercial acumen, including budgets, financials, and analytical skills
  • Experience working with employee unions would be an advantage

Interested?

You'll benefit from the coaching of our high performing and supportive leadership team and have the opportunity to continue developing your leadership career with one of NZ's largest employers. This role has a real opportunity to join an essential service and provide significant impact across the NZ Post business.

Hours will typically be Monday to Friday, however, flexibility in working hours will be required recognising the business operates 24 hours 7 days a week. 

Apply today or visit NZ Post's Careers site, www.nzpost.co.nz/careers to download the Job Description. If you require further information, contact Angela Reid angela.reid@nzpost.co.nz and check out the video here. 

Applications close on Tuesday 21st September 2021

All applicants will be required to provide proof of their eligibility to work in New Zealand. Appointees will be subject to a security check and must be able to pass all internal and external security vetting requirements.

There's something really special about being part of the team here at NZ Post - Tukurau Aotearoa, who we are and what we stand for is grounded in our values

We are proud to be Rainbow Tick certified and recognise the diversity and uniqueness of our workforce and reaffirm our commitment to create a safe and inclusive environment for everyone

job_title: Real Estate Sales Cadet - Personal Assistant
job_ad_details:
Maternity Cover with Transition to Sales

About Us:

Join the ranks of excellence at Property Brokers, a leading name in the dynamic world of real estate. We are excited to announce an exceptional opportunity for a Real Estate Sales Cadet to commence their journey in administration as a Personal Assistant to a top-performing salesperson. This role begins with approximately 10 months of maternity cover, providing invaluable experience and paving the way for a seamless transition into a rewarding sales career. The hours worked will be between 30 and 40 hours per week.

Role and Responsibilities:

As a Real Estate Sales Cadet, you will start as a Personal Assistant to a top-performing salesperson, playing a crucial role in supporting their daily activities. During the maternity cover period, you will gain hands-on experience, learning the ins and outs of the real estate industry from a seasoned professional. Your responsibilities will include administrative tasks, client coordination, and ensuring the smooth functioning of the sales team.

Requirements:

  • Exceptional organizational and multitasking skills.
  • Strong interpersonal and communication abilities.
  • Proactive and detail-oriented approach to tasks.
  • Genuine interest in pursuing a career in real estate sales.

Key Responsibilities During Maternity Cover:

  • Personal assistance to a top-performing salesperson.
  • Administrative support to the sales team.
  • Coordination of client interactions and appointments.
  • Maintenance of organized and efficient office operations.

Transition to Sales:

Following the maternity cover period, you will seamlessly transition into a real estate sales role. This phase of your journey will involve hands-on training, mentorship from seasoned professionals, and the opportunity to obtain your Real Estate Salesperson's License within the specified timeframe.

Qualifications:

  • Eagerness to learn and grow within the real estate industry.
  • Ability to obtain a Real Estate Salesperson's License within the specified timeframe.

Benefits:

  • Competitive compensation and commission structure.
  • Mentorship from a top-performing salesperson.
  • Ongoing professional development opportunities.

How to Apply:

If you are ready to kickstart your real estate career, possess the outlined qualifications, and are eager to make a mark in the industry, click the "Apply" button now!

Embark on a journey with Property Brokers, where excellence meets opportunity, and your success is our priority.

• Permit to Work System for every activity being carried out.

About New Zealand Couriers
Proudly NZ-owned and operated, for over fifty years our company has been driving ahead of the competition thanks to our passionate team and results-focused service delivery. Now with over 1,100 employees, and 550 independent contractors in 25 locations across New Zealand, we are proud to serve the local communities we work in, to be New Zealand's most experienced courier provider, and to be the flagship brand of Freightways.

If you're looking for a physical challenge and consider yourself an earlybird, join us as a Freight Sorter! New Zealand Couriers is looking for hardworking people keen to be part of a fast-paced and energetic team.

About the Role
Based at our Highbrook branch, our Freight Sorters handle the unloading and sorting of parcels, working to deadlines to have everything ready for courier pick up and delivery in the morning. In joining the Freight Sorter team, you are a crucial part of the nationwide mission to deliver our customers' freight safely and on time. Freight Sorters will also assist in maintaining the cleanliness of the depot, and be dedicated to the team's Health and Safety.

We can offer permanent fulltime hours, working Monday to Friday, 6:00am to 3:30pm - no weekends!

About you

  • You can lift up to 25kg repetitively and enjoy working on your feet
  • Strong commitment to Health and Safety
  • Forkhoist licence - advantageous
  • Experience in warehousing depot environments is a plus

What can we offer?

  • A hardworking team dedicated to shared goals
  • $25.50 hourly rate + onsite parking
  • Career opportunities within the Freightways group of companies


If this sounds like you, apply here now to join a high-performing company. Include your CV detailing your experience and suitability for this role.

All candidates will be required to provide proof of NZ working rights and undergo pre-employment screening, including a criminal history check and drug test.

job_title: Drug and Alcohol Clinican Registered Nurse
job_ad_details:
Employment Type: Permanent Full Time
Position Classification:  Drug and Alcohol Registered Nurse
Remuneration: $70049.73 - $98351.39
Hours Per Week: 38
Requisition ID: REQ460270
Location:  Broken Hill NSW


We really aren’t that far away - only 3 hours’ drive from Mildura, 5 hours from Adelaide or a short flight from anywhere in Australia with everything you need right at your front door!

Broken Hill truly is a town like no other with a supportive community that will welcome you with open arms. We can't wait to see you!

Take a quick look at "Living and Working" in the Far West. What you’ll be doing


What you'll be doing

  • Provide specialist assessment, care planning, treatment, withdrawal management, case management and referral services to people experiencing drug and alcohol problems and collaborate in the further development and delivery of a comprehensive multidisciplinary drug and alcohol service.
  • Work collaboratively with clinical and non-clinical services to provide quality and appropriate care to drug and alcohol clients with co-existing mental health issues and disorders.
  • Provide drug and alcohol education and training, promotion and prevention activities for communities, key services and clients and carers.
  • Participate in clinical handover, clinical  supervision and clinical reviews, utilising outcome measures and consumer goals in the development of ongoing care plans  

What is on offer

  • 5 Weeks Annual Leave
  • Salary packaging (pay less tax!) up to $9k living expenses + $2.6k for meals and entertainment
  • Rural remote housing
  • Novated Lease
  • Paid Allocated Day Off (ADO) Every Month
  • Isolation & climate allowance
  • Support through advanced education & training
  • A comfortable country lifestyle that supports balance & wellbeing

About the Far West LHD

The Far West Local Health District is one of 15 LHDs under NSW Health, providing high quality public health services to the communities in far west NSW. Our vision is to create excellence in rural and remote healthcare.

Key to our success of course, is our people. Our workforce is inclusive and diverse. We employ well over 800 clinicians and support staff across our 9 health facilities in Broken Hill, Balranald, Dareton, Ivanhoe, Menindee, Tibooburra, Wentworth, White Cliffs and Wilcannia. In the Far West LHD, we are working together to make a real difference to the health outcomes for our communities. We encourage you to consider joining our friendly team for a meaningful and rewarding career in rural and remote healthcare.

About Broken Hill

A true “Oasis in the Outback”, Broken Hill is a thriving regional town in far west NSW full of diversity, history and character. Being Australia’s first city to be Nationally Heritage Listed, Broken Hill is a culturally rich town with a vibrant art scene with over 20 galleries! The unique attractions, festivals and beautiful natural landscapes see tourists flock from all over, but the ones who stay quickly fall in love with the place and its liveability.

With a population just shy of 20,000, Broken Hill is small enough to allow for a relaxed country lifestyle, while big enough to provide all the desired facilities of a regional hub including major supermarkets and retail stores, excellent schools (7 primary & 2 high), multiple gyms & aquatic centre, well-known fast food franchises and a plethora of trendy restaurants, pubs and cafés.


How to apply
To be considered for this position, please ensure you address the selection criteria in the application as thoroughly as possible.

  • Current unrestricted Registered Nurse registration with the Australian Health Professionals Regulation Agency (AHPRA) with a minimum of two years clinical experience working in the drug and alcohol sector.
  • Demonstrated knowledge and experience in drug and alcohol clinical practices and treatment interventions.
  • Demonstrated application of evidence based practice and critical thinking to advocate for and implement recovery oriented individualised person centred and trauma informed care to clients of the Drug and Alcohol service.
  • Demonstrated commitment to work and partner with Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander consumers and their families to enhance health outcomes.
  • Evidence of participation in own professional development and commitment to maintaining competence and enhancement of skills together with willingness to apply and share professional expertise with colleagues and students.
  • Demonstrated effective interpersonal skills including the verbal and written ability to communicate and consult with clients, family and/or carers and other health, community and welfare professionals together with intermediate computer skills including use of the Microsoft Office suite.
  • Demonstrated competence in the use of electronic information systems and the ability to maintain accurate medical records utilising appropriate documentation and entering data related to activity in a timely manner.
  • Current licence to drive in NSW


The Welcome Experience  

The Welcome Experience in Broken Hill connects you and your family with local people and local resources to help you settle in and feel at home in your new community faster.

Learn more at www.nsw.gov.au/welcomeexperience


Need more information?

  1) Click here for the Position Description
  2) Find out more about applying for this position
For role related queries or questions contact Vanessa Smith on Vanessa.Smith@health.nsw.gov.au

Applications Close: 9th February 2024

At Far West Local Health District we are proud to be an equal opportunity employer, where we don’t just accept differences, but we honour and support it. Committed to providing a working environment that thrives and values diversity, we encourage people of Aboriginal and/or Torres Strait Islander background, people with a disability and people from the LGBTQI+ community to apply.

บริษัท เป็นหนึ่ง โฮลดิ้ง จำกัด (PenNueng Holding Co., Ltd.)

บริษัทเป็นหนึงโฮลดิ้งจำกัด 576/18 ลาดพร้าว 118 แขวงพลับพลา เขต วังทองหลาง 10310

Tel. : 093-654-5544 , 093-624-5544

Job Description

The Health Services and Systems Research (HSSR) Programme in Duke-NUS is a centre of academic excellence for research and education on the organisation, funding and delivery of health services. The programme's focus is on public health and clinical service innovation in an increasingly complex and connected world.

The candidate will act as a liaison between study participants and members of the research team and work under the supervision of the Principal Investigator or his/her designate. The duties will include but not limited to the following: -

  • Perform tasks and support data collection and recruitment of the research project.
  • Screen and recruit study participants.
  • Obtain informed consent from study participants.
  • Ensure compliance with protocols and complete assessment.
  • Compile relevant study participants' data and maintain proper documentation.
  • Undertake any additional duties as assigned by the supervisor.
Job Requirements

  • Bachelor's Degree in Nursing, Implementation Sciences, Public Health, Epidemiology, Social Sciences or other related disciplines.
  • Prior research experience in healthcare and/or research environment is preferred.
  • Have aptitude and potential in research excellence.
  • Able to multi-task and have good time management skills.
  • Possess strong communication and interpersonal skills.
  • Highly motivated and able to work independently in a multidisciplinary setting.
  • Able to converse in at least 2 national languages (English/Mandarin/Malay/Tamil) as the role involves recruitment of study participants.

We regret that only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

Covid-19 Message

At NUS, the health and safety of our staff and students are one of our utmost priorities, and COVID-vaccination supports our commitment to ensure the safety of our community and to make NUS as safe and welcoming as possible. Many of our roles require a significant amount of physical interactions with students/staff/public members. Even for job roles that may be performed remotely, there will be instances where on-campus presences are required.

In accordance with Singapore's legal requirements, unvaccinated workers will not be able to work on the NUS premises with effect from 15 January 2022. As such, job applicants will need to be fully COVID-19 vaccinated to secure successful employment with NUS.

job_title: Financial Controller, Non Bank Financial Institution
job_ad_details:
1. Oversee the Finance Department's Financial Accounting, Budgeting, Reporting and financial control
  2. Evaluate business performance, conduct various financial analysis and presentation to support strategic decisions
  3. Streamline finance process and system to improve efficiency

客户简介

Non Bank Financial Institution backed by strong Private Equity Fund

工作内容

  1. Manage and oversee the financial accounting processes, ensuring accurate and timely recording of financial transactions.
  2. Develop and maintain budgets, providing guidance and support to department heads in budget preparation and monitoring.
  3. Prepare financial reports, including profit and loss statements, balance sheets, and cash flow statements, for management and external stakeholders.
  4. Conduct financial analysis, evaluate business performance, and identify areas for improvement or cost-saving opportunities.
  5. Present financial information and analysis to senior management, providing insights and recommendations to support strategic decision-making.
  6. Ensure compliance with accounting standards, regulations, and internal policies, and implement controls to safeguard company assets.
  7. Streamline finance processes and systems, identifying and implementing improvements to enhance efficiency and accuracy.
  8. Lead and manage the finance team, providing guidance, training, and support to foster professional growth and development.

理想的求职者

  1. Minimum of 10 years of experience in accounting, auditing, treasury, or funding within a financial institution.
  2. Prior experience in mergers and acquisitions (M&A) would be an advantage, demonstrating an understanding of the financial implications and integration processes involved.
  3. Must be a qualified accountant, possessing relevant professional certifications such as CPA (Certified Public Accountant) or ACCA (Association of Chartered Certified Accountants).
  4. Strong knowledge of accounting principles, financial reporting standards, and regulatory requirements.
  5. Proficiency in financial analysis techniques and tools, with the ability to interpret and present complex financial information in a clear and concise manner.
  6. Experience in overseeing financial systems and implementing process improvements to enhance efficiency and accuracy.
  7. Excellent leadership and management skills, with the ability to motivate and develop a team of finance professionals.
  8. Strong communication and interpersonal skills, enabling effective collaboration with stakeholders at all levels of the organization.

福利待遇

Good benefits and culture

The Administration Officer is responsible for the reception area and is the first point of contact for resident, family, staff or guest enquiries; as well as performing a range of administrative support functions including filing and data entry.

What do I need for the role?

  • A passion for providing exceptional customer service
  • Previous experience in office administration, preferably in a residential aged care environment
  • Great attention to detail and time management abilities
  • Demonstrated experience in all aspects of office administration including proficiency in the use of Office suite products
  • Ability to work well within a team
  • Current Flu and COVID-19 Vaccinations
  • NDIS Worker Screening Clearance or willingness to obtain, or current Police Check (issued before 1 Feb 2021)

The bonuses of joining the Carinity team

  • Work with a leadership team who are passionate about outcomes for residents
  • Not-for-profit organisation with a values-driven culture of caring for others
  • Access to extensive not-for-profit salary packaging options (pay less tax)
  • Access to our Employee Assistance Program for our staff and their immediate family

Who is Carinity?

Carinity is a not-for-profit, values-driven organisation, which has been making a real difference in people’s lives since 1949, through comprehensive and integrated community services.

Carinity Aged Care – Wishart Gardens is a modern and attractive residential aged care facility located centrally in Brisbane and is close to shops, main roads and public transport.  Wishart Gardens is a 104 bed Residential Aged Care facility with a great reputation in the community. A retirement village is also located on site. 

How do I apply?

Carinity is after motivated and enthusiastic candidates who are committed to working with Carinity to make a real difference. If this sounds like you, we want to hear from you!

To apply or view more information, including the position description, visit https://www.carinity.org.au/join-our-team/. Applications should include a brief cover letter and Resume that addresses the Essential Competencies and Experiences.

Carinity actively encourages and invites applications from people with disabilities and Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people for all our positions.

job_title: Benefits Realisation Lead - Patient Billing Standardisation Program
job_ad_details:
Employment Type:   Full Time Exempt (up to 72 weeks contract)
Position Classification:   Health Manager Level 4
Remuneration:  $137173.00 to $163431.00 plus 11.5% superannuation and loading
Hours Per Week:  38
Location:  St Leonards/Hybrid

The Opportunity  

Are you seeking a rewarding career that allows you to make a positive difference in the lives of others? HealthShare NSW is looking for an organised and detail-oriented Project Lead.

The Benefits Realisation Lead for the Patient Billing Standardisation Program is responsible for leading and executing the Program's Benefits Realisation Framework, as well as developing the Program's Benefits Realisation Plan, including validating the benefits identified in Program documents.

The role will also develop savings strategy, manage the reporting and work closely with governance groups and relevant stakeholders across NSW Health entities to ensure targets for the savings program are achieved. 

  
Why Work for HealthShare NSW?  

HealthShare NSW touches the lives of NSW Health employees and patients every single day by delivering services that keep our public hospitals and health facilities running.  

Watch Our HealthShare NSW story video to learn more about the work we do and the diverse range of roles we have on offer.  

We reward our employees with a terrific range of benefits, including:  

  • Flexible work arrangements: varied start/finish times, part time work and job sharing where applicable  
  • Hybrid working: enjoy a combination of working from home and the office  
  • Great leave conditions: enjoy one day off each month as an ADO, annual leave loading (a bonus extra payment of 17.5%) and 14 weeks’ paid parental leave for eligible employees  
  • Salary packaging and novated leasing: you can access up to $2782 extra per year in your pay  
  • Wellbeing programs: access a large array of wellbeing programs designed to support your physical, mental, and emotional health  
  • Commitment to career development: Expansive free online training, talent programs, study leave and internal development opportunities to accelerate your career  

Please note some benefits may only apply to certain employment types.  

Further information on our wide range of benefits is available here.  

  
Eligibility Requirements  

  • Meet essential requirements as outlined in the Position Description and ensure they are referenced in your resume or answers to targeted questions.  
  • Candidates must have Australian work rights (citizens, permanent residents, or valid work visa). Permanent roles are open to Australian citizens and permanent residents, while temporary and casual roles welcome applicants with a visa.  
  • This is a NSW Health Category B position. Please complete the OASV Undertaking/ Declaration Form and upload this with your application.  

  
How to Apply  

  • Click Apply Now at the top of the page  
  • Attach your resume and provide answers to the Targeted Questions below.  
  • To find out more about applying for jobs with HealthShare please view our resource: Your Guide to Employment with HealthShare NSW.  
  • Any role related questions can be directed to the hiring manager at Melissa.Wolfgramme@health.nsw.gov.au
  • Any career portal support questions can be directed to our customer service team at 1300 679 367.  

  
Targeted Questions  

  • When have you led and managed the development, implementation, monitoring, and evaluation of a Program's Benefits Realisation Plan within a dynamic, challenging, and complex environment?
  • Describe how you have led the development of actionable and targeted Benefits Realisation tools and templates, as well as the design and development of data collection tools and dashboards for Benefits tracking & reporting on multiple sites.

  


We are Diverse and Inclusive  

We welcome applications from all ages and genders, Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander peoples, culturally and linguistically diverse groups, the LGBTIQ+ community, veterans, carers, and people with disability. If we can offer some support or make some adjustments to our recruitment/interview process to better enable you to shine, please contact the Diversity and Inclusion Team HSNSW-Diversity@health.nsw.gov.au and let us know.  

Further information on how we support Diversity & Inclusion at HealthShare NSW can be found here.  

  

Talent Pool  

An eligibility list from this recruitment may be created for future casual, permanent, or temporary full-time or part-time positions within the next 6 months.  

For exempt roles: Please note, this is an exempt role (has a contracted end date) and there may be opportunities for conversion to permanent employment at the same grade.  

  
Applications Close: 11.59 PM, Wednesday 18 September 2024
