All about my new employer?
The hospital serves the local and wider community, including the Torres Strait.  Based in tropical North Queensland April and May are amongst the best times to visit – little rain, 25° sunny days and endless things to do.  You will work within the professional team at the hospital and provide services to in-patients, out-patients and day admitted patients.  Duties based on your experience.

  • This role is full time hours with a start date in April for 4 – 8 weeks negotiable.

Your next steps, APPLY

Are you a motivated and passionate nurse inspired by professional development and nurturing of others? Join Knox Private Hospital in our standalone, state of the art Intensive Care Unit as a Nurse Educator.

As a key member of the team, you will work collaboratively within the education team and work closely with the Nurse Unit Manager of ICU to meet the educational needs and objectives of the Unit and wider hospital.

You will play a key role in ensuring the planning, development and teaching of nursing education course/programs at the hospital are well thought out and executed. 

As the Nurse Educator your responsibilities will include:    

  • Plan, develop and deliver nursing education courses/programs within the hospital 
  • Coordinate and provide hands on educational support and clinical teaching/facilitation and orientation to staff 
  • Promote a high standard of evidence-based nursing care to patients, through dissemination of current best practice knowledge 
  • Supervise staff compliance to annual Mandatory Training and completion of eLearning components 
  • Ensure best practice competency-based programs are available and assessment of staff competencies are provided for all ICU staff 

Located in Wantirna, Knox Private Hospital is a fully accredited tertiary facility with 310 beds, providing 24 hour Emergency Services, extensive Surgical Specialities, 31 bed ICU/CCU, Medical, and a full range of Cardiac Services including two 24-hour Cardiac Catheter Laboratories.

Essential Criteria:     

  • Registered Nurse with Current AHPRA Registration 
  • Certificate IV workplace training and Assessment (TAE) (or working towards)
  • Post Graduate Certificate in ICU 
  • Minimum of 5 years relevant educator experience 
  • Demonstrated experience in eLearning platform 
  • High degree of computer literacy including MS Office
  • Excellent interpersonal and communication skills

Benefits

  • $57.56 per hour (Grade 4B in the current nursing Enterprise Agreement the "Healthscope - Victoria - Nurses' and Midwives' Agreement 2021-2025") 
  • Additional allowance for approved postgraduate qualifications 
  • Discounted private health insurance and Gym passport
  • Access legal advice, nutrition and lifestyle advice, financial coaching and counselling via our comprehensive Employee Assistance Program

Why Healthscope?

We care about your career at Healthscope.

No matter where you go within our community of care, you’ll be supported by great team leaders, be part of strong, innovative teams who always strive for better and have the opportunity to flourish and grow.

Our people are at the heart of our organisation - no matter the role, every day our people make a difference to the lives of our patients and their families. We work together to create positive, memorable experiences, alongside our quality care, in every moment of every day.

Joining us opens the door to endless opportunities. We encourage the pursuit of continuous professional development, specialisation and education, and support our people to grow and flourish.

Come and be the difference in our patient's lives.

Applications close: 29th October 2024

To Apply: Please click on the 'Apply' button to be taken to our online application form. For any questions, please reach out to 

More Information: Our commitment to quality and safety for our patients, staff and visitors is our highest priority. Applicants will be required to provide a current National Police check, WWCC (where applicable) and Evidence of right to work in Australia prior to appointment. Staff in patient contact roles will be required to provide proof of immunity to specified infectious diseases as a Category A Healthcare worker

What's the opportunity?



Y Victoria is currently seeking Casual Educators for our Before and After School Care and School Holiday Programs within St Josephs School, Cobram. This is a casual position, with working hours varying from Monday to Friday, on a rostered basis between 7:00am - 9:00am and 2:30pm - 6:00pm (you'll also be paid split shift loading if you work both)! School Holidays shifts vary across 6:30am - 6:30pm.

The hourly rate for the position is between $33 - $38 p/hour (depending on your qualification & experience) + 11.5% super.

As an Outside of School Hours Care (OSHC) Educator you will be dedicated to empowering young children and have a passion for providing engaging experiences. Supported by the OSHC team and an experienced Coordinator, you will enhance positive relationships with children, families and the school community while facilitating our Before and After School Care sessions and School Holiday programs.

What's in it for me?

At the Y Victoria, we value our people. Working for us means you'll enjoy great work-life balance and a range of benefits which improve your wellbeing and help you develop as an individual, such as:

  • Free access to gyms, recreation, and aquatics centres across the state
  • Discounts for your children to attend a Y Victoria OSHC service or Early Learning centre
  • Dual staffing policy - when you work at a Y OSHC service, you will always work alongside a Coordinator or another Educator
  • Supportive management teams - Coordinators and Regional OSHC Coordinators who work on the floor, mentoring and providing guidance to our teams
  • Split shift allowance - if you work both before and after school in the same day, you'll receive additional loading on all rostered hours for the day
  • Flexible working and rostering arrangements
  • Opportunities for career development and growth
  • Free access to the Virtual Y - online health and wellness

What will I need?

  • You'll need to have either completed or be working towards an ACECQA-approved qualification (see the link below) - or willing to enrol in a course
  • You'll need to have, or be willing to obtain a First Aid in an Education & Care Setting certificate (or equivalent)
  • You'll need to have, or be willing to obtain a valid Victorian Working with Children's Check - employee check

There are a variety of qualifications that ACECQA has approved to work within OSHC ranging from education to community services to healthcare. Please copy the below ACECQA webpage into your browser to check your qualifications: https://www.acecqa.gov.au/qualifications/nqf-approved

How can I apply?

If this opportunity interests you, click the Apply button or email for further information, noting we do not accept applications submitted via email.

Y Victoria is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity and social inclusion. We warmly welcome applications from individuals of all backgrounds.

At the Y Victoria, we are committed to empowering all Children and Young People to feel safe and be safe. As such, we ensure that all of our candidates are appropriately screened (including police check, working with children check and reference checks). To learn more about our commitment to safeguarding children and young people visit victoria.ymca.org.au

About the Y Victoria

Our Vision is to inspire and empower young people and communities to thrive. With over 5,000 staff and volunteers, Y Victoria delivers services at more than 150 locations every day, including: Children's Programs, Action Sports, Camps, Recreation and Youth Services.

Y Victoria are proud to be a 2024 Circle Back Initiative Employer, we commit to respond to every applicant.

About the role

Mater Private Hospital Brisbane are seeking enthusiastic Registered Nurses with experience in Scrub/Scouts for permanent positions, full time or part time roles on offer and immediate start available. 

This is an exceptional opportunity to join our Perioperative department which boasts up to 15 operating theatres (including Neuroscience & Paediatrics theatres) across our private hospital settings, our main centre of excellence specialties include. 

  • Paediatrics
  • Neurosciences
  • Orthopaedics 
  • Robotics 

Salary range: $40.27 - $51.74 (Registered Nurse Level 1) per hour plus superannuation & Salary Packaging 

What you’ll be doing

Whilst displaying the highest level of clinical standards for the unit you will be responsible for:

  • Achieving optimal patient outcomes throughout the patient journey and continuum of care
  • Demonstrating exceptional clinical expertise and knowledge of procedures and the management of patients seeking outstanding care
  • Implementing strategies to ensure that quality and risk management are integrated into service provision.
  • Working collaboratively with the nursing team to provide exceptional care every time.
  • Maintaining current knowledge and skills to ensure continued professional growth.

About you

You will be driven by a challenging yet rewarding environment where you can bring your energy and experience to this dynamic and exciting unit.

Other skills and experience include:

  • Minimum 3 years’ experience as a Registered Nurse in a Perioperative -Scrub/Scout setting
  • Current AHPRA nursing registration as a Registered Nurse (no restrictions)
  • Ability to work in an ever-changing and fast paced environment.
  • A strong work ethic, positive attitude and willingness to role model and promote the Mater values.
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills and the ability to liaise with all levels of the multidisciplinary team.
  • Demonstrated ability to operate both in a team environment and autonomously using initiative, sound reasoning and strong listening, negotiation and decision-making skills.
  • Strong attention to detail and organisational skills
  • Commitment to ensuring the levels of service is always delivered to patients at all times.

Why join us?

Mater is Queensland’s largest and most innovative not-for-profit healthcare service, providing care for almost 700,000 patients a year across a network of 11 hospitals.

We are a leader in healthcare, education and research — and that’s because we employ exceptional people. #MAKEYOURMATERMOVE

  • Increase your take-home pay via Salary Packaging by allocating applicable living expenses directly from your pre-taxable income
  • Access to package meal and entertainment expenses via Salary Packaging
  • Access to leading education and professional development through Mater Education
  • Access to our Employee Assistance Program and on-site pastoral care teams
  • Discounts to local and national businesses/venues for dining, retail, travel & accommodation, other
  • Access to on-site, discounted parking
  • Discounted food and beverage at various campus cafés and coffee venues

Please note, we will contact applications as they come in, please do not hesitate to APPLY NOW!

Please Note: We will not require any support from Recruitment Agencies at this time and kindly request no contact is made. Only direct applications will be considered.

It is now a mandatory requirement of employment at the Mater that you are and remain fully vaccinated against COVID-19.

Weekend Shift Leader

Thursday to Sunday (4 days) from 10am – 8:30pm During School Terms (with flexibility around start and finish times)

Monday-Friday 8:30-4:30pm During Term Breaks

Organisation: BLENNZ (Blind Low Vision Education Network NZ)

Are you passionate about making a difference in the lives of young individuals who are blind, deafblind or have low vision? Do you thrive in leadership roles and enjoy fostering a positive and supportive work environment? If so, we have an exciting opportunity for you!

About Us:

Blind Low Vision Network New Zealand (BLENNZ) is a school and a national network of educational services for children and young people who are blind, deafblind or have low vision in New Zealand.  Our vision is ‘Every BLENNZ learner is well prepared to achieve in life’.

Job Description:

  • Provide guidance and mentorship to Youth Workers, fostering a supportive team dynamic that caters to the unique needs of ākonga who are blind, deafblind or have low vision in residential / educational programmes based at the Homai Campus, Manurewa.
  • Collaborate with the Youth Work Team Leader and Residential Transition Teaching team to implement educational and engaging activities which complement the teaching and learning taking place throughout the week.
  • Ensure the safety and well-being of all participants, adhering to organisational policies and procedures.
  • Cultivate a positive and inclusive atmosphere for both young people and staff.
  • Be happy to complete some domestic duties.

Qualifications:

  • Previous experience in a leadership role, preferably in a youth-focused environment.
    • Experience in supporting young people who are blind, deafblind or have low vision develop independent living skills would also be an advantage.
  • Strong communication and interpersonal skills.
  • Passion for working with individuals who are blind, deafblind or have low vision and creating inclusive environments.
  • Ability to think creatively and adapt to the unique needs of our program participants.
  • Understanding of safety protocols and the ability to prioritise the well-being of all individuals.
  • Understanding and adhering to Te Tiriti o Waitangi principles and their application in practice.
  • Cultural awareness and experience / understanding of working with Māori and Pasifika families.
  • A good level of fitness for actively participating in ākonga programmes.

What We Offer:

  • Remuneration is based on the Support Staff in School Collective Agreement and will be based on experience and qualifications.
  • On-going career and professional development
  • Professional training specific to the role
  • Work with a dedicated team
  • A challenging, fascinating and rewarding position within a team committed to the highest standards of work

What we need:

  • A full, clean valid driver’s license is preferred.
  • In line with the Vulnerable Children Act 2014 a Police Safety check will need to be completed before employment can commence.

How to Apply:

If you are ready to take on this rewarding leadership role and contribute to the mission of Blind Low Vision Education Network NZ, please submit your resume and a cover letter outlining your relevant experience and passion for this field to carolyn.barton@blennz.school.nz   

A copy of the Job Description can be obtained by emailing carolyn.barton@blennz.school.nz   

Applications close December 8th 2023

RESPONSIBILITIES
  • Provide expert advice to on-board new users to NSCC’s systems.
  • Engage with new researchers, communities and disciplines with data-intensive computing.
  • Translate user requirements into optimal computational work plans.
  • Assist in the design of NSCC's HPC systems, including benchmarking NSCC workloads on various platforms and recommending the most suitable architecture for the research community.
  • Design and implement scalable and performant HPC software infrastructure with ease of maintenance.
  • Analyse system and user job data for efficient resource allocations and management.
  • Profile and optimise the user applications and workflow on the NSCC's HPC systems.
  • Develop HPC utility and automated testing tools for NSCC's HPC systems.
  • Develop HPC user guide and best practice guide documents for NSCC's HPC systems.
 
QUALIFICATIONS
  • Master or Bachelor degree in the field of computer science, computer engineering, or other relevant areas.
  • Proven working knowledge of HPC system and software.
  • Experience with HPC development toolchain and scientific application software stack (GCC, oneAPI, AOCC, AOCL, MPI, CUDA, HDF5, NetCDF, MKL, and FFTW) for building HPC software is essential, knowledge in using Spack or EasyBuild is a plus.
  • Strong programming skills in C, C++, and Python, familiar with Fortran programming is a plus.
  • Good knowledge and experience in HPC performance optimization and troubleshooting.
  • Familiar with HPC job schedulers (PBS or SLURM), OpenMP & MPI, and container technologies (Docker or Singularity).
  • Familiar with scripting languages, Linux and HPC profiler & debugger tools e.g. AWK, Bash, Perl, Conda, GDB, Git and IPM.
  • Familiar with HPC storage e.g. GPFS and Lustre.
  • Demonstrated good team play spirit and high-level problem solving skills.
  • Demonstrated effective communication skill including the ability to articulate technical concepts to a diverse range of clients.
  • Demonstrated ability & willingness to contribute novel ideas and approaches in support of research community.
  • To be considered for a senior position, the candidate should have at least 3 years of relevant experience in a similar position and environment.
  • Familiar with AI software stack (PyTorch and Tensorflow) and programming is a plus.
  • Familiar with database technology (MySQL, Cassandra, etcd, MongoDB and Redis) and programming is a plus.
  • Good knowledge and experience in HPC analysis and data analytics is a plus.

A Day in the Life

  • Support IT system or technologies launch and replacement with BI requirements delivery
Sales Enablement
  • Be an SFDC Champion and lead the rollout of SFDC and modules by accompanying the commercial team in each step
  • Able to formalize dashboard to translate Commercial needs
  • Work on Online Reporting solutions such as Tableau or PowerBI to automate, enable, accelerate key information into the hands of our commercial team
  • Drive demonstratable improvements in the efficiency and effectiveness of Sales teams
  • Gain and maintain a thorough understanding of incentive plans and business structure. Provide inputs on the possible incentive structure suitable for the Region
Customer Experience
  • Have an appetite for a new business model, adapting to the new norm
  • Work on Remove sales framework and support the commercial team in its implementation from business case modelization to Go-live and tracking tools
  • Work on the rollout and adoption of our Digital Website (Medtronic Connect), support the commercial team with dashboards


What we offer:

About Medtronic

Together, we can change healthcare worldwide. At Medtronic, we push the limits of what technology can do to help alleviate pain, restore health, and extend life. We challenge ourselves and each other to make tomorrow better than yesterday. It is what makes this an exciting and rewarding place to be.

We can accelerate and advance our ability to create meaningful innovations - but we will only succeed with the right people on our team. Let's work together to address universal healthcare needs and improve patients' lives. Help us shape the future.

 
 

Required profile:

Minimum requirements

  • Bachelor's degree required, preferably with an advanced degree (MBA, MA Ed, MA, or PhD) or Engineering background
  • With at least 4 years of relevant experience in the BI & Analytics area and hands-on experience with Salesforce or Sales incentives or both.
Nice to Have
  • Domain experience in salesforce and commercial excellence role within the healthcare or pharmaceutical industry in a regional capacity is preferred but not a must
  • Strong ability to read and understand data sets
  • Has exposure in an MNC environment
  • Handling Business Analyst Profile in a Consultancy firm or Market Research
  • Knowledge on SAP

Company description:

KiwiRail Ltd



Job description:

It's time to join our team! Check out our video clip click here to see what it's like to work as a Rail Safety Protector for KiwiRail.

If keeping people safe is your passion, then have you ever thought about using your skills to build a meaningful and interesting career with an iconic Kiwi company?

  • Entry-level opportunity
  • Tauranga-based
  • Great earning potential (starting hourly rate is $26.24 - plus overtime/penal rates for weekend and night shifts)
  • Structured pathway for career progression

The opportunity we have:

This is an exciting opportunity for passionate, reliable, and trustworthy individuals to secure a permanent position with an iconic Kiwi company.

Our Safety Protectors are trained staff who make sure that employees, contractors, and the public don't get hurt by trains.

During training you will learn how to take ownership of the following duties:

  • Communicating with staff and contractors working on the rail
  • Assist with the preparation of safety plans
  • Review land entry permits for contractors
  • Liaising customers, subcontractors, and train control daily
  • Conducting a job plan and safety briefing for a worksite
  • Complete forms and documents as and when required

You will need to understand and follow the rules and processes to keep people safe.

What skills are we looking for:

  • You must be able to follow rules 100% of the time
  • You will be a confident communicator, able to interact with people either face-to-face or over the radio
  • You will be passionate about keeping people and keeping them safe at work
  • You will enjoy working outdoors as part of a team, or sometimes independently

It is critical you are alert, conscious of your surroundings, and aware of where people in the rail corridor are at all times. Being able to adapt to changing conditions and being able to think on your feet will make you an ideal candidate for this job. It is also very important to build rapport with key stakeholders such as Project Managers, Project Engineers, Track Workers, Train Control etc

It is essential you have:

  • Full driver's license essential
  • Excellent communication skills (both verbal and written) and radio communication experience will be advantageous
  • Good computer skills with an eye for detail
  • Be physically fit and happy to work in all weather conditions
  • Available to work non-standard hours as required (including nights, weekends and public holidays)
  • Health and Safety focus with the ability to think outside the square

Benefits

  • Starting hourly rate of $26.24 plus penal rates for weekend and night shifts
  • Full paid training and support to gain rail qualifications, certificates and required licenses to set you up for success
  • Structured career development prospects within the Rail industry
  • Enjoy staff benefits such as access to discounted travel, accommodation, and insurance

You must also be able to pass a Ministry of Justice check and complete a mandatory medical and drug test to be considered for this role.

You must have full working rights to NZ to apply for this role as it cannot support a visa application.

Job description: Rail Safety Officer

We value your application and interest in working for KiwiRail, however our teams are away from the 23rd of December 2022 till the 16th of January 2023, so please expect a delayed response to your application, we will endeavour to reply as soon as possible

Our client is one of the top logistics players in Indonesia. Currently, they are looking for a procurement manager to be responsible for the procurement of all goods and services that the group need within the warehouse and logistics function.

Client Details

Our client is one of the top logistics players in Indonesia. They work with multiple industry and often their own sister company to make their supply chain happen. This time, they are looking for a senior candidate to the the right hand man of their Head of Group Procurement.

Description

  • Procure respective needs within the multiple warehouse and logistics department.
  • Communicate/ negotiate with suppliers including pre-qualification and negotiation for price discounts and all other spare parts related issues.
  • Liase with local suppliers for new/recurring orders and ensure delivery of goods in a timely basis
  • Managing overall direction, coordination and evaluation of procurement for the organisation
  • Develop bid packages for service and material requirements.
  • Select and develop new suppliers and business opportunities.
  • Maintaining and grow partnerships with internal and external team across functions frequently.
  • Ensure that process is aligned with various departments in the company.

Profile

  • Bachelor's Degree in business, engineering or a related field from Tier 1 universities.
  • Minimum 5 years of relevant experience, with good track record
  • Have exposure to contracts bench marking
  • Project management experience to drive improvement initiatives
  • Well developed influencing skills and is able to engage stakeholders at all levels.
  • Strong written and communication skills
  • Strong negotiation skills

Job Offer

  • Be part of a exponentially growing company.
  • Opportunity to be a value-adding contributor in a fast growing company.
  • Work with passionate people.

job_title: Process Operators - Annies Fruit Bars - Morning and Afternoon Shifts
job_ad_details:
Our Business

Since the time of the hekenga, our people have displayed the qualities of innovation, perseverance, flexibility and adaptability. Our tupuna were creative, astute and forward thinking people who gifted us our land, whakapapa and cultural identity. Kono NZ LP is a business that thrives off the taonga or gifts that have been handed down to us by our tupuna and include land, sea and natural resources.

Kono is a top 100, premium New Zealand food and beverage company with a unique 500-year business plan, Te Pae Tawhiti. Our interests span wine, horticulture, fruit bars and seafood and we export to over 25 countries throughout the world. Our products encapsulate the pure taste of Aotearoa New Zealand and are produced sustainably, akin to the Maori values of our owners.

Our business is diverse, from farming and harvesting, to processing and the marketing of seafood, wine, cider, apples, pears, kiwifruit, hops and natural fruit bars.

The Role

As a production/process operator, you play an active role in ensuring that the fruit bars are continually delivered at a high standard to all our customers in an effective, quality focused and productive manner.

We have a number of permanent roles available at our Annies Fruit Bar factory in Grovetown, on both the morning and afternoon shifts. The roles are varied, and we need people who have a good level of fitness as some heavy lifting is required. Great time management is also essential. In return we offer a great team environment along with a strong values-based outlook.

This is a great opportunity to join a fantastic team. If you think you have got what it takes, then we want to hear from you.

Applications for this role close Friday the 2nd of April 2021.

To apply for this job go to: kononz.recruitmenthub.co.nz/Vacancies and enter ref code: 5406767.

Applications close: 02 April 2021
